Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable enough but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Sjanetb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in the hotel and my overall feeling was 'underwhelmed' When we arrived the staff were extremely polite and friendly and because we had to wait in a queue to check in they gave us free tickets to the hockey hall of fame! A lovely touch! The room was clean and had a view of both the city and water, but the decor itself was dark and well underwhelming! Plus- Starbucks coffee in the room Major minus- WIFI access, you get one hour for free then you have to pay after that, totally unacceptable to me in this day and age! We didn't eat in the hotel as prices were rocket high, especially for breakfast! (We found a diner on Yonge called eggspectation which was just amazing!) Overall it wasn't a bad stay in the hotel just not what you would expect, the quality wasn't there. Unless you get a deal on it I wouldn't say it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Got upgraded to Penthouse Suite”
Reviews.Author: SidB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place for work. Great place and location. This place over sees the lake and is close to good eating places. The concierge people seemed very new as they had to open google maps to give wrong directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: I had a great one night stay at the Westin Harbour Castle in a lakeview corner suite. I was impressed with their level of service, and the room was very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Weird thing about the room was that the bed was one that you can flip up into the wall, so there was a big hole from the top of the bed to the wall, and if you drop anything in there, it's hard to get out. I also want to point out that you should be prepared to walk a bit from each area of the hotel to another since it is so big! Its location is great - close to a lot of restaurants and bars, the ACC, Rogers Centre, and it is right by the harbourfront. I also have to mention that I got a great deal on the room for $109, so that made all the difference. I don't think I would have paid $200+ for a room here. Overall, though, it was a nice stay and no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “They don't get that internet is actually important”
Reviews.Author: MelvinWinnipegMelvin
Reviews.Content: I am a trader and I new 24 hour access to high speed internet. Most hotels do offer this. Their internet did'nt work at all, for the entire night, at 5 am I called the datat velet serice he put me on hold for 15 minutes then came back and said try it again in half an hour. It still didn't work i moved to the business centre whjere it did work but was extremely slow, had to change hotels. At one point guy helping me said that the room would be complimentary, but when I checked out the manager looked all puzzled when I told him that, and would'nt do it. I don't think these guys understand the interent requirements of some guests. I guess they think you are e-mailing aunt Millie opr looking up a chilli recipe. I don't think they are capable of understanding the importance of it. So in case an actual person from this hotel is reading this, I fiqure my stay at your hotel cost me in excess of $40,000

Reviews.Title: “3 star service and a slow fade of quality”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller30
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle over a 3 day period while on business in Toronto. I have stayed at this Westin a number of times of the years and in the past I have really enjoyed it. This time however my experience was slightly different and, I hope, it is not the standard/direction that this hotel will continue to pursue. First though, the good aspects: Check-in was quick and efficient -- when you come in from a long flight, late at night, the last thing you want to do is wait an endless amount of time for the check-in process to be completed. I was checked in and in my room within 5 - 7 minutes of arrival. Very good and since there was a large conference going in the hotel, serious kudos to the front desk staff for managing things so efficiently. The gentleman who was running the hotel gift shop was extremely pleasant -- always a ready smile and just an overall nice guy. A good ambassador for his little shop and one that other staff in the hotel would be wise to follow. The Bad: Upon arrival in my room, I unpacked and got ready for bed. For a hotel that markets its beds as "heavenly" mine was lumpy, dumpy and pretty blase. The sheets were rough, there was a stain on them (the sheets were clean but seriously, has nobody in the laundry room of the hotel heard of bleach?!) and the mattress pad under the sheets felt really lumpy and like it was pretty old. The bathroom was also a disappointment. "Heavenly shower" it says on the shower head --- that is caked in mildew. Right, I'm sure heaven's showers look JUST like that. Small little bathtub and plastic cups in the bathroom. It was like I was in some bathroom crossed between a run-down roadside hotel and some small town 3-star joint that markets itself as THE place to stay. Light in the closet was burnt out. I did some ironing the next morning but as I was running late for my meeting I darted out before I had a chance to put the ironing board and iron away. Imagine my surprise when I came back to my room hours later to find that while the room had been cleaned, the ironing board and iron were left out, cord strewn across the floor. My understanding is that housekeeping can and should be taking care of that. They didn't. Water and an evening turn-down service is offered for hotel guests -- or ostensibly it is anyway. I was there 3 nights. I received one bottle of water and that's it. No turn down service and the other two nights I was there there was neither water or turndown. Fail. I had gone down to have a lunch meeting in the lounge restaurant on the second day I was there. As the carafe that had come with my breakfast was still full, and as I had work to do after my lunch meeting, I left a note stuck to the top of the carafe that said "Please do not remove the carafe as I would like to finish the coffee later". I returned to my room to find, you guessed it, the carafe gone. Do people not read anymore? The service in the lobby lounge is abysmal. The server we had left us sitting there for 15 minutes before I had to go on a search to find her. I asked the bartender if they were open (it was 12:30 pm) and he said yes, they were. The server came out of the back and was like "I'm coming, I'm coming". Followed me to the table, pretty much dropped two menus on the table and bolted. Service was pretty much like that for the rest of the time I was there. To say it was slow would put turtles to shame. We ordered appetizers that took 30 minutes to arrive, despite the lounge being almost empty, then the meal arrived 20 minutes after the appetizers were taken away. Had to go on a search again to find the server, who had mastered the vanishing act, if I could have another Diet Coke. Also, the time lag between requesting the bill and actually getting it was abysmal. 3 star service and I'm being way too generous. Food was, well, bland. I needed to book a car service one more whilst I was there. I called the Express Service line for guests and they put me in touch with the doormen who handle the taxis, cars, etc. The doorman then proceeded to tell me to just take a cab. When I go to a 4 star hotel I don't expect to be told by the staff what I can/can't take for a long drive. Needless to say that he was so unhelpful, I wound up calling the car service myself. I wanted to have a drink while in my hotel room so I opened the bar fridge -- only to find it empty. They no longer offer mini bars in the rooms apparently. You can either call room service (with the requisite service charge for delivery) or stack your mini bar yourself. If I wanted an empty fridge and the ability to grocery shop, I'd stay at a Hilton Express. I should also note that they could do a bit better job at clearing the room service trays that were in the hallways. They sit there unacceptably long. All in all, a forgettable stay that I won't soon repeat at the Westin Harbour Castle.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly bed”
Reviews.Author: eliza124
Reviews.Content: I am currently living about 30 minutes from downtown Toronto, have been down several times for a visit, but decided I want to spend the night. Got a great last minute deal on price line, lake view room for about $145 including tax. The stay reminded me how much I love the heavenly bed, going to get one for my house. The pool area was nice, but the water was not warm enough for a night time swim, but did enoy the hot tub. Must have been some university party going on, lots of young people in the elevators, but hotel security seemed on top of the problem. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of a Let Down”
Reviews.Author: smcooper77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a two-day holiday at the Westin this past weekend, to start off the March Break. We enjoyed the Westin, but must say that had we not secured a deal on Hotwire, I would probably been far more underwhelmed. The room was satisfactory. It was clean, had the typical amenities one finds at a normal hotel, but nothing out of the ordinary. One bonus was the flat screen t.v., but that has become fairly standard by now. There was a surprising lack of information about the hotel in the room, and I still don't know whether they have a pool or a workout room although I assume they do. And there was a surprising lack of information about the surrounding area, especially the Queens Quay area, which they are right in the middle. What did irritate me was the continuing list of add-ons we were asked for, such as harbour view, the $5 coupon for not using the maid service, an extra charge for internet, the outrageous parking fee/valet service, the skimpy number of towels and one bathrobe for two people. For a four star hotel, I've really had far more amenities and better service at a Holiday Inn. However, the biggest disappointment of the trip was the Sunday evening meal at Toula, their rooftop restaurant. We arrived at the hotel at 5pm and I had reserved a table for 8:30pm. When we got there, there was only one other couple eating and single male at the bar drinking. The host sat us and then gave us a story about a mishap in the kitchen and there would only be pasta and salads. Being that hour and not really wanting to tramp around looking for a restaurant, we stayed. Soon after we arrived several other tables without reservations showed up. Miraculously, they were able to eat grilled items. It turns out the host was trying to get us to leave, thinking they could take an early night. For an expensive hotel and restaurant, I was not pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Always liked the Harbour Castle, but .........”
Reviews.Author: RandallSRogers
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here off and on since the days when it was the HC Hilton. Love the location, and the amenities such as the pool and gym and squash courts have always been an attraction to us, as well as the location on the Toronto waterfront which is getting more and more built up and now offers lots of restaurant and grocery options. This month we stayed for a week and paid for a package that included breakfast buffet for two people. On check in we were told that our rate only covered one person for breakfast, and were given just enough coupons for the week for one of our party. So, we adjusted our plans and the second person paid cash for breakfast each day. On the second last day of our stay my wife contacted the front desk to confirm the rate that we were quoted and found out that we were in fact supposed to have breakfast included for both of us. Instead of adjusting the rate, the front desk staff simply gave her a stack of breakfast coupons (four more) which we now were unable to use as there was only one day remaining in our stay. Seems kind of ridiculous, paying $ 30 a person per day for a prepaid meal amenity and not being given access to it. I tried to get the bill adjusted on checkout and got a runaround that this was a fixed online rate and couldn't be changed. So, we're out $ 30 per day for a one week stay. Not impressed, and this might be enough to chase us away from future stays at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 10JBT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on the Family Day weekend. Our kids ages 10 and 6 loved it. A gift bag on check in, movies at the pool, extended pool hours and crafts and hot chocolate in the lobby for family day. The restaurants are pricy to take a family but there is a little cafe across the street that is inexpensive to grab a quick bite. We parked down the street across from the Toronto Star for just 10 dollars instead of paying for the valet which seemed like a good option since the people waiting for their cars seemed miserable. Staff were very friendly and professional and the room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just too big!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDudeMan
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbour Castle is an average hotel that does what it does (namely host a lot of conventions) simply because of its size. From the moment you arrive, you're reminded of this. You need to find parking across the street. Or next door. Or anywhere really, other than the hotel. Unless you want to pay valet pricing. Which will run you about $30 a day. But wait, the valet parking fills up REALLY quickly because the hotel is so large. So actually, you're parking across the street. Get inside and you'll find the check in area to your left - about 20 booths. And yet there is still a line! Amazing how that works. Check in is quick and painless, but be prepared to walk. Elevators are fast, but if you're unlucky and you get a room near the edges, you'll have a 5 minute walk from room to elevator every morning. This hotel is big. And it never ceases to remind you of this. Rooms are average for the type. A bit worn down but overall comfortable. Certainly not worth the scratch they're asking for. On the plus side, room service is quick, the rooms are very clean, and everything works as advertised. As for restaurants - breakfast buffet downstairs is quite good. Recommended. Room service is pretty terrible. Not recommended. If you're visiting in the winter, note that although this hotel is reasonably close to the downtown (and very close to the Air Canada Center), it is still in a sort of no man's land of concrete due to the Gardiner Expressway which creates wonderfully frigid gusts of wind. You will be cold. On the plus side, it is also very close to the Harbour 60 restaurant, so if you like great (but expensive!) steaks, have at it. As a conference center, the Westin is lacking - again the size thing. Rooms are relatively very far from the conference halls. 10-15 to get there in the morning with elevator traffic at highest volume. Plan accordingly. Lastly, I can't forget to mention picking up your car from valet. Chaos theory taking place right in front of you. Again, be prepared to wait - possibly for about 20 minutes. In summary - you'd never pay to stay here for anything but conference business. So how can this be a good hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Cookie Cutter Convention-Style Westin But in Nice Lakeside Location”
Reviews.Author: bkl2
Reviews.Content: In some respects, this Westin is your standard convention hotel. It's large, somewhat impersonal and shows some wear and tear. The elevator cars look all scuffed and worn and even some of the hallways feel that way.The main lobby is impressive but that doesn't follow through to the rest of the place. If you have to stay there for a convention, you'll be fine. But there may be better, more centrally located options for business. Also hotels with a more personal, less generic feel. That said, there are some real positives here. The lakeside location makes this a great spot for spring and summer. Not so for winter. It's just too dead in that area in the winter. The indoor pool is great and it overlooks the lake giving you the feeling you're swimming on a cruise liner. The changing rooms are fantastic and include a sauna. The recreation areas for kids/families are great. There's an outdoor play area and tennis/basketball courts. They even have a little kids play area near the pool. Then bottom line: It's great for families vacationing during the summer. It's just OK for business types. P.S.: Beware of the room service food. The quality of my order was poor at best.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: NRuff1121
Reviews.Content: Nice location along the water. Only negative is it is $40 a night to park.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Plan Concert”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel we have ever stayed at. Convenience, convenience, convenience......the staff was amazing, rooms were clean and classy, pool and hot tub area were clean and spacious with a nice view of harbour. Hotel was a stone throw away from the ACC and a short walk to Union station subway. Nice view from our window as well. Will only use this hotel for future concerts we see!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterfly123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and were very happy with the hotel. Our room faced both the waterfront and the CN Tower. The kids loved watching the Tower change lights at night (as well as the elevator going up and down). The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is walking distance to many restaurants and theatres. If you don't want to walk, you are close to the subway also. The customer service was helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: RowanberryTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Westin Harbor Castle very frequently on business. The rooms are fairly standard, however they are nearly always very clean and put together well. On the rare occasion that there is a problem - once I had a room with a very noisy air con unit - the front desk is always ready to make it right, and that's really what I want when I stay anywhere. The WHC features the Heavenly bed, super comfortable pillows, and has a newly redone fitness room with mostly new gear - a very nice upgrade that shows the commitment to improvement and reinvestment in this hotel. The lobby is very welcoming and I think they have some sort of event every Tuesday in the lobby where there is wine to sample or something similar. The service is consistently top-notch. Food is delivered quickly, problems sorted without issue, I've had my shoes shined urgently when I was late to a meeting, late checkouts when you need them, etc etc. One time I didn't answer my wake-up call as I had gotten up early and was in shower, the front desk staff came and knocked on my door to make sure I was ok - how's that for service? My experiences with the staff at the WHC have been very positive. My only gripe - other than the nonworking equipment in the temporary fitness center in January when the fitness center was being redone - is that the room service menu is ok but not stellar, is a bit pricey. Once I asked if they could make me a smaller pizza as I hate to waste the food since I was dining alone - and was told that it wasn't possible. Small issue and if that's the biggest complaint I can think of then they are doing pretty well. Note the WHC is a large hotel - I think 900+ rooms - so might not be the cozy place for a romantic getaway, but the hotel does have great lake views - and for business travel it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Rubin65
Reviews.Content: stayed during family day weekend, bed was so comfy, room in prestine condition, the staff were very helpful....watch out for the waiter in the Mizzen restaturant, had the breakfast buffet (way overpriced) with my 12 yr old daughter, when the bill came he charged me for two adult, when I questioned why isn't it half price he said its only for children 10 and under.....I brought this up with the front desk where they confirmed it is half price for children 12 and under NOT 10, and they credited me the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Jackhammers make already painful parking situation even more stressful”
Reviews.Author: AJGSudbury_ON
Reviews.Content: Once you get into the hotel, the lobby is very inviting, especially with freshly baked cookies and hot chocolate being offered to all. Check-in was very courteous and quick, with the room meeting our expectations of a hotel of this star rating. The only negative aspect continues to be driving up to the entrance; it is up a very twisted ramp, that always has massive SUVs valet parked along the sides. You feel as though you are crawling up a mountain of American automotive excess. The overhang to the main entrance is very low and claustrophobic, leaving the exaust fumes with nowhere to go. Add to this the construction taking place in the middle of the arrival area and the ear-drum shredding noise of a jackhammer running a full tilt made for a very stressful arrival/departure.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: kdkvenice
Reviews.Content: Great value for Toronto! Hotel is quite nice. Room had a nice view, bed very comfortable, not bad size, and very clean. If you call directly to hotel and get a non cancellation room it is only $107.00 a night, great price for Toronto!! Close to where we were going. Went to Brewery District, what a gem of a place! Only a 5 minute cab ride, and $9.00. Parking a little pricey! $40.00 at hotel, get the parking right next door! It s only $10.00 for the day, so it would of been $20.00 for over night! Saturday & Sunday! Shower needed to be fixed, double head, only one head did not work. But if that is all we had to complain about, I can live with that! Will defiantly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Great Rooms! Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rhaydon51
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin Harbour Castle only lasted one night, but the rooms were great! service was excellent! and the staff were all friendly. The few things that I did not like about my stay was the fact that you had to pay for your Wi-Fi, and not only that, but the cost was based on how much data you used; also the elevators were very loud throughout the night, In don't know if this was because of our room location. I have stayed at many hotels before, and none of them have ever charged for Wi-Fi. Now back to the positives, the fitness centre was very good for a hotel, the pool large enough to accomodate lap swimmers, as I mentioned before, the staff were all very friendly, especially the valet drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: FlorGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The bed was soft and soo comfortable wish i could of brought it home with me! The view of the water and the CN Tower was beyond beautiful..... However, the price for parking was horrible. 40 Canadian Dollars a night which I thought was a little too overpriced. Upon checking out on Sunday there were only three receptionist's at the front desk and we waiting about 20 minutes just waiting on line to be checked out. One of the receptionist seemed to pace back and forth from behind the "wall" door and ran back in as if she tried to avoid the guests checking in and out. The other receptionist gave a little demeaning attitude when we first spoke with her. So that wasn't fun... So that service in particular was not exceptionally great. Plus we had to wait an additional 30 minutes to obtain our car from valet. So checking out on a Sunday around 12pm would probably not be a good idea. We also had breakfast that was not complimentary for at least one day unlike the Hilton and costed 49.72 Canadian Dollars for two for the brunch buffet. The food was great too. However, overall everything else in terms of food, view, room, was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased To No End”
Reviews.Author: hadthetimeofourlives
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ this fabulous hotel in Toronto, Ontario Canada. My deluxe room had a large balcony facing Lake Ontario. King bed - very well decoration in earth tones. Excellent service @ check in/out - Restaurants - Room Service. Beautiful lobby - It's a non smoking hotel + PLUS for me. Walked to major attractions including Eaton Centre... using PATH underground - lovely decor & shops. Had unforgettable Prine Rib Dinner @ Baton Rouge in Eaton Centre... had a fantastic getaway worth every penny! Toronto is the place to be...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Westin in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Aurora100
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the Westin Harbour Castle while on a business trip to Toronto. My stay got off to a good start because as a Gold Starwood member they gave me a room on the 34th floor in the South Tower with an awesome lake view and gave me free Wi Fi as well. The room was a typical Westin; that said it was very nice. The bathroom though was unusually small. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever seen a bathroom that small in a hotel in North America, outside of New York City. That was probably the only negative thing about this hotel. The Westin had a very good gym that was not crowded and a decent size pool that was big enough for laps. One lane was roped off so you actually could swim laps even if there were kids in the pool. The location is mixed. Itâ€™s only a 12-minute walk to the business district but feels cut off from the rest of the city. This can be a positive or negative depending on your perspective. Itâ€™s probably a better location in the warmer months. I was there in the winter and was unable to walk on the lakeside trails due snow and ice. I was concerned that there would not be many restaurants in this location, but there is a Thai restaurant 5 minutes away, and a Chinese restaurant (Pearl Harbourfront) that is even closer. The food was great and it was right on the lake. So in conclusion, I enjoyed my stay here and will most likely return on my next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Manager of the Spa has no idea how to treat customers”
Reviews.Author: Avidtraveller04
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a massage and facial at this spa. The spa employees who delivered the service were professional and did a great job however the whole experience was destroyed by the manager of the spa. She was extremely rude and obnoxious - can't imagine why the westin would ever hire someone of this ilk to front their spa. While we waited to be checked in at the spa, we knew we were in for a rough time since the people ahead of us were being treated badly. Who goes to a spa to get stressed out? Stay away from this spa if you are staying at the hotel - there are many other fantastic spas in the neighbourhood that will pamper you and provide you with excellent service from every perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of Lake Ontario”
Reviews.Author: mtl-wasa
Reviews.Content: Nicely located offering rooms with a great view of Lake Ontario. Nice and spacious lobby where it feels good to just sit, relax, read and watch other guests come in. The rooms are comfortable and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Westin Harbour Castle”
Reviews.Author: DevPS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle, Toronto in December 2011 and I can say I enjoyed the 2 days there. Everything was set up in a nice way. It must be mentioned that there are two sets of elevators - North and South and you must make sure which one you are going to. The views are fantastic/scenic. I must also mention that they take good care of your luggage and do everything for you safely and with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: nathanrs1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your standard westin hotel. Nice lobby, quick checkin. Nice comfortable room. Both the sheraton bed, and the Westin Heavenly bed, are by far the best beds we have ever slept on in a hotel. Hotel has a nice indoor pool. Good location with Access to underground streetcar station across the street. Smokefree hotel is always a plus. We had a lakeview room on the 24th Floor. The only two issues we had with the hotel -Valet parking was alittle expensive @$40/nite -Someone was smoking pot in the hallways, which then started filtering into our room. But we called the front desk, and they sent up security to deal with the issue, and they also wavied our Valet Parking. Whenever we stay in toronto, we stay at this hotel or the Sheraton Center Hotel. both great hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent view”
Reviews.Author: petethepirate
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 nights at Westin Harbour Castle in May 2009. Big room with a nice big bed. Big bathrom with shower and tub. Exellent view of Lake Ontario from the room. Staff was very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Westin never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: NycHappy_travels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Westins and this was not surprise since of level of service, room quality and amazing views is what makes sets this brand apart from the rest. The restaurant on top also has great food and wine selection, and did I mention the views? My husband and I stayed for 5 nights while vacationing, this location is close to the subway stations, many attractions and restaurants in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Mirage2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while at a conference and got a great deal. The hotel is a little out of the way but we got an upgrade with a view of Lake Ontario that made up for it. My one criticism is that the bathroom could've been cleaner. For the price though, a fantastic deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, typical Westin”
Reviews.Author: IzzyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for a business trip. Even though this hotel has been in Toronto for many years, parts of it must have undergone recent renovations. The lobby was spacious and modern. It was full of "life" as people were dining and drinking in the restaurant and bar in the lobby. Check in was quick and easy. Front desk staff was polite. My room was on the 16th floor of the north tower. It was spacious and furnished in the typical Westin fashion, with a large work desk for the business traveller. A nice chez lounge chair was in the room for a comfortable place to sit to read and relax. King bed was "heavenly" as would be expected for a Westin. The room was clean. I was disappointed with the lack of toiletries though - there was no bath gel, no shower cap or any Q-tips etc. It was bare bones and odd for a Westin. Food in their 38th floor restaurant Toula and their lobby restaurant was ok - nothing special. Meeting rooms were fine as was the catering provided for the meeting. Again, nothing to write home about. Would consider staying here if visiting Toronto as it is very centrally located, right on the waterfront, close to Rogers Center, CN Tower etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tazman3038
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for 3 nights at the Westin Harbour and it was wonderful. The staff were very friendly, rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and room service was fast and friendly! We had to call down for weird requests twice and both times they were more than happy to help us out. The location is great, close to major attractions and shopping. We will definetly stay there again while in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Got scolded by the staff...but rooms and view was nice”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Papa
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, this hotel is nicely located along the waterfront. The rooms where clean and bright. Very typical Westin Standard. The arrival experience was uninspiring compared to other Westin, no help with bags unless requested, check-in time was a bit long but we got the desired connecting room on floor that had a pretty good view. The pool was large and my 3 children where having a great time. It was one of the better Westin Pools. Now for the negative experience, we paid for full service valet. When we wanted to go out for dinner, I called service and requested my car to be brought up. The lady on the phone was friendly and told me that the car should be up in 10 min. We went down to the lobby and our car was ready as promised. As I approached the vehicle, the conversation went something like this: Valet: (condescending tone)"Is this your car??? Me: (puzzled) yes Valet: (harsh tone) don't ever do call down service again Me: oh??! Valet: there is too much going and are you checking out tomorrow? Me: yes Valet: well we are not going to do this service for you? So don't do this again. We have done it this time but we won't be doing it again! Me: in every Westin, I always do a call down service? Plus the lady on the phone never told me. Valet:( continued with condescending tone) well there is too much construction and choose to do call service would be difficult Me: I get that but you should manage I grabbed the key and ignored the man got my family in the car. The conversation was a bit longer but this is what I remembered. As a Gold Status member with Starwood I have never been scolded in such manner at any Starwood property, and trust me I went to many. I am ok with not having a call down service but please manage expectation and there is polite way to say it. In general, I found the staff to have a bit of cold undertone to the way they treat guests compared to other Westin. Most staff were helpful and met our needs but a certain warm, inviting, welcoming feeling was missing. I wrote to the management about the incident but was unanswered which so uncharacteristic of Starwood properties. I have always received a response. I don't think I would want to go back to this property again. While our weekend birthday celebration for my son was great, for me this event cast a shadow over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Alessia88
Reviews.Content: I stay at the hotel 4 times a year on business. I am never disappointed. The rooms are clean, the service is great, and when they make a mistake, which rarely happens, they do no hesitate to make whatever it was, on the house. They have renovated the rooms, and for business, I find them to be more than adequate. The "heavenly beds" are just that, i sleep really well when I am there. I am often upgraded to a lakeside view, which is really nice. The hotel bar is very comfortable, and I go there often with my ipad or documents that I have to read, and I get great service, and do not feel rushed. The food in the hotel is uniformly good, and the cartering is superior. i would thought like another visit to Toula their rooftop restaurant before i weigh in on that experience. They were hosting an event that night, and it was not a great dining experience due to the noise. But the view was great. The food was expensive and while good , not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a night in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Barricuda
Reviews.Content: Spent the might here after our anniversary dinner in the city. We got a room at a cheap price since we went through Priceline. The hotel is located on the harbour front and our room had a view of the lake ontario which was cool. At night the street in front had plenty of street food vendors and all night places so it was an easy access to food. The room was plush and neat and we would definitely consider staying in here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey but a great location.”
Reviews.Author: CCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We stayed on new years, but it wasn't that noisy. The accommodations were great. The hotel is right by Union station so very easy to get to and great views of the city. There work out facilities are nice. The hot tub is crazy hot (which is great because I did the polar bear dip). Nothing but good things to say really.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say anything bad”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatPrayLove
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night on our way back home. We were exhausted, and basically checked in and went to sleep. We weren't disturbed once by any noise, even with our room facing the little landing strip across the water. The Westin still has the most comfortable beds of any hotel, in my opinion. Location was okay, a bit of a walk to shopping, etc. Not a big deal though. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the category”
Reviews.Author: steilkurve
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, downtown Toronto lacks good options in the middle range category of hotels. There's several good high end places, and a few good budget ones. However, it has very few good options in between. Most of those in that category were built in the 70s and only cosmetically fixed up over the years. The exception in my mind is the Westin Harbour Castle. Still built in the same era but one that went through proper renos with rooms pretty much gutted. So, nice rooms, decent service and gorgeous views of the lake on the north side. Cons: Slightly out of the real downtown core, very few rooms where you can't hear the elevator and older/noisy airs conditioning. Despite that, one of the best in that category.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Tired Old Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: scarlet177
Reviews.Content: The Hotel looks nice...the Lobby and Front Desk are very attractive and staff most accomodating. We were given, what we thought, was a lovely corner suite overlooking the water..looking out to the Islands...that is where the "lovely" ended. It became a continual and constant trip/call to the Front Desk. Everything from the TV to the bathroom sink to the thermostat was not working...sigh! It got to be a real pain after the 2nd day! The Concierges were most helpful giving directions - even procuring tickets to a Leafs Game for us! The Restaurant on the 38th Floor offers a spectacular view...however, the food was not acceptable...it is an Italian Restaurnat and both our Pasta meals had to be returned as the Pasta was undercooked...the people at 2 other tables close to us also returned meals. The Lobby Bar offers good drinks from rude staff! We were not pleased with our stay and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: fyzhix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in November 2007 and overall we had a great time. We stayed in a corner suite with a pull-out couch which was spacious, tastefully decorated, and had a fantastically comfortable bed. The location is a bit out of the way since you're down by Queens Quay and the Ferry Docks to the Toronto Islands but it's a great location for attending functions at the ACC or if you don't mind walking to the TTC at Union Station. We had breakfast on one of the mornings and although it was good, I found it quite expensive even by hotel standards. All of the staff were extremely friendly and personable. The only complaint I have is about the check-in. We requested an early check-in and were told it wouldn't be a problem. The room wasn't ready when we arrived (at 1pm) which wasn't a problem since they have a luggage check service. The problem is that it wasn't until 530pm that the room was ready. That isn't acceptable since the standard check-in time is 3pm. The check-in problems did not ruin our stay though and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value under $100”
Reviews.Author: rayz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite central to a lot of sites right on the shores of Lake Ontario and minutes to the convention centre and downtown Toronto. As mentioned in other reviews, people are getting good value through hotwire and other internet cites. I booked mine and bid thrugh Priceline and paid $80 plus taxes for a basic room. The rooms are small, and if the hotel is not that busy, you can always ask for a comp upgrade to the next level. Ask for a room with a view of the lake. Higher up ther better I find. Parking is not free. It is expensive here. $45 per day valet is your best bet. Ask for a discount on check in and you may get it reduced $10. This is a good business/convention type of hotel and lots of hustle and bustle with a constant lineup at the front desk check in. Nice lobby bar to hang out , and lots of people with laptops in the lounge area. Upscale, but not over the top. Good comfortable sleep. Nice bedding. Great valet service. A good bargain hovering around $100 per night for basic room. Did not eat here as there are many other less expensive eating establishments close by. I always suggest to eat at the CN Tower as your lift ticket is included if you dine there. The food is excellent and on a clear day you can see Niagara falls. Book just before dusk so you can have a day time view into the night. Best sightseeing value in my opinion. ( I live in Toronto and go at least once a year)

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulinhoDJ
Reviews.Content: Everything's great: Location, Staff, Breakfast, Internet... Clean and quietly rooms... Perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Green Choice program needs some work”
Reviews.Author: GreatlakesMCS
Reviews.Content: This is the second consecutive year that I have stayed at this hotel during the Toronto Boat Show. As a vendor at the boat show, I'm here in Toronto for a full week. Westin's Green Choice program is a great idea - I certainly don't need to have my towels and sheets changed every day... My biggest gripe is that when I have stopped by the front desk on my way back in after work, and asked to get get coffee packets for my room, they do not have them at the front desk. Both times, they've told me they would send it up and both times after waiting for a ridiculous time, I had to remind them. They need a better system. Otherwise, I enjoy this hotel in general but that may be because we get a reduced rate. At the reduced rate, the rooms are a good value. Everyone is very pleasant and helpful the coffee issue was really the only downside to my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and great view”
Reviews.Author: redhead49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a family trip. We were on the 26th floor and the views out over the city and lake were fantastic. The room was clean and spacious, and our bed was unbelievably comfortable so we had a great night sleep. A slight downside is you have to pay for Internet access and breakfast is also expensive. You'd be better off going to one of the nearby cafes. But, altogether, a really good hotel and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Favorite”
Reviews.Author: gizzymark
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Toronto for an anniversary. Central location good for the hockey hall of fame. Near the CN tower. Took a boat out to the islands, which was nice. Rented bikes to see the Toronto islands and had a good time. Summer time is a great place to vacation. If you are a hockey fan, it's awesome to see the NHL hall of fame nearby...you can walk to it. This hotel is centrally located downtown. Nice rooms, go up in the CN tower. In the summer, there are many festivals downtown. Hockey nuts will like it. There is a very diverse crowd in this this town. People from all over the world immigrate to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: GTruss
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing rate for New Years Eve from Hotwire. Altough my family and I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel, we were very impressed. Courteous staff and a comfortable clean room made for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice stay”
Reviews.Author: KitchenerWelshguy
Reviews.Content: I had some business in Toronto the weekend of Jan8, so my wife came along for mini-vacation. Check-in was quick and efficient and the staff were quite friendly. We had a junior suite facing the lake, and for the harbor front in Toronto, it was pretty reasonable .... $239/night. Room was clean, a good size, and the king-size bed was comfortable. The room had a flat screen TV, though not a particularly big one. Still the reception was good. While I worked, my wife availed herself of the spa which they have in the hotel. It was expensive, but she thoroughly enjoyed herself. View of the lake was beautiful. For the two mornings we were there we had the breakfast buffet. It was quite good, with lots of selection, however, it was also quite expensive. Same thing for room service .... quality was good, but very pricey. Gratuity is included in the room service price, so be careful you don't tip twice. The only negative experience we had was at about 3 in the morning Sunday. There had been a hockey game on in the city, and some of the drunken fans staying at the hotel ... who were either celebrating a victory or mourning a defeat ... made a heck of racket in the corridor outside our room. This went on for about 15 minutes, but by the time I got to the phone to complain to the front desk, they moved the party elsewhere. Its obviously not the hotel's fault .... they have no way of knowing that ill-mannered louts are staying there. Still, it does mean that sounds in the corridor leak into the room, and for light sleepers that could be a problem. All that being said, we will probably stay there again when I have another trip to Toronto. My wife really enjoyed the spa. I didn't have a chance to check out the gymn or pool, but we were told by other guests that the health facilities are quite good. I'll give them a try next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLive
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, gym, pool and sauna very good. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Return every year”
Reviews.Author: Erino87
Reviews.Content: I visit Toronto every year for a weeks time for a large agricultural event. I have stayed here 4 different times now, and love the hotel. Great location downtown, very good service, new, clean rooms. Extremly comfy bed! I have never eaten at the hotel restaurant but have heard good reviews from friends. I will continue to go back. Price wise, they offer great dicounts for booking with our event- im sure they offer other deals throughout the year.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NATJAYW
Reviews.Content: Had holiday party at westin harbour castle. I feel the banquet or halls need renovation. Very old looking... Surrounding the hotel very nice view. We did not stay over night. Just felt that the halls should be renovated, considering it is one of the best hotels in toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: TLLcanada
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in September 2010. Esthetically it is a beautiful hotel and it's location on the harbourfront is wonderful. The meals I had there were better than most hotel food I had ever experienced and would highly recommend it as a convention or wedding venue. I had room service on my first evening and the food came HOT (which in my experience never happens with room service) and quickly. It was reasonably priced as far as room service goes. My room was clean and nicely furnished. I was disappointed that there was not a stocked fridge in my room. However I was mostly disappointed in the noise and coldness of my room. The fan was loud and continuously running. Despite my attempts to warm up the room when I was not there the temperature never changed and I spent two very cold nights in my room bundled up in a sweater and socks over my flannel pajamas. I am not one to complain and didn't have time or energy during the day to ask for a room switch so I just sucked it up. However I did mention it during my checkout and was delightfully surprised when management spontaneously offered up a free nights stay on my next visit. They assured me they would look into the fan issue of the room and fix the thermostat. So customer service definitely means a lot to them. Would I return to this hotel despite the issue with my room? Yes. I would. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that this isn't the norm for their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but other Starwood options exist”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear777
Reviews.Content: Huge convention hotel along the waterfront. A bit far from a good selection of restaurants and bars. Good facilities, but no Club Lounge. Not a bad hotel, but I would rather stay at Sheraton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “A typical Westin.”
Reviews.Author: SusanM643
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here now several times for business. Exactly what you can expect from the Westin. Great bed, clean and good location. Good restaurants around and good access to downtown buildings. Room service was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Property, Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: jmrun1126
Reviews.Content: This is a Westin with some great staff members but some issues with attention to detail. I found it for a real bargain on Starwood's website, so I prepaid for a king room. However my plans changed and I then needed two double beds and since it was prepaid and nonrefundable, I could not make the change myself. An email to the front desk was returned promptly with the change made. Upon arrival, the staff was very friendly and courteous. Entering the room was a bit of a different story. As a SPG Gold member, at least I was given a room with a very good view. Instead of the usual fresh Westin scent in the room, we were met with a musty smell. Immediately outside of the room, the carpet was noticeably stained (27th floor). The bathroom was okay but again lacked attention to detail -- for instance some of the molding had been chipping and cracking. The same was present throughout the whole room. The worst part of the room was a ceiling tile (containing a sprinkler head) that was all mismatched. Overall, we'll only return if the price is good. The location wasn't even that great -- it was a bit of a trek up to Union TTC station or anything for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently high quality rooms...”
Reviews.Author: JCG123DXB
Reviews.Content: Always stay at Westin when visiting Toronto. Top quality bed and very clean. Central location as well - better in summer but always consistent. Expensive parking and no free wifi?? Whats up with Starwood hotels and wifi?

Reviews.Title: “Not to Bad”
Reviews.Author: wrngames
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and close to the tower and to other attractions. It has a good restaurant and coffee shop inside with a small shop for last minute souvenirs and soft drinks if you need any. It is aalso very close to the rocket tram system but is only an additional five min walk or so away from th train station where yoy can catch the underground trains which cover most of the city Checking in and out was very quick and painless which is what you want after a long haul flight. Overall this hotel is clean and adequate for a 2 to 3 break away

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, needs update”
Reviews.Author: 47Sandy
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I was expecting too much, but I was disappointed in my stay at the Westin Harbour Castle. I found it too busy when we got there, we used the valet parking but the front entrance is so full of people and cars. I found the rooms are not great, they are small and well used. They need an update. The pool area and fitness center were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently very good.”
Reviews.Author: markp30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle one night this week for work. It's consistently a good choice for downtown Toronto. On this particular stay, I had a standard room with king bed. The room was a decent size, and the finishes were clean and contemporary. Linens and bed were comfortable. No problems with the wireless. In the past, I don't remember having a microwave in the room. There was one in this room, just sitting on the dresser. It seems kinda goofy (am I going to heat up a frozen lasagna maybe?), and cheapens the place. Otherwise no complaints about the room itself. During past trips, I've parked at the lot recommended by the hotel - it was inexpensive, but a long walk. This time I paid for the valet parking, which was very efficient and easy - definitely worth what they're charging. Location of the Westin isn't ideal - it's a ten minute walk to Front St. to catch the subway or find restaurants, etc. I don't mind the exercise, but there are definitely better-located hotels in the city. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: PrincessArlene
Reviews.Content: For a downtown Toronto hotel, the Harbour Castle offers nothing special. Standard room, reasonably clean; some of the carpets and furnishings a bit stained. Good view of the lake, unless you want to look at the building across the street. "Heavenly Bed" -- not so much for me. Woke up to the worst pain in my side from an uncomfortable bed. Also, the comforter on the bed -- did they think we were sleeping in the sub-artic -- OMG way too hot The heating unit in the room sounded like a jet engine. On-site valet parking of $40 ????? really? Try $20 about 10 feet away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Awesome City”
Reviews.Author: dumpty27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle over two weeks in November/December 2011 and was very pleased with the property. The hotel is truely a "full service" hotel. Pros Great location - there are multiple restaurants and bars and sights to see within walking distance of the hotel. Where we were working was downtown and within a 20 minute walk every day. The hotel was very lively, there were conferences, UFC fighters, and many people in and out making the lobby and bar scene quite lively Rooms with a view - I had three different rooms over the course of my stay. Two with views of the CN tower and one with a corner view of the harbour and city. The corner rooms are awesome...really nice views. Work out facilities - very nice workout room with a lot of equipment, treadmills and elipticals. Also a really nice pool area. Cons Toronto is in general an expensive city. You'll notice this when a beer at the bar costs you $10 and a coffee and muffin from the little Starbucks costs you $7. Some of the paint in the room is getting a little worn. Self parking is $30, but I think you can park in the same lot for $15 a day, so I'm not sure why the markup? Maybe because of in and out privileges? The hotel also did a great job resolving an issue for me. One afternoon I returned from work and the connecting door in my room was ajar (save for the latch). They moved me no problem to a room with a better view. Kudos to the staff. In general, if I was traveling for business, I would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Great view...like the indoor pool!”
Reviews.Author: SusieJue
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Toronto for business while the Greenbuild trade show was in town. Even though the hotel was sold out, I was able to get a Starwood Platinum upgraded room to a Jr Suite with panoramic view. Everyone at the Westin Toronto is very friendly and helpful, including Gus and Goran at the front desk. They were able to get my friend a room, even though they were sold out. There is alot of energy at the hotel and seems to attract many young adults. From the airport, it is very easy to get to the hotel on the Airport Express bus that is on the curb as you exit the airport. The fare was $23.95 one way and $39.95 round trip. The first stop is the Westin and the ride was comfortable and quick.www.torontoairportexpress.com. The valet parking is $40. The check-in was smooth and I was in room 2639 in the north tower with an excellent water view. There are 35 floors in this building. The room was large with king Westin Heavenly bed, desk, lounge chair, mini refrigerator and 30" flat panel TV. There was a large closet with safe and iron board. I really enjoyed the Starbucks coffee maker with tea also, in the room. The bathroom had a tub/shower combo, robe, slippers and the small size Westin toiletries. I loved the counter makeup mirror, usually they are wall mounted and I am short, so they're always too high. As a Starwood Platinum member, you get free bottled water daily and in room internet access. The weather was rainy and I was going to explore the city before my meetings, but it was so nice to hang out at the indoor pool and just relax. The pool (open 5 am - 11 pm) , fitness center and locker room (with sauna and steam room) is located on the 5th floor with the Westin Kids Club. The weather was 15 degrees colder than normal and the HVAC was not adjusted for this. My room was too cold for my liking and I met Kevin, the Director of Engineering and he was right on it! Unwind in the lobby is Mon-Fri from 5-7 pm and they serve small bites. Our last night, we were going to find a restaurant close by and were so exhausted we sat in the lobby bar and had small plates. There was a good variety of choices on the menu and we were happy. There is a small store across the street for drinks and snacks and there is a kiosk in the lobby that serves Starbucks coffee and pastries in the morning. There is also a gift store in the lobby for magazines, drinks, snacks etc. Also a Business Center here and kiosk for printing boarding passes. The room service seems reasonable at $16.50 for ham and eggs breakfast or $17.50 for continental breakfast, plus 15% service. The reason that I do not give this hotel five stars, is that there is no Starwood Club Lounge for free breakfast and evening appetizers. I think the location is not ideal, but suitable and you can easily get around. The CN Tower is within walking distance. Seems like the choices for restaurants may be limited if you want something within walking distance. Toronto is a very sustainable city and definitely someplace for foodies! The side trip to Niagara, the surrounding wineries (check out Stratus Winery) and the town of Niagara on the Lake is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Had higher expectations from this place.”
Reviews.Author: slantyvivie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a small getaway for my fiancÃ©e and I. We stayed one night and had a lakeview room on the seventh floor. The service at the lobby check in was slow and not very welcoming. At first glance the room was nice. Good size, but it wasn't very clean. The headboard was stained-eeew. There were toe nail clippings under the bed. The shower was starting to clog up a bit. The make up mirror was grimey. We ordered room service for breakfast and it was good, but very very expensive. Overall, we wouldn't stay again. It was just too expensive to stay in a dirty room.

Reviews.Title: “Fading quality with new competition in downtown Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: HughK1
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbour Castle is getting a bit tattered around the edges and even with a recent facelift internally it's looking decidedly 80's (well maybe 90's). The location is pretty good with everything that you would be in Toronto for just a few minutes walk away. The rooms that overlook the lake have great views. It's got pretty good Westin service, the rooms are not super expensive or super cheap, they are pretty clean but it all feels all a bit drab and dreary. The food options in the hotel are average at best and the Toula's on the top floor is best avoided. Here's the real issue - Toronto and Canada for that matter are really going places. Great restaurants are springing up around town, many new 4 and 5 star hotels are either built or about to be finished and the poor old Westin is simply getting left behind. To be fair it's a good place to have as you can really see how much Toronto has come on in recent years. I have used the WHC for business for years now but I am afraid we are moving on as there are much better options close by at the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: biztrav2011
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times. The view of the lake is great. It's within walking distance of several great restaurants. They offer some great rates throughout the year. The rooms and beds are very comfortable. The only complaint I had was retrieving our vehicle from the valet at the end of our stay. It took forever and they were not very organized.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed some of the facilities”
Reviews.Author: nadma
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel but I did attend a conference there in November 2011. Great facilities. I liked the conference rooms, had a good time at the lobby bar and ate amazing food at the restaurant on the main floor by the escalators. The salmon filet was to die for!! All in all, this hotel is located close walk to the happening district and offers wonderful views of the harbour. Very close to the city airport which I flew in/out of. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING in every way”
Reviews.Author: kingjkhan
Reviews.Content: being an spg gold member as with any spg hotel i was treated awesome the rooms were very nice with comfortable beds and Great view of the city and harbor and the lake ontario of course! efficient friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “the best 5 star hotel in toronto”
Reviews.Author: jraja1
Reviews.Content: Great quality room with all mod amenities, friendly and helpful staff, amazing views (of lake ontario), sauna is a bit worn down though, one of the best locations in downtown Toronto, free wifi, overall amazing! Excellent lounge & business centre with stunning views!

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront view with modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Linda K
Reviews.Content: The junior suite was lovely, clean and modern decor. Comfy beds, spacious layout with a view to the fairy boats traveling to Toronto Island. Location, is not right down town so you need to take a cab or subway. Yet if you don't want the hustle then it's location is good. Very close to the aircanada center so it gets all the people from there for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Never stayed here before. Had a nice room at the top - great view!”
Reviews.Author: RandyMark
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in this hotel. Found the rooms a little cramped and dated, but not too bad. We had a room near the top of the hotel. Great view of the city and harbor! Found things a little pricey in the bar, restaurant, etc. So ended up going out for food. Close to a number of places. We also went to a hockey game. Close to the Air Canada Centre too - just a short walk. Overall, nice place.

Reviews.Title: “evening out with my husband”
Reviews.Author: Mexx_10
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the hotel, check in was fast and efficient. The room was pleasantly appointed and the view to Toronto Island stunning. The service at the bar, even so it was really busy, was timely and friendly. Breakfast buffet pricy but worth it. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JMA_QC
Reviews.Content: Westin habituÃ©s be warned : this property does not live up to expectations. As a longtime SPG member, I chose the Harbour Castle in Toronto for a week-end with a friend because I've usually been very satisfied with the Westin experience. However, the room disappointed for many reasons. The first room we were assigned hadn't been made up yet. Back to the front desk. The second room had dirty bathroom floors, toothpaste in the sink, fingerprints all over the windows. Time Out Toronto described the rooms as "light & spacious" : ours was quite small and very dull. Loud inconsiderate neighbors because of a badly sound-proofed connecting door was the straw that broke the camel's back : back downstairs to the front desk to request a room change. Manager Aditya P. was very apologetic and immediately found us a better room; he also waived the charges for the Internet access and a phone call that had been made, a much appreciated attempt to soothe ruffled feathers. He also called to make sure the new (third) room was satisfactory. The Escape Package included breakfast for two in the Mizzen Dining Room: satisfactory but not outstanding. We realize cleaning rooms is monotonous and boring, but that's not a reason to cut corners nor take pride in one's work. A lot depends on the first impression and for many women, it makes all the difference between a return trip or not. True, front desk staff were efficient, but not particularly welcoming. Bar staff were gracious. But the cleanliness issue will make me think twice before going back or recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weird place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ENem
Reviews.Content: The property itself is nice - comfortable rooms, nice views. I can't really complain in that regard. However, like others have said, it's very expensive and "nickel and dime-y" compared to hotels in other cities of that size. The cost for basic services was a bit high - Can $7 for a very small chai latte at the cafe, and the other restaurants were similarly expensive (yes, semi-normal for hotel restaurants, but the food quality not even remotely worth the expense). Also, some of the foodservice staff were quite rude, making me even less thrilled to shell out $20 for a chicken sandwich. The conference facilities were OK. Room sizes were nice, but the actual meeting rooms are scattered about several floors among 2 buildings, and I can see where it would be a bit of a pain for anyone with mobility challenges. All in all, I would most likely look for someplace else to stay on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Exhibit Number One in Corporate Greed”
Reviews.Author: gazooby
Reviews.Content: What do you say about a hotel that asks you if you want to "go green" when you check in and then tells you they mean you won't get housekeeping service? So the $5 per night they give you (NOT good at the bar, by the way, and forget about using it toward your hotel bill or for an early cup of coffee) is supposed to compensate for their contribution toward Toronto's unemployment rate? I cannot believe they had the chutzpah to compensate me $5/night for the $25 in overhead they saved, while putting more women out of work. Then there was the $28 for 48 hours of internet (but NOT good for the conference end of the hotel, only worked in the lobby and my room), the $14 bowl of oatmeal, and the $10 glass of beer. I left gasping at the greed. Yes, my room was decent and the staff did their best even while they said "no" to my requests to put my worthless $5 chits toward the cost of my room. It just wasn't worth the price. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “A Review of Westin Harbour Castle (2011)”
Reviews.Author: drjwb42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle due to a scheduled conference. What I liked most about the hotel was the kids club. My 4 year old enjoyed the atmosphere set up in the pool area and the social activities designed for toddlers. So for that they get a good rating from me. I did think the pricing was a bit high for food and the movies on demand. This kind of thing made me feel as if I was being "nickeled and dime" to death. The room was clean, although we did have to call each day to remind them to re-service the coffee area. Overall it was a good hotel, the bell staff were extremely nice, and we enjoyed our harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service EVER”
Reviews.Author: LynneKnowlts
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle many times. We love it every single time. We have come to get to know some of the staff members and it has made our stays even more special. We love the rooms with the lake view. Room service food is SPECTACULAR. They have a very warm reception for us when we arrive. Beautiful service. Feels like home. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, restful stay.”
Reviews.Author: geetap
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, just want to say it was a delight. It's been a long time since I've stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle, and sorry I stayed away so long.....worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not going to return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mart439
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Westin hotels before and have always been impressed. This servive at this hotel was awful from the minute we checked in until check out. The beds were not "heavenly" nor were the showers. We booked a corner room but when we arrived they said they were all sold out. That wasn't such a big deal because our room was fine and to make up for it they said that the 3 couples that booked with us which were arriving the following night would all be put on the same floor as us to make up for the confusion. When the others in our group arrived they said the corner rooms could be available for an extra $60. Odd considering we were told they were booked. So once everyone had checked in there was one room on the 8th, 32nd, and 34th floor, and we were in a completely different tower. Not quite the same floor. The remote never worked for our tv after calling and having it replaced twice. And a request to have our room cleaned between 9 am and 1pm while we were out was egnored. When we returned to the hotel in the evening 4 of us decided we would have a drink at the hotel bar before going to out rooms, after the bartender took our order the manager came over and cancelled 2 of the orders and saying we had to go straight to bed. I asked him why but he just egnored me, after the others left i went to ask why he cancelled my order. He was very rude and then proceded to act as though he didnt speak english. When I told him I was going to write a complaint he said "I don't care, it won't matter anyway!" Great management staff!!!! We were going to book around 4 rooms at another Westin this summer for our wedding but are now second guessing our decision based on this hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying hotel, just so annoying”
Reviews.Author: american_expat_CPH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in October for a conference and cannot get enthused about the place. Annoying service throughout. And so overpriced. The hotel itself is a flashback to the 80's, very ugly building. After a long flight from Europe, had a very slow checkin, which was just torture. Room was okay, and I had a lakeview which was nice. The one light spot in the whole visit was the bed, which was nice. Never ate the overpriced breakfast buffet, but ate at Cocoberry Cafe to the right of the hotel which was good-and way cheaper. The hotel tried to tell us it would be 30 more dollars a night to get a working referigerator in our room as the one we had didnt work. After my husband raised hell with this extremely nice man who was a maintenance person, we got one delivered for free, so thank you to this guy, sorry but i cant remember his name. On second thought, it was just the front desk staff and those freakin customer service agents or whatever they call themthat tell you a refrigerator that works will be 30 extra dollars a day that were annoying. Hard to recommend for that price overall, but the hotel seems extremely popular.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I am a huge starwood fan, so I always try to stay at a starwood property if possible. This is an average starwood hotel. I only stay here when there's a business conference on site. The rooms are clean and the staff are nice. The location is poor. It's almost impossible to find park in the neighborhood. You're kind of forced to park at the hotel and it ain't cheap parking there!

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janebird
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have stayed at this hotel many, many times and thought it was about time I gave them props for being such a great place to stay. The beds are so comfortable and the rooms have a very modern, chic decor. I have always had amazing customer service and I would encourage everyone who intends on staying here to become a Starwood Preferred member. You get amazing deals at all Starwood Hotels including the Westin. Give the Toula Restaurant a try. Its a little pricey, but the 180 degree view of the city is second to none. The hotel is located downtown TO right on the lakeshore. If possible request a lakeview room, it is very beautiful to wake up to a sunset over the lake. I would choose this hotel over the Royal York, time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant service at the Harbour Castle”
Reviews.Author: halliday79
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the Westin Harbour Castle with a 13 month old baby and the hotel couldn't have been more helpful. After struggling for 2 days to heat bottles/food we requested a microwave which they provided, as well as a high chair for our room, free of charge. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The swimming pool and children's play area were fantastic for our baby who hadn't got used to the time change and got up at 05.30 every morning.

Reviews.Title: “One of my fave Toronto hotels!”
Reviews.Author: slim83
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels in Toronto. The rooms are great. They are very clean, the beds are extemely comfortable, and it just has a great atmosphere. The lobby is beautiful as well. I normally order room service; and I am never dissapointed with the quality of the food. This hotel is located downtown; however; if you prefer the hustle and bustle of the downtown core where restaurants and such are walking distance, this is not the hotel for you. However, by cab, everything is a mere 5-10 minutes away within downtown. I will definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator Noise”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is expansive, with good decor, modern and spacious, but each time we stay there we can hear the mechanisms from the elevators. It appears that because the elevators are centrally located (certainly in the North Tower) that, regardless of where your room is located, you will always hear the clangs and clanks from the constantly moving elevator cables and mechanisms. Unfortunately, this means we have now decided to choose another hotel in future. Also, less problematic, but inconvenient is the consistently poor service from valet parking. The call from our room asking valet to retrieve our cars is never relayed to valet and so we don't bother any more and ask for the vehicle at the outside lobby. Valet has confirmed that this is a problem they've also spoken to the hotel about, but to no avail. Lastly, room service food is tired and poor. Why would you add fresh rosemary to fries? I question how many times the chicken and peppers had been reheated before it got to me. It is clear that the food - across the board - is recirculated, ie chicken which is past its best is cooked, chopped and stored and thrown into various other dishes. We don't expect gourmet, but we do expect fresh and juicy.

Reviews.Title: “Average Westin”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here quite a few times, and although it isn't my favorite hotel of all, it isn't bad. First of all, if you are offered an upgraded room for a fee, save your money. I find the 'upgraded' rooms are lacking in various things. For some reason the lake view rooms and junior suites only have single-headed showers whereas most 'standard' rooms have the advertised double-headed showers. Rooms themselves are starting to look just a little tired. I also don't really care for the very bright lighting in the bathroom. The 'junior suites' are slightly larger rooms. Nothing more... Cleanliness at this hotel has improved over the years, and I've never seen any bed bugs. Pool area OK but not as good as the Sheraton. The beds are, well, heavenly. Never have an issue sleeping on them. Also, don't rely on the wake up call. On my last visit it didn't happen. Make sure you set a back-up alarm. The Mizzen restaurant makes a decent breakfast. Overall, not a terrible hotel, but there are definitely better choices in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “SPG hotels never fail to impress”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of the entire SPG chain of hotels (no - i don't work there or have stock in the company). When our conference was slated to be at the Westin i was happy. I was at the hotel for 4 nights and could not say enough nice things about it. Great location, great staff, good food, conference facilities were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: HelloKitty_35_76
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbour Castle is a great place to stay in the city while getting a beautiful view of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views from every side”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several times in June/July while my condo was under renovations and was amazed at how great this hotel is. Two towers conected to a convention centre right on the central waterfront. Views of the lake and Toronto Island, cool with the island airport right there watching the planes land and take off. Views from the rooms facing away from the lake and you get the downtown towers and CN Tower, which are all lit up at night, Great room with wi-fi and comfy beds. Bathrooms are small but clean. Ferry boat dock to Toronto Island right outside and easy walk to Hockey Hall of Fame and Path shopping. TTC right outside or a 10 min walk to Union Station. Air Canada Centre is right there and a short cab ride to the Entertainment District/Distillery District.

Reviews.Title: “A world appart”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2612
Reviews.Content: istayed 3 days for business in toronto but a had to bring my 9 month son and the nanny. The view was incredible from th 20th floor. It make you feel like you are in the islands. We enjoy the pool, it is very large and sunny (because surounded by windows.) we didn't have a fridge in the room, would have been practical.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wixxON
Reviews.Content: Check in was seamless, front desk very helpful. Room was well appointed. Bed & pillows very comfortable. The only negative was that the bathroom floor was suspect as far as cleanliness was concerned. It also troubles me that a hotel/conference centre charges for internet and local/calling card phone calls. Breakfast was very nice and in general, the entire experience was enjoyable, the staff efficient and pleasant. Catching a cab for the airport was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Chris044
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in october in the Westin Harbour Castle. The hotel is very nice and well located from the harbour were you can find in a walking distance, bars and restaurants. Toronto downtown can also be easilly reached by foot. (Eaton center is at 20min walk) This hotel is also well located for the Air Canada Center. We got a pretty good deal with a free third night. Only bad comments is the parking that is terribly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property - parking can be improved”
Reviews.Author: krobins110276
Reviews.Content: The property and rooms were nice, but give yourself lots of extra time (20-30 minutes) at checkout to receive your car because the process is slooow. It also took an extremely long time park as well when I checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashley014
Reviews.Content: Arriving to the hotel there was a steady amount of traffic going to the hotel and the drive way up was blocked with traffic, my taxi driver wouldn't pull up in the drive way due to it, so I then had to carry my 3 heavy bags up, around 40 stairs. Once at the top the stairs, the entrance to the lobby was lovely, there was a large line up to the front desk, which was disappointing, but understandable when I found out they had over 900 rooms. Once checked in the ( they were lovely at front desk) and going to my room, I found out quickly that the room walls are very thin and I could even here music from a room that was 10 doors down. Be warned this a big busy hotel. Hallway are worn and need a touch up.
