The next thing I asked for was 2 bowls for my room, when doing this I was told there would be a $2.50 drop off fee, which I was very suprised with for such a well branded hotel and star rating it felt like I was staying at a hoilday inn, small little touches are what I feel large chain brands should be good at! The gym and pool are great, enough equipement in the gym. Would I stay here again, I would say no. I think I like the hotel that is smaller and can give that little added touch, plus a few thicker wall wouldn't go a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff - Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: fint22
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the friendliness of the service desk staff, as well as the housekeeping staff. The housekeeping staff in the hallways were pleasant and made my morning commute down the hallway into a nice day. Location is a little out of the way of the convention center/theater district/CN tower, and is an easy walk during the day, but needs a cab if you are returning alone at night. The harborfront view and quaint setting is worth the commute. Overall, I had a very positive experience at this establishment - only docked it one dot due to the breakfast being over $20 for a bowl of oatmeal, although the wait staff was also very nice. There is a really nice breakfast place two blocks to the right as you walk down the street. Also - the ATM one block away does not charge any fee!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Stephy3026
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin as my fiancÃ©e attended a business meeting and I couldn't be happier with the hotel selection. This hotel is not just close to several attractions it also sits next to the lake and we had a beautiful balcony room with a wonderful view. Since I was alone most of the time the staff was very helpful and beyond friendly explaining all the services they offered daily breakfast and lunch in the restaurant on the lobby floor which was delicious and the pricing was not bad also. They also have a pretty large gym, very big pool,jaquzzi, steam shower and sauna that made the stay pretty nice also. They also have an amazing spa on site that i recommend to all! The staff was so wonderful they personally lead me to the gift shop when I forgot an item and did not want to go in town to a regular store. The gift store sells daily useful items in case if you forgot to pack anything. The valet staff are also very helpful and available 24 hours and available to get you a cab within a few seconds. They also have a wonderful conceirge desk that advised us of beautiful resturants and great activities in the area which we were able to have dinner in the CN tower that was pretty cool and different. The rooms are also very large and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. We also ordered room service and the food was delicious. Wether a business trip or for vacation this hotel is a beautiful place and they also have a small park by the lake that you could go for a walk or jog if you would like.

Reviews.Title: “Do not organise any business meetings in this place!”
Reviews.Author: JAEMH
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to depart after 9 nights in the hotel. Why? 1) the rooms are relative small and have even smaller bathrooms (you are not able to be in the bathroom with two persons in the morning without bumping into each other) 2) staff was not able to accommodate any of our request to change rooms (some what strange in a hotel with nearly 1000 rooms). 3) The top suite was not available in time for our VIP guest. He was asked to wait for a hour and was only given an alternative after we complaint. In a later stage the VIP guest was given a suite which was already occupied by another guestâ€¦.We were so shocked! 4) The staff in the restaurant are not facilitating any wishes. They were so rude to phone us late in the evening to settle a bill for a function. They demanded that we would come out of bed to pay (while they knew we would stay in the hotel for another week). 5) Drinks during functions are very expensive (11 dollar for wine and 6,50 dollar for soft drinks). All our (European) guests complaint. 6) The conference room was very noisy and the staff was not able to offer us an alternative room or stopped the noise. 7) Internet is not included in the rather expensive room rate. 8) spa is very old fashion and should not carry the name 'spa' On the more positive side: 1) the location is good. Close to the waterfront and in walking distance to down town (e.g. Eaton centre is 15 minutes by foot) 2) room was clean 3) environmental friendly options for not making use of housekeeping and be rewarded. However, in conclusion, we will not return and will look for another place to organise our meetings. We assume there are many other and better options in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views”
Reviews.Author: MSEbeling
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for walking the city and still getting the benefit of waterfront views. The room was clean and comfortable. The facility overall is one that I would recommend overall. It is the service that could have been better on our visit, but don't let that deter you from booking here as it is completely fixable! Ask for a waterfront view: worth it! Areas for improvement: Explain the parking situation when I'm at the desk or talking with the bellmen. "Self-parking over there" with a point and no mention beyond that is not helpful. "You know it's only $10 more / day to valet?" Yes, but I don't even like paying $30 for a car that is going to sit there for 3 days. For those checking in, go to the parking booth near the front door to get info - it will save you time and frustration. Pool area could use an update - seems a little dated for a Westin. The bathroom door was quite successful at blocking the toilet is was a little strange of a layout.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ssawrup
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Harbour this past weekend. The hotel room was clean, beds were comfortable and the amenities were good. We had an issue with the noise level in the room next door, so we called the front desk and it was very promptly dealt with so we could go back to sleep! Much appreciated. Kids enjoyed the pool area and the location was great too. There is valet parking for $40 but self parking is about a 5 minute walk away for $30/night. This tends to be how most downtown Toronto hotels are. The only thing that I wish they would change is provide free wi-fi to their guests. If lower end hotels and motels can do this for free, why not Westin? We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible conference venue”
Reviews.Author: jwcanada
Reviews.Content: We just organized a large international medical conference at the Westin (over 1,050 delegates) and the venue and service was outstanding! I have been planning conferences internationally for almost 20 years and the Westin team knows how to take care of the DETAILS. Upon arrival, they syncronized their BBM with ours and from then on the service exceeded all our expectations. Chef Duff did an incredible job on our Welcome Reception and Gala Dinner. Our hotel rooms were very comfortable. The energy at the Westin starts with Rekha at the top and continues throughout the hotel. We cannot wait to come back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A landmark in Toronto heavily disappoints”
Reviews.Author: iamcanadianenuf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin in Beijing, Singapore and from both stays I thought Westin was a top grade hotel; this trip to Toronto made me completely change my opinion. The facilities are old, which is fine if the service and amenities made up for it. There was no slippers in my room, and no toothbrush set. These are very basic items that a hotel should provide. The room was extremely dark, as if to hide the fact the carpet has stains and hadn't been cleaned in a decade. The noise barriers were low, every time someone walked by our room, it seems as if they were IN our room. And breakfast options were pretty poor, I walked 20 minutes to go to another cafe in the rain. Overall, the Westin Harbour Castle, which toots itself as a landmark hotel in Toronto is a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “i say... YES!”
Reviews.Author: Danoly G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a weekend and I must say, it was phenomenal! I work for a sister property, so from the start, my expectations were high! The service was fantastic- everyone was eager to assist, personable, and most importantly warm and welcoming! It was a great experience and this property is also centrally located- we were able to walk just about everywhere! Also, the pool deck, tennis courts, and basketball courts were a definite PLUS! I would definitely recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “The harbour views are great!”
Reviews.Author: PipsM
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. Best of all, we were upgraded from a city view room to a harbour view room without even asking. It is certainly a lovely view! The beds here are also super comfortable. I often have trouble sleeping and I had the best sleep I've had for a long time. My only complaint was that when we asked the concierge about the Airport Express bus that leaves from right outside the hotel, we were given some vague information that wasn't entirely accurate. It also would have assisted us if the concierge had mentioned that there is actually a shuttle timetable posted outside the hotel - this would have helped us to plan how to get to the airport but the concierge didn't mention this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent travel experience”
Reviews.Author: Tonyahall
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Harbour for one week and it was a top of the line experience. Everyone from the concierge to the guest relations staff was immaculately professional. I had a room on the 34th floor (lakeview room) which was exceptional. Anything I needed was provided before I could get the words out of my mouth. It was quiet, the beds were very comfortable and the location is phenomenal. Its just a quick walk to a variety of restaurants. I'm visiting again in November for a week! Definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air!”
Reviews.Author: JBalzli
Reviews.Content: It's not often that you find a world class hotel which gives you the opportunity to control the amount of fresh air coming into your room. These rooms have a small operable vent at the window. It's brilliant because it helps to prevent the scratchy throat and dry mouth that I always get at hotels because the air conditioning system removes all the humidity from the air in the room. Loved it!! Of course, this Westin had super comfy beds and the usual simple but elegant furnishings and fixtures. They also make it easy to opt out of daily sheet and towel laundering for the sustainability-minded guests. Even their mini shampoo bottles are recyclable - surprising not common in hotels. The staff at the front desk, concierge, and lobby bar were courteous and friendly. And, the room was cleaned to a sparkle every day. A few things to keep in mind: The lakefront location means you're a bit separated from the rest of the city by an elevated freeway. However, it's short walk to the city center and public transportation. The hotel entrance is a whole floor (maybe more) above street level. So, I'm not certain how a disabled person can get from the public sidewalk to the hotel. You might want to inquire about this if you can't climb stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the north/west tower. What a great room (# ended in 19) with a great view! Clean, up to date, quiet, and modern. Lots of space, awesome bed, and an attentive, professional staff. Definitely recommending to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: JoziMatt
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to be in downtown Toronto on business or leisure, I highly recommend the Westin. Check in was professional and friendly, the room was great, the view from the 31st floor was awesome, and I had a good sleep. The location is perfect for the Eaton Centre and other locations nearby. I would definitely make a point of staying there again. I got a good deal on Hotwire for this hotel, and it's worth noting if you are looking for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: steve_the_nomad
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed here and every time has been a pleasant experience. The check in staff are always very pleasant. The rooms have always been very clean. On the down side the hotel does host a lot of conferences so there is a lot of conference type traffic in the lobby. Overall a nice place

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Air Canada Centre Concert !!”
Reviews.Author: CuteTravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night as we were attending a concert at the Air Canada Centre. It was easy to find, had very courteous valet parking, friendly check-in/check-out, and a nice clean, quiet, comfortable room. The hotel itself has a huge lobby where we met a friend afterwards for a drink who, coincidentally, was staying there on business. Our stay was very brief, as we only checked in, freshened up, attending the concert, spent the night, and checked out the next morning. Therefore, I can't really comment on all of the amenities the hotel had to offer as our time was limited, and we could not take advantage of all of them. But as far was what were were looking for, which is great location, clean comfortable room, and courteous service, this hotel certainly met our needs and we would stay again, and based on our brief experience we would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Katanka
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, service is good, room service fast and efficient. Food decent. Beds very comfortable and huge. Decor - good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jean-marc2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the harbour castle for 4 days in July. The hotel is really well located close to the water and to some of the best scenery in Toronto. The rooms are nice enough ( standard Westin fare) and the staff is helpful but not outstanding. I really enjoyed relaxing walks on the harbor front during my stay. The hotel is walking distance to downtown but the walk is a bit of a stretch. So if you enjoy the shopping and theater scene, there may be better options closer to the action. If you like scenery by the water, it is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin was better a few years ago”
Reviews.Author: Luc427
Reviews.Content: The staff at check-in could be a lot friendlier. The room was alright. Clean sheets, comfortable bed. The drains in the bathroom were clogged (sink and bathtub/shower). The faucet for the sink was leaking. The room was very quiet even tough we were next to the elevator. Good location and does the job for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would recomend!”
Reviews.Author: llinosj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay in the Westin Harbour, we had a fantastic room for 3 of us, 2 adults and 1 child. " double beds. The hotel is right on the water front, fantastic view, our room had a view of the CN Tower and the waterfront, couldnt have asked for better and staff so friendly and helpful. we booked through Canadian affair, paid Â£68.00 per room per night, the hotel direct were asking $389 CDS. Book before you go and you will be very happy

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: Bayfieldbunch
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here with our two boys age 4 and 5. The front desk staff member was nice enough to send up a couple of kids' kits that my boys loved (a hat, map, pencil crayons, stencils and postcards). Nice pool, no complaints. We were in the south tower this time, I'd ask for this one, I think it's newer then the north and is handier for the pool, restaurant and reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms not cleaned properly during a 7 day stay”
Reviews.Author: kathiella
Reviews.Content: The locaton of the hotel is excellent. Right next to the lake and close to the financial district. The rooms are spacious although the bathrooms are poorly lit and not very attractive. The most disappointing thing was the lack of cleaining during my one week stay. Toothpaste and soap marks on the sink were left, the shower and toilet were not cleaned and shampoo and conditioner were not replaced. In fact, i got in the shower on day 4 and realised that I had no shampoo. It took them 20 minutes to bring it up to the room and I was almost late for a meeting. The gym and pool are really nice and well kept. The breakfast was pretty good. Would have been nice to have fresh berries insttead of canned, but apart from that it was nice. The waiter ignored us on the first day, so we didn't add a tip to the bill. When we asked for the bill he got quite pushy and told us we had to add a service charge! Finally, an internet charge was mistakenly added to my bill. I am a platinum member and I get tired of having to ask for this to be manually taken off in some hotels. I phoned reception and had to have quite a discussion to get them to remove it without me showing up at the front desk. They wanted me to come down to reception and take care of it. The hotel is packed with huge queues at reception so I didn't want to have to deal with it. Overal ok, but mediocre service and poor cleaning of the room somewhat compensated by the nice gym and location.

Reviews.Title: “Mint condition hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfcovi
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have seen in a city. I stayed there in October 2009 as well as a celebrity like Zinedine Zidane. I had two connecting rooms, one of which I had booked through hotwire. The location is very convenient but you are not in the centre of Toronto. If you are going to see a game at the Air canada centre, that's fine, you can walk from the hotel and see a game. I have only good things to say about this hotel. If you need to go to Ward's Island, you're good to go as well since the Ferry departs from there. They have a nice pool and a good spa and a very new gym. I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT VACATION DESTINATION”
Reviews.Author: Nadz007_11
Reviews.Content: On the lake with views of Centre Island, which is a ferry away. Excellent service, comfortable rooms, valet parking and great food. Grab a hotdog outside the hotel as well. Red line double decker tour bus picks up right outside of the hotel and there is an airport shuttle service as well. Westin Kids Club amenties are provided and a children's play room (unsupervised). Parking is expensive, but there is cheaper parking in the vicinity. Eaton Centre, CN Tower and other attractions are accessible. Across the street and down the road is a fun sports bar as well as a supermarket for odds and ends. Just ask the hotel though for toiletries etc. Heated pool, great gym, activity centre for kids and adults, a business centre and much more. It was a great stay for our tour of Toronto Canada and adjacent to the Toronto Island Ferry, Harbourfront Centre, Queens Quay, and the Hockey Hall of Fame. Centre Island a lovley park and great for picnics with lovely lake views and mini amusement park. The ride on the ferry alone was worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Mumbo82
Reviews.Content: Organized a stay at the hotel for 20 people, i talked to reservations a few times to make sure our check in was all set for when we arrived. Unfortunately reservations ( someone in Texas or somewhere) apparently do not have the best communication with the people actually at the hotel. Fortunately Joe(I believe his name was) at the front desk managed to get it sorted out for us, but check in took quite awhile. Try to make sure you talk to someone at the hotel when making your reservations for a group. The rooms were nice, ask for a lake view and up high and you will get a great view. The pool area was okay, steam room was not all that great but the hotel had a good work out area. Location is great for staying in Toronto, walking distance to many places. Parking is really expensive, $40 for valet parking or $30 if you want to park in a parking lot close to the hotel. The valet service was good, and cars were brought in good time. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Green and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FromToronto2011
Reviews.Content: Very functional and comfortable room with a King Size with the Heavenly Bed. Hotel were unusally friendly-but check-in was slow since they wanted to tell you about their green program. Bar staff in main lobby were very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Spot to Stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RIVTing
Reviews.Content: I ended up at the Westin Harbour Castle accidentally when another hotel erased my reservation and a friend who had booked the Westin was unable to make the trip. What luck! I encountered the best service I have ever had at a hotel of any kind in any country. Not only were they smart and quick, there was no pretense. The price was reasonable and the location was perfect. They provided me with a convenient sized pocket map with a 5k and 8k running route along the lake. There are little grocery stores nearby for keeping meal costs down and the gift shop had reasonably priced phone chargers (I forgot mine as usual). I'm planning on staying there next year when I visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel right on Lake Ontario”
Reviews.Author: tylerfitz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a few woman as we were going to a concert. Staff were very friendly, rooms were fantastic and beds were so comfortable. We walked outside along the boardwalk and had lunch at a nearby pub outside on the water. There is ferry access right from the hotel to centre Island as well. If you have a chance to stay here, do not hesitate. Ultra modern rooms as well. Beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business/conference hotel stay in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: winegirlSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted a client conference at this hotel. Everything was above average, I am only sorry I didn't get to experience more leisure time in the hotel. My room (2 doubles) was very comfortable although a bit on the small side - okay by me as long as the beds are comfy, (which they were) and the service is responsive (which it was). I loved the view out to the lake, very peaceful waking up to the sailboats on the water. I was actually surprised at how good the food and service was at the conference...no rubber chicken lunches here! Great hot breakfasts and seated lunches. The staff was beyond helpful. I would like to go back and stay here when I had more time to relax as it is located in a vibrant area of Toronto - close to restaurants, entertainment and street car access.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for summer stay in the big city!”
Reviews.Author: LandraNewLiskeard
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Westin Harbour Castle in late August- our room had a wonderful view of the lake- it was lovely to watch the ferries and boats each morning and at night, when they were all lit up! The Westin is a short walk to many attractions and shopping- the boardwalk along the lake was a particular favourite route for my hubby and I- lovely cafes and coffee shops along the way were great rest/refresment stops on our morning and evening walks- hotel rooms were very clean and comfortable- bathrooms were lovely- my teenagers and husband loved the pool and enjoyed the option of sitting and tanning outdoors- front desk staff very helpful and friendly- the parking at the Westin is very expensive, but my hubby found much cheaper/safe parking about two blocks north- we would definitely return, especially in the summertime because of the proximity to the lake- wonder if it's as pleasant in the winter?? cold winds off the lake?- brrr!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Canongirl24
Reviews.Content: I went to the Weston for a Photography group ,model shoot. i had never been there before so they gave me the best treatment. I got an awesome room looking out at the harbor. It was beautiful. I had everything i needed. I also was happy to have a safe to put my valuables in. My room smelled so fresh and clean. I wish my house was that fresh. I was treated very good by all employee's. I would love to go back again just for a break! ~christine~

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel with a boutique hotel feel.”
Reviews.Author: NAmStuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a few days in Toronto at the Westin Harbour Castle. This is an enormous hotel, two towers of 33 floors and yet it felt very warm and welcoming. The front desk staff was very accommodating even though we purchased our stay through Hotwire.com. Not a question to switch us to a king room. There seemed to be a great number of staff people walking around, greeting you, asking if you needed anything. Hotel Ambassador, Rick Soloman made us feel so welcome our first night there. We stopped in the lobby bar for a bit and he came by to say hello and then proceeded to stay and talk to ensure that we knew of all of the events going on in town. One of the bar waiters, Danny, also made sure that we felt welcomed. My husband said we already felt at home on our first night in the hotel. The next night when we stopped at the bar because the bartender mixed a good drink, Danny waited until I tasted mine since there was a different bartender that night and he wanted to make sure that this one got it right. I would recommend dinner at the bar as opposed to the swanky top of the tower restaurant. Even though it is an open lobby bar, there are big window and lots of comfy seating as well as a lot of wait staff who all seemed very nice. The view from the fancy restaurant upstairs is great, but it wasn't anything too special. Some other guests who wanted to enjoy the view told us that they had dinner in the bar and then went up to the restaurant for champagne and dessert--that seems to be the way to go! The hotel rooms were comfortable and pretty updated and modern. Westin beds are always comfy and the rooms were clean as well. The pool was nice and not terribly busy. The gym was nice and there was also a big rooftop (5th floor) patio with basketball and tennis courts! So I would recommend you take your work out clothes and sneakers. I just wanted to rave about the fact that such a big hotel was able to feel so warm and welcoming. Good job!

Reviews.Title: “It Was Great and We'll Try to Do It Again”
Reviews.Author: travelzgr8
Reviews.Content: My husband decided to do a couples getaway weekend in the city and was very pleased with the service the Westin provided. Check in was a breeze and service was great. Cora our housekeeper did a great job. The beds are truly heavenly. There is a cooler in the room to keep drinks cool, it's not a fridge but electric cooler. Coffee maker with Starbucks coffee. The location is great, we stayed in a Lakeview room which was nice and clean and I'm very picky. We had a great time, eating at restaurants in the area, a great place for breakfast is the Watermark right on the harbour front, for dinner we went to Lone Star, food is very good and drinks priced reasonably. We also visited the Harbour Bar & Grille just across from the hotel and all I'm going to say is we won't be going back. If you need snacks for your room there is a small grocery store right across the street. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl K
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Westin this past weekend, the service the amenities. Absolutely outstanding. I loved our room and I would love to have that BED at home. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: DMBFan77
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this Hotel. This was perhaps the biggest Hotel lobby I have ever been in. The service at the front counter was absolutely excellent! The young lady really made me feel welcomed and asked questions about why I was in town and really seemed interessted in what I had to say. She asked if I wanted a high floor or a low floor. The room was beautiful and the scenery was great in my opinion. On one side I got to see lake Ontario and on the other side a perfect view of the CN Tower. The bed was super comfortable. Most comfortable I've ever slept in at any hotel. The only thing I can complain about was that the bathroom could have been a little cleaner in my opinion. Maybe I'm picky but... actually I'm not that picky so yeah the bathroom could have been cleaner. FYI... not to far away on Young street are some Bixi bikes! I was going to walk to Eaton Center when I noticed the bikes and decided why not! Well it was a blast! Cycling down Young street was something unexpected and turned out to be so much fun! Would definately consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Below what we expect from Westin”
Reviews.Author: YOWboys
Reviews.Content: We were at the Westin Harbour Castle over Labour Day weekend this year. We chose the hotel based on the recommendation of a friend as well as familiarity with the Westin brand. The hotel is modern and located on Torontoâ€™s harbour-front. It is a quick taxi-ride from Toronto City Airport (Billy Bishop/YTZ), or, if you want to save the fare, you can take the Porter Airlines shuttle to the Royal York and walk the ten minutes to the hotel. Ferries to the Toronto Islands are directly behind the hotel, and there are a couple of places to eat within walking distance of the hotel (when asked where we could have breakfast, the concierge gave us a single option, circled it on a map, and went back to her computer). The views of the lake and islands are great, as is the outdoor terrace with tennis courts located off the pool area on the third floor. Our room looked out over the lake and islands. The blackout curtains effectively kept the room dark enough to sleep in broad daylight despite being directly on the lake. While the room was on the small side for North America, this did not particularly bother us. The staff at check-in and check-out were friendly and efficient. We frequently stay at Westins because they are reliably nice hotels with good service. The hotelâ€™s decorations are the Westin standard, but the fit/finish and cleanliness of our room left something to be desired. Some of the fixtures seemed to be coming loose on the ceiling and in the bathroom (the shower-head, for instance, wobbled against the wall). The shower-head was very low, even for someone below normal height. There was also dust on the upper shelf in the closet along with discarded laundry forms, and some of the bathroom fixtures looked like they had not been properly wiped-down when cleaned. The air conditioning unit is not particularly quiet, so we would recommend not setting it to â€œautoâ€� overnight. This is a very large hotel, and it was fully booked for at least part of our stay. This may have been behind the minor housekeeping issues, and we may have ended up with a room that would otherwise have been due for maintenance. Because the hotel was fully booked, I would have expected all of the check-in desks to be staffed mid-afternoon on Friday, but this was not the case. The result was a line-up (albeit one for which they seemed prepared by having airport-style queuing ropes set up) at check-in, though the staff was very pleasant and helpful. There was also a line-up for taxis in the afternoon outside the front door. This was our first stay at this hotel, and we expected better (based on our experience with the Westin brand). We might consider giving the Westin Harbour Castle another shot (though we would probably avoid it on busy holiday weekends) because the person who recommended it to us seems to have had a far better experience. We would also seriously consider returning to the Sheraton Centre, which is more centrally located and provided a better guest experience than the typical Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay maybe back ?”
Reviews.Author: sarshark
Reviews.Content: Even though it was the friday of a long week-end, the staff were extremely friendly and courteous. The hotel was clean. My wife and I were spending a night away from our 5 year old and we were looking forward to a romantic stay. The inhouse spa was excellent, we had the hot stone couples message and it was worth every penny. It was a rainy evening so we decided to dine at Toula located at the very top of the hotel with a 360 degree view. If it wasnt for the HORRIBLE experince at Toula, where the view was great, however the glass needs a good cleaning, the wait staff were good, however the food was prepared poorly and pricess for this abhorent food was through the roof, our experience would have been completely enoyable. My suggestion, stay at The Westin Harbourcastle, but DO NOT EAT AT TOULA. Even if it s minus 35 degrees, take a cab or walk to the Hotdog cart down the street, or even a McDonalds to have a better meal and better ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Service was good, errors were not.”
Reviews.Author: monaco10
Reviews.Content: Normally this hotel has top notch service. The front desk was exceptionally helpful as usual, as was there night manager who attended to my room when I found little creatures that looked like bedbugs (Which the night manager remedied by moving us to a new room and issuing complementary breakfast). He was incredibly polite and helpful. The only issue I had with the stay was in regards to billing, which I would assume is the responsibility of their accounting department. I had paid for the room with a combination of cash + SPG points for one night, yet I was billed the regular rate for three nights. It took nearly three months to have this sorted out and the credit card refunded. Disappointing service from what should be a world class Starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ewv1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night with a lake view room. Had a great view of the harbour and as it was a nice day lots of activity. Room itself was clean and large with plenty of room for myself and my girlfriend. We took advantage of the pool and hot tub. Both were excellent and the locker areas perhaps could have been better looked after (used towels lying around) but it was late evening when we were there. Overall a great place to stay if you are going to visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to see a brand deteriorate”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: What has happened to Westin the chain that was once the jewel in the crown. This property has some outstanding employees - one housekeeping person actually hand wrote a note and offering help and replaced a emptied toothpaste tube and help sort out some dropped clothing .. but the hotel is dingy and almost looks dirty .. stained hallway carpet .. battered furniture ..inoperable phones. And of course in true SPG tradition prices that you would expect at a 5 star property not a 2 star. The hotel does have great views but fair waring the plus of being close to Toronto Island ferry is off set by the constant horn blaring although it does stop around 10 and of course starts again around 5AM! Get a room as high up as you can. Better yet there are equally well located hotels for less. Avoid the noisy lobby and the clamour of families with kids and the very expensive lobby drinks and food. Stay else where

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: joyjoy2
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for a mini staycation. We chose it due to its location to Centre Island and Queen`s Quay. We were very pleased with our selection. The hotel is very clean and I didn`t notice anything in need of repair. We have 2 children and they were delighted to get the Kids Club bag with water bottle and hat. It was a nice little extra that made them feel appreciated too. My daughter is heartbroken she lost her hat! Staff: All of the staff we encountered were very professional, friendly and efficient. Rooms: The room we had was a 2 double room with partial city and lakeview. The room was very clean and looked recently updated. Only complaint about room was that we were right by the elevator and heard it ALL night long! Be sure to turn the fan on at night so you don`t hear the AC every time it turns on at night. Parking: We opted for the valet parking (pricey at $40) but was a better option than trying to locate the offsite self-park and have to navigate through all the pedestrian traffic in the area. Even the self park was pricey at $30. The valet has in and out privileges and they were very prompt each time we needed the vehicle. They were very kind (as they should be at $40 a day) and let us keep the car there for a few hours extra. Price: Be sure to shop around. We found that phoning the hotel direct was $100 more than their online prices. If you are going to Centreville you can book directly from their site and it is the best price we found. We never even looked at the pool, gym or restaurant so cannot comment on them. All in all a nice hotel at a decent price. We would definitely go back again but would look for different parking options and make sure room is away from elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4-star Westin”
Reviews.Author: ARC49
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for one night to see the nearby Cirque du Soleil show, Totem. We found the hotel to be lacking in cleanliness, customer service and overall decor that often makes Westin properties so nice. The pillows were uncomfortable, not the "heavenly" pillows that Westin advertises and the whole bedroom, bed and lines were extremely damp.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way - A Perfect Wedding Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: Cynth_L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married last Saturday at Ward's Island, and booked the Westin Harbour Castle for the night of the wedding, as did all of our out-of-town guests. We chose this hotel primarily for the location, as the ferry docks are just a couple of steps away, and we wanted something nice. We didn't book the wedding rate through the hotel, but we ended up getting a great deal through hotels.ca, and directed our guests to do the same. I would easily say that we would have been just as happy if we had paid the full price. The Westin really took care of all of us. As most of our guests were coming in from out of town, we wanted to arrange a meeting spot and have a couple of drinks with them before the big day. My girls and I must have called like 10 bars to find out if they would do a private area for us, what the set up was, how much bottle service would be, etc. Nothing was working. Then I contacted the Westin directly, and talked to Erin Haid. Erin was awesome. She basically listened to everything I needed, and put together a package for me. I was a bit skeptical about the bar area being in the lobby, but when we actually saw it, it was perfect. It was right by the doors, with signage directing "Cyr Wedding" guests to meet there, the bottle service was beautifully set up on it's own table, and we had a roped off area with lots of lounge-style seating, so it totally gave us a VIP feel. When we checked in (which we were given an early check in with no problems at all), we were given an upgrade, a corner room with a beautiful lakeview. The guests were all able to find the ferry docks and get to the wedding without any problems at all. **Break for my amazing wedding** My HUSBAND(!!!) and I returned back to the hotel late at night after the wedding to find a lovely bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries!! ERIN, was that you?? There was no card or anything and no one I knew said they had gifted us with this so presumably the hotel did. I swear, I did not pull any "this is my wedding!" B.S. with any of the staff; I didn't ask for anything!! We ordered pizza (haha) off the late night menu, which was prompt and SO DELICIOUS. The next morning, when we were saying bye to my NEW IN LAWS (!!!), a manager came by and congratulated us (again, I have no idea how they knew we just got married, but it seemed like all the staff knew?) and asked us about our stay, etc., and then asked if the kids wanted to make some paper flower bouquets at the craft station (no charge). They were ecstatic about that and it gave the adults an extra moment to say our goodbyes. In short, this hotel provided an amazing experience for us and our out-of-town wedding guests. I don't write reviews regularly, only for excellent experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday surprise”
Reviews.Author: italvegan
Reviews.Content: As a mom of then 2 small children, my husband surprised me with a night 'away' from the house and children on my birthday. Though close to home, this was a great getaway! What a beautiful room we had. Spacious, great view (ask for lakeview), and there was actually space in the room to move around. The bar in the lobby was great-nice staff, very attentive. Breakfast the next morning was buffet, and even as a vegan, I had a lot of choices. (Be sure when you check in to ask for the highest floor possible!) Would definitely go here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service...ammenities fell short”
Reviews.Author: Nancy D
Reviews.Content: My bf and I decided to have a night away, we booked the hotel through StarFriend and booked a couples massage for when we arrived. Upon our check in to our room we were given a wheelchair accesable room with no shower (merely a bench and shower head behind a shower curtain) I called down to the front desk and asked to be moved. We were not allowed to be moved because we booked through StarFriend, instead to accomodate our romantic night away we were sent up wine. The couples massage was very nice and relaxing (the only good thing about our stay). We found a camera case, battery and computer hook up in our room (clearly not cleaned well) and we went for dinner at Toula and the food was extremely lackluster. I've eaten better pasta at East Side Marios. I've always had a great stay at this hotel, but this will seriously deminish my thoughts about coming here again. To accomodate our less than desirable stay we were offered a complimentary upgrade and breakfast for two the next time we stay. Sorry Westin, it will take more than that for us to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Westin, the best”
Reviews.Author: andrewtze
Reviews.Content: Room was a very nice typical Westin double bed room. The signature westin heavenly bed was there and double shower head too. Room had a chair/chaise and a little table. There was a desk too. There was a fridge in a cabinet under the tv but it can cool beverages a bit better. All the typical stuff was there too, suitcase holder, an "elsafe" ironing board and an iron. Bathroom was very nice. Thick counter top, nice sink and very cool mirror that had lights behind it. Double shower head was heavenly and the toilet. The toilet flushes similarly to like an airplane, very fast and powerful. The hallways do not smell like cheap, unlike other similar 4* hotels that smell like cheap. Pool was very nice, heated. There is a play area for kids and tennis courts as well as a basket ball net on the roof. There is a squash court and full gym and a sundeck. Parking sucks, 30$ to park a block away and 40$ for valet. Internet is not free which should be. Very nice lobby area. Pretty much westin is a good brand to choose for a hotel. This hotel was great. Also book online and get a discounted rate. I called for a price on a dbl lakeview and the rate was 278, booked online for the same and got 191.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: xicolopes
Reviews.Content: Very clean and spacious rooms, an excellent location near the ferries that take visitors to the islands, just a short walk to some restaurants on the water's edge, but a little longer walk to the Blue Jays baseball stadium,all make this hotel a place to stay while in Toronto. Valet parking is available, but at a steep cost of 40 dollars per night, with in and out privileges. But the valets are exceptionally polite, service oriented and efficient. For a good night's rate, look at the Westin web site for special offers (e.g., for AAA members)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: World17
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and 2 boys (10 &12) at this hotel in mid-August. It is a mammoth facility right on Lake Ontario with the ferries to the Toronto City Islands literally out the back door. The Rogers Centre, CN Tower, Air Canada Arena and numerous restaurants are easily walkable and the streetcar line directly in front of the hotel leads to the Ex. We stayed on an upper floor overlooking the lake and Toronto City Airport which was spectacular. This is largely a typical "higher end" type hotel with a concierge desk in the front lobby and a large conference presence (Vietnamese doctors during our stay). However, there were some nice touches, including free ice cream in the lobby one afternoon and a free cocktail the next day. The pricing was excellent for this level of hotel, particularly if you book a package (we booked the Hockey Hall of Fame Package, which included HOF tickets and free valet parking). Please note, however, that valet parking is usually $40.00 per night and self-parking $30.00 per night. I would not hesitate to stay here again. The location is fantastic and when you do a little bit of work, it can be a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre, Dinner and Hotel Package”
Reviews.Author: NormaJoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Westin Harbour Castle and wish it could have been longer.. We had a wonderful view from our 31st floor room facing the Toronto island. We could watch the planes coming in for a landing on the island. The sight seeing boats and sail boats were all out enjoying the lake. The king sized bed had snowy white bedding and was very comfortable and inviting.. The room is large and beautifully decorated with a lounge right in front of the huge picture window. We purchased a theatre, dinner, hotel package and found this a very economical way to take in the sights.. We chose to see "Billy Elliott" at the Cannon Theatre, within walking distance from our hotel. We enjoyed a 3 course dinner in the evening on the 38th floor of the Westin and again had a wonderful view of downtown Toronto.. After a great nights sleep we had brunch at the harbourfront and then took the streetcar to the CNE. for another exciting time. Took in the ice skating show and the dog show. So much to see and do and just not enough time. The hotel kept our overnight bags free of charge until our return around 5:30PM. A great way to celebrate a very special birthday..

Reviews.Title: “great for location and facilities but falls just short”
Reviews.Author: sid71
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay.As a family of three with 2 double beds and a lake view just great.I would say the biggest plus for this hotel is location.We have been to Toronto 3 times each time staying in 4 star properties.This hotel wins on location just perfect for ferry to islands just outside,walking distance to most sights.We did not use one cab just walked every where.Staff very friendly and chatty.The reasons why this hotel falls short? 2 main reasons....first in hot weather in a property like this one, you would expect to have a cool drink in your room without the aid of ice in your drink.Sadly this is lacking as there is no fridge to keep any items cool.So no food or drink could be kept cool for later consumption.Secondly the beds were just too soft not firm enough for us.The pillows lacked any firmness( sorry just being honest).Bring your own pillows if you need a good nights sleep.Do not bother asking for firmer ones as they are all the same.Some of you maybe thinking that is being picky.I say when you stay in hotel with this level of expectation then comfort and choice is essential.Having said this do not let me put you off as this hotel hits the mark on all other areas....swimming pool, staff,location,cleanliness.All good but why o why no fridge in the room especially in hot August weather.......

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: MaveWill
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Westin Harbour Castle. It is a beautiful hotel and it has the most beutiful location overlooking the harbour. There are plenty of restaurants close by and it is a 5 mins walk to the CN Tower. Lovely room and lovely staff. If your breakfast is not included and you would like a cheap option, there is a little bistro to the left of the hotel as you exit which has plenty of choices.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVERYONE ELSE IS NUTS OR TOO PICKY”
Reviews.Author: butcherandthebride
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying, I am very picky where i stay, but at the same time I sure don't go around with a fine tooth comb to look for flaws with a hotel. Unless something is really not up to par eg bad service, dirty room...i usually have no complaints. And this time, I have NOT ONE! I got this hotel on priceline for $90 a night. We arrived...BEAUTIFUL lobby, beautiful EVERYTHING! Nothing is outdated or worn looking and like I said, pretty picky about that. Even as funky as the ramp up the the entrance was..the lighting out there was even cool. No wait at all to check in. Our girl was awsome,and we are selves are laid back funny easy going people so it always makes everything more pleasant. She upgraded our room to a Harbour View at no extra charge because it was my birthday and our 10 yr anniversary. we didnt ask for it, but it was a great room. Our room was cool, however if you dont close the blinds when your gone no kidding the air cant keep up if the suns beating into your window all day. common sense. The ac was fine, we like a little white noise to sleep , not too loud at all,BED WAS HEAVENLYYYY.....we didnt eat there but did go snoop at The place at the top how amazing..and the people we not snotty, as so many said, had a cool girl with tattoos actually started chatting it up with her, I think you just have to know how to relate with people, and myself dealing with people all day I treat everyone the way I want to be treated. So for the price we paid, A. I wouldnt complain even if there were issues because I can't even stay at a 2 star for that price!! and i would pay full price to stay there (although i loved the deal we got) so thank you Westin, Best place we ve stayed so far!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_native
Reviews.Content: I don`t know where these bad comments about the location comes from. This hotel was absolutely great. The rooms are very nice and the extra facilities like pool, tennis, and even a squash court were great. The hotel is not directly downtown but it is a very short walk to the Union subway station. It`s only about a 5 minute walk to the Hockey Hall of Fame which was a lot of fun. Right on the waterfront it was great to walk along and look at all the boats on the water. If you take the escalators from the lobby up a level there is a small patio which offers great views of the waterfront. The room as expected was very comfortable, clean, and well appointed. I had a room on the 30th floor since I had asked for a high floor. I unfortunately did not get the greatest view however. The room was located in the South Tower but was facing East so the view was limited to a bit of the lake and not much else. Since I will for sure return the next time I will ask for a North Tower room which seems to be the better place to be in for city views. The parking is 40$ valet or 30$ self park. We decided to park somewhere else and actually ended up in the lot were the Westin self park option is. It is a multilevel underground lot. If you fellow the signs to the Westin side it will take you to the bottom of the lot and they will charge you 30$. However I simply parked in the other level of the same lot and ended up paying 22$ for the same lot! So long story short don`t bother going to the Westin side and you`ll save some money. I usually stay at the Sheraton when going downtown Toronto but next time I`ll have a hard choice to pick which one since the Westin was an awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lakeside hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinky23_10
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto and decided on a spa get-away weekend. I chose the Westin Harbour Castle due to its location and reputation. Had a very relaxing and wondeful time. Felt rested and pampered when I left. Stayed for two blissful nights. The Spa was wonderful and very peaceful. Staff very attentive. Room was gorgeous Jr Suite on the 18th floor and well worth it. Would I do it again - yes Would I recommend it to a friend - in a heart beat Hint: Ask for lakeview. Unforgetable views of the lake, the every changing scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor service.....no value for the money”
Reviews.Author: MsMarg
Reviews.Content: In advance of check-in, I called the hotel seven times to inquire about parking costs. Unfortunately, I hung up before speaking to a hotel rep each time...after spending more than 10 minutes on hold. They also did not replenish coffee, shampoo, etc. thru my stay. There are better hotels in Toronto that are more focussed on the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: southernNHKayaker
Reviews.Content: We used priceline to bid on a 4 star hotel & ended up at Westin Castle right on the waterfront. It was extremely busy & because we had to wait for a room we were upgraded to a Jr Suite with spectacular views. Great location. All attractions nearby. Concierage found us excellent theater seats 2 hrs before the show started. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “World-Class Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Ryan C
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aug 13-16 with wife and 2 kids to celebrate wedding anniversary. Hotel upgraded us to one of their Crown Suites (Vice Regal) ... staggering views of Lake Ontario, Toronto island & the downtown skyline. Kids had their own bedroom with 2 doubles, the dining room / living room seperated our king bedroom from them ... hardwood floors, high-ceiling, complimentary tickets to the hockey hall of fame for our son, an amentity package upon arrival including champagne, chocolates, and candies for the kids ... Rekha Khote, Mary Taggart, and Aditya teamed up to make our stay the most memorable our of lives ... kudos to all of you for your efforts! Breakfast at the Mizzen was fantastic (as was our server 'Rhey', complimentary frozen treats in the lobby on Saturday afternoon was a huge hit with the kids. Bell hop / valet service / room servicing was timely, friendly and efficient. Location to downtown core was quite convenient ... 15 minute walk or 5 minute taxi cab to the theatre district. We found the air conditioning quite comfortable / the mattress was extremely comfortable ... very sound sleeps for all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ern_11
Reviews.Content: Believe this hotel is rated 4 star. Did not meet our expectations...we expected better. The room air conditioner was very noisy and the room never cooled below 76-78 degrees. We set thermostat on 68 and the room never cooled to a comfortable temperature. The water temperature in the shower was unpredictable...sometimes very hot and then sometimes very cold...difficult to enjoy a nice shower. The self parking 2 blocks away for $30/night and valet parking for $40 was a ripoff. No big deal but we were charged $1/ day for a newspaper we did not want...told we had to refuse it when we checked in. There was no way to get from street level to lobby without going up steps...this was difficult for one member of our party. Our experience rated this hotel a 3 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “A Vacation in the City”
Reviews.Author: misshann
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently enjoyed a staycation at the Westin Harbour Castle Hotel. We arrived Friday night from Mississauga and stayed until Sunday noon. The lobby was bustling but vast enough to not feel crowded. Checking in was a breeze, there were enough clerks working (5) to prevent the line-up getting too long. The hotel was able to provide us with a lakeside view as we requested ahead of time. The rooms were clean, cool with a small fridge, desk, and chaise lounge. We were there for leisure, but there was a docking station for laptop hookup. We did not eat or drink at the hotel but only because we wanted to try local eateries. Express checkout was a breeze - we dropped off our keys in the mail slot outside the lobby elevator and waited about 3 minutes for the valet to deliver us our car. The weekend was relaxing and we are planning to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with good service. Over priced and needs updates.”
Reviews.Author: jan1015
Reviews.Content: All in all I was very pleased with our stay. The room was satisfactory. A/c worked well. Room darkening curtains worked. View was ok. Rm 1111 The room does need updates. The bathroom was very small and the tub wasn't draining properly. We are a family of 4 and by the time the 4th person finished showering the tub was full of dirty water. Not a pleasent experience. We did complain however we were only staying one evening and it was check out time so no poin in waiting for maintenance. We planned on mentioning it again at check out however the line was crazy and so we used express check out. I was disappointed in this. A shower is one of the most important needs while on holidays. Would I stay there again? Possibly. I would check the shower first thing. Also no wifi in our room. Valet service was very speedy for us. We only waited 10 mins and it was a very busy day. All staff were friendly and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, & staff.”
Reviews.Author: windzaloft
Reviews.Content: Location was within walking distance to everything we needed downtown. Taxis and airport shuttle were readily available for transportation out of the downtown area. Room was very nice. Great view of downtown and the lake. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Will definately stay there again when returning to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel and fab view - good for business too”
Reviews.Author: Tallulah_D
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle on business and really enjoyed my stay. I had a great view of the lake and room was very clean, airy and spacious. I didnt get time to eat in the restaurant there so can't comment on the service but the lobby staff were very helpful. I would stay here again if I were to visit Toronto. It is a walk away from CN Tower and Yonge street and there are plenty of taxi's lining up outside to take you up town. The hotel is about 40 mins taxi journey away from Pearson airport. Just to note that room service is pricey, but it usually is in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: canadiancraftsman
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days and the Westin Harbour Castle offers what I thought was a pretty interesting option. You can opt out of maid service during your stay (really, do you have to have fresh towels after just one use?) and in return they will give a $5 voucher good for food service within the hotel. We didn't use it, but it was a nice touch, we thought. The room was comfortable, clean, fairly newly refurbished and the staff on the front desk were great. A little pricey, but check out rates on Expedia....sometimes you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: bharrin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin was good, and the location was excellent. The staff was attentive and helpful. Drinks, food, breakfast buffet - expensive and quality of buffet was average at best. We were surprised to have to pay for internet service. Many Starwood properties offer it free of charge. Also, $40 per day for valet parking! In my opinion this hotel is priced for the business traveler and discourages family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: MissDew17
Reviews.Content: This hotel far and exceeded my expectations. It was well priced, the staff were friendly and helpful and it was in an ideal place for travellers. The lakeview room is the way to go, what a beautiful site to wake up to! The food at the Mizzen restaurant was delicious and the rooms were comfortable and clean. A great place to stay for good value.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sarsonian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a weekend getaway. We had great interactions with all of the staff, the view was really nice, location ideal for seeing the city, and the bed was phenomenal. The attention to being a green hotel was also refreshing. They really seem to make an effort.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall, but a few problems you wouldn't have expected”
Reviews.Author: AlanMAF55
Reviews.Content: This is a high-quality, high-cost (even with a convention rate) hotel. Oddly, given that, a few of the electrical items in our room didn't work properly. An outlet strip built into a table didn't work, the mini refrigerator didn't cool anything, and the iron sparked. My wife reported these items to housekeeping, but I don't think any action was taken while we were there. On the plus side, the staff was exceptionally nice, the rooms were quiet and comfortable, and the beds were terrific. The lakefront location was very nice, and we had a partial lake view without paying more for it. There were enough places to eat nearby that we never had to eat in the hotel. If you skip housekeeping, the hotel will give you a $5 voucher for each day you do, good at some but not all of the plaes in the hotel. The valet parking was expensive ($40/night) but quick to produce your car when asked. You had to pay for in-room Internet access if you wanted it, but if you went to the lobby the staff would give you a password good for a free hour of wireless access, and I was told you could get another if one hour wasn't enough. The signage for getting where you needed to be at the convention was inadequate, but I'm not sure whether that was the hotel or the organization holding the convention. Overall, we had a good experience, and would go back if we got a good enough rate, but if there was a Drury or Hampton nearby we would probably go there instead, because I think you get more from them for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in blissful waterfront location - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: G4L
Reviews.Content: Me and my Wife stayed here for 7 nights as part of our honeymoon in late July/early August, and cant fault the hotel at all really. The hotel is right on the harbour front of Downtown Toronto. The main shopping areas and restaurants are all within a 15 - 20minute walk from the hotel. There is also a taxi rank right outside the lobby. Staff were always friendly and knowledgable when approached, although we did get a couple of random visits from staff for laundry and the occasionl random phone call to our room. There is a little shop in the hotel in the North tower, has your basics like bottled water, soft drinks, crisps, chocolate, painkillers etc, however the prices are pretty expensive. We had dinner twice in the hotel, both times was very good. Again prices are expensive, but certainly worth it. We ventured up to the Toula restaurant on the top floor of the South Tower one evening, but were told we could not have just drinks there, which was a little disappointing. Our room was on the 7th floor, had a slight sea view, partnered with a street view. Street noise varied from this floor. Our room was lovely and spacious, 2 double beds. Bathroom modern and spacious too. Cleaners every day, unless request not. Hotel does a good green incentive, which you can obtain voucher rewards if you refuse the cleaners each day. You get a $5 dollar voucher to use on food/drinks within the hotel. We used this a couple of times to pay for breakfast at their coffee bar downstairs. The hotel also has great sports facilities, a large heated pool, big enough for about 10 - 15 families. It has a basketball court, tennis/squash court, fitness suite. My Wife used the fitness suite who said it was pretty good. The pool was always nice and warm, and not too busy when we used it. There is also a very large plasma TV on the poolside if you get bored swimming :) Over all this hotel was great, and we loved staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Formiga
Reviews.Content: Went for business in July and it happened to fall on the Caribana Fest. The hotel was incredibly busy but the doormen helped me get to where I was going and I got my room service promptly both evenings. There are two towers, I'm curious to see what's on the other side. It is a bit of a trek to the malls or entertainment district but I took a cab everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place to stay on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: CaperGal
Reviews.Content: My room was massive and even had a small balcony attached to it, facing the water. The waterfront in Toronto is actually quite nice now, with several pedestrian friendly areas. The location worked well for my purposes, since I had a conference at the Renaissance hotel (attached to Skydome - 20 min walk). It's about a 25 min stroll to CN tower or Eaton Centre, and maybe a 5-10 minute walk to Union station. My one quibble is with the stairs to get into the hotel. While there is a wheelchair-friendly entrance on the side of the hotel, it's not very well marked. Also - no breakfast option that I was aware of, other than paying full price at the on-site restaurant or Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, average location”
Reviews.Author: querque1
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbour Castle has a lot to recommend it, but the location is kind of a drag. ROOMS: The rooms are in the contemporary Westin style - clean lines, modern furnishings, ample rooms, comfy beds. The walls are paper thin, so I heard both neighbors' alarms on those days when they did not hear mine first. LOCATION: If you plan to spend your time in the hotel, the harbor location makes for lovely views. If you want to explore the city by foot, be prepared to walk under a dark, smelly and not always safe-feeling highway overpass to get just about anywhere. Unlike the hotels on Front Street, this one is out of the way. Although there is convenient grocery, I regretted not staying somewhere more central. I found cabs to be expensive. AMENITIES: There is a full gym that was really quite nice - could have been a more comfortable temperature but I appreciated the full range of free weights and equipment. The pool area is also large and user-friendly. Although prevalent in so many luxury hotels, I find the pay wireless internet service appalling. It's 2011 - wireless internet should be free. SERVICE: The staff is very kind and courteous and they promptly helped me with some special items I needed, like a real refrigerator. The concierge staff was not very knowledgeable about the larger city, but I think those days of the brilliant concierge may be gone. They do jam this whole no cleaning service thing down your throat, but I guess it's the modern trend. CONFERENCE AMENITIES: I must say that the conference room, facilities and break service were all very good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Amazing Service! Staff went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: kay2424
Reviews.Content: I choose to stay at the Westin as it is the closest thing to a "W" hotel in toronto. The staff has always been friendly and willing to help. The last time I stayed there I was greeted by the Hotels Guest Experience Ambassador who has certainly secured my stays at the Westin. He ensured I was more than taken care of. He did what ever he could to make sure I was comfortable and even sent up treats to the room! He made my stay at the Westin the best experience. He made me feel like I was not just someone staying in room ****. Along with his staff, that had remembered me from prior trips, I felt safe and right at home. You are in golden hands while staying at this hotel! Amazing staff, and an outstanding Guest Experience Ambassador!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steel2527
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We received a discounted booking. The room had a farely nice view of the lake. Lobby is nice. We took our kids. Parking is 40 a night which gets steep.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront gem in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jedixtine
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while attending a concert at the Rogers Centre. Great rates compared with what else was available. The harbourfront area was nice, great grocery shop 'sobeys' in Queens Quay for budget snacks or meals. Pool area was small but nice, they had an outdoor sundeck also. Good value, convenient location. There is also a shuttle that runs along the harbourfront and goes to Union Station for easy transfers.

Reviews.Title: “eXCELLENT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lynjoyric
Reviews.Content: We had company from Scotland who wanted to visit Toronto and felt that it would be better to stay rather than travel back and forth. I purchased two rooms through Hotwire not knowing which hotel I was staying at unti I paid for it. The rooms were great. When we arrived I asked if it would be possible to have both rooms on the same floor as I had family visiting from Scotland and the clerk stated "absolutely and we'll see if we can get something with a view for you". We were given side by side rooms with a lake view on the 29th floor. Absolutely breath taking views, and fabulous bed. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel in the summer especially”
Reviews.Author: CPfella
Reviews.Content: This continues to be one of my favourite places to stay in Toronto, especially in the summer . I love the proximity to the lakeside promenades and the Toronto Island ferry. The front desk staff are very professional and welcoming, the rooms nicely are appointed, and the hotel offers a large comfortable lobby area to site and chat with a view of trees! My only issue is the noise from other rooms during the night on occasion - something that the hotel cannot fully control.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Great View! But....”
Reviews.Author: Northontmom
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and modern with a clean and bright bathroom. But, be warned everything else is expensive! You even have to pay for internet access. Parking is just awful unless you take city transit everywhere but even then you have to pay stupid amounts to just park. There is no included breakfast, but there is a nice little store/eat in dinner sort of place across the street. Our two kids were given nice little backpack bags with goodies inside when we checked-in, that was nice! But, there was no kid's playing area like advertised online. The pool was amazing .... nothing to complain about there. So, if you are looking for an expensive, modern, relaxing get away, this might be it. But, be prepared to pay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of the lake.”
Reviews.Author: jackiekos
Reviews.Content: Very busy hotel the weekend we were there. Got a great deal on the room. Spent the weekend visiting the Distillery area, enjoyed my first Yankees game in Toronto. Great restaurants in the area. Went for Morrocan at the Sultan's Tent. Enjoyed the pool. Needed more time. Never got to Toronto Island via the ferry outside the hotel. Maybe next time. Nice room with a great view of the lake. Only negative was pulling into the hotel...very busy. Check-in took too long. Went with another couple and their room was not ready. Otherwise, great weekend. Will definitely return if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but Air Conditioning was not good”
Reviews.Author: 26hockeymom
Reviews.Content: We were at a different hotel and it was not good. So we drove to downtown Toronto to look for a hotel close to Roger Center and also to the Hockey Hall of Fame. This was perfect. We walked in at like 11 am and they had a room, so we took it. We actually used the valet parking and forgot something in the car and had to have them get it for us and they were great about it. We had a couple of problems while we were there: first thing, the air couldn't get the room cool enough, second, the valet couldn't find our car for about 10 minutes, and then the shuttle bus to take us to the mall there never showed up. But later talking to other people that we were waiting he had come and gone and never asked if we need a ride somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with ideal location”
Reviews.Author: DogloverSLC
Reviews.Content: This was my second business stay at the Westin Harbour Castle and I'll definitely stay again. The rooms are clean and spacious and the Heavenly Beds are superb. Drinks in the hotel lobby bar are expensive but it's a nice area to relax or meet friends. Wi-fi access was very good in the lobby but did not work in my room so I used the cable there. The rate I booked included a coupon for coffee, fruit and a danish from the lobby stand but the guy who checked me in did not tell me about it or provide the coupons. Fortunately, my colleague was checking in at the same time and did receive the vouchers so I was able to get them from the person checking him in. (Be sure to ask if your rate includes breakfast coupons or a discount on breakfast, if you're traveling on a corporate fare.) The hotel is 10 minutes walking distance to the BlueJays stadium and it was a safe walk. It was also near the Hockey Hall of Fame although it's only open until 5pm. If you want a great dinner, albeit pricey, go to The Keg. It's a 10 minute walk north of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a terrific harbourfront location”
Reviews.Author: travelpair55
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Harbour Castle. Our room on the 21st floor had a great view of the harbour, a very comfortable king bed and the chaise lounge was a perfect spot to relax and read up on the nearby amenities. The Bar Lounge was a great place to enjoy a late night drink. Self parking is $30 and is a block away, but we chose to use valet for convenience, $40 with in and out privileges. We spent a wonderful evening strolling along the boardwalk and enjoying the harbourfront...lots of little cafes and shops to browse. Not only is there lots to do along the harbourfront, the hotel is also in an ideal location close to Union Station, the CN Tower, the Air Canada Centre and the Rogers Centre to name a few. We'll definitely return for another nice weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: rdh1979
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to lake view. Very clean, great beds. Good location, enjoyed a baseball game also while staying

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location beautiful lake view”
Reviews.Author: myself-7
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Ontario. The Westin Castle proved to be a very good hotel. We were given two connecting rooms since we were travelling with our 18 year old son. We had an excellent view of lake ontario.which looks beautiful at all times of day. I would most highly recommend the holtel's top floor restaurant, 360. As the name suggests one gets an excellent view of the lake, the islands across and the little airport runway not far off. The food is great and so is the service. Aim to be given a table by the window. Since this is a revolving restaurant you a sure to get a 360 view of the surroundings. Worth visiting is Central island. A short trip of 20 mins takes you across the lake. On the traffic free island there is a pleasant walk, a fun parlk aimed mainly at the young, but with some attrations that all the family can enjoy. There is a beach, and also a restaurant. Boat leaves just at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel but my family enjoyed It!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSpaLover
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a business hotel and the staff kind of looked at my children like they were aliens but other than that we had a great stay. We had a harbour view room and it was beautiful during the day but pitch black at night...we missed seeing the city lights. Great location. We walked to the CN Tower and took the subway a couple of times. It was March so we didn't get to do any of the warm weather activites that must be great at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Hockey weekend in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Northernfly
Reviews.Content: We found CAA had hotel /parking packages on their website and utilized this - what a great saving! When we checked in, our room was upgraded to a water view without asking for it. We were able to walk to the AC centre to watch the hockey game , so no drinking and driving. Great weekend - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in summer months!”
Reviews.Author: dorismct
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel when visiting Toronto in summer months. Good size rooms and really nice pool area.!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend In Toronto at Solid Westin”
Reviews.Author: luckyseven01
Reviews.Content: Starwood Fans and others have come to count on the Westin line as a "solid" upper-mid-scale hotel. Westin Toronto Castle fits build. We stayed in an high-floor "junior suite" facing Lake Ontario (due to Starwood Gold upgrade). Nice room with flat screen TV, comfortable Westin heavenly bed and nice view of the Lake and the Island airport (kind of fun watching the small planes and puddle jumpers take off and land-- sometimes in the water!). The drawbacks were the super small (and outdated) bathroom, and the temperature within the hotel (particularly the common areas). According to the front desk, Toronto is experiencing abnormally hot weather for Toronto and their air conditioning system cannot keep up. Not sure if that was "hot air" (no pun intended), but they were apologetic about it. They offered guests free bottled water and popsicles for kids to make up for the balmy stay. We did not eat at the restaurants, so I cannot comment on the food. Parking is super, super pricey, but that is a Toronto thing, not specific to Westin. Expect to pay at least $30 per day, even for self-park. We would definitely stay there again due to convenient location and solid amenities.

Reviews.Title: “great room no cool air”
Reviews.Author: familytrippin1010
Reviews.Content: i was very impressed with the hotel's commitment to saving the environment. i elected to pass on the housekeeping and received a $5 voucher x 2 (we stayed 3 nights) to spend on food/bev in the hotel. this was a nice treat. my husband and i enjoyed a starbucks on our last morning "on the house", sort of!
