while i was also pleased that the lobby was not over air-conditioned (i find this a common problem, and unnecessary use of energy), our room was very warm. even though we had the a/c set at 60 degrees, and on constantly, i would guess the temp in our room was about 80. also, very humid, the bedding felt damp (not that we were under any!), and our swim clothes/towels would not dry. i LOVE the westin beds and bedding and was looking forward to cuddling up underneath, and so was disappointed. i did mention to the front desk about this, they sent someone up and said the a/c was working at capacity, they offered to send a fan, but one never appeared. otherwise, the pool/basketball/patio were great and my boys had fun there. free freezies (the big ones!) and water with lime/lemon - also excellent treats! i loved the location. we live in a small rural area in northern ontario and enjoy walking around downtown toronto because there is always something interesting to see. close to many areas of interest. our view included part city/part water. everything was excellent...except the heat! it was in the 90's outside and it would have been nice to cool off in the room. by the way, some reviews comment on housekeeping being pesky, but we weren't bothered at all, and found them to be very pleasant and helpful, when i asked about exchanging our towels and needing an explanation about how the giant starbucks coffee and filter would fit into the tiny cup on the coffemaker. many times, at 4 star hotels everything, everything costs extra. i was amazed at the number of things that were complimentary - in-room coffee/tea, water with lime/lemon in the lobby, $5 vouchers for declining housekeeping, giant freezies, in-room fridge for cooling beverages. also, even though we booked on hotwire, i didn't feel like i was treated with any less respect than an ordinary customer. we would stay again - but we might bring our own fan!

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe what I got for what I paid!”
Reviews.Author: TheHagans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights mid July while U2 was in town. Decided to try and bid a price instead of paying the high 4 star quote. Paid $138 per night, instead of $260. This a beautiful hotel located right on The Lake and close to all the major hot spots ( Rogers Centre, CN tower, Air Cananda Centre to name but a few ). Room was on 27th floor with fab view over the Lake. Clean, tidy, comfy beds, decent bathroom, noisy A\C unit. Parking was a New York style stitch up at $40 a day, and if you wanted internet access it was $15 upwards depending on usage, location. Coffee was $8..WTF!!!! Anyhow, facilities we're fab, beautiful pool on the 5th floor, hottub, sauna, steam room, outside sports area, patio, Spa and beauty salon, all top class and nicely laid out. Staff were great, no issues there at all, room service excellent. Didn't use the restaurant or bars, so can't comment how good or not they were. For what we paid, it was great. If I was paying full tilt price and to have parking nailed on top aaaaand internet, then I would not say it was good value. Yes this is Toronto, it is waterfront, but it isn't New York!

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: vacationhugger02
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Harbour Castle in the past and have always enjoyed my stays, but this time was a disappointment. The A/C was not working properly and apparently it had been broken for a few days. I think the hotel should have advised people of this prior to their arrival, as Toronto was in the middle of a heat wave. I was not even told when I checked in - it was not until I complained about the heat in my room that I was told the A/C was not working!! They offered me bottled water, and in the evening did give me a fan. Staff was very apologetic but the fact is, you don't spend this type of money to be cooled by a fan. I have sent a letter to the manager asking for compensation, but have not as yet received a reply.

Reviews.Title: “It's exactly what it says on the tin!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryKate1971
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel, affordable hotel that offers what it says. We had the most beautiful view over the lake to Toronto Island. Everything is within walking distance and the hotel was very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Great price and very clean. Great sleep also.

Reviews.Title: “Sad birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: leslieevan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there July 24-25, 2011 for my birthday. We were booked for one night. First room no air conditioning, second room no air conditioning, we went to dinner and were told by manager that this was unacceptable and they would move us to an upgraded room that had working a/c. We came back at 11 pm went to our new room and guess what? NO AIR CONDITIONING AND THEY LEFT A FRIGGIN FAN RUNNING. I spoke to other guests and most had no A/C also. We went through Hotwire so we have no recourse. Hotel did take off $40 valet parking charge. Not enough. :(

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Pricey Food”
Reviews.Author: LeeAnneCanada
Reviews.Content: I had just flown back from Europe after a 12 hour flight and four plane transfers so was pretty tired once I arrived at 8 at nite. My luggage was somewhere in Germany so all I had was my carry on with me, check in was easy and efficient. I had found an online deal for this room and it was only $120 + taxes. The room was beautiful and I had a great nite view of the lake and a quick peak in the morning before I flew out again. I found a hair in the bathtub but other than that the rest of the room was clean and I really wish I had more time to spend in it. I was disappointed that I was only there to sleep as it it very close to all that downtown Toronto has to offer. I am not that naive to not understand that downtown Toronto is expensive, but my breakfast at this hotel cost me $30 with tip, which was an omelet with fruit and a $5.50 cup of tea. The waiter was excellent and when I told him to hold the toast he brought be fresh fruit without me ordering it. So the breakfast and the service was good but I just got back from Ukraine where a meal for four with two bottles of wine and tip was $40 so I was still price comparing. Anyway this was just a stopover on my way home, so I ordered a cab to take me to the Toronto Island Airport (Porter Airlines) and it was only $15 with tip. So besides the pricey meals, the proximity to downtown and the airport and the deal I got on a really nice room, it was pretty good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful, helpful, efficient and friendly staff in-spite of the 100 degree plus temperature.”
Reviews.Author: DB1988
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the hottest day of 2011, arriving at about 7:30 PM. As mentioned in most of the hotel's reviews the staff are cheerful, helpful, efficient and friendly and all of this in-spite of the 100 degree plus temperature. The hotel check in was quick and the parking staff guided me to the nearby self-serve parking lot. We were given a room with a view of the lake as a bonus when our requested king bed wasn't available. The room was very comfortable with what felt like dense linen sheets and fabulously comfortable beds, a great bathrobe and thick towels. The bathroom was big and the bath/shower was great with a functional shower-head and lots of hot water. There is a good food shop across the street which has both gourmet prepared foods and snacks and is open until midnight. The room was an internet bargain. I am someone who likes his creature comforts and likes to make sure that his partner finds the accommodation I have chosen to be of high quality. The Harbour Castle more than fit the bill. The internet is $17 per day and the parking is $30 self-service or $40 for the valet service. I understand that there are other parking lots nearby that charge substantially less. The only annoying thing seems to be the hotel General Manager's attempt to make a comment on every review. This is boring and repetitive. It would be better to only make a comment where there is a particular complaint or a really nice comment. You have a terrific hotel and a super staff so please reduce the number of comments to the essential ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great waterfront location......”
Reviews.Author: 67HOCKEY
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a waterfront location with 2 beds for our family of four. We found here. Our boys enjoyed their pool & hot tub. We only ate one breakfast buffet. Your usual over priced hotel meal. We did eat breakfast down the street a few blocks. Good, and lower priced. Our room was nice, beautiful Lake front view over looking the ferry boats going out to Toronto Islands. We walked along the waterfront and found the Harbour Front Centre. Wow, on a Friday night it was busy with activity. Outdoor eating, shops, people, pretty cool. We kept walking and came upon the outdoor International marketplace. So much to do and look at in this area, all on the water. The Hotel was convenient for us. We walked to the Hockey Hall of Fame, Eaton Center and over to the CN tower. We did take the subway from the Eaton center back down towards the hotel. Pretty cool for us as we have never road a subway. We did do the valet parking at check in and never left the hotel until check out. At $40 a day it is higher than the other street lots, but it seemed safer and easy to do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: duckngail
Reviews.Content: We take our Grandaughter to a Blue Jays Game every year and make a weekend out of it. This hotel is within walking distance of the Rogers Centre, Waterfront and the St. Lawrence market. Along with lots of other things. We are always able to find a package that suits us. Last years extra was tickets to the Hockey Hall of Fame, this year parking and breakfast. It has a great view of the lake if you chose that which we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: stuinwales
Reviews.Content: stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary for 2 weeks. We had booked this as part of a British Airways package. Luckily I asked the hotel if they could change our room to a lakeside facing room a month before we travelled which they kindly did as British Airways online booking gives you no opportunities to make any choices with rooms etc. Upon arrival we were booked in a conceige service was very efficient. Rooms are reasonable , nothing special and although the beds were large memory foam beds are quite uncomfortable after a few hours in bed and make you quite hot after a while. View was great from 14th floor. Generally the room was quiet up in the corner however the guests in the room above were particulary noisy for a couple of nights running past midnight moving furniture around. We found out later that it was probably moving furniture around for an Italian business meeting being held up on that level? On the day of our 25th wedding anniversary we were greeted on our return from Niagara Falls with Champagne and chocolates in our room from the front desk. A nice touch as this would have only been mentioned on my first email a few months earlier. We saved our vouchers for not having room service everyday and after the 2 weeks had accumalated about $40 of 'eat in' coupons which we used in the main foyer, the food has to be said although expensive (if we'd have paid the full price) was the best we had during our stay. Overall a reasonable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: I was on business. The waterfront is an amazing place to stay in Toronto. The room was impeccable. The staff very helpful. As an full service hotel they lack the amenities. I don't believe their restaurant situation is great, but maybe that's because they have so many close to the hotel. I also don't appreciate the self park.. 2 or 3 blocks away and still expensive... but hey it's downtown Toronto so that's how it goes... pay the big bucks for valet. Also their coffee stand never seems to be open but with a 5 minute walk down the Quay.. there are lots of options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: berrigrl
Reviews.Content: Being a starwoods customer gives one so many incentives to stay here, but from the moment we arrived until our departure, my companion and I were treated with the utmost hospitality, respect and the hotel management went out of their way to accommodate our needs after a very bad experience at another hotel in the area (Hotel Victoria). The hotel offers an amazing amount of amenities, culinary fare and it is located on the waterfront so it could not be a better choice for stay in Toronto. Do try to avoid the convention season and book on spg,com if you are a customer! They have better prices than any travel website.

Reviews.Title: “Room Service Below Average”
Reviews.Author: dakinshaun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. I, however, arrived in the afternoon and needed to work all day in my room. Because the hotel is located away from most downtown eating, room service was convenient. I decided to order a hamburger with fries for a late lunch. The burger was dry and bland. The fries uncooked. Then later that night I ordered again. I decided to order two appetizers, including calamari. It was in-edible. I sent it back and asked for the cost to be removed from my hotel bill. As a busy business person, I need to be able to work in my room and to eat decent food. This Westin did not deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: gsega
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Westin Harbour, room 1616 for a total of 8 nights. We are a couple + our infant child. On total, this is a very good hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful and it offers all the amenities you'd expect. We also got a corporate rate which is very pleasing. But, unlikely to this kind of hotels, we repeatedly find ourselves not entirely pleased. The main complaint is that today both of our door cards stopped working, which left us outside the room with a very tired and hungry kid for 20 minutes, until a staff member came with new keys. We had to ask 3 times to send him up to us! and all we got from the service team was they're sorry for the delay, no explanation and no compensation. Other then that, cleanliness of the room varies, probably due to different housekeepers

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandArtDeco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for 4 nights during our touring holiday to Canada. We upgraded to a superior room on the 25th floor with windows to 2 sides looking across Ontario Bay and a view of the CN Tower. The room was big with all mod cons and very comfortable. The buffet breakfasts were great value for money and the food pletiful with loads of choice and all freshly prepared. I am not a hotel lover, always preferring a holiday home or condo, but this hotel was really great and I would recommend it without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, helpful, worry free”
Reviews.Author: Canayjun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the harbour Castle for just one night and it was wonderful. The valet parking attendants were friendly and helpful (this was appreciated after 8 hours on the road). Chek-in was friendly, very professional and made us feel like they were waiting for us to arrive to welcome us. We had a beautiful room on the 30th floor with a magnificiant view of the lake and the Island, the CN tower and the unique small island airport. My 11 year old granddaughter was amazed at the planes that would come in over the lake and land on the airstrip. The room was very quiet. The Hotel was swarmed, because it was the Fomula One Races that weekend (that was a surprise)however the atmosphere in the lobby was and calm but busy and we were treated just as important as the race VIP. The pool and hot tub are indoors (5th floor). the area is glass all around and one side large doors open onto a huge outdoor patio area and tenis court and lots of lounge chairs. This is a spectacular view of the city from the patio area. The pool area is well designed for sound absorption and the few noisy children were not a bother. We had breakfast in our room the next morning and it was on time and the hot stuff was hot and the cold stuff was cold, well presented and on time. Check out was a breeze and the car was brought promptly our luggage stored and were given a few directions becasue of the races some roads were not accessable and we were off. Personally I am a worry wart and critical I must say that it was a very relaxing stay, I felt that they were taking care of me and my family and that there was nothing to worry about. I actually relaxed for 18 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: jacnic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter overnight, having booked 2 days before and had a good deal. Hotel was close to harbour and not far to walk to city. Room exceptionally comfortable and lovely decor. Two things to bear in mind, enquire about parking charges as these are not included in hotel price. WiFi has to be paid for (not cheap) which surprised me as there was a conference room and many people staying on business. Overall though good time had by us.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brianauditor
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay my cousin and I recently had during our stay on July 12, 2011. When we checked in, I was pleasantly. surprised to be guest of the day and entiled us to a free in room movie, wireless internet, and breakfast the next morning. We unfortunately couldn't do the breakfast as we had an early train, but made good use of the wireless internet. Staff very friendly and room was spaceous and nice., Will defintely be back to this hotel. ALso nice and close to the subway line and in the heart of many fine restuarants and attractions that Toronto has to offer. Special thanks to the staff and the general manager of this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Brandon95Ag
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 4 night stay. The hotel is within walking distance to the Hockey Hall of Fame, CN Tower, Steamwhistle Brewery, Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre. The Toronto Islands ferry terminal is right outside. The rooms were comfortable and the bed "Heavenly" as advertised. Everyone on staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. Only downside is the high charge for in-room internet service. But the hotel does offer free wifi in the lobby for one-hour per day with an access code from the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: awfountain3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin while attending a conference in the ajoining conference center. It was an absolutely great place to stay. It is right on Lake Ontario and next to a Ferry station. From the hotel you can walk to lots of resturants or cruise by ferry to the Toronto Island; which is in sight from the landing. The service was excellent. The hotel did a great job supporting the conference as well. Internet was free for conference attendees, but generally not provided in the room charge. The food in the bar was great, but very expensive. You are better off walking across the street to the Harbour Grille Sports Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: juliebooBuffalo_Ny
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location-it was going to be hot and we wanted access to the Toronto Islands. (Ferry access is directly behind the hotel.) Our room was on the 27th floor with the lakefront view. It was an overnight stay. Parking is Toronto can be challenging-it always seems to be on the opposite side of the street from where you are! In this case trying to make a left then right then left then right was too complicated for us so we opted for valet parking, as suggested by a previous reviewer. It was worth every penny. The room itself was beautiful, decorated in neutrals and browns. The bed lived up to the "heavenly bed" slogan-super SUPER SUPER comfortable. My husband loved the double shower head in the bathroom and the wall length vanity. Our problem was the location of the towel rack. Having it on the wall IN the shower, sticking out eight or nine inches made it hard to get in or out. A special shout out to the hotel staff, who were all super nice-valet, front desk and baggage check area. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay. A few small improvements, and it would be perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Gina-Gina-Bo-Bina
Reviews.Content: Our family of three (two adults and one teenager) stayed one night on Canada Day 2011 following the Jays game at the Rogers Centre. Our package (which included one night in a standard room with city view, valet parking, and buffet breakfast for four at the Mizzen) was a good value downtown at $209 plus tax. We were placed in the south tower on the 24th floor, and delighted to find that our room had both the promised city view (looking left out the window) and also a beautiful view of the harbour (looking to the right). The best of both worlds! The room itself was clean and bright with a modern decor. The location of the hotel is great for those wanting to visit the Toronto Islands, as the ferry dock is just steps away from the entrance. It was also an easy walk (15 minutes) to the Rogers Centre. The Air Canada Centre is five minutes away on foot. Staff were fantastic. We have nothing but positive things to say about the attitudes of the valets, the front desk, the fitness area workers, and the Mizzen staff. They made us feel pampered and above all, very welcome. A small issue with our breakfast voucher (our son was not included as we reserved) was remedied by the front desk efficiently and with a smile. The recreational facilities were bright and had a great view of the harbour. The pool was large and comfortably warm. The hot tub could have used more powerful (and more plentiful) jets, but it was nice and hot. There's a great kids play area adjacent to the pool for those wee ones not wanting to swim, and a flat screen tv on the wall at one end of the pool for "dive-in movies". The outdoor recreation area has a great tennis court, chairs for lounging in the sun, and a basketball area in need of some TLC (and a new net). Internet access is outrageously priced and was the one of the few disappointments of our visit. We chose to forego internet access and leave the lap-top turned off as the price did not justify the convenience. The charge for toll-free calls was a second disappointment, as a phone call via my calling card would still have run me up in extra charges. I missed being able to check in with my senior-citizen mother in the evening. Breakfast the next morning was excellent. A large variety of quality items that were hot and delicious. Superb service. Lots of selection, both hot and cold items. It was an excellent start to the morning. Room service prices are freakishly expensive and we avoided purchasing additional food on site at all costs. Parking fees are also unbelievably high, and we were grateful that we had that portion of our stay included in our package rate. All in all, we enjoyed our stay very much and were impressed by the Westin Harbour Castle. Remedy the ailing basketball area in the recreation centre, do something about the exhorbitant internet fees, and allow for no-charge toll-free calls and this property would rank a perfect 5.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: The valet greeted us with a genuine smile as he open my car door asked if we were checking in then hit me with the fact that valet parking was $40 p/n and self parking was $30. We were given a nice room overlooking the lake, furnishings were in good order but the shower water temperature was not hot just warm. Bed was comfortable and room was designed well. My gripe with hotels in this class, they charge you for Wi-Fi, @ $17 for 24 hours. I paid for one 24-hour session then decided the next morning to go to Cocobery diner just left out of the hotel. Breakfast was $7 and included free Wi-Fi! I suggest all guests do the same. Here the deal my rate was $139 p/n plus $40 per day for parking, $17 wifi grand total with tax $415.00 for two nights. So a good rate turns into an expensive one.

Reviews.Title: “It is okay”
Reviews.Author: DingDong22
Reviews.Content: The check-in was smooth but I had a hard time hearing what the receptionist was saying to me, she spoke ever so softly. The initiative on Greening is good but the incentive is not strong. I choose a hotel by location and price and using SPG points or $5 a day food/drink coupon to be spent at an overpriced hotel restaurant does not encourage me to enroll in the program. An upfront discount, perhaps for a smaller amount would be a better incentive. Wi-Fi is ~$15 a day at the hotel. There is a great diner down the road with free Wi-Fi and a Starbucks further away, why would I want to spend $15 to use the Wi-Fi just for a few minutes. There was a $5 15 minute option at the business center but as my travel companion put it, â€˜May as well get something more for $5 further down the road.â€� The beds were comfortable but the duvet weighed a ton and the hotel was advertising for customers to purchase one for personal use, I doubted if they ever sold one. The shower was okay except for the mold on the grout around some of the tiles and the tub. The shower curtain also has a foul moldy smell. My travel companion decided to wear flip-flops in the shower. The check-out was great and the receptionist was the most pleasant and gracious person that we had met at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but poor food and location too far away from Toronto action.”
Reviews.Author: Chili-Bite
Reviews.Content: Great for the view and waterfront atmosphere, but the lack of healthy fare and distance to Toronto activity means I will be staying more central. Usually stay at the Sheraton but could not get a booking and wanted an SPG hotel. Ease of access to TTC subway is also poor, meant taking a street car to the closest station adding time to my commute. On a positive note, the corner room overlooking the lake and island airport was very picturesque.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: nibster
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a two and a half day trip combining business and pleasure. When we arrived there had been a mistake with our booking and the hotel had no record of us having a reservation. The check-in clerk was fantastic - courteous, patient and helpful, he took up the matter on our behalf and sorted everything out for us. The hotel is in a good location if you are only staying in Toronto for a few days. We had a lake view and the hotel is walking distance from Union station where you can get metro trains to most of the city. It is walking distance from the CN Tower and the Harbourfront arts centre. The ferry to the pretty Toronto islands is right at the back of the hotel. The actual building is a bit ugly but the facilities were great, we used the decent sized pool and jacuzzi. The hotel has a top floor restaurant called Toula with impressive views of the city. We had lunch there and the food was very good, but we ate at restaurants which were amazing during our trip, so I would say that you can do better in Toronto. For business travel or for a reliable base during a short trip this hotel is excellent - if you want something romantic or intimate you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sfael
Reviews.Content: I showed up here (literally) in the middle of the night, with no reservation and with all Toronto hotels near capacity. I explained to them I'd had to suddenly check out of another hotel due to a bad experience, and they were very accommodating. They explained they couldn't guarantee my corporate rate because the hotel was nearly full, however they gave me as close to it as possible. I explained I had to leave the other hotel due to noise problems, they told me to go up and check out the room and come back down if it wasn't quiet enough and they'd move me immediately. The girls that checked me in could see I was exhausted and was so friendly and sympathetic I could not have felt more welcome. This will be my hotel of choice for all future trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Kavajo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 nights on business, and the room I had was large and spacious. The decor is slightly shabby but overall room was good. Housekeeping and laundry were excellent, same day service for laundry and overnight ironing service. The gym has plenty of modern machines and free weights, and the pool looked good for exercising too. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is situated in the downtown area, so perfect for a short walk to Bay St and the business district. It is also on the lake, so rooms facing that way have a great view. Also within easy reach are CN Tower, Toronto Island ferry quay, Union station & metro, Air Canada Centre. The only negatives are that the decor is looking tired, time to think about refurbishing. Also the bar restaurant prices are expensive, but you would expect it from a hotel catering mainly for business travellers. I'd overall, a good hotel, recommend for business trips, though maybe you can find better value for leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: jraja123
Reviews.Content: Great quality room with all mod amenities, friendly and helpful staff, amazing views (of lake ontario), sauna is a bit worn down though, one of the best locations in downtown Toronto, free wifi, overall amazing! Excellent lounge & business centre

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights - 2 business, 2 pleasure. Check in was quick and very friendly. Room was nice. Corner view of city and lake. Housekeeping was good - no complaints. Staff in the coffee shop downstairs were lovely as was the coffee and the fruit. This stay was definitely worth the money - surpassed expectations. Only negative observations: Would not self park again - would valet. Self parking lot is a pain to get to, expecially if you are in a rush. Toula - the restaurant - needs a facelift. Food, ,menu and decor do not match the view. Otherwise will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel nicely located on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Kheldan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many time with family and on business. Always received great service and a fabulous room with a view. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: thatguy73
Reviews.Content: Really good location, beautiful hotel inside. Rooms are very clean and well kept. Staff are excellent to deal with. Great value for money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday to remember”
Reviews.Author: mps0302
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle on 18-23rd June 2011 to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Hotel kindly gave us a room on 20th floor, with an unbeatable view of lake Ontario. We chose this hotel due to location on the harbour front, which proved to be excellent with easy access to the harbour walkway, boats, shops, restaurants, CN Tower, bus/rail network and Air Canada Centre. All of the hotel staff that we met were absolutely charming, eager to help and very friendly, at reception, concierge, porters, restaurant, cleaners and the swimming pool area. Minor problem that we experienced with the bathroom was reported on the service line phone at 07:30, and was quickly attended to within a few minutes. This was a thoroughly enjoyable and memorable holiday, and we would highly recommend this hotel for anybody thinking of taking a holiday in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great girls' weekend at the Westin Harbour Castle”
Reviews.Author: JellybeanandBug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle the weekend of June 17, 2011 with a girlfriend for a ladies weekend in Toronto. I have stayed at this property a few times before and this trip certainly did not disappoint. I was upgraded to the executive suite on the penthouse floor of the north tower when I checked in (a lovely and wonderful surprise). The Executive Suite has an "entertaining space" connected to two rooms on either side. The entertaining space has two couches, two wingback chairs and a large dining table with seating for six. This suite is also complete with its own powder room and a wet bar for making drinks for your guests. The adjoining bedroom was decorated in a more classic style, heavenly beds and a flat screen television.The rooms on the 34th floor command an amazing view of Lake Ontario and the Toronto skyline. I had some friends over to this space for some drinks and they were all very impressed with the location and the view. We felt like rock stars. We ordered four rounds of room service during our stay and the food was everything that I have come to expect of the Westin: promptly delivered and tasty! The gentleman who delivered the food was very welcoming and friendly. While I was in the elevator one of the security staff recognized me from my last stay in November and welcomed me back to the property. She even remembered where I was from! This personal gesture, along with all of the other interactions I had from the staff, is what will keep me coming back to this property. I am even going to send me mother and sister in law when they visit the Toronto area next month!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Business Hotel But What Is Up With Housekeeping?”
Reviews.Author: tripsnjunk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the recent NXNE indie music conference. Got a very decent lakeside view room on the 29th floor thanks to my wife's gold spg status and paid for 3/4 nights w/ points- so no complaints about the price. Room was spacious except for the tiny, tiny bathroom. Location of this hotel is good- the harbor area is right there, obviously, and we were able to walk all over the city. Here's the thing though- what is up with the housekeeping at this property? It was literally the worst housekeeping I have ever experienced at ANY starwood property- bar none. Here are my examples: 1. Iron in room didn't work- put a note on it "Iron Doesn't Work"- came back after they had been in- Iron was still there- still didn't work. Called housekeeping, had them bring up a new Iron- old Iron remained on our table for the next two days. 2. Our shampoo/conditioner wasn't replaced 2/3 days, despite the fact that the empty used, bottle were placed in the bathroom trash. 3. Coffee was used in the morning, and not replaced. Generally speaking, every day it looked like the only cleaning that happened was that the bed was made- poorly, I might add. In case anyone from the hotel is reading it was room 2924 and we were there from the 17th through the 20th. Get your house in order, Westin Harbour Castle. OH also- someone needs to tell Toronto about this crazy thing called "wi-fi" it's like it doesn't exist there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: CMartis
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of fancy hotels, as I usually find them stuffy and not worth the price - But I found all the staff I interacted quite sincere, helpful, and informative! The porters who helped with my bags as well as getting a driver and offering local info... the concierge very helpful, the room service folks always puntual and super delicious food ! Also most hotels now have a deal to minimize the unnecessary waste of energy in cleanning all linens, towels..etc but this is the first time, I've seen it with an incentive to the customer (of course besides that of their future generations). If you opt out of getting your room fixed up which honestly most folks that don't have maids waiting for them at home could easily do, you actually get either 5 bucks or 500 hotel club points. Of course, I'm sure many people like me are impressed but forget to cash in the points - but its the thought / intention that I think goes a long way. For the conference all the staff was quite good as constantly clearing up the glasses / coffee mugs people would leave, so definitely great venue. Only drawback to the conference was that they did not have any snacks during coffee breaks. Would have been nice even if trail mix, nuts, cookies, fruit, left over halloween candy :) at least once a day. Oh one more positive thing... I came in 3 hours before check-in and that was not a problem at all, they had the room ready for me... after a 20 hours of flying - kicked off my stay quite nicely!

Reviews.Title: “Not like it used to be”
Reviews.Author: moebus
Reviews.Content: We arrived here as a reuslt of a 'Hotline mystery'. $ 130 for the night. I used to stay here regularily years ago and I must say time is telling in the common areas. The first room we were assigned was heavily coated in dust and had 2 double beds. We were moved to a portion of a suite with a queen bed, very clean and a beautiful view of the island. After a month of travelling around Europe with free Wifi in every hotel, it was a shock to find no Wifi and a $15 charge for a HS internet connection which doesn't hlp my IPAD. Parking is ridiculous. This hotel needs to move into the new century.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway piece of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Kirstysmiles73
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - every moment of it after an initial bump. They put me in a room that had a leak and I found out they knew it had a leak and this had not been communicated to front desk. I called the manager and said it was not what I expected of their hotel and they could not have helped me more - I got upgraded to an amazing suite and also free breakfasts and papers both mornings of my stay. They moved all my things for me too. My new room overlooked the islands - the best view so pretty and relaxing. My breakfasts were unbelievably good! I slept like a baby. I loved walking along the front of the water and looking out at the view from the room and the room service was delish. The only negative was the price of the massage - fabulous massage but more costly than I ever experienced. I didnt want to leave my relaxing room sometimes. I got a special offer which is why I could afford it. They should put on as many special offers as they can so people on a tighter budget like me can stay and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff a wonderful surprise in a big faceless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thad_McIlroy
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Castle is about as large and anonymous a hotel as any in North America. The rooms are Westin standard. It's an enormous high-rise complex serving conventioners and business travelers. But despite all of this, the staff are top notch. I had friendly encounters at check-in, with bellmen, housekeeping and with the concierge. But the highlight of the visit was superstar Christopher in the health club. I'd lost my bathing suit. No problem. Christopher had a few stashed away, long forgotten. I found one that fit, showered, and had the swim of my life, a sauna, whirlpool and a lay-down on the sun-deck. I was refreshed and pleased as punch to encounter such happy-to-go-the extra-distance staff. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, big room”
Reviews.Author: Principessa10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Harbour for only one night during an event I was attending in Toronto. The hotel is a very easy walk from Union Station and was very nice inside and out. The lakeview room I had was a very spacious double bed room which had a very nice partial view of Toronto Island and you could watch the planes land at the island airport. The room itself was very clean and the washroom and shower were adequate. Had an awesome sleep and would love to know where they get their pillows from! They were soooooo comfy. Would definitely consider staying there again when I'm back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room... or being checked in to an already occupied room”
Reviews.Author: DM138
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay here for our anniversary the weekend of June 10th. We booked through Priceline...... which makes me believe that our experience was because we were not paying full price to stay at the hotel. We often use hotwire/priceline to book hotels as we are both students - yet we have never experienced inferior service. We attended the Blue Jays game Friday night and went to check in to the hotel around 10:30 PM. When we went up to our room, we saw that there were dirty towels lying everywhere around the bathroom floor. There was also a room key on the TV unit in the bedroom. However, the bed was completely made...and there was no luggage in the room. Thus, this leads me to believe that either A) our room was not completely cleaned.... or B) someone had been occupying the room. We called the front desk and we were immediately "upgraded" to another room. We went to our new room. It was clean; however, the only upgrade was the view (it overlooked the water instead of the street). It was the same small room. I was utterly shocked. This is how they were going to make it up to us after what just happened? My boyfriend called to complain and the manager told us that we already got an upgrade .She also explained that no one was staying in the room... they probably just forgot to clean it (UHH...THE BED WAS FULLY MADE with the "green" sign on it...and the rest of the room was ok). Also, being 10PM and the fact that we were just using the room to sleep as we had baseball games and shows planned, the view was not much of a compensation for their terrible mistake. In order to make us happy they did give us free buffet breakfast and the vouchers would be sent up... after 45 mins (nearly midnight), the vouchers were no where. We actually had to call back and ask if we were getting the vouchers or if we just go down to breakfast in the morning and get them there. 20 mins later, they were shoved under our door. It was like they did not want to deal with us and just wanted us to get off their backs. I do wish the staff had been more understanding of what had happened - I was truly worried about leaving my stuff in my room as their story of why our original was in its state did not entirely make sense. Accordingly, our experience at this hotel was rather unpleasing - at least Toronto did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms - great conference facilities”
Reviews.Author: WayneinCollingwood
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the hotel for a conference. As an SPG Platinum member was upgraded to a huge suite. Spotlessly clean and comfortable but shutters on windows do somewhat obstruct the great view. Conference facilities are first-rate and food service during conference drew very positive reviews. Serving a plated meal to hundreds of people at the same, including a soup course, and delivering it piping hot is no small accomplishment. Staff were helpful, positive and energetic. Overall, an excellent experience. Only downer: at a hotel of this type, there should not be a change for internet use in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Itsbeenawhile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle over the last weekend in May due to business in Toronto. Initially, we booked a standard room with two double beds. The room was clean and of a size to be expected. During the first night we had to call security twice due to party noise leaking through the double doors to the adjoining room. In the morning, my wife discovered a note written by the occupants telling us, in no uncertain terms, how they felt about us. My wife promptly brought the note to the attention of the front desk. She was assured they were leaving that day. I decided to confirm this later in the morning and was told otherwise. A manager was brought out to speak with me and we were offered an upgrade to a suite. The suite offered was the Harbour Suite. It occupied the entire Southern exposure on the penthouse floor and it was huge. I have never before been in a suite was large as this. The odd thing was that the suite appeared as it certainly must have appeared when the hotel was built in 1975. I have never before had to call security due to noise in an adjoining room. Management went out of their way to ensure this issue did not dampen our weekend and I thank them for that. One foot note. Valet parking is certainly the way to go, but beware, Sunday checkout is pure ciaos. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Hlondon99
Reviews.Content: While the lobby was lovely, the rooms can use some sprucing up. The bathrooms are minute, some wallpaper is beginning to peal. The bigger issue is the concierge staff sent us to a restaurant that was closed on Sunday, and another that was only mediocre, and the restaurants were poor. The breakfast buffet was one of the worst I have eaten, and the lunch buffet was even worse. The "fancy" dinner restaurant was overpriced and didn't have much of a menu. The late night menu in the bar was good, but..... Also, Internet access was shakey at best, and required a sign in code each day.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T USE THE HOT TUB”
Reviews.Author: Michelle1978-32
Reviews.Content: I ended up with a bacterial skin infection called "hot tub foliculitus" it ended up going systemic. I was off work for 3 weeks, as I work in a health care facility. I looked like something out of a hororr movie. The doctors finally came up with this diagnosis after constant visits in Emerge-internal med doc and the chief of Derm. It was so bad it was in my joints and swelled lymphnoids. I REPEAT STAY OUT OF THE HOT TUB. Thanks Westin Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Craiger
Reviews.Content: Always clean and comfortable rooms although a little on the small side. My favorite is the lakeview rooms high up. Exercise room is good if you get there early. Work up a sweat shower off then go swimming in the large indoor pool. Parking is easy with the valet service although during party seasons you might lose your spot if you venture out in your car. Its only happened to me once. The hotel is just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the inner city but many popular points of interest are within walking or a short cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “I'd forgotten how I love a Westin”
Reviews.Author: LisaN11
Reviews.Content: My 3 night stay at the Harbour Castle was wonderful. Helpful staff, good breakfast, good facilities, bed AND pillows. Everything a person needs for a great stay. And what a nice surprise to be told you're 'guest of the day' when you check in....I'm mystified how that happened, but resulted in an upgraded room, free breakfasts and free WI FI. ...icing on the cake !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel terrible service”
Reviews.Author: members2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great spot - right on the waterfront with easy access to many of Toronto's tourist sites. The room was clean, and well appointed. Check in was a bit slow considering there were no line ups. The biggest problem was valet parking. When I checked out at 10:45 AM I had no idea that I would be standing in front of the main entrance for 70 minutes waiting for the valet to retrieve my car. Judging from the line up behind me I would guess that guests who left closer to the noon check out time were destined to wait up to 90 minutes possibly 2 hours for their cars - service was incredibly slow and there hoards of people who were waiting. I actually paid $40. for valet parking - I always thought that Valet parking was premium parking - the best service available. Other guests who were waiting in line vented that it was not uncommon to wait 40 minutes at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto at its best”
Reviews.Author: jeanpereira
Reviews.Content: I'm very glad I chose Westin Harbour Castle. It's a splendid hotel, although huge and crowded, its roons are fantastic, cozy, clean, super-confortable beds, modern and spotless bathroons. Location is not the best (some minutes to get to Dundas square by walking), but there's no problem when you are in the safest country in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Everything up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: klodya
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for one night at the Westin this weekend with my boyfriend, and I already feel like going back. I checked in at 12pm and my room (a corner unit with view on Bay St and the lake) was already available. The room itself was pretty large, very nice, big and clean bathroom. The bed was in fact heavenly. I think the highlight of my stay was the bartender that was on duty that day. I cannot remember his name, only that he is japanese. He was AWESOME! We went to check out the hot tub for a bit and lazied around outside on the nice "roof" terasse. I have to agree though that we could hear VERY WELL the people in connected room. And what the hell with 15$/day WiFi? We're in 2011...

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay”
Reviews.Author: irene2211
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the westin for a work conference. I arrived for the conference at 8am as it began at 8:30am I went to the front Desk and was pleased to hear that I would be able to check in early. Gerry (Gerardo) at the front desk is great and very friendly he was very informative and made my check in very pleasant. The rooms are clean and the bed is very comfortable. When staff pass you in the hall they make a point of saying hi to you. The staff seem really happy to be working at the Westin. The only downside of this hotel is the cost for valet parking. It was $40.00 and self park is $25.00. Self parking is not a good experience I would pay the extra money and use the valet. Great hotel over all and great location.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal”
Reviews.Author: seatsale
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel room on travelocity with the secret room option. My hotel room was $100.00 a night. The room was clean. The check-in was prompt. The location fantastic. All in all, a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view!”
Reviews.Author: researchnerd
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying the Westin Harbour Castle for a Saturday night in April. Was in town to watch the TFC soccer game and upon looking up hotels online saw that on the Westin website they were advertising 1 night for a nice low price of $100. Pulled up to the front of the hotel and were told they only offer valet parking at the hotel for $40 and self-parking a few blocks away in an unattended lot for $30. Kind of a surprise that self-parking would be so high, so we went with the valet. We ended up with a regular room with 2 queen beds overlooking the lake. We had a great view overlooking Toronto Island, not sure how I would feel with a city view. The rooms were modernly adorned, with sleek TVs, cabinets and washrooms. The beds were Westinâ€™s Heavenly Beds, but slept just like any normal mattress. There was a little wear-and-tear on the desks and in the washroom, with the wood being quite scratched and a cupboard door not properly closing. A minor gripe with the shower as I got up at 8am on Sunday and there was no warm water, 2 others that showered later on also did not have any warm water. Before the TFC game we stopped by the lobby bar for a few beers. Decent prices for a hotel and the bartender offered us bar snacks which tasted great. Overall I would recommend the Westin Harbour Castle. I would not consider it a luxury hotel, but if the price is right you could do no harm staying there. Anytime I have been there during a weekday they are extremely busy, so they must do well with conventions and group travel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Room. Disappointed with concierge services”
Reviews.Author: misschief23
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Westin Harbour Castle with a friend on a impromptu trip. Arrived on a Monday night and left Thursday morning. For a 4 star hotel, I was quite disappointed with certain elements. I have traveled extensively over the US and Canada and stayed in various hotel establishment usually in a 3 to 5 star range. Issues: - For a room that was booked for 2 people in a double bed room, you would expect to have more than one small conditioner bottle and one small shampoo bottle on the first night. We didn't make a fuss thinking they would provide us with a new set the following day. However, as our stay progressed we gained an extra bottle of shampoo on night 2 and an extra bottle of conditioner on night 3. The soap bars were not renewed or exchange at anytime. - On our first night, the bedsheets were still a little damp and were quite wrinkly. Saw some mystery hair was a little weary but too tired to deal with it. Placed the sign on the bed to renew all bed sheets. Sheets were renewed and opted not to renew sheets for following evening. - Most frustrating experience was with their concierge service. I have never been so disappointed. Our first day in Toronto, we inquired what there was to do in a 3-4 hour window before our dinner reservations. We were told we could check out some shows and then he provided (forgot name) a sheet with things to do. Instead of inquiring of our interest, he just handed us the sheet. I had asked about the Tim Burton exhibit and he said we could find it at the Bell Tiff Lightbox and showed us how to get there...EXCEPT when we arrived there, found out the exhibit had ended the day before. He also suggested we go to the box office to see if we can purchase tickets to the Lion King, another FAIL, the box office was closed on Monday. So we pretty much wandered to the Entertainment district to waste time. At that rate, we could have just walked to the Eaton Centre and done some shopping at least. All in all, I would probably never use their concierge service at this particular hotel. - For a 4 star, you would expect them to have decent umbrellas as loaners. I've been in 4 stars where they provide you excellent umbrellas for rainy days. We were given broken umbrellas during our stay and decided to spend another 20$ each on buying some umbrellas that were not defective. My friend put it perfectly - it's like they gave us Dollarama (dollar store) umbrellas. - No free wi-fi in room. Complimentary 1hr wifi/day available in the Lobby. - Walls were pretty thin, spent one night listening to our neighbors yell at eachother until 2am. And could hear flushing noises above us at all hours. Positive side: - The food in the restaurant lobby was on the more expensive side (as usual) but it was delicious. - The service in the restaurant/bar at the lobby was outstanding. - Was able to check-in at an earlier time without any extra charge and under short notice. - They are really trying to stay green by offering various initiatives such as refusing turn down service and not exchanging sheets etc etc. I booked this hotel through Hotwire at a discounted rate. I would never pay regular price for the room we were given and I wouldn't recommend anybody book it at the rate they are requesting. That would be tragically disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Night Sleep in a while”
Reviews.Author: Bex_smiles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel as a one night get away to the city. We live about 45mins away from Toronto so we arenâ€™t international travellers to this hotel or anything but we have stayed at many hotels and resorts and I am a fairly picky traveller. I like comfort, clean and convenience. We pulled into the front of the hotel and were greeted politely with a valet attendant. He advised us Valet parking was $40 a night and there is a parking lot one block away for $25 on Queens Quay W. My husband dropped me off and actually found $10/ night parking on the corner of Queens Quay W and Yonge Street. Just head up Yonge Street towards Harbour Street and itâ€™s on your right side. Once he returned, our check in was fast, painless and the lady that helped us (Noor) was so nice. She gave us the option between Queens or King bed. She gave us our keys and said if we get up there and we have any issues, contact her (she jotted her extenstion down) and she gave us the time she is there till. We headed up to our room, we had a very nice view, we were on the 18th floor. The room was very nice and clean. Our fridge didnâ€™t work but, we werenâ€™t using it anyways so we didnâ€™t bother complaining. The bath products they use (soaps, creamâ€¦.etc) are quality. The bathroom has enough lighting, a large bathroom mirror and a make up mirror. Also, they have a full sized conair hair dryer ladies!!! The bed was sooo comfortable and the room was nice and cool. The air conditioner was a tiny bit loud to sleep with, so we just turned it down to â€œlowâ€� and we survived. That night we went out to a show and when we came back, we sat in the lobby lounge. We wanted to have a snack. We sat down with a drink and started looking over the menuâ€¦.*gasp* $$$$$$$$$ So, as a tip, order pizza or order something to the hotelâ€¦.because you donâ€™t want to eat at the hotelâ€¦unless you donâ€™t mind paying $20 for an appetizer. We had a lovely stay though. The elevators were very fast and always available. There are two towers and we stayed in the North Tower. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and service”
Reviews.Author: plong406
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful, comfortable room with great views of Lake Ontario and the Toronto skyline. After we found our original room to have a smoky smell, we were immediately offered the option of an even nicer room with a still great view. It was the cleanest and best maintained room I have stayed in. Our teenager was in heaven with the large screen TV and the cushy bed. The location, right on the waterfront, would be ideal in the summer, but during the cold snap we experienced it was just a bit of a hike from the main downtown area. Even so, it is within a couple blocks of bus lines. My one disappointment is that wireless internet would have cost an additional $15 a night. Parking is an additional fee - $40 for valet, $25 for a garage 1 block away. We parked our car and were very happy walking or using public transport our entire visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: JayTea
Reviews.Content: I expect all the Westin brand of Starwoods to be pretty first class. I can't say that about the Westin Harbour Castle in Toronto. The check in was very slow. And at about midnight, I learned that my brother in Ottawa had died and I had to check out immediately. I got a perfunctory "sorry" and that was that. I would never stay there again. And in addition my room was quite small with a little slit looking out over the lake even though I learned that the hotel was almost empty.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable and Very disorganized”
Reviews.Author: DNM007
Reviews.Content: First they screwed up with reservation as one of my colleagues despite of confirmation # had to struggle for 1/2 hr to get the room. Myself cancelled one out of 4 nights (one week prior) I was planning to attend the conference but they still charged me at check out and I had to spend 40 minutes for them to look at the previous records and accounts to refund the cancellation. Food served in conference as below average and despite of dietary restriction I was given food I am allergic to and I had to vomit to get it out of my system (My MD degree helped). Bed was average and I could not find any heavenly bed they were claiming they included in the package. My advice: Stay away from this place if you can.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: desboro1
Reviews.Content: Staff make an exceptional facility an extraordinary unforgetable experience. Starwoods green program is a tribute to their environmental comittment. From recycle specific bins in each room to credit for declining housekeeping, in my opinion, they care. Great view of Toronto Island or the city. Form soft in room towels to great pool comfort then Westin is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: michiganuncledoug
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience. Nice room with view of the harbor. The staff of the hotel and restaurant were very helpful and professional. Great location near downtown and especially the waterfront with all the shops, restaurants, tour boats to the Toronto Islands, and activities that are all walking distance from the hotel. There is a great paved path for walking, jogging, roller blading, bicylces and skate boards that follows the waterfront to the west that goes for at least 6 1/2 miles through parks and by the Ontario Place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, great experience”
Reviews.Author: cuteontariocouple
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We used to stay here often but have tried a few other places on recent trips, but we will definitely be back again. The check-in experience was great. A staff member named Julie helped with a little glitch in our reservation and gave us a fabulous room overlooking the lake on one side and the CN tower on the other. We loved the room. It was clean and comfortable and very spacious. The bathroom was a little small but everything else was perfect. This location is very good for seeing the city. The pool is excellent. It is huge with natural lighting and has a real 9â€™ deep end. The temperature was perfect and it wasnâ€™t busy most of the time. We had one little problem with our stay. On our second night we were awakened in the middle of the night by a screeching noise from the air conditioner vent. It sounded like a fan scraping against metal and we had to turn the fan off to get back to sleep. It wasnâ€™t ideal but certainly didnâ€™t ruin our stay. We had a great time and the staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lucy1655671
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Staff very friendly. Very clean, beautiful lounging area, very relaxing. We had two adjouning rooms as there were four of us. Rooms very clean and we had a beautiful view overlooking the harbour. Would certainly recommend this hote.

Reviews.Title: “Great,clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotsally
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, lots of supplies, great view, great staff. 24hr restaurant across the road with great food

Reviews.Title: “Typical Downtown Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wenbone
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in alot of downtown Toronto hotels and found the Westin was a typical hotel. The lobby was nice, the staff was courteous and the location was excellent. Especially its proximety to the greek restaurant Alexandros at 1am! I got this room for a good price on Hotwire and it was worth the money. I am writing this for people who are willing to pay top price for a top Toronto hotel. If it was me, I would spend my money elsewhere. There are other 4 star hotels downtown Toronto that are nicer with an equally convienent location. Other than that, if you can get a good deal on the Westin, take it. You will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING WE NEEDED”
Reviews.Author: lilshd
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. Even though this room was a lower classed room than our last visit, it was still worth it. The most friendliest employees I've ever met - in and out of the hotel. Clean, comfortable, large rooms and walking distance to ACC. Just what we were looking for. Only thing, this time around the coffee machine was filled with water. I would prefer to fill the machine myself. For that reason, next time I will remember to bring water. But, such a small thing for an overall great experience. Will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “A step above”
Reviews.Author: JDMitch
Reviews.Content: Six colleagues and I attended a conference at the Westin Harbour Castle on March 3 & 4, 2011. Every one in our party was pleased with the beautifully decorated rooms and their overall experience at the hotel. I have attended alot of conferences in the Toronto area over the years. The fabulous menus offered during the conference and the updated rooms at the Westin Harbour Castle made this conference a step above your usual Toronto conference. When we made the reservation, we wanted to make sure that all seven rooms were on teh same floor of the hotel, as some of the women travelling with us wouldn't be comfortable being away from everyone in another section of the hotel. While this was not appearing to be available when we first arrived, (nor did the first front desk clerk think there was anything she could do to solve this problem), when prevailed upon, one of the other clerks stepped up and managed to make it happen, which was much appreciated. The views from the 30th floor were amazing! There were first rate views from all the rooms occupied by our party. The sunrise in the eastern facing rooms was spectacular, as were the views for those facing the city CN tower and the lake. The rooms have obviously been upgraded and redecorated. They are stylish and sophisticated, as well as comfortable. The chaise lounge was the perfect place to relax. The beds were divine - everyone was well rested and ready to work. The bar in the stylish lobby was a great meeting place. The servers were very prompt and friendly. Parking was the only downside to our stay. Valet parking was too expensive at $40. The first night I opted for self-park ($25), but that was inconvenient; I had to park a block away in the underground lot of a condo building that was under construction. One of the other women in my party had to accompany me so I wouldn't be in the underground parking or on the street alone after dark. The second night, I decided to pay up and use the valet service so that my vehicle would be adjacent to the lobby and it would be easy for everyone to load up their belongings in the morning. Although I visted for work, I would definitely stay at the Westin Harbour Castle for pleasure. It is in a scenic, prime location downtown with easy access to theatre, shopping and the ferries. The waterfront walk is also fabulous in the spring, summer and fall.

Reviews.Title: “Very Great Hotel - Only 1 Little Complaint”
Reviews.Author: windsova
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel this weekend and it was a very busy weekend in Toronto... however my experience was practically flawless. The hotel is so gorgeous, clean and everything is at your fingertips. My only minor complaint is that our room, although not next to the elevators, seems to be connected to the same air duct of the elevators so we heard them go up and down all night long. We also thought we heard a flushing noise all night long which may have been our neighbors, i'm not sure. All in all it was a great hotel. Valet parking is expensive ($40 a night) so be warned - there are many parking lots close by if you need to park for a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “SO SO DISPOINTED! WHAT A WASTE OF MY HARD EARNED MONEY! BEWARE HARD WORKING PEOPLE.”
Reviews.Author: Aronmel
Reviews.Content: Reservations Department needs to learn more about there 'RESERVATIONS' policies. READ EVERYTHING IN YOUR ROOM (It will save you money) For one, I don't understand why (with every hotel) there is not a mention of SECURITY DEPOSITS on top of the room you are paying for!!!!! BEWARE THE HIDDEN COSTS OF A SECURITY DEPOSIT anywhere from $50.00 if you use a credit card, and up to $200.00 in cash to be held until your departure. In my case with the Westin Harbour Castle in Toronto. I had called in advance, to ensure I had everything covered (since using a pre-paid credit card) I wanted to make sure I had the PROPER AMOUNT OF FUNDS, to cover everything with the hotel. They messed up in telling me that as long as my credit card went through and paid for the room, there would be no added charges. (In this economy BUDGETING for me is essential, and there is hardly any extra) So when this happened to me I so embarrassed and DO NOT WANT IT TO HAPPEN TO ANYONE ELSE!!! WESTIN HARBOUR CASTLE, TORONTO, with there miss-informed information to me, REGARDING SECURITY DEPOSITS caused unnecessary embarrassment at the Front Desk. You know the front desk even asked if there wasn't someone I could call to bring me money? Can you believe that! Instead of trying to accommodate me first as a client who had already PAID for the room in full, and try to work out a solution first with the hotel, they suggested I impose on family or friends to bring me money to cover the SECURITY DEPOSIT, rather than themselves, when they were the cause of the situation.Having only $100.00 Spending money for my weekend, they took $40.00, which they used to cover the SECURITY DEPOSIT!!! That was their solution, not to waive the fee, but to take as much of my money I could spare for that weekend, and they did. IF YOU PAY FOR YOUR ROOM IN ADVANCE AND DON'T HAVE ANY $$$ ON CREDIT OR IN CASH FOR THE SECURITY DEPOSIT, THEY WILL NOT LET YOU HAVE THE ROOM AND YOU WILL BE OUT THE $$$ YOU PAY FOR THE ROOM, ALL BECAUSE OF Not being informed of A SECURITY DEPOSIT (Which is non-negotiable with the Hotel) AND NOT MENTIONED ON THE WEBSITE. No Security Deposit. NO ROOM. (even if you've already paid for it) The room was dusty, I wrote the word 'DIRTY" in the dust on the dresser, and left it there. For a $289.00 per night for this room.....I at least expected it to be dusted, not to mention find a smudge of something on the main comforter. FOR A SUPPOSEDLY FOUR DIAMOND HOTEL..........IT SUCKED. And don't forget the hidden charges for the phone!!! CALL FRONT DESK $2.00 LOCAL CALLS OUT $2.00 + $2.00 FOR EVERY MINUTE AFTER THAT!!!!!! THE FINE PRINT IS written in a really light blue....you'll hardly notice it. OH AND ONE OTHER THING.......They deliver the Globe and Mail to your door in the morning....IT IS NOT FREE....UNAWARE AND UNINFORMED, YOU WILL BE CHARGED FOR THE PAPER even though YOU NEVER REQUESTED THE PAPER in the first place. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE FOR THIS KIND OF MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, felt nickel and dimed though”
Reviews.Author: lexphile
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle from March 20 - this morning, March 25th. I received a rate on Hotwire of $125 per night which I thought was a great deal. Unfortunately, the costs of internet and food made that price rise dramatically which will make me rethink my choice of hotel in the future. The lobby is very nice and well-maintained, although no one seemed to realize that the random assortment of tables and chairs smack dab in the middle of the lobby is actually the restaurant. The food there is unfortunately pretty mediocre with a hefty price tag. I sampled their burger (which is NOT good, the meat looks very weirdly colored... I don't know if I'm just not used to Canadian meat or what, but it was not good). The fries they have, however, are really yummy. Due to my schedule, I usually had to resort to heading back to the hotel for dinner so didn't have many options. I quickly learned that since nothing was that great, it was best to just order from the Childrens Menu so I wasn't paying an arm and a leg. Their chicken fingers were the best thing I ordered. Also, steer clear of ordering drinks through room service - a can of coke thats a couple of dollars in the lobby costs FIVE DOLLARS through room service. Outrageous. My room was on the 34th floor in the South Tower. I highly recommend that you try for the north tower as my room overlooked a construction site that was definitely an eyesore. The room itself was very clean and nice. The bed and pillows were comfy, and it was nice to have a wall-mounted tv that could be moved when I sat at the desk eating dinner. I was put in an adjoining room, and every time my neighbor sneezed I could hear him. They could be better at insulating sound in adjoining rooms. The bathroom was clean and well-maintained.... but very small. You open the door and its about 1 inch away from the toilet, so even if you are by yourself you have to shut the door while using the restroom or the door will hit your knees. There were plenty of toiletries provided (though not restocked) including shampoo, conditioner, soap, lotion and mouthwash. There was also a robe but after one use, housekeeping did not leave it in the room or provide a new one. Housekeeping was good at the start of the week and wasn't the best towards the end. They weren't bad per say, but they would move some things while they cleaned and then forget to put them back in place when they were done... but it wasn't anything major. It was nice to have the little 'Starbucks' cafe (though the may brew Starbucks coffee, they are not properly trained on how to make latte drinks, that's for sure). They have pastries, fruit, coffee and beverages available (though a little expensive, but to be expected at a hotel). Though I always tipped the ladies, I felt like they weren't very friendly to me, yet there would be other customers who were staying at the hotel for a conference and the ladies would gush over them and call them by name. When I booked the hotel on Hotwire, I purposely selected one with a Business Center and Wifi. The hotel offers you 60 minutes of wifi use for free in the lobby (which is consecutive, not actual time used, so from the minute you log on your time is winding down). After that, the wifi rates are astronomical. You would be paying their monthly bill by paying for any of the daily/weekly rates. So the have a Business Center, which I planned on using so I wouldn't have to pay for wifi. My assumption of it being free comes with the inconvenience of using a public computer that is located only in the basement of the north tower. But the prices they charge for that internet are just as ridiculous! So after one use that was absolutely necessary, I avoided the internet altogether. When I received my bill this morning, I noticed I was charged almost $5 for an "in-room internet" charge... which isn't even possible, considering I purposely avoided using the Wifi, not to mention that in order to access the internet, you have to log into their system first. So I will be calling them to have this situation fixed. Overall, the Westin is not a bad hotel. There are plenty of taxis lined up ready to take you where you want to go, and I'm sure its a lovely location when the weather is nice. But given that I was travelling on business and their internet prices were ridiculously priced, I probably would not stay here again on a business trip unless they offered some better wifi packages. For a personal stay, I probably would stay if the rate was more like $100/night on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy room, disgusting bathroom”
Reviews.Author: ihgelap
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for couple nights (because we couldn't extend our stays at Sheraton Center hotel). We booked via Priceline for a good price, so maybe that's the reason why we're getting such a lousy and dirty room. It was one of the lower floor and we enter the room we noticed that there were dirt and spots here/there (e.g. trace of coffee stain in the side table, dirt spot on the wall, etc) in the room. But, it's late and we're tired (traveling with an infant daughter), so can't be bothered with it. The shocker came the next morning, when I noticed that there's traces of urine on the side of toilet seat, and when I lift the toilet seat, it's even worse, as I can see some dry feces, looks like the toilet bowl hasn't been clean for a while. YUCK! Called the room service to complain and they just offered to clean the room, which I refused as I don't trust these folks touching anything in the room. We just clean the bathroom ourselves with sanitizer wipes. Location wasn't that great, near the lake and quite far from restaurant etc. (specially during cold winter time). There's free wifi at the lobby but the connection was very poor and unreliable, I need to reconnect almost every 5-10 mins. Also, I went to the lobby bar getting some hot water couple times, the bartender was giving me this look, like it was a hassle for him. The folks at the door were great though, one of them giving my daughter a rubber ducky while we're waiting in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: canuckgurrl
Reviews.Content: We arrived Saturday March 19, 2011 for an overnight get away with our daughter. The room was very spacious. We cancelled the roll away we had ordered ($25 savings) when we saw the chaise lounge would be adaquate for a bed for our daughter. We enjoyed the pool that evening. I was very disappointed in the buffet breakfast. For $19 per adult the choices were severley lacking. I could not even ate it due to most of the items being garnished with strawberries (extreme allergy). As stated by other travellers, the valet parking was a nightmare for the amount they charge. Very disorganized and always have their hand out for a tip. I do not think we will return to this hotel. We will return to the Intercontinental on Front Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Pitcherfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin on Thurs. March 17 in the middle of March Break and we were very pleased. Upon check-in(before noon) we were impressed with the lobby and the fron desk personnel. They were quick to accommodate our request to have a CN Tower view without any extra charge and our room had a view of the city, the tower and the lake. I would recommend the north tower rooms ending in "47". Our room was 2547 and any one above us would be great also. We only stayed one night and wished we had stayed longer. It was walking distance to everything (Sportsman show, CN Tower, The Old Spaghetti Factory, the lake, etc). Our room was neat, clean and stylish with windows on two sides. The only complaints we had were the faucet leaked in the bathroom when turned on and the high parking costs. Our room price was more than reasonable as we got a deal through Travelzoo of $100 a night. The pool was busy (March Break) but nice with great facilities for fitness and changing. We would book here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Putney_resident
Reviews.Content: Just visited on business. Room was spacious, toiletires good (though only a soap, no body wash), good breakfast (though quite expensive) and a good gym. Had a bit of noise due to being an intercommecting room.

Reviews.Title: “The room I had was not worth the money, as far as I was concerned definitely not as clean as I would expect,.”
Reviews.Author: DAT17
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money to stay here-the location is great-the only thing good about the room was the bed (although a little hard) otherwise the floor outside the room was stained and dirty, the floor in the room was dirty-maybe it was just the room I had- we did go to the Sunday Brunch upstairs and that was terrible-the food downstairs was better and even that was not great. Service was good and must say elevators were fast.

Reviews.Title: “Business with a side of pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: jamesdavidson111
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for the first time for business meeting over the past week and I had a great time, I had no idea Toronto was such an electric city! First of all the staff was amazing, the young lady that checked me in was fantastic, I believe her name was Trelyn. So welcoming and so helpful. My room was immacuate, even by hotel standards. The bed was extremely comforatable, which I really appricated since I had an awful flight and jumped straight into it that night!
