They have a great swimming pool, but not much in terms of free weights though but their cardio equipment is good, with personalized tvs too! During my downtime I hit a few spots in the city as recommend by some of the staff and had a great time people we soo warm and friendly! A very plesant surprise considering how cold it was outside... Anyway I would recommend this hotel and city to anyone, for business or pleasure My meeting went well, so hopefully I'll be back sometime soon

Reviews.Title: “Near Union station, nice gym/pool facilities”
Reviews.Author: PaulandNadene
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the water in Toronto. It has really nice gym and pool facilities with a hot tub and sauna, I quite enjoyed it. It's around 2 blocks from Union station, so you can get anywhere on the subway. Would be an ideal location for ACC events. Rooms were fine, standard Westin, so nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great...”
Reviews.Author: HutPrince
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in the service was friendly but my reservation wasn't kept. I had reserved a terrace room w/double beds a couple weeks before my arrival but instead they told me that due to how busy the hotel was I had to get a terrace room w/one king. So, why did I make the reservation for? Also, I had requested a fridge and microwave the day before over the phone and I felt that should have been in the room prior to my arrival, but we had to wait for it. I told the rep at the front and then I had to call the front desk again later before I received them, as well as a roll-away bed for the other guest in my room (since my reservation wasn't kept). I was given a guest of the day package which included free vouchers for internet and breakfast, which was nice. But, the front desk rep forgot to give it to me and they had to deliver that also to my room, after I called the front desk. The breakfast had a great selection except the breakfast meats were all under one buffet dish, which isn't good for those with religious sensitivities (ex: chicken and pork in the same dish). Also, the almond croissants were too close to the butter ones, and this could bother people with nut allergies. And $9.60 for a Corona? Am I getting served in a gold cup? What about $40 valet? Are they cleaning my car and doing an oil change? Lucky for me I got dropped off. On a positive note, the hotel and rooms were very clean, no bed bugs or vermin, with comfy (but not exceptional) beds and furniture. The balcony was a nice addition. I feel that the value of this hotel is OK, but I have stayed in cheaper hotels and have received better value. Well, a semi-long weekend on the lake downtown...what can you expect, right?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: cruiser2b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin 2 nights and had an enjoyable stay. The rooms are clean and the bed was very comfy. We had a lake/street view. It is near Air Canada Centre where we went to Bon Jovi concert and hockey game and in walking distance to Eaton's shopping centre (app.20 min walk). The location was perfect. We booked through Hotwire ($115 per night) and was certainly worth it. Service was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for $115 or less - parking expensive but close to street car”
Reviews.Author: TrulyCanadian786
Reviews.Content: I bid on Priceline and got it for $115 per night. I stayed for 5 nights. it was good location, good service, clean rooms. 4 star worthy. valet parking $40per night was very steep. as was the self park at $25 per night. overall, great experience. 3 min walk to street car which leads to subway. also very close to stadium. don't pay more than $115 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and excellent staff....”
Reviews.Author: Holly's_Parents
Reviews.Content: Its is really difficult to fault this hotel and their staff. Apart from the noisy heating/aircon unit it is difficult to find any other faults. Not only did they upgrade our room from a std room to a deluxe corner lake view room (after mentioning that it was my 40th Birthday during our stay) but they also gave us a complimentary bottle of decent red wine, fresh fruit and 2 tickets to the Hockey Hall of Fame on the day. The conciege Joe was very helpful in booking our trips and generally helping us with any questions and David for providing the complimentary gifts (see above). Location is superb for Toronto Island, the Air Canada centre ( a Maple Leafs game is a must ) and for the CN Tower. The room was very spacious and the bed was very very comfy. Could not recommend this hotel any more highly and will definately visit again. We stayed for 7 nights but did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay , friendly staff & a very unique entrance”
Reviews.Author: dtokio
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, clean room ,fair size. Checkin person was very pleasant & helpful, got a good price on Travelzoo so all was good. The only thing a little strange is that the entrance to the hotel is elevated and about 100 feet back from the street and you have to walk up about 50 stairs or go up the car ramp. If your going to the ACC ( which we were) it's perfect as you can walk it in about 20 minutes. Upon checking out the room as we arrived I noticed that ther e was no robe hanging on the hanger that said "enjoy this robe" so I called down and housekeeping had one there in about 5 minutes... PDQ.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive and comfortable but some room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: SeeTee-27
Reviews.Content: Rooms are recently and nicely decorated, beds are comfortable, bathrooms well-appointed and the view of the city and/or the lake is great. A few things could be improved: internet access is expensive; wireless is available but you don't realize it until after you've plugged in the old-fashioned way (a little card next to the very visible cable set-up would do the trick); restaurant didn't seem to be open either evening I was there and there's nothing in the immediate area (the no man's land south of the Gardiner. It's actually a fairly short walk to the restaurants on Front Street and the Esplanade but a bit unnerving if you're doing it alone in the evening); bar food and drink are predictably expensive (minimum $10 for a glass of wine; $20 for a salad); in the room there was lots of noise overhead the first afternoon/evening I was there -- sounded like maintenance or construction as opposed to overhead neighbours; service adequate but not spectacular (luggage check refused to take my coat and boots; taxi stand attendants not keen on providing any info or directions and they whistle for cars VERY loudly -- with startling effects if you're standing too close). If you're attending a conference on site, it's a practical and comfortable choice but not a destination in and of itself... unless you get a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Communication”
Reviews.Author: johnpyt
Reviews.Content: Pre-paid rates limited time offer ends before we could book. 200% increase in rates post special offer. Call Hotel to discuss. Limited time offer ended response. Displeased with lack of communication on promotion ending and ask them to honour. No deal. Hot-wired similar quality hotel in area for the same rate as the promotion ended.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, nice harbour views and pretty much what you would expect of a Westin”
Reviews.Author: Dr3z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times. Pretty simply put your getting the quality you would expect out of a Westin. Not the cheapest option but its a nice place and certainly one of the places Im happy to stay at when in Toronto. Habour views are typical and very nice, the rooms and main areas are well kept and the decor is modern and well taken care of. At my last visit had a surprise found under the bed missed by the maid upon check in but the hotel fixed it and it can happen easy enough I suppose, in general everything is clean. Location is good, close to the Skydome and Tower if thats important to you, a little farther from the Eaton centre if thats your goal. Pool is nice enough. All in all, a solid choice in an upper scale hotel. That does mean the extras are never cheap (i,e internet, valet parking etc.) but thats not new.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bayfieldbunch
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend at the Westin. Nice clean rooms, looked to be recently renovated. View of the lake or city. Buffet breakfast was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent minus location”
Reviews.Author: davidplustanya
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great. Staff was amazingly friendly and should be commended for this. Saeed at check-in even gave us a free upgrade to the Lakefront room! The room was much bigger than the one we had at the Sheraton and needless to say had a very nice view. While the room and hotel were great, the location left a lot to be desired. It was hard to find respectable places to eat within walking distance and the area around the hotel had very few people walking around. This gave the area kind of a "dead" feel to it and was a bit of a downer. We thought about eating at the Westin's restaurants, but both of them were quite poorly reviewed online. I'd still recommend this hotel to anyone, even more so if you're not planning to leave the hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto with a view”
Reviews.Author: SGT_DAWG
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our travels to Canada. This past year it was Toronto we visited. My wife and I took our soon to graduate son to the city. We chose the Harbour Castle on recommendations of friends that have stayed there. The location was great , and like the title says it was Toronto with a view. The rooms were clean and service was impeccable. The Concierge staff was great and we had an easy time making our way around the city thanks to them. My wife enjoyed a spa day while my son and I went onto to spend the day at the Hockey Hall of Fame.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel.Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: kayla9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Toronto and would definately stay here again...The staff were so friendly and efficient(Saied at reception and Danilo in lounge deserve a special mention)We felt so relaxed and taken care of from check in to departure day..Our room had a lake view which was lovely, I found the double beds a bit small..but maybe thats just because we have a huge bed at home!Leisure Centre is clean and very relaxed and even has a small play area for toddlers...pool a little chilly but fine..Buffet Breakfast was excellent and again staff could not have been nicer,we had our two small girls with us and they were made so welcome...I have stayed in many hotels and this one would rate as 10/10...

Reviews.Title: “Poor service with an attitude”
Reviews.Author: linjudy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Westin for 3 days before visiting family. The hotel is nice enough, typical Westin with nice rooms and good amenities (gym, pool). However we had some major issues with service. On our first day, we left our room about noon, and returned by 5pm. The room was not yet cleaned/serviced. Clearly they forgot us, as we had not left the "do-not-disturb" on the door. When we called, they could not send anyone up immediately, and it was an hour before the room was made up. We had to wait down in the bar, and while they did comp us a couple of drinks, the person at the front desk only did so after we made an issue of it, and did it with a horrible attitude. We are SPG gold members, and would expect better treatment. The hotel location also left a lot to be desired. I'm sure it's nice to be on the waterfront during summer, but during winter, it's an unpleasant walk beneath an overpass and through a tunnel to the rest of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for your trip to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: FlopsyBunny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel previously but not for over 7 years and have visited Toronto a number of times. The hotel is located by Queens Quay Terminal downtown Toronto and this is where you catch the ferry to the Islands. The hotel is within easy reach of Union Station, Air Canada Centre, Eaton Centre and the CN Tower so really a good starting point. Westin's Heavenly Beds are lovely and make for a nice sleep, although there were very noisy people on our floor (and next to our room) and so I was glad I had my earplugs! We had a room overlooking the Lake and we could see the aircraft coming into and out of the Toronto Islands Airport and a lovely view of the CN Tower. I am not so sure about the 'Heavenly Bath' although the soap was nice! This is a nice hotel where you can walk your socks off and come back and sit in the bar/lobby lounge and have a drink and watch the world go by. The breakfast was a bit 'fancy' although it was included in our rate but scrambled egg with brie .... Staff were lovely and the place was clean. My husband has not stayed at this hotel before and commented that it was the best hotel we had stayed in in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pontygirl
Reviews.Content: We were a party of two couples who had two rooms next to one another. Both were very nice, large rooms with extremely comfortable beds. The rooms were clean and spacious and we'd been upgraded to lake views. The hotel staff were helpful and did all they could to make sure we had a good time. We only had the breakfast buffet once but it was tasty and well-cooked, with plenty of choice. On other mornings we had breakfast at nearby cafes - the favourite being Cocoberry just down the road. The hotel was a little bit further from the shopping areas than other hotels we've stayed at in the past - but not annoyingly so (we still had a good time shopping and spent lots!) It is, however, extremely handy for the ferry over to the islands (which were very peaceful and quiet when we visited). All in all, we were very pleased with the hotel and would have no qualms about staying there again or recommending it to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service response when dealing with a tough situation”
Reviews.Author: JellybeanandBug
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle over the November 26-28th weekend while we were in town to see a concert at the Sony Centre. This hotel is ideally located if you want to be handy to everything but isolated from the noise of downtown, as it is located on the waterfront. The only real noise you hear is the occasion street noise and planes taking off from the Toronto Island airport. Staff at this hotel were extremely accommodating to myself and my brother during our stay. Our trip started off a little rough as my brother had a medical situation on approach to the Toronto Island airport which required us to be at the hospital for most of the night. We checked in at 3:30am and I explained to the front desk clerk why we were late. First he inquired about my brother's well being and made sure we had everything we needed and if he could get anything for us. He went even further to invite us to order some room service free of charge so we could get something to eat after our ordeal. I thought this was an incredibly nice gesture and this attention to customer service is something that I have experienced at many Westins in Canada. Our room had two double beds and the decor had bene updated semi recently. The beds were comfortable as always. The bathrooms had been updated partially with new vanities and toilets but the older style bathtub remained. For me this isn't a big deal as I'm not really a bath person. Our room was on a corner so we had a view the air canada centre and Royal York on one side and a partial harbour view on the other side. Westin has changed their menus around a little bit since I was at this property last to a more spa/well being focused menu. We ordered room service breakfast (eggs and sausage and belgian waffles). I found the breakfast to be great. Many of the ingredients were organic or locally sourced and the flavours were great in the hashbrowns, sausage and eggs. We spent the day shopping and the evening attending our concert. When we returned there was a serious problem with our room. I called down to the front desk when we noticed it, around 12:00am, and the response was immediate. A night manager and security staff came to our room and moved our luggage into a new room that didn't have this issue. The total turnaround time was very quick. I was impressed with this as there were many events in the hotel that event (holiday parties, etc.) that many of the staff were occupied with. For our trouble, we were sent a fruit and cheese platter with a hand written note apologizing for the inconvenience. I felt this was very nice. In the morning, we had the buffet breakfast in the Mizzen restaurant. The selection is excellent and the value is great for the amount of choice you have ($20.00 per person). I would stay at this property again when my travels take me to the Toronto area due to the good value ($149.00/night) and excellent customer service by all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth staying”
Reviews.Author: Shahbanoe
Reviews.Content: I 've been staying at this hotel for 10 days in September with my partner. Being a Starwood Gold member I was appointed a large room, a Suit, but I 've to admit that this hotel really truly needs some new decorations and is worn out and outdated. The only good thing about the room was the BED! The rest? NO. I 've been a very loyal Starwood member and I have to admit, I rather do not stay at this hotel again, unless they build a whole new one. Luckily, I could enjoy being a Starwood member when I stayd for two days at Sheraton Toronto Center and there, yes I 'd a great time, good room and all. At Westin though, bathroom was really so small you had to close the door as to just fit yourself in the bathroom and on the toilet seat! Dusty, filthy, dirty, yeaks! ... Food? aweful ... Breakfast? Not really good, have seen much better than that. Internet connection was fine but yes, you 've to pay a fee for it and that was not included in the price I 'd already paid for a suit! If this was a suite, I wonder how aweful the standard rooms are! I shall never ever stay at Westin Harbour Castle.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: CaroM8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in November; we were attending the NFL game; and it was simply amazing! We took the train to Toronto, and looked up directions to walk to the hotel. The hotel is only a short 10mins walk from the train station, which was great! The lobby and entrance is beautiful, always seems like there is something going on, very lively (and security guards patrolling as well...). Reception desk was very helpful and friendly; we got upgraded to a junior suite facing the lake even though we had a certificate for a free stay. The view was amazing! Very nice to wake up to a peaceful lake in the morning. Furniture in the room was nice, a little worn, but no biggie. Another plus of this hotel is the location! Steps from the Air Canada Center (hockey and concerts, CN Tower, Rogers Center (Football, concerts), restaurants, Hockey Hall of Fame etc. We walked almost everywhere! The buffet breakfast, which was included in our package, was delicious! And the service was very attentive. Servers seem to have been working there for a while and are very good at what they do. All in all, nothing bad to say about this place! Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Westin - Read on”
Reviews.Author: sherryteacheralberta
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in the hotel. Not at all happy with our stay. We arrived casually dressed in jeans and were made to feel awkward by the gal at the front desk - who hummed and hawed because our "Starwood" Alliance card had expired. Other issues that occurred: 1. asked for a room as high up as possible in the north tower (booked 7 weeks in advance) ended up as low as possible in the south tower. Stayed in this room for one night, as we didn't want to be rude guests. (no record of this request on file.) 2. First night in the hotel room, they could not get our pay per view TV to work. They tried unsuccessfully for 2 hours to fix it - by then it was too late and we asked for it to be fixed the next day. 3. in the morning Room Service stopped by at 8:00, waking us up, but we never ordered room service. 4, Once we got up and ready for the day, I found black mould around the shower head and then went to front desk to report this, the TV that was not working and the fact that we were not place in the room we had requested... 5. We were moved to another room in the North Tower on the 18th floor. 6. Returned to the room after a full day away to find that housekeeping had not yet visited. Phoned and they did come while we were out. 7. High speed internet - wireless - very expensive...$15.00 for a 24 hour period I believe. All in all there were two highlights: Gabby from the front desk was lovely. The restaurant at the top of the South tower was a nice treat - pricey - but very nice. Except for the manager who kissed the butt of the girl seated behind us. He bragged about bringing in "girls" for a famous Soccer player and continued on about all the famous people he has dined with/seated etc. It was evident that these two received special treatment including the manager saying "please call me personally if you should require any thing further". It was amusing to him kiss their a*** but left a bad taste in our mouth for the $300.00 that the meal ended up costing the two of us. Our server was exceptional, the view spectacular and the food was delicious. The manager however - not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service.... Great Room & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MarkPotvin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. They upgraded us to an awesome corner junior suite facing the lake with a stellar view. The room was very clean with a super comfortable bed and modern bathroom. On our last day..... we did not catch our flight home until 8:00 PM ..... so we asked for a late check out explaining our dilemma.... and they let us stay in our room until 4:00 PM which was a huge help. We absolutely love the location and we will definitely be staying at the Westin Harbour Castle on our next stay to Toronto..... It's nice to see in an era where most have forgotten what good service is...... the Harbour Castle has made it their foundation and mandate!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “First-rate stay on Lake Ontario”
Reviews.Author: coconycNy
Reviews.Content: My husband had business in Toronto so his company put us up at the Westin Harbour and we couldn't have been happier. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a lake-view room. Our room was spacious, with a gorgeous view, trees changing color really took my breath away as I'd never even seen Lake Ontario! The gym also features the same view. The staff is very friendly and while I only enjoyed one meal at the hotel, my breakfast was delicious and the service was extremely attentive. While the location is ideal for attending events at the Air Canada Center, it is a bit of a walk for shopping and a taxi or subway is required to visit some Toronto's local hoods.Also there is a charge to use the internet at the business center, which can get costly.... All in all, a great stay- first-rate service, we would return again!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: groggymorning
Reviews.Content: We live in Toronto but were running a race on Saturday and took the chance to extend our outing to a weekend getaway without our kids. This hotel suited us perfectly. We got a good price, and it had everything we were looking for. Pool was nice, very bright, and not too busy, (hot tub was average), lots of outdoor space to sit and read a book on the common terrace, and even a small terrace beside the pool deck to soak up some sun overlooking the lake. Rooms were updated and classy, very comfortable bedding and mattresses. Location was great for us, close to Harbourfront, lots of restaurants and theatres. We didn't eat in the hotel, so can't say anything about the restaurants. Parking, though was very quick and easy. We will be back for sure (the next time we can get a whole weekend of babysitting! )

Reviews.Title: “Good overall stay”
Reviews.Author: philosIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Less than 10 mins walk from station and close to the lakeside. Efficient check in. Room was on 14th floor with view of CN Tower and around to lake. Comfortable bedroom including chaise longue. We did not eat at the hotel- seemed expensive but there are good cafes nearby. Overall a good stay. We did an excellent walking tour with Bill Genova who took us to many interesting locations. We also saw a show, football match and had an excellent dinner up the CN Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...but expect to be nickle & dimed”
Reviews.Author: crystart
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful for a conference. Rooms are spacious and what you'd be expected. Nickle and dime though for everything...internet, phone calls, etc. I just hate paying hundreds for a room and then being told it's $20 for internet, phone calls, etc when any best western or holiday inn offers all the extras incl. for the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTCK
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel right on the lake. It is also a 5-10 minute walk to all the offices/banks. The hotel staff is quite helpful. The restaurant on the top floor offers good views of the city. The bar in the hotel lobby is quite happening as well during evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great!”
Reviews.Author: SilverPorsche
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, fantastic service from staff and overall attention to detail- our â€œLeafâ€� home away from home. Thank you valet team for your quick action and getting my vehicle groomed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Not so great location”
Reviews.Author: gpbc
Reviews.Content: In 1987, the Toronto Hilton Harbour Castle became the Toronto Westin Harbour Castle, and the Toronto Westin became the Toronto Hilton. In an instance, the centrally located Westin was moved from its prime downtown location to a lakefront location. Gone was the quick access to Torontoâ€™s heart. In its place, a soaring twin tower hotel overlooking Lake Ontario was borne just south of the Gardiner Expressway and the railway tracks that serve Torontoâ€™s Union Station. Though the hotel has excellent access to the harbour frontâ€™s many amenities, itâ€™s location away from the main shopping and entertainment areas might frazzle some. The hotel is typical of a Westin. The hotelâ€™s spacious and contemporary lobby welcomes guests upon their arrival. Guest rooms are located in both the south and north towers. South facing rooms have beautiful views of Lake Ontario and the Toronto Islands, which are accessible by the ferryboats that depart from just behind the hotel. North facing rooms have wonderful views of Torontoâ€™s CN Tower, the Rogers Centre (Skydome), the soaring steel and glass pinnacles of the financial districts. The contemporary styled guest rooms are done in earthly shades of taupe and brown with accents of green. Bathrooms echo the same style and colours. A large wall-to-wall window embraces each room. And of course, the Heavenly Bed, which feels like sleeping on a cloud. The hotel only offers valet parking at $40 per night. Off-street parking is available off site for $25 per night. I love the `Westin` but do wish that this one were located in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Relations Testimonial”
Reviews.Author: BobcatTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing the Bay with glorious sunshine. The hotel is situated between Bay and Yonge Streets. It is a 30 minute walk to the Entertainment Section. What sets this area aside is during the weekends you can Purchase a subway pass for $10.00 for a one day pass for up to 6 People to use public transportation eg. streetcars, busses,subways. You can do this at Union Square station which is a 10 minute walk to Front Street. I have to compliment the hotel management since we had an incident involving our room the second night. The manager of the hotel and maintenance person appeared at our door after our phone complaint within 5 minutes. Right away they told us to pack and they would send a bell man to take us to a new room. Little did we know we would be upgraded to the 35th floor to a large suite reserved for celebrity status. It was as large as an apartment. Kudos for taking care of your patrons I suggest when you go to take a look around if you are on a budget for Breakfast. The area does have a cafe just down from the hotel going West on Harbor Street quite reasonable. Also right a across the street is the Waterfront Deli that offers $5.99 Breakfast. Not fancy by a long shot but if does the trick. I found parking simple enough. Just use the self part for $25.00 night which is an enclosed lot. I think Valet is just too expensive at $40.00 a night. The Westin comes as advertised with their comfort beds and the double shower heads. We had a chance also to use the pool area on the fifth floor that was really nice. Large pool and whirlpool. very enjoyable. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to rest and indulge”
Reviews.Author: ParksyMelb
Reviews.Content: Great staff, wonderful room, and great facilities. Great for a well needed rest! Exactly what the doctor ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Joanne M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle one week for business. Check in was smooth and room requests were met. Only had cocktails in the the restaurant and lounge but everyone was very attentive even on the busiest night. The room was a little dated but comfortable. Beds are alsways super comfortable with a variety of pillows. Maid service was outstanding, room very clean and all toiletries always refilled. Overall very nice stay. Would stay at the Westin Harbour Castle if returning to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy but do you have to charge extra for Internet”
Reviews.Author: ilir11
Reviews.Content: The good: It's very comfortable and clean. If you get a room with the lake view, it's very impressive at sunrise. Also the restaurant downstairs has very good food. The bad: The internet access charge. Why do you have to pay an extra 15 bucks when you are already paying 300+ per night? It's sketchy to nickle and dime customers in this fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: cmuelle2
Reviews.Content: We had the most awesome time in the westin; no need to complain at all. The staff was very friendly and most helpful, room was clean, large and had a great view, free newspapers and starbucks coffee prepared in the room every day, luxurious bathroom. The location very lose to CN tower, union station and lake ontario was excellent. I just donÂ´t know why they charge for use of internet but I am sure, this will change soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: Onthegofam4
Reviews.Content: Having just completed a three night stay at the Westin Harbour Castle, I found the hotel to be disappointing for a Westin. First, on the positive side, the hotel is in a good location and is within walking distance of the the Toronto business district and many tourist attractions including the Air Canada Centre, the CN Tower, the Hockey Hall of Fame, etc. Some of the rooms have nice views and the fitness center was nice. Unfortunately, these positives were outweighed by the negatives. The room was not very clean and had not one but two live spiders in the bathroom along with an assortment of dead bugs (mostly gnats) on the desk. The service was very poor. I called twice and visited the front desk twice to get an issue corrected with the room and it was never addressed although I was given mutliple assurances that it would be. The hallways and room were dark, making it difficult to work and the air conditioner was very noisy. While I was in a "junior suite" the room was no bigger than most hotel rooms and the combination bath/shower was on the small side. When traveling to Toronto there are much better hotels at which to stay. I'll certainly be at one of them next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a lovely city - needs a bit of TLC tho”
Reviews.Author: soshbfly
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid Westin customer, so when possible for travelling for pleasure or business, I always stay at a Westin. This probably wasn't my favourite Westin, but the people working there were lovely and the location terrific. I was fortunate enough to get a Harbour view which was gorgeous! Didn't get my SPG Gold upgrade, but to be fair there was a convention at the hotel and it was fully booked. My only real complaint was the hotel seemed to be a bit rough around the edges... the halls, elevators, and public areas seemed worn and dated. The room was lovely enough - spacious and decent lighting. I had an issue with the hairdryer and it was rectified immediately and with a smile. There were only 3 toiletries in room though - shampoo, conditioner, and lotion. The shower pressure was rubbish as well... had to stand there ages to wash and rinse hair. Load of channels on the TV. No minibar, but a fridge to cool drinks bought at the "airport store" in the lobby. There was a coffee maker in the room as well. The biggest reason I gave this an "average" was that the beds did NOT seem like the "Heavenly Beds" I'm used to at a Westin - the sheets weren't that nice, the bed was rock hard, and the pillows just average. Seriously, I'm not that fussy, but this is the MAIN reason I book Westins every time - I know I'm going to get a fabulous night's rest. That was just not the case at this location (and I've stayed loads and all beds seemed to be cut from the same cloth.) I almost complained, but seriously what was I going to say... "your beds seem different from other Westins??" I kept quiet. I'd probably go back again though - the location was perfect and the staff were just so nice! But if i found a similar hotel with a better price, I'd move... I don't normally though - I always pay the bit extra for a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - but needs more attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: swisscook2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel at the beginning of September for 3 nights. The location is great, the staff friendly and the rooms spacious enough. A request for a Crib was no problem and they where really helpful when we where out and about with our stroller. The rooms are a bit dated but still ok. Gym / Pool is a bit dated as well and the Men locker rooms was always messy when I was there. Towels on the Floor, Soap in the Shower room was empty and all the keys for the lockers had no number tags. I was told that they fell off at one point and where not replaced. Fair enough I guess - but not really Westin style. When I used the business Center it was unmanned as well and rather disorganized. Paper lying around all over the place, pencils and pens as well. PC's where extremely slow and Internet outrageously expensive. Breakfast Buffet was ok - but nothing special. One thing that did bug me though was how dirty everything was. The restaurant was very busy and the Buffet was very poorly maintained. For example, Butter was served in a big bowl and People where all using the same knife to butter their Toast while at the Buffet. Not really clean and looked dirty. Refilling of the buffet was very slow and Cereal station was always very messy with Cereal all over the place. While I can understand that small Pastries are easier to serve people tend to forget that they also bake faster and usually dry out rather fast. Fruit was also not ripe and Cheese selection was poor. I mean if you pay 30$ for Breakfast one does expect a bit more. Kitchen staff was very friendly though. Service staff seemed a bit rushed and overwhelmed. Hostesses seemed to have had a bad day on all occasion we where there and there was 1 guy with tie & suit who seemed to be busy walking to floor and avoid all tables asking for coffee or having dirty plates. All in all a not bad hotel. They have great deals on their website so make sure you check that out before hand.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great waterfront, close to financial district”
Reviews.Author: Travelefes
Reviews.Content: A rather large Westin hotel within a very upcoming location in Toronto with views of Toronto Island, the spike and almost next to Canada Centre. Great service all around, a few remarks: the gym equipment is slightly outdated and not all exercise bikes worked as they should. The Bar/lounge area is not shielded off from the main corridor/front entrance which makes it less appealing to sit and have a drink. Having said that, you can't go wrong with a Westin hotel and this location is quite convenient for exploring Toronto or getting on the Gardner Express out of Toronto quickly.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: alka1960
Reviews.Content: i would strongly recomend this hotel!....this hotel is located on the harbour front which is so relaxing...the food is excellent....however the breakfast is expensive but worth it...and they front deak agent offered me a package that included breakfast for very cheap!.....this made our stay more enjoyable....ask for the upgrade that includes the breakfast.!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cratch
Reviews.Content: Superb room, excellent space, office and comfortable bed. Breakfast Buffet good but $30!

Reviews.Title: “Nickle and Dimed to Death”
Reviews.Author: BonnieHeather
Reviews.Content: Cost $40 to have your car parked, or $25 to park it yourself a block away. No vending machines, everything must be bought at expensive gift shop or restaurant. Breakfast prices exorbitant. Beautiful large room with partial view and king sized bed. Chaise lounge. Double head shower but not enough water pressure. Wireless telephone didnâ€™t work. Closet door wouldnâ€™t shut so light stayed on all night. Huge list of services available for a price. Swimming pool and whirlpool adequate. Tiny steam bath (for two) good. Excellent exercise room. Internet available for a price. Hard to get space in an elevator going from the 5th to the 18th floor. Service staff could be patronizing. TERRIBLE SOUNDPROOFING. Could clearly hear guests in next room talking and people in the hall. Pretentious and overpriced. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical chain hotel, close to CN Tower but rather far off the rest”
Reviews.Author: ianwolff
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicely located at the harbour front with great views on the water and rather close access to the CN tower... but as a drawback rather far off (by foot) from the other interesting parts of Toronto. Room was good (what one can expect from such a chain), but of course doesnt have the charm which one could get from staying at a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HXNBasshead
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for about CND$92/night including taxes. The staff were very friendly and I was not treated differently because I had booked with Hotwire instead of directly with the hotel. The rooms are a bit bigger than average and the beds are incredible. My room even had a small fridge. The food in the restaurant in the lobby (Mizzen) was very good, with service to match. While the prices in this restaurant are a bit on the high side, they are still competitive with similar restaurants in the area. I found the location of the hotel to be very good. True, it is a slight walk to Union Station, but there is a streetcar stop across the street (Queens Quay, underground on Bay Street) from the hotel that will take you to Union Station. Walking to Union Station only took me about 12 min., and that was taking the long way by walking up Yonge Street instead of Bay street. The ferry to the Toronto Islands is right next door to the hotel. The only "con" I could find was with the speed of the high speed internet. At 1 Mb/s I found it to be a little on the slow side, but that's most likely because I'm used to the 15Mb/s service I have at home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Okay Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rizzi66
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel on Aug 22 and 23. We traveled to Toronto to watch the Yankees and Bluejays. Hotel is only 10 minute walk to the Rogers Centre. I used a combination of Starpoints and cash for the room. I was disappointed that the hotel did not offer me free internet access. When I asked and mentioned that I was an SPG gold member, I was told that only SPG platinum members get free access. This is obviously up to each hotel as I have received free internet at other Westins while staying. Room was okay. I don't think I was on an SPG preferred member floor. Fitness center was small and had older equipment. Parking was $40 a days for valet and $25 for self parking, but the staff offered me valet parking at self parking price. The location was good and convenient to many downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it ( with a caveat).”
Reviews.Author: verybigv
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and daughter on Aug22 and 23rd. I shopped around quite a bit before settling on the Westin's "Love Your Family" package. The cost was $199.00 per night. The package included valet parking and breakfast each morning for the three of us. The Harbour Castle charges $45.00 for valet ($25.00 self park) and $30.00 for the breakfast buffet if you don't buy the package. With these services included I would say this place was a pretty good value. But without them I'd say probably not. The breakfast buffet was great. There's more food options available i.e. lox,pastries, pancakes, fruits, cheeses, cooked to order eggs,etc, than you could possibly take advantage of. Really a top notch breakfast. But no way would I pay $30.00 each for breakfast if it wasn't already included. Same with the valet parking. I love the idea of handing over my keys and forgetting about my car. But not for $45.00. I'm not a budget traveller, but I am a value conscious one. Our room on the 26th floor had what they call a "partial lake view". I thought the view was extraordinary. The room was actually kind of small and sort of dated, but clean. The black out curtains worked very well and the "heavenly bed" was excellent. The air conditioner was reasonably quite.Harbor traffic begins early,but it didn't keep me awake. There is no microwave. There is a refrigerator,but they warn guests that it's for cooling drinks and that food would spoil in it. Kinda weird. The bathroom was fine and the shower had two heads. Not sure why. It's not like you could fit two people in there. The pool was fantastic and the workout facilities were some off the best I've encountered. This was a busy place. There was a convention of some kind and lots of out of towners with kids going to the Blue Jays/Yankee game. I was one of them. It's a 12 minute walk to Roger's Center. We had a great time. With the perks this place was worth it. But if you're just looking for someplace to rest your head in Toronto I might look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cool location”
Reviews.Author: loup29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a very muggy summer day - the breeze off lake made a load of difference. Took boat to island, kids loved Centerville. Ride for 4 was $19, park admittance free, rides cost a bit. Great vacation for a family with little ones. Boat ride itself was an event. Hotel is very nice, rooms nice, not that huge. People at desk were helpful and quick to fix a problem with the bill. We had a deal with free breakfast - which was very nice. Pool area was very nice. The best part of the hotel was the pool area, huge outside area with a basketball court, tennis court and many loungers to just relax and view lake at night. If you are not up for the congestion of dt toronto - this place is a nice alternative. Can walk along the lake and to the CN tower too if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put.."It's a MADHOUSE"”
Reviews.Author: BobbyBigTime
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for the weekend (8/13-8/15) and between a conference and a large wedding, the hotel was overwhelmed. Housekeeping did not make it to our room until we called to complain at 5pm! The bathroom shower had peeling paint and the shower head piping was exposed, maybe we should have called engineering instead! Do not stay here unless you are the corporate type and just need a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Always have an excellent stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sbf73
Reviews.Content: My wife works for Starwood Hotels which makes hotel reservations for this chain all over the world. She has stayed at this property many times but this was my first stay. It was such an amazing property. The receptionist was friendly and helpful. We asked if there was a upgrade available as my 2 boys wanted a view of the water and airport. They gave us a very nice corner room at no extra charge and it had excellent view. Later on that night we went down to the pool area so the boys could go for a swim and my wife and I sat out on the roof top patio. The boys also enjoyed the tennis courts that were on the roof top. At check out we still had some site seeing to do and the hotel was kind enough to let us stay parked at the hotel at no extra charge. We cant wait to go back again until then my wife keeps recommending this property to her customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lizmar2
Reviews.Content: The Westin is large and very busy but we never noticed. The staff was working at top speed but they were friendly and prompt and very helpful. Our room, and the hotel, was clean and updated. The pool and recreation area are large and well furnished. The views are fantastic! Transportation options were numerous and easy to access. As we walked around downtown Toronto I kept looking at some of the other hotels we had considered when planning our trip. I am so glad we went with the Westin - a really great choice!

Reviews.Title: “A LITTLE LACKING!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOVETOTRAVEL989
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, but not a five star by any measure. We arrived and were greeted by the valet, $40.00 to park for the night...hmm, ok we were only there for one night.... went to get our room and were upsold to a lakeview and breakfast, $55.00 not bad, so we took that also. We went to our room, small but nice, clean, kind of ordinary. There is no mini-bar, so bring your own, no robes, hairdryers, short on towels(pretty much lacking everything). We had an awesome view though, 31 floors up, it was great. We enjoyed our night out, stopped at the bar for a quick drink, quick because it closed at 1 am on a Saturday??? Went to bed, sleep wasn't near as comfortable as the Hilton or Sheridan or even the Laurier. Woke up for breakfast at the buffet...YUK...the meats were terrible, and Don't try the eggs, you won't eat eggs for a year..lol The waiter only came around once to offer us a drink ,the only thing that we liked was the toast, and that was because we made that ourselves... as one lady in line put it, "Ive had better breakfast in an army barracks" Total waste of $26 per person. At that rate though we only spent $3 for our great view(that was about $1 per minute). The hotel has potential to be a great one, the manager just has to stay in a room to find out what needs to be fixed....

Reviews.Title: “Good location â€“ impersonal â€“ got all facilities”
Reviews.Author: savouk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the start & finish of our tour of eastern Canada â€“ total 5 nights. [We travelled Via Rail â€“ Business Class between cities. Between Toronto to Montreal and Montreal to Quebec we received first class hospitality and service. But the 18 hour overnight trip from Quebec to Halifax was disorganised and with VERY poor food, zero hospitality and a cramped and uncomfortable sleeping cabin â€“ a massive (& expensive) disappointment.] Hotel very well sighted on the waterfront. Reception is vast and this is very much a people-processing establishment. Room not large but with everything you would need â€“ and good beds â€“ clean, no bed bugs! Air con noisy (but we Brits always thinks air con is noisy â€“ take ear plugs). Hotel food & drink expensive - we ate well at the nearby Queens Quay. Donâ€™t miss the amazing St Laurence Market, and sporty folk should take in the Skydome (now rather boringly called the Rogers Centre).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Needs to Work on a Few Things to Justify Prices”
Reviews.Author: orleans_motr
Reviews.Content: Location is a excellent is you are seeing a show at the Air Canada Centre as it's a short, safe walk. For other activities you have to walk a fair bit. They charge $40 a day for valet parking which is quite expensive if I compare to other more upscale hotels. They need to work on the following: - consistency of cleaning (amount of towels, soap) - rooms are small are not well suited to families - hallways are warm - our room was very damp and we asked to have another room on the same floor but it appeared all the rooms were damp, from the feel of the floor it looks like the carpets had recently been cleaned and were definetly still wet. Staff has to work on how they deal with this type of issue -This used to be a luxury hotel, now i would consider it more modest, perhaps a 3+ star - Breakfast buffet is expensive and not refilled regularly. This morning one of my children had rancid pineapple... -The Heavenly Bed in our rooms may have got old, it's not as good as others in other Westin's -For the prices that are being charged they will need to up their service levels and ameneties. Some suggestions; -better training staff to ensure consistentcy in preparation of rooms and also standard process when dealing with unsatisfied customers -reconsider the hotel's value proposition to its customers and what type of hotel you want to be -think about how you service families

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrissynGreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and found the hotel experience good overall, The Decor was contemporary. The rooms were spaceous, clean and up to date. It's a nice property but I think serivce needs improving at the cafe section and at the front desk the way they have the lines setup for their members and non members. Also location is a bit out of the way and parking is expensive and a bit of a walk to get to your car.

Reviews.Title: “Served our Purpose”
Reviews.Author: atapul
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very busy , touristy location. Right across the hotel is the ferry station to the Toronto Island. So, when we arrived it was a little overwhelming. Too many cars trying to find a spot in front of the hotel etc. I managed to pull into a spot and walked to the valet parking office. It is $40 valet parking and $25 self parking. I told them I wanted self parking. They said it would be $125 up front. I told them maybe I would just park 1 night at their facility and maybe tomorrow I would find a cheaper place and park there for the other 4 days. Immediately the valet office person started whispering... "I will give you the self park rate for valet parking" So I got $25/night valet parking. This really irritates me cause I could have paid the full $40 and after reading my comment here i would have felt really bad. The big hotel was nickel and diming me... Anyways... check in was ok. Not much wait. I got upgraded to a lakeview junior suite because I am an SPG platinum. But I was assigned to 7th floor. Remind ytou it is 34 floors in this hotel. It really didn'y feel like an upgrade to open up the shades and be at the eye level at the lower roor. Plus during day time, street music players could be heard very loudly inside the room and the ferry whistles feel like inside the house. The only complain about the room is the loud (and I mean very loud A/C) I recommend setting it to run very cold all day long and when you come to your room turn it off and sleep as fast as possible. There is no way to watch TV when A/C is on. Which really wasn't a problem for us. The junior suite was decent size. We skipped the room service for 2 nights. I was hoping that I would skip it for 1 night and get the $5 credit and use it at the bar for a beer. But the flier fails to mention that the $5 food and beverage credit can not be used for alcohol pruchase. But I used it for 500 spg points. The pool is very little but serves the purpose after dark. The hotel is in a nice location but feels left out after dark. Overall good hotel. Can't comment on the value as I used the cash and points. Platinum members get a bottle of water daily (Yeay!!!!) The restaurant and pool was exremely expensive (but so was Toronto and Canada IMO coming from medium town,USA)

Reviews.Title: “nice stay with a nice view”
Reviews.Author: SmallLady
Reviews.Content: My one night stay with my fiance was very nice. We had a lake-view which I am sure would have been nice in the morning; at night when we checked in, it was simply black. I prefer city scapes myself, but I don't think they had one to put us in at the time so the lake-view had to do ;) The room was clean and comfortable. Both the room and the hotel had a lot of amenities available, though I did not take advantage of any of them except for the mini-fridge which had a few snacks (chocolate, chips, cookies) and drinks (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic, wines, pops) in there that you could eat for an extra fee. I think we ate a coffee crisp choclate bar from there, but the prices were generally extortionate so we didn't indulge. It has been awhile, but they may only do valet parking for which there is a fee plus gratuities, but there is also a car park near by. I can't remember how the prices compare. Overall it was a nice stay. I found this hotel at a good price and so I wanted to see what a 4 star hotel was like in Toronto's downtown core. I think if I had paid more, I think I would have been disappointed as I did not necessarily find it to be that much better than other 3 - 3.5 star hotels that I have stayed in. However, it is a nice hotel in a prime location with a lake view that most people would value and, if you are willing to pay extra, there are a lot of extra amenities that you could take advantage of that may not be available at a lower star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Waterfront Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephenL16
Reviews.Content: Provided a very relaxing and affordable room and services were excellent. Cordial staff and very efficient design. Green business strategy and environmentally savvy products. Very good menu. Worth paying what you get for it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lakeside Location”
Reviews.Author: mottyandfluff
Reviews.Content: A very large hotel: the downside was long queues at reception, both checking in and checking out

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected.”
Reviews.Author: Ulliboo
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Toronto the week-end of July 10, 2010, to see a baseball game for our 10th anniversary. I got a great rate on the Westin, so we decided to stay here. It was also within walking distance to the Rogers Centre. The hotel was extremely busy this week-end, which may account for some of the craziness. Check in was good, and we were offered a room well before check in time. The rooms themselves are very dark . I also had a strong musty smell in our room. The wallpaper was bubbling and peeling on one wall. The bed was comfortable, and the TV was nice. On Saturday at approx. 10:30pm, the fire alarm went off. Initailly we just listened for an announcement, but all they said was they had an alarm going off in the parking garage. Nothing else was said, and then we could hear the fire trucks coming. People were leaving via the fire exits, so we left as well. We were on the 29th floor, so it was a long and dizzying trip down. We stayed outside for a short time, with other travellers in their PJ's, and with sleeping kids in their arms. No one came out, or made an annoucement about what was going on. Finally, a woman next to me asked a fireman if it was alright to go back in, and he said no problem. Still no announcement from mgt, and so we waited for the elevators to come back on line. There was an irate group of people at the front desk demanding an explanation...not sure if they got one. Next day there was a posted letter by the elevators from mgt indicating they were sorry about the disruption. The overall feeling this hotel gives off is one of "tiredness". Every day there was a group of young kids sitting all over the front lobby steps, smoking away, and inside things just tended to look a little messy and unclean. Never ate in the restaurant, so can't comment on the food. I wouldn't book again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: jocelynbichard
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay at the Harbor Castle over the Canada Day weekend and following five days. Most of my extended family stayed there as well. We found the location great with shpping handy and the Tall Ships in the Harbor were an extra bonus During the period of blackout in Toronto on July 5th,the management kept us well informed and provided refreshments when it was over. The staff were great. Breakfast at the Hotel is expensive but just a short walk down the street was Cockoberry a good breakfast location..

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable and relaxing stay at the Westin Harbour.”
Reviews.Author: SheenaL74
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Westin Harbour for 10 nights visiting Toronto.Hotel staff friendly and helpful and room was spacious enough for 2 adults and 1 teenager with the bonus of a lakeside view! The hotel was very busy - lots going on with conferences and large groups (Shriners?) but we never experienced any problems with the service (eg room cleaned early/no queues at lifts or bar! We have visited Toronto before and stayed 'downtown' but the harbour area had plenty to offer and we enjoyed the free music;wednesday movies and the world cafe at the weekend. A visit to the islands is a must - ferry is cheap and provides fantastic views of the city - as well as the opportunity to relax on the beaches or the beautiful gardens.

Reviews.Title: “there are better hotels that cost less and give more”
Reviews.Author: kerri33029
Reviews.Content: I had lunch with a friend and colleague today who is making plans to go to Toronto. We discussed various hotels and I shared our experience with the Westin Harbour Castle as well as a couple of other hotels. She encouraged me to post my complaints and compliments. So here is my experience from the WHC from March 19-21, 2010. My family and I stayed here for a couple of nights back at the end of March. We had 3 rooms, we all share the same last name. However, my parents arrived before us and were not allowed to check the rest of us in. My brother, sister, brother-in-law and five year old had all spent several hours driving all day and were looking forward to relaxing as soon as we got to the hotel. Relaxing is not the right word to describe this hotel. It is busy, but that's ok. It would be nice if the staff were as friendly as other hotels. It would be nice if they wouldn't argue with you. It would be nice if they didn't have fire alarms going off in the middle of the night which meant carrying a very sick 5 year old down several flights of stairs. We were told our 5 year old did not need to pay for the King Tut exhibit. But then we were told we had to buy her a shuttle ticket to get her there. Nowhere in the ad for the King Tut package did it say that children under 5 were free EXCEPT when they take the shuttle. I was so fed up with the fellow arguing about it that I said we would rather take a cab than pay for something that is supposed to be free. He then relented and said she could go on. When we were on the shuttle, there were other 5 year old's there whose parents did not have someone who argued with them about buying a ticket for the 5 year old. Why were their 5 year old's free but mine was not? When my dad checked in, he was told that he could access their internet without an extra charge. Later, when he tried to access it, he was told there was a charge. Again, more discussion and we finally didn't use it because all the wrangling to get it put us off and I had found a hotspot anyways. At other hotels, internet is included which is much nicer and way more civilized. Then to top it all off, a fire alarm went off in the middle of the night. My poor daughter had caught a cold and had become more sick that night. She had only just gotten to sleep and then the alarm went off. I had to carry her and a box of tissue down all those stairs. I know that the hotel had little control over the fire alarm, but it was just the straw the broke the camel's back. There are much better hotels in Toronto and they are much friendlier, provide complimentary internet, free papers, breakfast and coffee. We prefer to stay at Hampton Inn and Homewood Suites. Our experience at WHC was not great and this is what I told my friend today.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good”
Reviews.Author: margreek
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from July 9-12. I travelled with my wife and 2 year old. Overall the location is good for downtown Toronto with easy access to the major auto routes. Parking yuor car valet is $40, I chose the self park which is a mere block away for $25. Walking around the area it seems you can find even cheaper parking rates if you go another block. Check in was great and I did like that they did offer a welcome bag for my son. Included some safety items (plug covres, night light) along with a ducky for his baths. The room was fairly clean but under the tv stand and beds was GROSS. Beer caps, potato chips and other food; this was very disgusting. The hotel staff was friendly and over all was pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had better stays here before....”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: On this trip to Niagara Falls/Toronto/Blue Mountain Canada, I stayed only 1 night at the westin harbour castle which is the usual place I visit with friends and family as the location near the waterfront is relatively convenient to a few events and festivities my wife likes to attend each year (tried out the sheraton centre as well, though this trip was mostly for Niagara and the Westin Trillium Blue mountains). Got a basic upgrade to a nice room overlooking lake ontario as usual given to platinum members. Room quality and the hotel is standard for westin hotels which is above average overall. The only hiccup on this trip was when the a/c died around 1am and still wasn't fixed by the time I checked out around noon time. I called the front desk to see if they knew why the room was so hot and they mentioned that a "chiller" went down that night and was in the process of being repaired. While I was fine with the warmer temperature over night, it did get a bit uncomfortable during the morning while in the room. For me the experience was a bit embarrassing, as I was travelling with my Sifu and wife visiting from Thailand who is used to top quality hotels and rooms (which I did get in the Westin Trillium and Sheraton on the Falls for 3 nights). He kept mentioning how he and the wife couldn't sleep well and that top hotels would never have such a problem and not comp or apologize in some way. Led to a big philosophical debate on blame and responsibility for what a hotel is obligated to provide for the hotel rate paid. I tried defending the Starwood side for a while as I couldn't blame any hotel for an unexpected breakdown, but after a while I do feel like the stay was compromised somewhat for my room and more so for my friends in the other room as a/c is always one of the most important requirements towards a satisfactory stay. Maybe i'll contact corporate in a few days, but if it weren't for my friends in the other room who keep telling me how upset they were, i'd probably just ignore it as bad luck (unless of course they still didn't fix the a/c if i were staying a 2nd day).

Reviews.Title: “The worst housekeeping of any hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: It was surprising to find this large, impersonal and poorly managed hotel to be a Westin. Most Westins where I've stayed previously tended to be a cut above the norm. This one totally disappointed. With the exception of the beds (great), the rooms are in need of refurbishment. The air-conditioning in my first room was so noisy that I had to move. The bathrooms were in particularly poor condition, with broken shower rings, toilet paper holders and towels that were just a shade softer than cardboard. What was both frustrating and offensive was the housekeeping (or lack of it). Of my four days at the hotel, there wasn't one in which the room was made up properly. Towels, toiletries and coffee weren't fully replaced until a call was made. On one day, I returned to the room at 6 pm to find that it had not been made up at all. On another, 2 of the pillows were suddenly missing from the room. Calls to the "Service Hotline" were answered promptly but not once was an apology offered (they are obviously used to the complaints).

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Elli2222
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler the most important thing for me is a good night's sleep and a comfortable stay so that I can wake up refreshed. The Westin provided neither. It was a terribly uncorfortable bed, the room was dark and dreary (despite the water view) and overall I felt the hotel was a zoo. The entrance to the hotel is through a dark parking garage areaToo many conferences and zero personality or charm and very overpriced. The only nice part is that the location is very central and only 5 minutes or so from the airport. Surely there must be nicer places to stay in Toronto at comparable or lower prices - I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin at the top of their game”
Reviews.Author: Tom2592
Reviews.Content: I stay at lots of Westins and their competition (Renaissance, Intercontinental etc) and found this hotel's facilities to be excellent. In fact, I would describe this as Westin at the top of their game. Why? 1) Upscale, stylish, recently renovated rooms that are neither glitzy or boring; 2) Professional, friendly service that doesn't cross into Ritz-Carlton step-n-fetchit servile ridiculousness; and 3) A central location convenient to the downtown core. Worth noting is 1) this is a convention hotel and 2) the building is architecturally undistinguished.

Reviews.Title: “Okay... but don`t eat at the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Louberge
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with hotwire and what a great deal! The hotel is a little worn in places but otherwise it is not bad. We loved the Westin style beds, I could have slept for a week in our bed. As the hotel name says, it is close to the harbour and water front. Also within walking distance of everything downtown including the CN Tower, Steamwhistle, NHL Hall of Fame and Muchmusic. We were on the 23rd floor and had an excellent view of the Harbour, Toronto Island Airport and the western portion of downtown...what a great view! Service and check-in, check-out at the hotel was nothing less than perect. What I did not like was paying $40.00 a night for parking. I could have payed much less at an off-site parking lot but was worried about my brand new car, so I paid their price. Ouch! Another ouch was their restaurant but I guess it was my fault. We paid $97.00 for a very ordinary breafast buffet. My fault for not checking the menu and prices before entering, The second day we found many delightful breakfast places close by for less than half the price. All that aside, the Harbour Castle was well worth the price and we will return... and we will again pay their price for parking but eat off-site.

Reviews.Title: “It Couldn't Have Been Better!!”
Reviews.Author: SteveJ2586
Reviews.Content: From the minute the booking was first made to the time we (sadly) had to check out, this hotel could not have provided better service. We arrived early and negotiated to magnificent entrance and air-conditioned lobby to find we could check into the room earlier than advised - and what a room! Having been wished a happy 25th wedding anniversary on arrival, we then found we had been upgraded to a Lakeview King room on the 32nd floor. The view can only be described as spectacular, as we were also on a corner, giving views right across Lake Ontario and Toronto Islands from one window, whilst turning to the other gave a panorama of the city with the CN Tower in full view. WE also discovered a chilled bottle of wine and other goodies, together with a personal card from Gus, wishing us a Happy Anniversary and great stay. The location of the hotel makes it perfect to explore downtown Toronto, being only a two minute walk from the nearest streetcar station which connected to the subway network. This is great value, with a single trip ANYWHERE on the system costing only $3, down to Â£2.50 if you buy tokens in Â£10 batches at Union Station. There's also a $10 per person day pass available if you want to "hop-on/hop-off", with even better offers for weekends. The hotel concierge can offer advice on places to see, eat, walk, shop, all within easy access of the hotel, and they are always ready to help. After a great evening out we returned to the room and got into the signature "Heavenly Bed", which really has to be experienced rather than described! Suffice to say you don't want to get up in the morning! The twin-headed shower, combined with the "bowed" rail curtain makes for a great start to the day, complemented by the exceptional buffet breakfast, which puts just about all UK hotels to shame. Eggs and omelettes cooked to order (and perfection) with a mind-blowing selection of pastries, meats, fresh fruit, cheeses, cereals, juices, and a full range of traditional Canadian hot breakfast dishes makes for great value and means that you really don't have room for lunch! The service is first class and I wasn't surprised to find that the hotel was to be used by delegates for the G20 conference the following week. This was the reason that the staff kept apologising for the fact that the building was surrounded by high security fencing, which was being installed all round the city in preparation, but once through this barrier, you were truly in another world, where service came with a smile and was only equalled by the overall atmosphere and ambience. It's easy to see why the Westin Harbour was chosen to accommodate such high-profile dignitaries, and we were made to feel as important as them. I can honestly say that this made the perfect start to our holiday and was the ideal base to experience the city, with so much within easy walking distance. I shall certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family and cannot compliment the staff enough for their service, care, and consideration from start to finish. We were truly sorry to leave and would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay at this high end hotel”
Reviews.Author: celica079
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and is close to all major tourist attractions of Toronto. Parking is a bit of a hassle. The rooms were average. Was attending a function,The Banquet hall was average too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downown Location”
Reviews.Author: outlawjb
Reviews.Content: Very nice first class hotel. My room was upgraded at check in. It was busy with guests however, front desk and concierge desk were friendly and helpful. Great transit system in town right outside the door. Location is near all the sites and arenas as well as the shopping malls and the St Lawrence Market. Only issue I had was the casual restaurant hours were really short. There are plenty of places in the area once you get the lay of the land. Room was usual Westin class, well appointed and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at this high end hotel”
Reviews.Author: celica079
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbor Castle is in a great location with all the sight seeing places not far off, i was not impressed with the services, especially the room service which was slow. The get together hall was average too.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel may have a great view, but the pool is not always available to paying guests staying at the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hhi6064
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable and the view of the lake wonderful. But while enjoying the pool we were ousted by a water arobics class of individuals not staying at the hotel. They took the entire pool for their class. Since the hotel was chosen for its inside pool, having to give up our swim time was not acceptable. We also received a 6 a.m. wake up call we did not request. The ice machine on the 24th floor did not work the two days we were there. It was reported on day one.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, too little insulation”
Reviews.Author: NCRMaven
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Lake Ontario, so the view is lovely, but you do hear the horns of the ferries back and forth from the island. They start early, so if you don't want this, request a city view room - not as pretty, but quieter. The other noise issue is between the rooms - arguments and crying children are clearly audible, as is plumbing from neighboring rooms, and the a/c system. Staff is friendly, accommodations quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pethouse
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here during a conference. I got an exceptional rate using priceline and I was happy with the choice. Had a room on 27 floor and a lake view. Swift check in and express check out. A 15 min walk to downtown straight up Yonge street and you are at the Eaton Centre or the other way to the Baseball dome or distillery or CN tower. The rooms are standard with a large plasma, the heavenly Westin bed and include a bar frig. Mine was empty but that suited me as I filled it with items from the mini market opposite. I breakfasted at the Mizzen restaurant buffet each morning ($25 weekdays and $20 weekends), great selection and very friendly and effiicient staff. This hotel gives you the option to miss your room clean for a day and receive a $5 voucher for use in the hotel. I did this every 2nd day and put it towards my breakfast cost. If you are in Toronto make sure you do the Niagara falls tour, I used "Chariots of Fire", they were the best value and do the same as all the others. You do have to walk up Yonge street a little for pick up though as they don't come to the hotel. All in all I would stay here again but it is a little way from the action although it does seem to get busy down around the harbour area on weekends in nice weather. Good Irish pub at the Harbour centre waterfront building which is 5 minutes along the road at front towards the CN tower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: AllProLondon
Reviews.Content: Prompt check-in, great staff, excellent stay! We forgot to bring our hand-blender for our baby's fruit to blend up, so we asked the hotel if they had one, they lent us one from their kitchen. They even lent us two umbrellas in case it may rain while we were touring the Casa Loma. Lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Not As Heavenly As Bed”
Reviews.Author: mklein818
Reviews.Content: Having been a loyal Starwood Points collector during a recent job that involved a lot of travel, and having a couple days to spare in Toronto, I was quite excited to obtain a cash and points deal here. But when I checked in and asked for a water-facing room, I was told "a room upgrade would be $30, and we have a special room upgrade with two buffet breakfasts for $55 per night." Nothing pisses me off more than being offered a paid-for room upgrade, and what was even more appalling was being placed in a room that had a view dominated by a nearby sugar refinery and a clapped-out steamer now in a second life as a scary-looking seafood restaurant. Such a wonderful thank you for my Starwood loyalty. As such, the hotel is OK--as clean and sterile as modern high-rise hotels get--but with little in the way of give for the guest. Business centre internet was 25 cents a minute. Extra one-cup coffee packets were offered for sale instead of free. I got hit with a $5 charge for processing an outbound fedex package. The bed, as usual was great, and seemed with the shower to be the only things included in the price--even the concierge seemed unusually keen to be the one to sell me the attraction tickets (he was helpful, so I obliged, even though I didn't want to give the hotel the extra money in the process.) Good point--the excellent Kitchen Table convenience store/deli and decent Harbour Grille sports bar across the street. In short--if you use any internet service at all, the "cash and miles" deal can be easily beaten with a regular priced room via Hotwire or Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, with great views of the lake”
Reviews.Author: Barry_Jordan
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel. We arrived early at check in, and were given a brilliant room with a view out to the islands and lake. The room was perfectly clean and very modern with a lot of space, and a good sized bathroom. The hotel was in a good location and central to everything in Toronto. All the staff were very friendly, and the concierge arranged an excellent trip to Niagara Falls for us. If I am able to visit Toronto again, I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in love with Westin already”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: I would consider staying at the Westins one of the best decisions that I've made for this trip. Both Westins (at Montreal and Toronto) are great value for money (because of their birth year promotion). Overall The hotel lobby is modern and clean. I like the design and they have a bar and small Starbucks outlet that serves very limited range of pastries and drinks. But the security is questionable. Anyone can just go to the elavator and go up to any floors. Unlike the Westin Montreal which you need your card key to press the button in the elavators, the Westin Toronto does not have that security feature. It is an important feature especially their bar seems to be a very popular joint with hotel guests and locals. It was crowded every night when I was there for three nights. And the lifts look old. Room The room is big. Like the one in Montreal, it was big enough for my four large suitcases wand enough room for me to walk around without tipping over any furniture. The room is clean and the design is modern and well design. Basically, it suits my taste in design asthetics. And also, my corner room oversees the lake and city. That's a plus point. Amenities Other than the soap, shampoo and hair conditioner, you have to call the housekeeping and ask basic stuff such as a cotton ball! I find this very absurd! And also, these days, people would prefer to use shower gel instead of soap. So that really irked me when I was staying there. No complimentary Wifi They don't even have complimentary wifi in the hoitel lobby! Check your bill Even though I've reserved my room under the Birth Year promotion on its website. I was charged the full rates when I was checking out. If I did not go through the entire bill, I would have been over charged by Westin.
