The staff told me that the staff who checked me in failed to indicate it when I checked into the hotel. I find it unexceptable when my reservation indicated so. Staff are not friendly at all Generally, I find the service staff in Toronto rather unfriendly. This is unlike Montreal where most of the people that I've encountered are very polite and friendly. The ladies at the Starbucks outlet in Westin Toronto looked sulky and they are just there to take orders. They are not service oriented at all. The staff at the bar is similar as well. Great sporting facilities The gym is comprehensive. The treadmills face the lake which is nice if you are not keen in watching the TV in front of you. The pool is definitely much bigger than the one in Westin Montreal but they only blocked one lane for the lap swimming. The major part of the pool is occupied by children! Hence, if someone is doing his/ her laps in the reserved lane, you will have to fight for some space with the children. There is a hot pool just besides the main pool. In the changing room, there are steam room and sauna. I like these features. Not all hotels provide them. Expensive parking Don't park at the hotel. It's bloody expensive. The next available place to park which is a walking distance is $25 per day. However, you should check out the nearby places if you have the time. Apparently, you can get cheap parking (where Westin direct their clients to park) at a lower rate. Subway It's very accessible from the hotel. It's located convinently below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One word, dirty”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysonbusiness53
Reviews.Content: The place is dirty. The steps leading in are dirty, the room was not clean, the bathroom floor was dirty and the place lacked the TLC you would expect at Westin. Location was great and the concigre was helpful although a bit short. The front desk staff seemed very helpful. The lobby bar was nice with great bartenders. Parking is $40 a day so hold on to your hats. The location is the only reason to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill carefully”
Reviews.Author: austraveller44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights on business. The hotel itself was good with everything you would expect of a Westin. However, when it came to checking out and dealing with the account department I encountered many problems. I was overcharged over $500 for my stay, they charged my credit card for nights I was not even at the hotel. I understand that mistakes happen but when I called the accounting department and left a message I did not even receive a call back. And two months after my stay, they have still not refunded the full amount.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, terrible staff service!”
Reviews.Author: carlos_canada
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, terrible staff service! Very Good real-estate Not so good (expensive) parking

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and nice room”
Reviews.Author: CIVOG
Reviews.Content: It is a nice and mordern hotel. The lobby is large and spacious. The room was clean and spacious, as well as the bathroom. The amenieties products were very nice; I loved the leaf soap was - very exquisite! My room view could be better... In terms of location I consider not to be as good as Sheraton Centre, if you want to visit tourist sites. As I had stayed 3 nights in Sheraton Centre in the beginnning of the trip (in this period I did more sightseeing!) and in the end of the holidays I stayed here 2 nights, I consider to have done the right choice. It was nice to walk in the harbour by the lake! Vallet parking is extremely expensive ($40/night!) and our friend that had a car just park it himself (I believe around $20 or $25, still very expensive for European standards).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: justh8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! The view is amazing, and it is very close to everything downtown Toronto. It is very clean as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect birthday!”
Reviews.Author: w0rshipthesun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harbour Castle to celebrate my birthday and to attend the Fashion week closing shows. I was greeted by a friendly and charming gentleman at check in, believe his name was Mike. I was upgraded to a room to a junior suite with a king bed. It was spacious with a breath taking view to the Toronto Harbour. It was neat as you could watch the boats and the planes taking off from the airport. I was later surprised that he sent up a birthday card to wish me a happy birthday. It made me feel like a million bucks, I have never experienced such service and was above and beyond my expectations Perfect location! close cab ride to the all stream centre where the fashion week events were held. I took the go train in and it was less than a 10 min walk from union station. It was 5 minutes from the Air Canada centre which would make it a great place for staying when seeing a concert or sports game. The buffet breakfast in the morning was steller! Great food selection fresh and tasty. I'm a health freak they even had smoothies. The service was awesome, you never had to look for someone for a refill on coffee they were always attentive within close proximity. Everything from the room to the service was exceptional! I will definitely be returning to the Westin Habour Castle for my next trip to Toronto. I can't wait to go back !

Reviews.Title: “the Westin Harbour Castle my fave in TO”
Reviews.Author: rvgary
Reviews.Content: very simply stated i have never had a bad experience at the WHC,everything about it is great,Super clean rooms,great meeting facilities,wonderful staffff

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: ViaFan
Reviews.Content: Asked for a "quiet room" and the staff went out of their way to find me a great location high above the traffic below and a beautiful view of Lake Ontario, Toronto Island and the light airport off to the side. Check out The Mizzen restaurant for the breakfast buffet, but I was disappointed that they no longer kept a chef behind the counter to custom-make an omlette or a crepe from scratch. Food was still delicious. Went to see Mamma Mia and was able to walk to the theatre and back - very senic and safe. Will definitely return to the Westin for a repeat mini-vacation. !

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Downtown but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: fhpete
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbour Castle sits in a very nice spot on Toronto's lakeshore and close enough to get anywhere downtown in a minute or two. This hotel has been around for a long time. The rooms are decent although you can hear everyone talking in rooms around you (very thin walls). Don't book into this Westin with high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larryo
Reviews.Content: very convenient to it all in Toronto. Very comfy beds, exercise room, pool.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel for Events”
Reviews.Author: SilverPorsche
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for BMO Conference and enjoyed it immensely. I stay at a hotel about 80 times a year and this is one of the best I have been. Great room, great bed, friendly staff, parking was easy and valet accommodated me many times for my briefcase, Mizzen had the best risotto- will stay here again. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and look forward to booking it again this year.”
Reviews.Author: efalcioni1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite, where we could enjoy the Christmas holiday with our family and friends. The spacious living room / dining room / wet bar with the attached bedrooms allowed us to entertain like the convenience of being at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a heavenly bed!”
Reviews.Author: Paramedicgirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location many many times over the years and it is a family favourite. It is in a perfect location when visiting Toronto for shopping, going to the theatre or going to sporting or concert events at the Air Canada Centre or the Rogers Centre. The views from the rooms are incredible. The streetcar is steps away to take you down to the shops on Queens Quay, over to the Exhibition grounds or up to Union Station to take the subway. There is also a delightful small grocery store across the street or a LCBO or larger Loblaws a block down the street. The rooms in the hotel are all redone with flat screen TVs and all of the great amenities offered by Westin, ie. heavenly beds and fantastic showers. If you do not want to pay for valet parking, just park next door for 1/2 the price. You cannot go wrong staying at this location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay overall”
Reviews.Author: mr_minx
Reviews.Content: had a great stay, bed was super comfy. room was very clean with great view. pool, hot tub, and sauna were all clean and enjoyable. ordered room service, food was superb but they forgot one appetizer, so when i called back they gave it complimentary, so was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Amazing service Nice views”
Reviews.Author: LawrenceToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for one night staycation in Toronto. Check in was flawless and done with in 2 minutes. Had a room on the 27th floor with a brilliant lake view. The beds at this hotel are GREAT i did not want to get up in the morning. This hotels proximety To most of Torontos main attractions makes it ideal for tourists wishing to seek the best of Toronto.. CN tower Rogers Center ( SKYDOME ) and Air Canada Centre are all with in 5 minutes walk. The ferry docks are also right beside the hotel if your are venturing to the islands for the day.. All in all i had a great stay you cant go wrong with the Westin Harbour Castle :) Only downfall is it is a bit pricey but if you can get a deal GO FOR IT !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great view and location”
Reviews.Author: travelbugcheri
Reviews.Content: Check in was very slow, we waited in line for about 10 minutes. But a couple other guests seemed to be high maintenance. The clerk that checked us in also checked in the two people in front of us, so she was quick. She also asked whether we preferred a lower or higher floor, we opted for the higher floor (33) for the view. We got our room through "hotwire" and don't feel we were treated any different than anyone else. Room was clean, and nicely appointed. Bed was great, large, comfortable. High end sheets and pillows. I did hear some sounds from next door and above me so it wasn't that soundproof. Bathroom was clean, nice soaps and lotions. Double shower head was nice too. Not enough towels in my opinion, I feel there should be 4 large ones. I paid $100 on hotwire, which for this hotel was reasonable. Although I had a pleasant experience I don't think I would pay the rack rate or book directly, but wouldn't be too upset if I stayed there again from an auction travel site. Also, they wanted $13.00/day for wifi access....just makes me feel nickle and dimed. I opted to use my blackberry for info I needed. We were woken up by a very loud and obnoxious fire alarm at 4:40am...Not the hotels fault. We heard in the morning that a guest was smoking and it set of the alarm in the whole hotel. Glad the smoke alarms are sensitive, but really?? A smoking guest disrupts the whole tower? We wished they would have sat the offending guest in the lobby in the morning with a sign saying "smoking schmuck" so everyone could give him/her a piece of their mind for the disruption (joke)

Reviews.Title: “Priceline price, priceline room?”
Reviews.Author: snowshoer811
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 4 star room. At check in clerk made a point of saying we booked with Priceline. Room appeared clean until I dropped a coin and noticed how dusty the carpeting was near the wall. Also drapes were nasty and back of toilet had not been cleaned in a long while. On the plus side, view was wonderful. Bed was great. Didn't eat any meals at the hotel. Should not advertise daily newspapers when the only way to get a paper was to ask the bell captain.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Chewy69
Reviews.Content: We booked with this Hotel because they offered the King Tut Exhibit Package. Personally talked to someone on the phone to make sure there were no hidden costs which they stated there were not so we booked. We arrived at the Hotel and had our luggage put on a cart and left outside while they parked the car. Had to retrieve our own luggage while we checked in. Then out of nowhere someone comes to take it to our room so they will get their tip. Room was okay but the view was lousy. On the website they show all the rooms facing the lake but ours faced the Redpath factory. Not really a nice view. Booked our AGO King Tut tickets and the shuttle was supposed to pick us up at 3:00 and it arrived about 3:15. The only way in and out of the Hotel is by the ramp or by steps. Not very handicap friendly. We went to the exhibit and we were told that the shuttle would pick us up at 4:45, 5:45 up to 8:45. We waited for the 5:45 pickup along with people from other Hotels and we were informed this shuttle was only for the Sheraton Hotel people. After much discussion with the driver all the people were allowed on and dropped off at their various hotels. Back at the Hotel we asked the Conceirge to reserve a table for us at the Old Spaghetti Factory and we were told they don't take reservations and that since it was a Wednesday night it would not be busy. We asked if the Hotel shuttle could take us and he told us to take a cab. We got to the Spaghetti factory and we were told it would be 1 1/2 hr. wait. As we were waiting people came in with reservations so obviously they do take reservations. We finally had supper at around 9:00pm which is very late for children. It was hard to sleep as you could hear the elevator going up and down all night long. No Continental breakfast is offered only overpriced food. We decided to check out early and go somewhere more reasonable to eat breakfast. We thought the bill was totaled up wrong so we asked when checking out and was told we actually got a deal because it should have been higher than that. Still this price was $40.00 more than quoted when we booked. Then we were told it was $40.00 for parking after specifically asking when booking about parking and we were told in was included in the package. After asking to speak to the Manager the gentleman decided to give us a $20.00 discount. Not a big deal for all the inconveniences. Overall we were treated like second class citizens. Would not recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “jr suite - NOT!”
Reviews.Author: spahotel
Reviews.Content: Got the Junior suite. Was more like a corner King. The decor was Dark and needed to be updated. The bathroom was a joke! too small and the bathtub was like 1 foot deep. If I stay in a hotel, I'd like to be able to soak in the bathtub, not just cover my ankles. The room service options were nice BUT they are the EXACT same as their restaurant Mizzen. So for those of you grounded here. You end up eating the same thing from room service as you do for your meal at Mizzen! Was going to go to Toula restaurant. But had friends that went their before us and said they had the same sauce for their 3 pastas. and checked the yelp reviews which were BAD. The bed was nice. but the walls a bit thin. I could hear the alarm going off in the next room as a quiet annoying beep. Parking was crazy expensive as a guest and for my friends that visited me!

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: GMROCKS
Reviews.Content: Third time at this hotel, and it's better than ever with the renovations completed. I attend an annual conference at the Fairmont Royal York and I choose to stay here over the stately Fairmont because I prefer comfort in my stay over nostalgia. Rooms - modern, clean & comfortable Lobby - nicely arranged Staff - generally very good Location - only drawback as it's a bit out of the way, taxis very necessary. Nice view of the lake and easy access to waterfront however. Other - have never been to the restaurant, but the bar area has vastly improved since the the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “parking NO WAY”
Reviews.Author: travelnowordie
Reviews.Content: If you want to pay 20.00 per night parking fee and walk 10 t0 15 min to park your car off hotel property then this is not the hotel for you. Valet parking is 40.00 daily. Sleep I don't think so. To much construction everywhere starts at 8:00 am on a SUNDAY!!! WHAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile and sincere interest to please!”
Reviews.Author: pbarbiero
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk in to the the time you check out, these people know how to sincerely make you feel welcome and completely satisfied with your stay. As an example of this I'd like to share a brief story. First let me start out by saying that i spend over 200 nights per year at hotels and at least half those at Starwood properties. As such I can honestly say ..."I'm Spoiled" and appreciate the finest service standards around. I arrived at the hotel around 4pm exhausted from a multi city trip week and having to preapre for a Breast Cancer Awareness function that was to start at 6pm. I unpacked and found my wrinkled pink shirt and backup blue one so wrinkled that the thought of ironing them brought my already exhausted state of mind even more so exhausted. I called Housekeeping and got Gloria Huang on the line who understood my predicament and although their in house laundry services were closed for the night, she immediately had someone run up, pick up 3 shirts, press them to perfection and all with a smile and commitment to ensuring I had a great night! She was awesome as was her staff who supported her efforts. I looked great, fwelt great and had a great evening...largely due to their efforts. Thank you Gloria, thank you Westin.... Paul Barbiero Starwood Platinum member

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: cmason971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle on March 20 after booking through Priceline for an amazing price. I have used Priceline before but never got such a nice hotel, I was pleased to have booked a Westin, as I have found that usually they are reliable in terms of quality. We stayed in the north tower on the 28th floor and initially we were not impressed when the front desk put us in the room right next to the elevator, but it was quiet enough and the room (and entire hotel) is very nicely styled, great colour scheme, and very contemporary furniture and finishings. The room was pretty small, but we had a great view of the Toronto island and its airport from our room (and I wasn't going to complain, given the price we paid). This hotel is very large and ideal for conferences, events, tourists, etc. It was very busy when we were there as there was a Leafs game that night but the room was relatively quiet despite being close to an elevator. I would recommend staying here if you are visiting Toronto and are traveling with a group or with family. In my opinion it is not a very romantic hotel due to its size and the 'conference'-like feeling of the place, although the views are very nice. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurants or order room service, although I have read reviews of Toula and they are so-so. There are many fine restaurants nearby to choose from, again, great location. The only disappointment we had with the hotel staff was when we requested a late checkout in the evening and the front desk asked us to call in the morning to request a late checkout. Doesn't calling in the morning defeat the purpose of a late checkout if you are checking out late because you want to sleep in??? ;o) Also, valet parking is a bit pricey at $35.00 a day. Still, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Looks May Be Deceiving!!!”
Reviews.Author: samsinToronto_ON
Reviews.Content: In the beginning of March I booked a special hotwire deal and to my very pleasant surprise endined up with the Westin Harbour Castle. My curernt apartment had a mould infestation routing through the ventilation system which caused sickness in me. So the thought of staying at this hotel was a dream come true for me. A place where I could finally sleep and relax. When checking in I asked the extremely polite Service Receptionist if the rooms were hypo-allergenic. She was unsure of this fact. She went to verify the information adn quickly found out that the rooms were not. Ok....not a problem as I'm relatively an easy-going individual. The Receptionist said that she would accomodate Housekeeping to make sure the vents in my room were properly dusted. Great!! That's amazing service!! She also informed me that it would be a 30 min wait. I asked if there was a bar. She of course said yes and pointed to its direction. Again very nice service. When I ventured over to it (afternoon period) there was no one tending the bar. Since I was sick and dehydrated all i wanted wasd to have a drink , sit and relax. I then noticed 2 other women sitting by the large bay wondows enjoying the lovely scenery while enjoying their beverages. In fact many ppl were enjoying their bevs. I go up to the bar attempting to choose my boisson of choice. As I make my decision, one of the chefs walked y me quickly and back into the kitchen. So I thought perhaps I thought ask him where the bartender was. I walked back to the area..called out to one of the chefs. He informed me that he couldn't help me. Alright..that's fine. All I wnated to know was who could help me obtain my goal of becoming dehydrated. Instead he just gave me a dirty look and 'shoe'd' me away. I sadly walked back to a little tony chair to lean back on since I was losing energy. I notice the same chef walk by, again witht the same dirty look, right by me. Then again a couple mins later back to his kitchen to do his job. A couiple miniutes adter that I was greated by 2 menacing security guards asking me who I was waiting for. This to me suggested that they thought I wasn't a client of the hotel. Since I was sick and looked very run down, this also suggested to me that they were pretty much implying that I was a low-class vagabond. This of course upset me and I started to cry. I cried because I was sleep deprived and dehydrated. Not to mentioned incredibly insulted. They tried to give me dirty tap water in attempt to calm me down but I kept refusing. Why? Well regular tap water has bad chemicals in it that casues more dehydration in me. As I stood up to walk away they demanded to see my photo ID. More insults. Insult after insult. As I grwe more upset, they kept trying to push their flirhy tap water down my throat. NICE eh. This while trying to document the secuirty information on my credit card plus photo ID. This is not correct procedure as I told them I no lonfger wanted ot stay in a place like that. They did not comply right away. What is was wrong with this picture? EVERYTHING!! They judged a book by its cover and came out the loser. The loser in which way. Well I happen to come from a wealthy family, plus have my wealth self-made, mind you. All I wanted to do was relax finally then take advantage of as many spa treatments as I could to start feeling like a human being again. What they did was pretty much spat in my face. That is the truth. In this in age. The long days of a recession, businesses have to realise that if their entity is to shine and blossom, clients cannot be treated as numbers or dollar signs. That is what they did to me. Sorry they humiliated me infront of everyone. Me, being a 30 year old, humilated infront of everyone in the hotel, whom probably had more $$ than everyone. If you want my opinion, do not stay at a place like this. There is a far better place around the corner . The newly renovated Intercontinental : AZURA. They, on the other hand, treated me like royalty. If you think I'm bluffing, go ahead...find out for yourself. I did and what an experience that was. I will never forget it EVER. That is why It was important for me to write this review. They wronged me..and they could possibly do it to you..at the expense of your wallet and dignity. Never again will this happen to me. Please do take this review seriously. If the Westin Harbour Castle is reading this, you will know and remember who I was. How could you forget? You made a grown women whom was ill and tired feel like a sick sobbin child in public. With everyone's eyes on me. I hope this is lesson about client service as it pertains to its authenticity. There's no such thing as a "high valued customer". Looks may be deceiving!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Megan555
Reviews.Content: If the main restaurant had good tasting food, it would be a perfect stay. I wouldn't go back to their Italian restaurant again. If you're planning on having dinner Il Fornello at harbourfront would be my choice next time, but only in the warm weather because you have to walk there.

Reviews.Title: “Grossly overpriced old hotel”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTraveller
Reviews.Content: Well, I had forgotten just how old this hotel was (30 years +) but I was reminded while sitting in the seminar rooms and looking at the worn out rugs. There has been upgrading in the rooms but they are still small and seem to let the noises from next door get into your room. Prices are outrageous - the breakfast buffet is $26 plus tax which brings it to $29.38 for a breakfast. If you go al a carte they want $5 for some concentrated orange juice and $5 for a cup of coffee, $17 for an omellette, it is just nuts. Other bars and restaurants within the hotel are also way way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding views, terrific rooms.... no free wifi ?!!”
Reviews.Author: Bostonkiwi17
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I spent three nights in the Westin Harbour Castle, the result of a hotwire transaction. We were were just delighted with the view and the rooms (we requested an upgrade once we saw that "sleeps 3 adults" would have been complex and difficult because of the two double beds). Being frugal types, we did not avail ourselves of the spa or other hotel services, and were quite surprised even the basement-located business centre charged a fee for internet use. We really appreciated the outstanding view, the bedding and the bathrooms. We would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Web4
Reviews.Content: Had a blast with my friends. For once I go to a hotel and have no complaints. It was great

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Canuck72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the lake, a few minutes walk from the Air Canada Centre, or the Esplanade where there are some nice restaurants and bars. I would recommend going outside of the hotel for drinks, etc, as the hotel bar is excessively overpriced. The hotel is nice, clean rooms, good service. The people are friendly and responsive to your needs. I consider myself to be a low maintenance traveller, but my "customer" is quite the opposite. All this to say, he was very happy with his room as well. I didn't use the internet service as I only got back to my room around midnight, and it cost something like $13 bucks from noon to noon. I don't mind paying extra for services I use, if it means your overall rates are lower...but this doesn't seem to translate. In my case, I can't complain as I used hotwire and got the room at a great rate. My preference is to have all-included so you don't feel like you're getting milked. As for Hotwire, I still can't figure why we have to pay in US dollars, and I don't know who came up with putting the Westin east of downtown, when it is west of Yonge Street. My recommendation to anyone staying in Toronto is choose the area you want...east or west of downtown, choose four stars or better and go with the best rate. Having said this, assume an extra $30 for parking, regardless of hotel, and an extra $15 for internet. This way you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in T.O.”
Reviews.Author: jaxma
Reviews.Content: very nice amenities. great concierge and in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: TheFishinMagician
Reviews.Content: For a hotel in a major city, we look for a quiet spacious room, a good nightâ€™s sleep, security, walking proximity to attractions and easy access to the hotel from a freewayâ€¦we had all of this at this Westin. PROS: The BEST hotel nightâ€™s sleep either of us have ever had (BEST hotel beds by far and we had a quiet corner room). Strong shower, plenty of hot water with double shower heads. Hotel is off the expressway at the waterfront, yet we could walk to everything we wanted to. (This is NOT in the heart of Toronto, it's at the South end of Young Street, so check your map should you want to be more centralized.) The hotel exercise room, pool, hot tub, and saunas were great. CONS: For having the BEST beds, the pillows were so-so. (Bring your own and keep them in the car just in case you donâ€™t like your hotel pillows.) This hotel is not cheap, so shop around for best internet pricing. Valet parking is $40/night and the suggested hotel owned surface lot is $20/night. Instead, park at the $10 Municipal lot located between the hotel and the hotel owned lot. Hotel food is crazy expensive ($18 for a cold breakfast buffet, please). For breakfast, try either Eggspectations or The Sunset Grill, both on Young Street (a 10-15 minute walk but much better value). For dinner, try The Overdraught Irish Pub, 156 Front Street West. We ate there two nights in a row, had 4 different entrees (reasonable at $15 - $20) and all were authentic and wonderful. You wonâ€™t be disappointed. For Grocery items, walk to the METRO #62 Supermarket, 80 Front Street East and bring food/dessert back to the room or when itâ€™s open, try the St. Lawrence Market. For Pharmacy items, shop at any Shoppers Drug Mart. Toronto is a great destination escape for upstate New Yorkers like us. We will come back to the hotel as a base, but will again spend most of our time (and money) away from hotel high priced adds ons and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but can be costly”
Reviews.Author: marionallantravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the weekend to celebrate my birthday. I had previously stayed there years ago and had enjoyed myself. We came into the city by train which we were told there was a free shuttle the hotel provided, we waited on Front St 25 mins then decided to call the hotel, we were told to keep waiting it'll be around, after 40mins we decided to use a cab which cost around $8.00. Upon walking in I could see that there had been remodeling since my last visit. The lobby was very well decorated and welcoming. When we checked in the agent wished me a Happy Birthday and advised he had upgraded up to a lake view room. When mentioned problem with shuttle he indicated that he didn't think there was a shuttle service...Our room was very nice with an awesome view, great bed and modern look. We had an adjoining room which had their TV blaring all day and night which was very annoying and were told that the occupant had been advised to lower the volume but no changes... We ordered some room service which was very good and great personnel. Overall we found we used a cab to get around which ended up being costly. If you're looking to be "downtown" definitely would recommend another hotel. If you're looking to relax by the harbor and have a romantic weekend this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: badandjak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so over rated and over priced. Not wi fi unless you want to pay dearly for it. No working fridge in the rooms only an old pay bar fridge that doesn't work they just left them there for storage. The room with the ice machine was a janitors closet. They pool was dirty. Beware the internet pictures make the hotel look great they are definately inaccurate. More like a 2.5 star at 5 star prices!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: skatendance
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel were great. We there for the PULSE on tour and the staff was very accommodating to all of the dancers involved. Extra "food stations" were provided and all staff were extremely friendly. The pool area was gret for the kids and teens. Thanks for a great stay. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CampoBelo
Reviews.Content: wonderful place, wonderful view, very kind staff... Room 3337

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience w.r.t. service, ambience, room, recreational facilities”
Reviews.Author: jayros
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were fortunate to stay at the westin harbour castle at the end of january, 2010; was very impressed with the service, ambience, recreational facilities (gym and pool area), rooms and the whole experience! dinner in the lobby lounge was enjoyable since we were able to be a part of all the excitement going on in the lobby and lounge area; would definately recommend it;

Reviews.Title: “Amazing accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: lisaus01
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely warm and welcoming. The room was comfortable and enjoyable to go to after a long day at work. The conference I attended was at the hotel, so no need to even step outside into cold weather unless I wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - Dirty, Not Worth The Money and Would Not Return”
Reviews.Author: ik20xx
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel over New Yearâ€™s last year and though, there are no complaints about the staff; the rooms were another story. The rooms were dusty; the bathroom was tiny, filthy air conditioner vents, stains on the bed and even hair in the fridge. Thinking this was just a one off we asked for a room change to find that the other room was not much better. Considering we booked two rooms, the standard, much cheaper rooms was just as good as the room which was meant to be bigger and better. If you do have to stay at this hotel, don't waste your money on the bigger rooms. The hotel staff as a whole was friendly and attended to your needs as quickly as possible. Breakfast at the The Mizzen Restaurant was very good and dinner at the Toula Restaurant was satisfactory (You're not paying for the food, but the view). The hotel doesn't live up to its 4* reputation and Iâ€™m not planning a return. I advise you not to either at the chance at ruining what could be otherwise, a wonderful business trip/holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tqh099
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbor Castle does not live up to its Westin brand and 4 star rating. I was quite disappointed that while the room was okay, it was starting to look well used along with the elevators and general decor. In addition, several of the towels were not spotless to which I was really surprised. Perhaps a solid 3 star rating but not at the price its is charging. The Starwood desk was staffed by serveral young men who were courteous and definitely not helpful, and lacked service attitude - or maybe its just Toronto. I was there for 4 nights in all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel & good location.”
Reviews.Author: goodshink
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July 2009 and attended the Red Sox Vs. Blue Jays baseball series. The stadium is fairly close to the hotel. THe hotel is in a good location giving you access to many restaurants and bars for cocktails and good food. We stayed here during the City strike. All DPW workers were on strike and the city was a complete mess. There was trash all over the streets piled high. The hotel was very clean and the food was fairly good. We used a shuttle service from the airport that picked us up and dropped us off right in front of the hotel. This hotel is very nice and definitely clean. Even with the strike they managed to keep there property clean.

Reviews.Title: “They made us love Toronto even more”
Reviews.Author: cdrozp
Reviews.Content: Drove from Florida to Toronto for Christmas and ended up here. We got a fab rate on this hotel from a travel site that was less than 50% of what the hotel's own website advertised. Despite booking a mere hour before arriving at an insanely good price...we were treated like royalty. Valets and bell hops were friendly and insisted on carrying everything for us. When we checked in, we asked if there was anyway we could have the nicest room available for our rate, and they gave us the corner suite just below the penthouse with panoramic views of the City! Everything in the rooms from the sheets/ pillows to the shampoo to the awesome coffee set up was top notch and antiseptically clean. The Westin is known for its cloud-like matress covers and this was no exception...we were longing for this room in every hotel as we drove back to Florida. Another great thing was the hotel's concierge. We are non-planning, spur-of-the-moment travelers and the concierge got us VIP tickets to the King Tut museum exhibit and great seats at the Second City Comedy Theatre. He also recommended how to make the most out of each outing, where to eat and where to avoid. Honestly, our experience at this hotel has made us loyal Westin patrons for good.

Reviews.Title: “the Westin has changed!”
Reviews.Author: cardort
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Westin a year ago (December 2008) and had not a great experience, I wrote it up under cardort on trip advisor. We went back last weekend for the Toronto Boat Show, after speaking with Margaret Readings, the hotel manager. We had a lovely room, balcony overlooking the lake, although we didn't eat in the restaurant, we had a great time at Charts, (the bar) where the staff were interesting and attentive. From reading the recent reviews, definitely the management is working hard to restore the Westin image - and it's working. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: robertj1277
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbour Castle is a very nice, luxurious hotel. I highly enjoyed my stay and do recommend this hotel. Check-In was quick, although even though they have "Starwood Preffered Guest Floors" I was not put on one of those floors even with my membership. I don't know if theres any difference besides a sign stating it is one of those floors. The furniture in the room was a bit scratched up in the first room, 2211. It was also right next to the elevators, with the high speed they act like wind tunnels and can be quite loud, could hear them all night. We also did not have any cold water the first night. Other than that, the room was nice, the beds were comfortable, and the view was decent (East view), but not what the southwest views were like. In the morning, I asked for a new room, the person at front desk did change the room for me and we moved up to 2314, away from the elevators. Room was also cleaner and furniture was not scratched up. After getting a good nights sleep the second and third nights, I walked away with a much more optimistic perspective of this hotel than I did the first night. The only real problem with this hotel is its location during the winter. Theres not much to do on the waterfront, and its rather cold to walk downtown. There is streetcar access right across the street, takes you to Union Station. In the summer I'm sure this would be the place to be though. Not that its a huge problem, just make sure your aware that you may want to have some cab fare, and there are plenty of them waiting at the hotel. I payed 86/night, so what should I complain about? Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, right on the water, easy walking distance to downtown. Room was very nice - huge, very clean, extremely comfortable, and had an amazing view. When my travels return me to Toronto, I will most definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice luxoriously affordable getaway in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: krauserm
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline and it was an awesome deal. The room was very spacious, had a wonderful view and a bed to die for. Tips: Out of shape people will not enjoy the walk from the subway, but it is doable. Great city and lake views. Appreciated flat screen TV's. Good tips from the bell boys for pizza joints. Great jogging area. Nice gyro's around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction Guaranteed at the Westin Harbor Castle”
Reviews.Author: magicpeyotl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Christmas Eve and Christmas Day at the Westin with a few friends and I have to say the standards maintained in every facet of hospitality was on par with the best in the country. The view from the room was awesome and lighting in the room was great. I would certainly recommend anyone to savor the hospitality of the Westin.Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable and a Splendid Night”
Reviews.Author: travelwitus
Reviews.Content: It was a night that we will remember. The hotel was slow with visitors but the staff was very attentive. They were very efficient and friendly to all of us. Also the renovations through out the hotel is very impressive. Since we stayed only one night, with what we experienced we hope to stay for two night next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and cozy, with that touch of luxury...a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: chili7129
Reviews.Content: This place is a great spot if you want to be close to the waterfront...a great location in the summer months to take a ferry out to the islands or catch a basketball/hockey game at the Air Canada Centre or even check out the Harbourfront Centre! Take a walk by the pier, there's lots of restaurants and attractions to see! Quiet location yet close to the downtown core to explore around! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Love that Heavenly Bed”
Reviews.Author: jbomb060
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Westin Harbour Castle. The hotel is located right by the lake so it is a bit of a walk to some tourist sites such as the CN Tower and ACC, but still a pretty good location in downtown Toronto. If your into clubs, The Guvernment is about 1 km down the street across from a Loblaws. The lobby was large and beautifully decorated, as was the room itself, which ofcourse consists of the very comfortable Heavenly Bed. Some of the furniture was a bit dusty but overall, the room was clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was also nicely designed and very modern. The only downside was the insanely expensive $40/night valet parking fee. I think that's a bit much just to park my car. There is a $20/night self-park but its located off-site. There are a couple of other public parking lots minutes away from the hotel which charge $10/ night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our annual Christmas family party!”
Reviews.Author: toronto_alexc
Reviews.Content: We had our annual Christmas party at this hotel, renting rooms for over 25 of us! Westin were able to accomodate all our needs, including our incredibly long list of room service throughout the evening! They also provided us with extra towels and pillows when we asked. Calling room service was quick and easy, with the receptionist at the front desk being friendly and attentive. We had a fabulous stay, and it completed our evening of Christmas fun!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller4245
Reviews.Content: The Airport Express shuttle is an easy and inexpensive way to get to the Westin Harbour Castle from Pearson Airport. This hotel has friendly staff, comfy beds, and is about a 15-20 min walk to downtown. We had an unexpected stay in Toronto this Christmas, but absolutely enjoyed it. Our room was on the north side, 24th floor with view of the water, the CN tower, and downtown. What makes this hotel special is their human touch and attention to detail. Hotel tracks & acknowledges if you are a returning customer. I had a same day reservation, but staff was very accommodating to my request for early check-in and late check-out the following day.

Reviews.Title: “I have had a great and memorable stay at the Westin Harbour Castle.”
Reviews.Author: kmae007
Reviews.Content: I've only stayed for 1 night but everything about my stay has been great. From the valet service, to front desk, to room service - employees at the Westin are always very warm and helpful. The suite was amazing and very clean upon arrival. We ordered food late at night and I was surprised not only about how quick it came but also how accurate the orders were considering we ordered a lot of food. We have been guests at the Westin for years now and it has always been our first choice of hotels in the downtown area. We will definitely be guests again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back again and again”
Reviews.Author: XenMaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a family Christmas party. All the rooms we stayed in were very comfortable and spacious. Also very clean! We all ordered room service maybe 2-3 times throughout the night, and the staff were very prompt and helpful, even when we ordered at around 3am. You can see why many celebrities and athletes stay at this hotel. The view from our room showed a nice calm Lake Ontario, while the window in the hallway had a great view of the Air Canada Centre, CN Tower, and Skydome, all of which are within walking distance. Probably what I liked least was the parking. Valet parking was a bit expensive, and the only other parking lot was about two blocks away. Not that great in -12 wind chill. Overall it was a great experience, and I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: leftovercrumbs
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Our room was clean, but we noticed right away that there were no robes in the bathroom, so we had to call the front desk to get them to bring us some. It's not a huge issue, but I expected it to already be there. There were 35 floors, and we were on the 34th (preferred guest floor). The only issue I had was that there were a lot of 40-somethings on that floor having room parties, so it was very noisy when we were trying to sleep. The staff were generally courteous, but I felt that people at the valet parking could be a lot nicer. When we first arrived, we waited a couple minutes for them to come take our car, but they didn't, so we decided to kist get out and leave it there. It was only then that they came for the keys. I thought it was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: hermandree
Reviews.Content: Loved the room and the hospitality offered because I was able to feel safe and walk to all the things that I wanted to see and do. I loved the rooms layout, especially the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best out there!!!”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler78
Reviews.Content: We all know how hard is to find a place where you can feel that the people that serves you really care, but surprisingly enough I did and it was here at the Westin Harbour Castle. Friendly staff in all facilities I have gone through, personal service with a cozy and clean rooms. Reasonable price even when I was offered to upgrade my bedroom to a Corner suite which included breakfast and internet, Great deal ! Great fitness facilities and pool. Best beds I have ever slept on. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “a favourite in toronto- spectacular stay”
Reviews.Author: twoforthegirl
Reviews.Content: I'm stunnd to read any negatives at this hotel since we had such a wonderful stay! The lobby was spotless, modern, and new. Our check-in was a delight, asking us if we were celebrating any special event. We said no, it was just a 'date weekend'. To our delight, shortly after arriving in our room we had a knock on the door. Our front desk helper had sent us complimentary beer and snacks! Our room had to have just been renovated as everything was like new. The view over the lake was awesome. We could lie in bed and watch planes coming in and taking off from the island airport, and watch the ferry going across to the island. Everyone we encountered here was friendly and helpful. I almost changed my reservation before we left because i was worried after reading the reviews! So glad i didn't because it was one of our best hotel stays in toronto (and we come here often- about every other month).

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Castle has fallen behind... does not meet the Westin brand standard”
Reviews.Author: scapaflow40
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at the Westin Habour Castle in the past two weeks. If it was branded as a Holiday Inn or Ramada I would nave fewer issues with this hotel. However it is a Westin and should meet a higher standard. Here are the problems: - some front desk staff are not very friendly or helpful (others are fine) - rooms need to be upgraded!! They look old and scruffy - bathroom fixtures are shoddy, in one room on the penthouse floor the tap leaked as the grouting was gone. - the lounge bar is just ok. Would expect a proper bar in a high end hotel This property has one big asset and that is the lake view. Other than that it almost seems that the management is waiting for the hotel to reach such a low level that it will be rebranded.

Reviews.Title: “Most favorite place to stay while visiting Toronto”
Reviews.Author: wattshealthy
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms, feel like i'm at home...Service is wonderful and enjoy booking, the staff take great care ensuring your stay is a comfortable pleasure...Thank you Westin!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 1Anneliese
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel experience -especially at check in and check out -(4 days apart) - where our guest services manager greeted me warmly and we joked and laughed - to a goodbye hug upon departure -- the staff were attentive and pleasant -from the restaurant staff to waite staff at the banquette and room attendants- A delightful experience -- and the view of the lake was priceless- -thanks to Ann Marie Noreiga - Manager - for an amazing stay! One concern --the over-priced breakfast - brunch and meals in the restaurant and in-room service. Will attend next year with delight. Anneliese - ONPHA conference participant

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! The Couples Massage was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: GinniferBarnes
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle and the entire experience was unbelievable. Me and the hubby went for a couples massage and it was superb. I think the lady who massaged me was Farzana (sp?) and she was phenominal. Her hands were amazing and anytime I go back to Toronto I will make sure to go back to Votre Beaute Spa to see Miss Farzana. After the massage, we walked through to the pool area, conveniently, right next door and took a soak in the hot tub. i can't wait to go back!!!! The hotel and the beds are amazing and it was definitely a relaxing weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room to recharge!”
Reviews.Author: Oddiologist
Reviews.Content: I was at the Westin Harbour Castle for an entire week, with conference and meetings on a heavy schedule. The facilities were top notch. The room was an excellent place to just get away and recharge. Close to everything that downtown Toronto has to offer, and within an easy walk of restaurants, attractions, the subway and shopping. Staff was friendly and efficient. Enjoyed a chat about baseball with the bartender at the Chart Room and a discussion of Greece with the conference staff!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JenJen25
Reviews.Content: The westin Habour Castle was a fanatastic Hotel. It was clean and the staff was super friendly. It has a great location. The best Hotel in Toronto I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: brenda066
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin Harbour Castle was excellent...they are very accomidating!! The rooms are clean and spacious, very well decorated...

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: marvin83
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night to treat ourselves. It was wonderful!! Excellent view of the harbor and the CN Tower. Room service was exceptional and prompt. My favourite part of the room was the heavenly bed, so very comfortable. Also enjoyed the flat screen TV. Excellent place to stay for sight seeing downtown. Thank you so much Anne Marie for the Chocolate covered apples, very nice treat!!! All the staff was accommodating and friendly! Would love to stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: nationalmama
Reviews.Content: Westin Harbour Castle is a very nice, comfortable hotel in a great location on the water. It's near the ferry over to the Islands and also near a nice little shopping and dining area with loads of different types of restaurants. The restaurant in the hotel is a bit expensive for breakfast ($50 for pancakes for two!) but the food was good. When I was booking I was concerned about the distance to the rest of town but it really was no problem and my husband who is not a "walker" had no problem with walking to the CN Tower and on into the Entertainment district. This hotel is really close to lots of forms of transportation as well. Rooms are very clean and we loved watching all the boats on the lake.

Reviews.Title: “The only Toronto hotel I love! Best Breakfast Buffet, beside train/bus”
Reviews.Author: JoyLamour
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay was with my sisters. We won tickets to the Jami Foxx concert, which was hosted at the Sound Academy, $10 cab ride away. I took the Go Train in, to avoid traffic and parking fees. There is a privately owned parking lot to the east of hotel, which was $10 on my previous stay, but I'm sure will vary if there is a holiday or sports event that night. The location is 5 min walk from the Union Station, (Via Rail, Go Train), Air Canada Centre. About 10 mins from the Eatons Centre (the main shopping mall in Toronto). 5 min walk to my favourite lounge for drinks and apps "ki" on bay . It is expensive, but worth the experince (amazing outdoor patio with heated lanterns). Great for girls night out or romantic glass of wine. Breakfast Buffet is the best, decadent options including monte cristo sandwiches, fresh orange juice, fresh croissants, and many unique options you don't find at your everday buffet. It's $19, including your juice and coffee. I have not tried the dinner buffet, but have done the a la carte for dinner, wouldn't recommend it for the price. Cool indoor pool with adjoining outdoor sundeck. Ask for a newly renovated room, they are beautiful. I love that they have starbucks coffee and tea in the room and the to-go cups, so you can take your coffee with you. Some aspects of the hotel are slighty dated, but majority is first class.

Reviews.Title: “bring extra cash”
Reviews.Author: YoCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night weekend. Parking was $42, I laughed out loud. Self-parking only $20 but you need to walk 5 blocks. Left my car in wrong lot as it was dark and got $40 parking ticket first night. Front desk was chilly at best - again no sense of humour. Room was very nice with view of harbour. No mini-bar, and fridge was luke warm at best. Toilet was turbo powered, don't flush while sitting or your butt will end up in Toronto sewer pipes. Ordered movie on TV - didn't work and took over an hour for someone to come to the room and agree with me that it didn't work. Didn't fix it, just agreed. Charged for movie the next day but removed when called. Internet service was $12 a day. Outrageous in this day. Business services, wine glasses to room - seems I was reaching in my pocket for extra charges often. Pool nice, hot tub was actually hot although the jets didn't work. Change room was a mess with dirty towels everywhere both days. GREAT location! Close to everything although not walking distance. Cab driver tried to charge me an extra $10 because I "booked" a van. Quality liquor store across the road. Nice walk along harbourfront. Saw Circle Du Soleil's "OVO" which was outstanding! HIghlight of trip. Paid $122 US through Priceline which made overall experience palatable but could have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: histtrav
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for four nights for a conference. I've stayed at many Westin hotels and this one falls firmly in the middle of the pack. The things I liked about the hotel were: the heavenly bed, the maid was very friendly, the workout and pool facilities and check in and out was very efficient . There were some minor service issues such as: no newspaper on the first morning of visit--I called and it was delivered quickly, room service breakfast was delivered 15 minutes ahead of schedule--8:00am vs the requested 8:15-8:30 time slot and had the wrong juice, internet access is very expensive in the room and there is a charge for service in the business center, room amenities are less than impressive--stingy number of towels and sub-par toiletries, you have to request things like cotton swabs and a bathrobe and the ATM machine in the hotel seemed to be broken for my entire visit. Perhaps the biggest problem with this hotel is its location. While it is not far from the subway, it is also not across the street or a block or two away. You have to walk a few blocks and then under a freeway to get to Union Station which is the closest subway stop. While it is doable, there are other hotels in the same price point that are more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING location”
Reviews.Author: IndianMusic
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel mainly for its location. If you stay here, you have to stay in a room with a view of the lake. The rooms are large, but nothing really special. We booked with priceline and thought we were getting an incredible deal, but once we got there, the extra charges just kept adding up. Mandatory valet parking, extra for a lakeview room, etc. We asked for some sugar and had to pay a $5 service charge for it! Again I would recommend for the view, which is particularly worth it, if you are visiting/staying in downtown for the first time and have visitors, but be ready to pay for everything thats not included. Location wise its right on the lake, close to the Harbourfront, but a considerable walk away from the main downtown area with the shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Westin? How to trash a brand name 101”
Reviews.Author: L3506041
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how many hotels I've checked into, but it must be a couple of hundred by now. This hotel has the distinction of being the only one I've ever checked into and then straight out of again. The place feels like its been built under a freeway overpass. The lobby is in desperate need of a facelift, but where it really comes into its own are the rooms. They're very tired. I haven't looked into it but I'm guessing this hotel is shortly to be decommissioned and pulled down. The rooms are old, they smell musty and amazingly, they have powerboards and electrical cords exposed in them. I even took a photo because I couldn't believe what I was seeing. Despite the fact I checked in at 11pm after a long day, I still took the trouble to check out again. I headed for the Sheraton Toronto on Queen Street. It is a brilliant hotel. I have no idea how Starwood hotels expects its guests/members to make head or tail of their hotels. Sometimes what you check in to can be a total shock. The Westin is not worthy of its name. The Sheraton is on the opposite end of the scale. Its brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Competent and Comfortable, But They Could Try a Little Harder”
Reviews.Author: HiIslandsGuy
Reviews.Content: If you arrive at this hotel by airport bus, or by the train (several easy blocks to the north) you'll be confronted by several flights of stairs to get to the main lobby to check in. Unless you're arriving by auto, there seems to be no alternative to lugging your bags up these stairs. The bellmen have conveniently located themselves at the top. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Check in was fast, efficient and pleasant. Our room had a wonderful lake view with both a treat to sunrise and sunset. The view is probably the most compelling feature of this hotel. The room was also spacious and well equipped with the much appreciated heavenly beds. The housekeeping was excellent. If you want Internet, you'll have to pay extra. If you want to use the computers in the business center, you'll also have to pay by the minute. There is no Starwood Club Lounge at this hotel, so if you'd like a breakfast buffet, you'll also have to pay C$20.00+ at the small restaurant off of the main lounge. With the many excellent hotels in Toronto, I think the Westin Harbour Castle needs to work a little harder at providing value and winning preferred customer loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: VacationCouple35
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay and were immediately disappointed upon arrival. The bellhops ignored us at valet (we struggled to get our suitcases through the door-it was clear they were servicing people based on their make of vehicle as the valets/bellhops were prompt with expensive luxury vehicles but ignored us with our Honda civic), the front desk was less than friendly, and the room, although furnished with more modern furniture, wasn't completely cleaned (hair and pieces of paper on the floor) . Surprisingly too, there were holes in the walls. When my husband went to buy breakfast he was stunned by grumpiness of the woman at the counter who was mad when he paid for a drink with a five dollar bill instead of change. With a nightly price of 249.00 (for city view) and almost 40.00 per night for valet parking, we really did expect good service and a clean room. Also, be aware too that the valet lot is often full.The only positives include the downtown location and the view itself (our room did have a partial view of the lake). Don't be swayed by the interior photos of the hotel..decoration alone can not make up for poor service. We've decided to never book here again- there are plenty of other hotels at this price point in downtown Toronto that we hope will be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel right on Lake Ontario”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFunAdventurer
Reviews.Content: This Westin is just what you would expect from it's name. It's a beautiful hotel right on the water. Our room overlooked Lake Ontario and all of the activity in the area. The room was wonderful, the bed & pillows very comfortable, beautiful bathroom, and refridgerator in the room. The people were very professional and helpful, except the folks dealing with parking. They were unable to park our car, due to a full lot - so somewhat rudely directed us to a parking garage down the street. Now - our only complaint - the costs for parking and internet were crazy. Only valet parking is available at $40 per day...or you go to the outside lot ($20 per day). Internet access in our room was $21 per day - or $.025 per minute in the business center. Even using our calling card with a 1-800 number, there was an extra charge. All in all, however, it was a perfect location and absolutely beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but seriously lacking”
Reviews.Author: mel_o_dell
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for a special evening on September 19th. I had arranged with the hotel to receive a $50 upgrade to a junior suite. On our arrival, we sat in a line-up of cars for almost 1/2 an hour waiting for this Valet parking. Not a great start as we were on a timeline with reservations and needing to get ready. Once we were finally at the front doors, a man came up and handed us a ticket for the valet parking, which was $40 per night. What they did not tell you was that there is self-parking for $20 on site. We did not get offered this, and did not know about it until we were driving out and saw a teeny little sign on the round-about with the prices on it. $40 is astronomical for parking for one night, and as a preferred guest with Starwood hotels, I was unimpressed that we were not offered a lower rate, or told about the self-parking option. Upon check-in, they upgraded us as per our prior arrangement to the junior suite. Basically this just gets you a larger room, and I think the better view. There was a chaise lounge in the room, however it was extremely uncomfortable, and not really worth it. The view was definitely worth it, but I have heard you can do a $30 upgrade for the view. I would definitely do that instead and save the $20. The larger room size wasn't really worth it. In addition, we called and asked for a wine cork and wine glasses to be brought up as we were celebrating. It took the staff over half an hour to bring these things up to us. By the time it came up, we had to leave to go for dinner. The glasses they brougt up were also filthy. I had to wash them in the sink when we returned from dinner to use them. The wine cork was also this dinky little thing that did not work very well, and broke the cork so that we could not re-cork the bottle properly. We also went to go use the pool, and when we saw it were very disappointed. It does not look like it does in the pictures. The nice blue tile outline does not exist, and the pool itself was tiny. There were 4-5 ppl in it, and we felt uncomfortable joining as the size of it made it seem intimate. The hot tub looked nice, but we didn't bother and just went back upstairs. The outdoor patio looked nice, but it was chilly that day so we didn't go out. All in all, the rooms are decent. You can tell that their multi-million dollar renovation really just added some tiles in the bathroom and new fixtures. The reno's are showing a lot of wear. We have stayed at a few different Westin hotels, and others in the Starwood category, and I must say this one is the most disappointing. I would have expected more especially in Toronto. I would have also expected better service, however, it seems this is consistently lacking. I would most likely not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PaulAllenfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 8th to 10th September. Hotel looks goods and its staff are professional an pleasant. Had a minor problem on check in and they soon sorted this out. Breakfast is well worth the price, don't be put off by the $20 costs per person it is quality. Would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: southact
Reviews.Content: After having an excellent stay at the Westin Ottawa, we were extremely disappointed with the level of customer service at this hotel. On a previous visit to Toronto we had an enjoyable break at the Westin Prince, but chose this hotel for its central location. A good example is the breakfast service, we were shown to our table by someone who barely exchanged a word, the breakfast on offer was poor compared to Ottawa and the staff so slow that we had almost finished before being offered a drink on two occaisions. When we tried to extend our stay, you would have thought we were asking for the world! Only after speaking to a third person were we able to get an answer. The only good service we experienced was from cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “I'd have expected more from a Westin”
Reviews.Author: gd78
Reviews.Content: When we first cheked in we were assigned a room which was so noisy because of the air conditioning that we could hardly stay there awake!! So we complained and we were changed to a new room. However it was not so clean, with dust everywhere and stained sheets. Room service always pass in the afternoon (or they does not pass at all...if you are in room sleeping)....and their job is not so brilliant I can say. We booked through tui.com and paid 100 euros per night...which is quite reasonable...but the rates on westin website are way high for the service offered

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the lake and the ..... Sugar factory.”
Reviews.Author: LondonHotelinspector
Reviews.Content: We were on the 33rd floor with great views of the lake and the city, and yes the sugar factory but then this is a lakeside location and up until a few years ago the whole area was industrial. I liked the position handy for all that downtown Toronto has to offer as long as you don't mind walking a bit. The room modern, clean and well appointed with a fridge, flat screen TV and 2 yes 2 armchairs why you only get 1 in most rooms is beyond me, very welcome after a days sightseeing. Nice bathroom/shower with plenty of lotions and potions to play with, and the coffee machine ticked all the boxes for me, full marks. The restaurant on the top of the other tower however not so good, a great sounding menu that didn't deliver.. overcooked seafood and an overpriced wine list, but then Toronto has plenty of alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with amazing views over the lake”
Reviews.Author: userScotland
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for a week on our recent visit to Toronto. We got this room through hotwire and I think the rate we got for the room couldnâ€™t be beaten. The room was large, with a king size bed, LCD TV, desk and chair and other seating. The room was very clean and the maid service was great, they tidied the room every day and change the bedding twice whilst we were staying. The towels were also changed daily if you wanted them to be. The bath room was spacious and the shower was quite powerful. Loved coming back from our days out in Toronto and looking out of the window onto Lake Ontario and watching all the activity on the lake, the lake was busier than I thought it would be. Used the pool and whirlpool on the fifth floor a few times and enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere around the pool. There were also two sun terraces, one main sun terrace and another with only two beds on it facing the lake. The hotel is in a good location to walk thought he harbour front, which always seems to have something on, and is a short 10 min walk to the heart of downtown, it is also about a 10 min walk to the Rodgers centre an CN tower. I would stay at this hotel if visiting Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: drgauravgoel1
Reviews.Content: I went to toronto with my wife and my 5 yeard old son, stayed in westin for three nights. As we were travelling from montreal , we took a train and union station was five min from hotel, just walket to it. hotel was nice outside and grossly visible. some reviews, i read before i went ,claimed it was difficult to see, but i dint see that as a problem. check in was easy, though lake view required extra fee, which i declined, but took a thirtieth floor,which was for free. reception was warm and courteous. went to the room which was having a terrific view, on my left was lake ontario with a private airstrip and you can see planes taking off and on my right was CN tower in full majesty!!. i could not have asked for more. beds were nice and comfortable, and a large flat screen was good. they even provided microwave on demand (though i think it should have been there) but no charges for that. bathroom was nice and clean with a dual shower head and good hot and cold water. only downside was it has two connecting rooms and one of the nights neighbours were noisy and had a problem but thankfully they left and it was good for rest two nights. dint use much of the health club or other things, internet was not free in room which was downside. One last thing they charge access fee on telephone even if it did not connect, which i complained and they refunded the amount in a flash. overall very satisfied with the hotel, nice location, ferry goes at stone throw distance, and good feel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views of the Harbour.”
Reviews.Author: Sabsters
Reviews.Content: Went on this trip with parents and really enjoyed the stay. The hotel is by the harbour so its easy to take the boat tours. Upon check-in, we were pleasantly greeted by the staff. I believe his name was Gus. He was very well mannered and professional. Since i booked this room with Hotwire, i asked what room we got. Was advised that i had a half city and half lake view. If i wanted the upgrade to the full view it was $30 CAD. I took that upgrade and the view as unreal. Worth so much more than $30! Since i travelled with the seniors, we took a taxi to Eaton centre. Was about $10 CAD for the ride. We ordered room service one night but nothing fancy. Some desserts and soft drinks and the staff who delivered the snacks was so pleasant. To walk to Yonge, you wold have to cross below the bridge/highway. Ok in the daytime but i guess i would skip it at night. Overall, a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Crewze
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location right on Harbourfront. Check out the FREE concerts on the weekend during the summer. We stayed to go to the CNE and took the streetcar (just across the street) right into the exhibition grounds. Don't drive as the traffic is crazy. We had to pay $30 extra to get a water view. Be aware that valet parking adds $35/day to your bill. Internet adds another $21/day. The restaurant has OK food at very high cost (Walk up Young Street a few blocks and there are lots better choices at better prices). The big problem was we had security at our door at 10:30 PM telling us to turn down our TV which was at average volume. He admitted that the hotel has "paper thin" walls. We asked to be moved the next day but they blocked out the room so it would be empty for our second night. When we went swimming in the morning the pool was closed as a fitness class was scheduled. Had too many issues to be a good hotel. There are better options in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Nuneatonian
Reviews.Content: Located on the harbour front, this hotel offers a great standard of accommodation with easy access to all the city's attractions. Our nicely decorated room (on the 33rd floor) overlooked lake Ontario, there was plenty of wardrobe space & a nice flat screen tv, internet access was available althougfh pricey at $21 +tax per 24 hour period! The pool & gym were both very good and there is also a sun deck for topping up the tan. Restaurant, bar & parking prices were above average (as expected with this quality of hotel), but it still made for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Karwie
Reviews.Content: Travele alone for business for 1 night. Checkin in this huge place was smooth and friendly. Rooms were OK, bed was GREAT. Rooftop restaurant had the typical problems of many hotels with an outstanding view and food was very average. Meeting facilities lacked free wireless, the charge would have been 500 CAD !!! per day per laptop and the room or lobby wifi account would not work here. So overall, it is a gigantic hotel with a nice and consistent service standard and an inacceptable Wifi-policy.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: kirby3b
Reviews.Content: Our 2 nights in the Westin Harbour Castle gave us a fine location from which to explore Toronto. The room was fine - typical Westin, comfortable, roomy enough for two, nothing extravagant - and offered a nice view of Lake Ontario. We parked the car at a cheap, private pay lot next to the hotel and didn't use it at all as the hotel location allowed us to walk throughout the city. The Toronto Islands, Rogers Centre, CN Tower, and Old Toronto are each a stone's throw away and if you're a hockey fan the Hall of Fame is maybe a 5 minute walk up Yonge Street. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hope I Could go again”
Reviews.Author: Egyptian-Advisor
Reviews.Content: Words cant describe the beauty of this hotel. Despite the attitude I receive from one of the front desk employees. The whole stay at the Westin was really amazing to the fact that I hope to go again back one day. Pros: Location. In the heart of Toronto few minutes away from the down town area and facing the lake with a lovely view to the island and the small airport. A lot of boats are organizing daily trips just 1 minute from the hotel. You can find mostly everything in the hotel. Food is ok. Rooms are clean with a wonderful view. Cons: Entrainment. Not a lot to do inside the hotel at night but few minutes walking you can find a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Hotel! Read this review for some helpful tips”
Reviews.Author: AssyrianGreek
Reviews.Content: Parking Tip: Vinci Parking (Right next to Captain John's restaurant which is RIGHT next to Westin) will give you $10 a night if you tell them you will be leaving early the next morning (they are usually laid back but either way you'd be paying around $15 tops) Toula Restaurant: This is the giant cylindar that is on top of the westin building e.g. the 38th floor. This restaurant has an absolutely spectacular view with live music. Please note that the restaurant does not rotate. And don't expect the best service. As other reviewers have said, some of the waiters are testy and it took a while to get some service. However there was one gentleman that was extremely nice and helpful. The food is sub-par. We did have the pasta though, so their more expensive dishes may be more satisfying to those willing to spend more. The parfait dessert wasn't that great either. But overall, a very nice restaurant and I would go again just for the romantic view. There are alot of business people up their celebrating corporate events and there could be some noise after 10:30 as it gets more social. I would suggest going there anytime between 7:30 to 9. Buffet Breakfast at the Missen: The Missen restaurant was pretty nice. My only complaint is that for the money ($20 / person) there should be an omelette station but I did not see any. There is a wide variety of fruits and hot cereals. I stuck to the scrambled eggs, pancakes and egg qasadia. Service was much better here than at Toula. Room: The lakeview room was absolutely spectacular. We were on the 16th floor (room 1624) The pictures do not do them justice! The shape of the room is more of a trapazoid or pentagon with windows on two of the walls overlooking the lake and the dock. The night view with a full moon out is breathtaking and the beds are truly relaxing. One enjoyable feature was the fully flexible dual shower heads with 3-4 different massage features. The rooms are very modern and extremely spacious with a large plasma tv though we never used it. The only dated equipment in the room was the alarm clock / radio. Everything else was top-notch! The elevators are also very fast. Fitness: Amazing fitness centre. They also have jogging sessions in the morning! You will not be dissapointed by the gym facilities. There must be over 20 exercise equipment there and the treadmills face the lake too. The dumbell area is huge as well. Pool: Nothing spectacular except for the large overarching windows letting in natural light. There are many kids and families using the pool (I would say about 10 people in there). There is lots of pool toys, balls, floaters and a kids area with toy trucks and the sort. There is a hot tub as well but it always had 2 to 4 people in there. I must say it was pretty busy when we went but we stil enjoyed outselves. Price: we stayed at this hotel on a saturday (August 2009) after we found amazing deals for the hotel rooms.
