We upgrade our room to lakefront with breakfast for 2 at the missen restaurant for only 180$ CAD Tax Incl! Overal it was a great night at a spectacular 5 star hotel. Make sure you get the lakeview. You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: mattnvick
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotels.ca.(which i have used numerous times this summer with total satisfaction) for my wedding anniversary, 2 members of my family had both stayed here at various times and raved about it.. On check it i confirmed we had a lake view room and was told it was partial and it would be $30 extra for a full view. I produced the booking form which didn't indicate that at all and after going "out the back" to check was told OK you can have a lake view. Our room was on the 21st floor in a dark corridor with 2 other rooms. The room was small and felt claustraphobic due in part to a heating duct running along one side. the decor was dingy and almost depressing. There was a fridge but it was locked and no-one had offered us the key on check in. My husband went looking for ice and found it located in a dirty janitors cupboard. We went out for a walk and returned to the room later. Lying down on the bed gave us a view from the left hand window pane of the other tower and the middle pane had a higher than the side glass metal sill (i think something to do with the blind mechanism) but you couldn't see the lake. Glad i hadn't paid the extra. The 2 rooms either side of us were obviously filled with the same family or friends as we listened to doors banging and conversations in the corridor that although they were not talking loudly we could hear every word spoken. I was so disappointed and felt so let down we decided to throw in the towel and we just left. Didn't even bother to check out. We stayed 4 hours. I guess i should have communicated my upset to the front desk but to be honest i just wanted to be out of there. We paid $140 for the room and quite frankly it was a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, avoid restaurant”
Reviews.Author: sokrfrekz
Reviews.Content: We visited the Westin for one night, on a package deal with mirvish productions. Glad we got a deal, as I think the price is too high regularly. It was a lovely hotel, and the people were helpful at the front desk. However they nickel & dime you to death. You have to pay to use internet in their business room. Their movies were more expensive than any hotel I've been in. The room was nice even with decent view, and had a nice hotel. However if you're looking for the best, this hotel doesn't even come close to the Royal York. Oh and the parking is atrocious. If you do not want their valet parking, you can park at some mysterious lot 2 blocks away. However they don't tell you where this is. Good luck finding it, we used the valet. Also do not eat in the restauant "Toula". Other than the fantastic view, this restaurant has nothing going for it. For being an upper class restaurant it was poorly decorated. The wait staff were completely snotty. My food was good, beef tenderloin (cooked perfectly), however as always with a snooty restaurant the portions were small. My husbands dinner was inedible. He had seafood pasta. The seafood was undercooked terribly. He eats everything, and would not eat it. They did not offer to fix his dinner, and at the end when we declined dessert, the nasty east indian waiter, said well fine, i'll take off the price of his dinner.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable views if you have the right room”
Reviews.Author: jaeger_37
Reviews.Content: the location by the waterfront is just great (if you donÂ´t mind that you have to cross under a highway if you want to reach the towncentre - which might not be the thing you want to do late at night) . just make sure you really have the waterfront view and not the one to the side which is overlooking a parking lot the rooms are comfortable, quite spacious and clean (lots of pillows to choose from - which seems to be one of their trademarks) - just as one would expect from a hotel in this category as in some of the bigger hotels to use the internet or enjoy their breakfast you have to pay extra (both features quite overpriced in my view)

Reviews.Title: “Getting worse and worse”
Reviews.Author: IsmaelM
Reviews.Content: I came to Toronto for Business... booked via Hotwire. Ok parking is 35$ ... no problem... BUT ... 1 restaurant closed and only food was at the bar. Not the healthiest for the price ... BIG ISSUE .... Internet is slow slow slow (1mb max) .... AND I ask for a double bed and they charged me an extra 30$ because there was no more room available not in front of the lake. [--] Will never go there .... pay the price and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service At Any Starwood Property”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuest12
Reviews.Content: Horrible customer service. Guest Manager Atilla Mira is a rude and condescending person and doesn't take customer service or hospitality at all seriously. I would not stay here ever again and will be taking my future business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: reddiguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to feature quite regularly on â€˜opaqueâ€™ hotel sites (like Hotwire and possibly Priceline), so do yourself a favour and do a bit of investigation first before booking it directly through the hotel. We paid just $90 per night (including all taxes) at a time when the hotelâ€™s published rate was around $238 per night. My partner, parents and myself stayed here in two rooms for two nights in June 2009 as the fourth leg of our 22-day â€˜Grand East Coast Tourâ€™. We drove up to the hotel front and the car was immediately dealt with by the valet parking staff. At check-in, there was mention of a â€˜self parkingâ€™ option at around half the price of the valet parking, but for just two nights we felt it was easier to just leave the car with them. On checking-in, I was offered a view room at $30 more (per room, per night) but we were not particularly interested in just looking out at the lake, so declined the offer. I did, however, ask for a high floor. We got two rooms on the 30th floor of the North Tower (looking at the hotel plan, it looks to me like the South Tower is nearer the lake and so probably has more lake view rooms). One of our rooms had a great view of the CN Tower (and we could see the lake if we looked sideways), and the other room was on the other side of the corridor so had a view looking east with more of the lake, but less interesting in our opinion. If you have a choice, but donâ€™t want to pay extra for a lake view, I suggest asking for a high floor with a view of the Tower â€“ it worked well for us. The rooms were very nice indeed, with a very comfortable king bed, table, chaise lounge, fridge (key for this given to us at check-in), coffee maker, flat screen TV and a very nice bathroom with hair dryer and lots of towels. The rooms were decorated in creams and browns, and felt classy without being over-the-top. We were very pleased with the location of the hotel. The harbour front was interesting and busier than I expected, and there were more small shops and places for quick eats (cafes, Subway, delis, etc) than expected after reading prior reviews. It was only a pleasant 10-15 minute walk to the shops or the entertainment area, and we really enjoyed the location and the walk to and from the other nearby parts of the city. The hotel had a smallish pool on the fifth floor, located between the two towers. The restaurants at the hotel were too expensive, so we didnâ€™t contemplate eating there. There was a small gift shop, an ATM and lounge on the lobby floor. The ferry to Toronto Islands was right next door. Overall, we were delighted with this hotel, especially for the excellent price we paid. Would we have wanted to pay the hotelâ€™s published rateâ€¦ no, certainly not, because there would be numerous other options at that price. But, as I said at the start, if this hotel is on offer anywhere then I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend it. Unless you really want to be right in the middle of downtown (for some reason) then this is a great hotel for a short stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel stays. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: PigsFly
Reviews.Content: Splendid stay. If you want to have a skyline-level drink, they have a bar restaurant up high. If you want to post a postcard, there are stamps. Print out a boarding pass? Try the computer in the lobby? Very nice, accommodating staff. A bustling concierge desk. Gorgeous harbour views (pay for an upgrade, it's worth it). Rooms are modern, spotless, quiet -- no weird noises from the HVAC system. And the beds are just as they are called -- heavenly. You can walk to Queen's Quay and the Hockey Hall of Fame. There are trams nearby and a subway about 4-5 blocks away. Waterfront paths. The Airport Express shuttle stops right in front -- save half of what you'd spend on a cab. A faultless stay by my standards.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: JohannVienna
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Castle is situated on the Toronto Waterfront, a 10 minute walk away from Union Station and the Financial District. We got a room on the 32nd floor with view over the city and Lake Ontario, which is especially great taking into account that we booked the hotel for a very good rate with hotwire.com. The room was spacious, beautifully furnished and clean. We used the other amenities as the tennis court, the pool and the fitness room, everything was fine. The Toula Restaurant on the top is a nice place with lots of ambience to take a drink in the evening and to enjoy the view. The only drawbacks were, that there is no free internet, even at the business center and that the entrance to the lobby is quite weird, you have to entrance via the motor court or take the stairs, which are a little bit hidden.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - especially if there's a special price!”
Reviews.Author: grannywalescc
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. We had a room with a balcony which is essential if you don't like sleeping with air-conditioning. Also had special offer with 2nd and 3rd nights priced on year of birth ((44$Canadian per night!). Very comfortable and great harbour views. Only gripe is booking handled by the magnificent Amanda Callaghan whom they have now "let go". Big mistake

Reviews.Title: “Westin is Heaven ... but pricey”
Reviews.Author: KeroTravel
Reviews.Content: We only live about an hour outside Toronto, but when we need to stay downtown overnight we usually stay at The Westin. This time we stayed 3 nights. The rooms are large and the beds are Heavenly, soft and plush, making you want to sleep in them forever. The flat screen TV with pivoting wall mount come in handy if you're trying to watch TV from another part of the room. We usually have a partial view of the harbour, but were upgraded at not cost this time to a full harbour view. The harbour is stunning during the day, full of boats going back and forth and on a clear day you can see all the way over to the Toronto Islands, which makes for a great view from the higher floors (we were on the 21st). The bathrooms are large and the shower head is a dual mount, which makes for a relaxing shower. The hotel itself is a short walk to Union Station, Rogers Ctr, the ACC, Guvernment Entertainment Complex and front street where there are tons of eating options. Housekeeping is fantastic and always do a great job tidying up and re-stocking anything you may need at any time during the day. Front desk staff is great as well as our reservations are always in order and this time we had no problems as well. My drwabacks with this hotel are that the valet parking is crazy expensive. $40 a night is a bit steep, but parking elsewhere is a pain as the nearest parking lots are a bit of a walk and getting back up to the hotels main lobby is only available via stairs or steep ramps which doesn't seem very user friendly if you're in a wheel chair or have a stroller. My other draw back is the fact that you have to pay for local phone calls and for Internet Service, in this day and age it seems like those should just be included, but business is business. The food at the Westin is delicious. We had breakfast one morning at the Mizzen Restaurant (lobby of the hotel) which is a breakfast buffet. The buffet has both hot and cold food, a lot of selection including an omlette station. The price of the buffet is costly at about $30 pp for the hot buffet. It's pricey, but well worth it because the food is so delicious. We ordered room service one night (the food also comes from the Mizzen) which cost us apx $80 for a burger, sandwich and a shrimp cocktail. All the food was stunningly displayed but the portions aren't that generous for the price you pay. Keys for the room door de-activate themselves very easily. If you have other peole staying with you, make sure to put their name with the front desk or they will have a hard time re-activating them if you are not around. The slightest magnet around your key will make the key not work (clasps on wallets or purses). Other than the above mentioned drawbacks a weekend at the Westin is great. It's a beautiful, moden hotel and the staff make you feel at home. We weill definitely continue to come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Alison1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin harbour castle for 6 nights, which was my second time in Toronto and we were very impressed with the hotel. Upon arrival at the hotel we found the staff to be very welcoming. The reception area had building work going on but this didn't bother us and there were wooden boards positioned around the area to hide the work going on. Our room was a corner room with a half city and half lake view. It was a nice size with modern furnishings including a large flat screen tv and very comfortable beds. It was very clean and the bathroom especially was to my liking. Although this is primarily a business hotel we found it to be perfect as a base to explore the city. It was within walking distance of all the main attractions (CN tower, shops, restaurants) and was only a short distance away from the metro station. The hotel was right next to the ferry terminal where you caould get a ferry across to the toronto islands.This was especially handy at night when we wanted to go across to the islands and take photos of the skyline. We literally could get off the ferry and we were back at the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants but did order room service pizza a few times. This was reasonably priced and one of the biggest pizzas i've seen. The concierge at the hotel was great. they were happy to advise on things to do and see and booked for us to have dinner at the CN tower restaurant one evening. It was also easy to get a taxi from the hotel as there were always several lined up in front. We never noticed a problem with noise in the hotel and considering it's in a city, building works were going on and there were numerous conferences taking place this was a pleasant surprise. We hired a car and drove to Niagara falls for the day, which is well worth doing. Last time i was there i got the hoverferry and bus to Niagara which made it a long day. Having a car meant we could do things at our own pace and we took a trip out to Niagara on the Lake which was beautiful. The drive is very easy, straight roads all the way. Parking was easy when we got to the falls and we had a really great day. I don't think there is any need to hire a car in toronto itself as everything is easily accessable by foot or metro and parking can work out very expensive. Overall I would highly recommend the Westin Harbour Castle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saramcmillan
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a couple of friends. Our room was nice and clean. The beds were VERY comfortable. We were next to the elevator but did not hear a thing. Our room also had a flat screen TV, which was nice. The hotel is close to Union Station which was handy. We would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View of Lake Ontario”
Reviews.Author: Kevin999999
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for 2 nights and I thought it was great. We had a room on the 30th floor overlooking Lake Ontario. Incredible view! Much nicer than looking at another high rise 50 feet away like the other hotels downtown. The room and the bed were very nice... Definately 4 star... We ordered room service and it took 1 hour and 20 minutes. However they comped the food! Even though it took a long time to deliver, it was one of the best room service meals we have had. Food was hot. Things that I thought about: Parking: valet parking is $40/night and self park is $20/night. Self park is located 3 blocks away! Breakfast: Expensive if you eat in the restaurant.... We grabbed a coffee and muffin at the coffee shop and the prices were ok. TV: Flat Screen TV is 32 inch.... I guess I noticed this because I spent the previous 2 nights at the Marriott and had a 42inch.. Internet: Internet is $15/night

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerlass
Reviews.Content: I made the booking via priceline and managed to get a really good deal to stay one night on 29 June. The check-in was prompt and had a fantastic room on 25th floor. Btw, I was apprehensive at first when I found out I was staying at the Westin due to the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor as on priceline one doesn't know until the price has been accepted by a hotel. Anyhow, the room was situated facing the south of the water and was spacious (king size bed) and clean - can't complain. As for location of the hotel, it's closer to Via Rail so if you are planning to travel out by train then it's best to stay at Westin which is about 5-10mins walk although the hotel sits at the bottom of the main road or highway. The staff was efficient and typical of Westin apples are supplied at the reception desk for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but some problems made this not a great value”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: I'm a Starwood Gold member, and I stayed one night full price (well, AAA), then two nights Cash & Points. The rooms were clean, roomy for a big city, quiet, and comfortable. That being said, there were a number of problems I had with my stay which made me not terribly happy about the value of my experience. Firstly, the water pressure in general in our room (23rd floor) and the hot water in particular were barely adequate for a comfortable shower. When we called about the problem, someone did come up promptly and tinkered behind the shower, but this didn't affect anything, and, as the guy said, "I think they just have to turn up the water pressure." He said he would let the hotel people know, but nothing changed. Another minus of this hotel is that there are no elevators or escalators from the lobby to the ground level. After climbing the first flight of stairs, there is a phone for assistance, but at this point, this seems rather silly. I realize that Canadian hotels have no obligation to follow the dictates of the Americans with Disabilities Act, but in a supposedly 4-star hotel, this just seems like poor architectural design. A third item which left a bad taste in my mouth was their evening reception. It said "Enjoy an appetizer and a cocktail from 5-6:30" (I don't remember the exact time or words, but they were words to that effect). To me, that implied the drink was complimentary, so I wasn't very pleased to find out I was being billed for it (the crepe was free, though--I didn't go back the next two evenings). A fourth problem was that our windows were very dirty. My main reason for wanting to stay here was the views, yet the windows were the dirtiest of any hotel at which we stayed in Canada (9 of them). The final problem I found out when I got home. Despite paying the full rate for one night, we did not get credit towards next year's gold status nor towards their "Stay 2 nights get one week-end night free" promotion. I had to send copies of my receipts to Starwood and go through a 2-week process to get the mess straightened out. Why should I have been required to do the foot-work for the hotel's mistake? I can see how someone landing this hotel through Hotwire or Priceline would be pleased, and I can't say this is a bad hotel. But I seriously doubt I'll stay here if and when I come back to Toronto...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: lainie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another stay at the Westin Harbour Castle. This is a beautiful hotel. Definitely my favourite in Toronto. My room was on the 33rd floor in the South Tower. I had an amazing view of the lake, Harbourfront and the CN Tower. They asked me if I wanted to pay $30 to upgrade to a lakeview room and I declinedâ€¦.I had a great view without the upgrade! The room itself was great. I love the beds there! So comfortable! I also had a chaise lounge situated so that I could look out and enjoy the view of the lake. Shower was great. Double shower-head. And the amenities were very nice. Went for a quick swim in the pool in the morning. The pool area is great and the water was very warm. There were lots of kids in the pool but they have one lane closed off for people wanting to do laps. The hot tub was busy so I didnâ€™t bother going in there. The lobby is beautiful and the receptionists are very friendly and efficient. There is a small coffee shop in the lobby to grab a quick coffee and snack in the morning if you like. I didnâ€™t use any of the restaurants but I sat at the lobby bar a few times while waiting for friends. A bit expensive but the staff are very friendly. I walked up to Eaton Centre to do some shopping. Very quick walk, right up Yonge Street! And Harbourfront is great for wandering around, many restaurants with patios. The hotel is also close for subway, street cars and buses if you like to get around that way. I took the Airport Express from Terminal 1 at the airport. Took less than half an hour and the Westin is the first stop! Much cheaper than taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsMaytag
Reviews.Content: The Westin came to me at a cheap price on Hotwire but price isnt everything. The location is near nothing else other than the ferries that were on strike. The hotel itself is pretty though valet parking at $40 per night and $28 buffet breakfast make you wonder if you're in Manhattan. The hotel hallways were always dirty and it's quite disturbing to see on a daily basis. Personally I would rather be centrally located than stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Rought start with a perfect finish.”
Reviews.Author: AZWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this may have been the best example of customer service I've experienced in my millions of miles of travel. I ended up at this Westin with a winning priceline bid. We arrived late, around 11:30pm and quickly checked in and went to our room. After about 20 minutes and the kids falling asleep, the AC unit in our room decided to break and dump a bunch of water on our bed. I immediately went back downstairs to complain and the girl that checked me in was very helpful but indicated there were no rooms to move us to. She called engineering and offered me four breakfast vouchers and a $60 food credit for our stay. Needless to say there was no fixing this issue so the only option was to be moved to another hotel for the night. The manager on duty came out and apologized and provided me taxi vouchers as well as a promise that he would credit us the night on priceline (it's now about 12:30am). We got up the next day and showed up around 11am assuming that we would just check our luggage and the room wouldn't be ready. I was wrong there as well, they had a mini suite ready to go and the manager on duty came out and apologized again for the incident. Later that afternoon the general manager sent up a bottle of wine with another apology. This was by far the best customer service I have ever received, I didn't get upset with them and never raised my voice, they just took care of it. For a hotel this size I was impressed, although surprised they had no empty rooms the night of the issue. I would highly recommend this place, especially if you can get a nice deal through priceline (BTW, as promised the credit for one night showed up on my credit card within a day).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a family to see the sights!”
Reviews.Author: KentCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and were initially concerned about the fact the location. On a map, the Westin appears to be isolated on the southside of the Gardiner Expressway. In actual fact, the Westin is perfectly located for a family visit to Toronto. It is right in the middle of the wonderful harbourfront district and is an easy 5 minute walk to Union Station giving easy access to everything. We had an easy time getting everywhere by transit and subway. The Westin had competant and strong service but not overwhelming. It is clean and beautifully located. Many reviews have commented on the price of parking. While I agree, my advice would be to take the Airport Express into the city ($19/person) which gets you directly to the hotel door and to take cabs and transit otherwise. Transit in Toronto is wonderful and we never spent more for cabs and subways that then the $40/parking cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: azlodaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for two nights and were upgraded to a lakeview room. The room is spacious and the bed is great - all the things we've come to expect from Westin. Upon arrival we had a complimentary cheese plate and bottle of water delivered to our room! The room is clean and modern but the bathroom was a little too small - the door would not open completely as it blocked by the toilet - but it's not like you spend a lot of time there so this was just a small issue. We were within walking distance to CN tower as well as downtown shopping. Always recommend Westin!

Reviews.Title: “shame about the steps”
Reviews.Author: Edd60
Reviews.Content: Our coach dropped us of at the hotel and we were greeted with steep steps up to the lobby there was a phone to ring for assistance half way up (why not at the bottom ?) these were not a problem for us even with 2 cases but anyone disabled or with young children could have problems we later found a slope up to the lobby but again could cause probs. The hotel was clean modern and the staff friendly and helpful room was clean tidy and spacious as was the bathroom as we were on 34th floor we had great views over lake Ontario. It is close to CN tower and rogers center and the ferry terminal is next door downtown is a bit of a walk but the metro is just up the road nice hotel shame about the steps.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great room for the name Westin on the hotel”
Reviews.Author: lewisma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited for one night while we were driving through Ontario and the parking price shocked me for valet and they charge for self parking as well. When we walked in to the lobby it was very gorgeous and modern so I was expecting the same of the room. The front desk clerk asked if we wanted an upgrade from our lake view room to one with a balcony. Do not say yes to this offer! We went from a room on one of the upper floors with an unobstructed view to a 6th floor room overlooking a busy ferry dock. When we stepped off the elevator to go to the room, which was also located right next to the elevator, the doors closed quickly after my husband stepped off in front of me and the doors closed on my shoulders. A call to the front desk sent security up to get a report and find out what happened, but the elevator was not serviced for the duration of my stay. I would not recommend staying at this hotel unless I was staying for business only and getting reinbursed for the cost of the stay. We signed up online to get the breakfast special but like other reviews I have read they did not give us a voucher and did not seem to know what we were talking about when we mentioned our breakfast deal the next day at the buffet. We did have it in writing though and it was cleared up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: platinumman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable, although the location is far away from civilization. It's about a 15 minute walk through highly trafficked roads with few people just to get a bite to eat. I'm sure that's fine when it's warm but in the winter, be aware...

Reviews.Title: “Not Crazy About It”
Reviews.Author: French_Viking
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have indicated, this hotel is lakefront and therefore just on the outskirts of the downtown core. Union Station is a very brisk 10 minute walk away requiring the crossing of a couple of busy intersections, the use of a few ackward sidewalks (due to construction), and passing under a couple of highway/rail underpasses. Certainly doable... but really not a scenic or entertaining walk. Those wanting to experience the city's "vibe" may be disappointed staying here as it is nestled among residential condominium complexes with mini-marts and small delis scattered here and there. There was also no other pedestrians to be found on the street! On the otherhand, those wanting to retreat back to a quieter part of town after a day of sightseeing may find staying here ideal. The ferry terminals to visit the Toronto islands are right behind the hotel. The hotel itself is nice enough but I feel it doesn't have much character or warmth... the entire lobby and sitting areas are (in my opinion) devoid of any atmosphere. The lounge area off of the lobby (which is set in front of floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the lake) are (again, in my opinion) uninviting. The hallway leading to my room was also a little dark and dreary... and definitely showing some signs of wear and tear. My room, however, was spacious and ultra-clean. Despite being on the 7th floor of the North tower, I had a nice view of the lake and ferry terminals. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom (with shower/tub combiniation) was stocked with all the necessary amenities. I ordered room service (late night snack... cheese plate and glass of wine) and though the price was a little higher than I was expecting for room service, at least the plate was artfully presented and a little more generous than normal. All of this being said, and as with a hotel stay anywhere else, a large part of your satisfaction will be based on the price you pay. I used one of those "blind" sites to book my stay. I ended up getting about 60% off the usual Expedia/Travelocity rates so really can't complain as the basics were there (i.e., cleanliness, comfortable bed, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location, but lovely views!”
Reviews.Author: pojaya
Reviews.Content: A bit off from the main downtown area, prob 10 or more minutes walk to Union Station area. The park areas along the lake is directly accessible from the hotel ( go down one level from the lobby). This lakeside area makes for a lovely stroll in good weather. The public areas of the hotel is not very good. The lobby is quite dark with low ceilings. To get to the hotel from the street is also a bit awkward, esp with luggage. Really don't know why the design is like that! I guess it is OK if arriving by car. We got this hotel thru hotwire. Got a room on the top/ penthouse floor, next to the prime minister's suite. In fact, there is an interconnecting door to the PM suite. The room is adequate, and the east facing views are fantastic from this level. Internet costs are exorbitant. Free wifi can be had near the hotel, but not from the room. The Heavenly Bed is definitely great.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you get a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: Shiny9
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for a leisure trip for my boyfriend and I off a blind third-party site for $57 a night. For that price, I was extremely impressed! The customer service agents at the front desk were very friendly and were able to get me an early check in of 9 a.m. due to my early flight. The room was a standard size room and had very nice furnishings. I checked up the regular price of the hotel from the Westin Harbour Castle's official website and it ran upwards of $180 per night! Personally, I don't really think it's that great for that price, but for what I got it was just amazing! and I would not have been able to afford to stay there if I had to pay regular price. We had a half-lakeside half-city view. It was okay minus the giant sugar factory directly in our view. You can pay $30 extra per night for a lake view room, though, if you desire. The hotel is really conveniently located. Just a few blocks from Union Station and GO bus terminals. So it's great for anyone who doesn't have a vehicle. It is close to the Eaton Centre as well. There is a little grocery store across the street that I bought the most delicious and ripe fruits for breakfast each morning (the hotel restaurants seem ridiculously pricey, $20 for Eggs Benedict and considering I am a young student on a budget vacation, I could not afford either of the restaurants located in the hotel.) ....The Mizzen smelled amazing each day, though! There are some really great "hidden gem" restaurants located around the area. Located directly next door is "Alexandros World Famous Gyros." They are delicious and open very late (to about 3am). Also very inexpensive, it came to $12 for my boyfriend and I to eat there. If you walk a few blocks in any direction you will pass several other stands or little restaurants. The phone prices are ridiculous, $2.00 for ANY phone call whether it be local or even toll-free! I found this annoying considering I was making a LOT of phone calls trying to make plans with my brother and friends from the area. I went across the street to the little mini-grocery store and bought a calling card with 500 minutes for $5. There is a pay phone right outside the Gyro shop and I would dial the toll-free number and use that to make calls, I would suggest doing this to anyone on a budget! Be prepared to pay big for parking if you want to park right at the hotel! It's $40 per night, but there are a few cheaper parking lots nearby. They have a business room that is 25 cents per minute to use the internet and 40 cents per page you would like to print, 50 cents for color copies. The pool area was pretty standard. The pool furniture was nice, though. There was never any lack of clean towels at the counter. The hot tub was sweltering hot, though, in my opinion. I don't think I've ever been in a hot tub so hot, I could only stay in for less than 5 minutes before I had to jump in the pool to cool down and I normally LOVE excessive heat! The jets were also fairly sparse. It was just very standard, not what I would expect for a fancy hotel. The workout centre is good, although there are usually a lot of people working out. They have headsets for your use during workout and TV's at many of the machines. I wasn't able to get late checkout as it was booked solid apparently, but I was able to store my items at the front desk for the entire day as I had an 8pm flight and check out was noon. You can get a shuttle for $40 to the airport. I took the subway and a bus. It was $2.75, so it worked out well for me and I only had to walk a few blocks to union station with my luggage. Overall it was a great stay. Good environment and a great deal overall! I couldn't have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “A stylish room on Toronto's lakeshore”
Reviews.Author: patrolman_pete
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip in May. The Westin underwent major renovations quite recently, and at the time of writing, the smell of new carpets and paint was evident. The result is that the rooms and public spaces in the hotel are very elegant and attractive. The rooms are typical in terms of size and amenities, but they are very clean and fresh-looking. The in room amenities are very good, with nice touches like a chaise (instead of an armchair), a big flat-screen TV, a single-serving Starbucks coffee maker and the impressive Westin shower head being appreciated touches. Of course, the bed was excellent and made for a very comfortable night's sleep. The views from the 30th floor were very impressive. The soaring view of the lake made me feel like I was at a resort and not in the heart of Canada's largest city. It was quite a pleasant change of scenery (literally). Incidentally, it is located right above the docks for the Toronto Island ferry, which is a must on a nice day. The only major drawback for this hotel (in my eyes, at least - your mileage may vary) is the rather remote location relative to the rest of downtown. I really enjoy walking around in Toronto, and having to walk the same drab stretch of road under a couple of tunnels and bridges to get to Union subway station became annoying (even if it was only about 5-10 minutes). Fortunately the area around the hotel has really matured and there is a good selection of shops and services nearby (including supermarkets, coffee shops, restaurants, etc.) so you don't have to go far for any basic needs. Despite my location-related reservations, I would definitely come back to this hotel. It represents very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “In the city yet so far away...”
Reviews.Author: Karen2Fold
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Westin through Expedia and got a great rate for this kind of hotel. Overall the stay was pleasant and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the downtown Toronto area. The hotel is geared more to business travelers and had a few conventions/meetings happening while we were visiting. The lobby just underwent a huge renovation and there were still a few workers around repairing and doing odds and ends...nothing distracting though. The overall feeling of the hotel is dark woods, tranquil light and there are fresh flowers in the lobby. The staff were helpful including a quick check-in, helpful concierge and considerate maids. The hotel is on the waterfront which is lovely and relaxing, but there are some restaurants and shops nearby if you want them. It's about a 3-4 minute walk to Union Station & Air Canada Center; and about 15-20 walk to CN Tower and Rogers Centre one way and the same to Distillery District the other way. The upsides: - If you want to go shopping at the Eaton Centre or downtown the hotel provides regular (and free) van trips. - Globe and Mail at your door every morning - Starbucks coffee you can brew in your room, and a Starbucks in the lobby - Westin Heavenly Bed and Heavenly Shower - Awesome views! - They will bring you extra towels, blankets and robes to you room if you need them ... and they're quick. - Airport express bus comes every 1/2 hour (about $35 for 2 people one way) - Bonus: there's a big liquor store nearby The downsides: - There are two flights of stairs or a big incline (through parking garage) to get up to the lobby of the hotel so it's hard to get up with luggage or sore feet from the curb. Cabs will drop you off at the top though. - Parking is expensive (we didn't use) - Wireless is available but it's $20/day! - Rooms have mini fridges you can use but they are full of expensive mini-bar stuff - If the fire alarm goes off (it did once for us) and you're on a high floor (there are 25 in total) it's going to take a long time to get down and the elevators won't work...even for a period of time after the alarm goes off. - The location is lovely but it is a bit far for city-trotting or sightseeing (unless you're up for some walking and/or subway-ing).

Reviews.Title: “perfect.”
Reviews.Author: lordbarneth
Reviews.Content: we got a great deal thorugh priceline, worked out about Â£60 per night. we joined the starwood preferred guest prgramme and this seemed to get us a wonderful room on the 33rd floor of the south tower with great views of both the lake and the city. room, the service, location was ideal. if on a budget there is ane xcellent deli and general store just across the street and an lcbo just along the road. 10 min walk takes you to the union station subway station.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst hotel stays I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Herzmoor
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that I am changing hotels for the remainder of my stay in Toronto. I stayed over 35 weeks in a hotel last year and this hotel was the worst. The room was so loud with elevator noise and the sound of running water in the wall it was near impossible to sleep. Combine that with pillows that seemed to be stuffed with basketballs I may require physical therapy on my neck when I get home. I would recommend you stay anywhere but this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Matt T
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and got a special deal on a room for two with a partial harbor view and one king-sized bed. I expected the view to be an exaggeration, when in reality we had almost a full-on view of the lake from our hotel room. The parking is a little ridiculous price-wise, so I'd recommend you drive around the block and park in any of the cheap lots in the area. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the closest subway station, so if you want to be right in the heart of the action you may want to look for somewhere in the downtown section. This is a conference hotel, so expect the bar and lounge to be pretty full with suits during cocktail hour. Check-in was simple, the hotel was sparkling and clean, although there was minor construction going on. The room was spacious with huge windows and the king-sized bed was plenty of space for two. The bathroom was also well lit and spacious, as well as clean. The indoor pool and workout area should be more than enough to fit your needs while on vacation. The area the hotel is located in can be either good or bad. If you head east you'll pass some factories and go through a grimy area, although still safe. Head west though and you can walk along the shore and enjoy the Queens Quay. North puts you right into downtown area and Yonge St. To sum up, this hotel would be perfect for a couple or some friends who can get a budget room here. Probably wouldn't recommend for families, unless you plan on having a car and driving to avoid any excess walking.

Reviews.Title: “Get Hotel Special Offers in Writing”
Reviews.Author: noworriesOntario
Reviews.Content: Long story short.....when booking Hotel Special Offers on the phone get email confirmation with the specials in writing. I looked up the Hotel specials online then phoned to make a reservation. On the phone I was told that I would be given free breaksfast buffet voucher. When I checked in at the hotel, they did not honour the offer I was given on the phone....no breakfast voucher , no explanation and no apology. I was given a room on the 5th floor-- no complaints about the room but the view was unexpected....when I looked out the window I expected the ground to be a few floors below me but the room was level with a roof overlooking a tennis court. I went to the hotels breakfast buffet ($26 ) but was going to order a la carte since I did not want a big breakfast. The waiter was at the table promptly with coffee urn and juice pitcher which was appreciated until reviewing the menu. I realized that anything I ordered would be more expensive than the buffet because of the drink prices..coffee $5 juice $5 !! $26 Buffet included drinks, was very, very nice, but expensive in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like First-Class even though our room was free!”
Reviews.Author: DetroitLover
Reviews.Content: I had a free gift certificate for a one night stay as well as free brunch the next morning but you would never know it because my friends and I were treated like First-Class. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, including the employees at the front desk, the gift shop, the dining room, the concierge, and the valet. Our concierge explained how we could use public transportation and helped us pick a dinner spot and a night spot that suited our needs. Breakfast was delicious and the dining room staff gladly accomodated us even though our coupon had expired at 10:30 am (which we hadn't noticed). The front desk and the valet helped us when we had checked out and returned an hour later upon realizing that we accidentally paid for parking twice. Finally, our room was a corner unit overlooking Lake Ontario... a view I never expected for a free room. It was a wonderful trip in a wonderful city. I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Harbour Castle Saved My Life.. Literally!”
Reviews.Author: HardLite
Reviews.Content: I owe this hotel my life. On April 23, 2009, I woke up in my room at this hotel feeling ill with a shoulder pain. I immediatley called the reception, who contacted 911 while I was on the phone. We had a 3 way conference call with the 911 attendant asking me about my symptoms and assuring me that the ambulance was on the way. In the meantime, the hotel immediately send 2 security agents to my room who put me on oxygen and kept me company while waiting for the EMS staff. My symptoms turned out to be exhaustion but the this hotel's staff professionalism, care, compassion was really remarkable and I want to thank all of their staff from the bottom of my heart. When i returned from hospital, I had a nice candle waiting for me from the hotel's managaer with a get well note. Thank you Westin Harbour Castle, thank you thank you.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel, questionable star rating...”
Reviews.Author: Steph_260
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my significant other for one night in February. We managed to get a cheaper rate through one of the well-known travel websites. However, despite the good rate, this hotel left me feeling rather let down. I will try to be concise, so here goes... - The room was averaged sized, though the bed was lovely with expensive looking Egyption cotton style bedding. However, when staying in a high-star rated hotel, I don't expect to see questionable stains on the sheets! ( brown staining....almost like dried blood!). I contacted room service immediately and they sent someone up to change the sheets. The staff member who did this was very appologetic and even sent up his manager to offer an explanation....the response I got was that they were in the middle of renovations, and attention to detail may have been lacking in this circumstance! Indeed it was! This put me off from staying at the hotel in the future.... - Also, the lobby was being renovated at the time, and this caused lots of dust and noise. I believe this work has been finished now, however. - The view we got was probably the worst view in Toronto! We overlooked an empty warehouse and carepark.... Overall, this hotel struck me as being 'nothing special'. I've stayed in better 3 star hotels in Toronto, so I would say only stay here if you can get an exceptionally good deal! Do not pay full price!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: antoine321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to visit the Toronto Artexpo and stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for two nights. It really lived up to our expectations. Very beautiful and comfortable with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - a little off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Travelcritic-ca
Reviews.Content: Picked this up for valentines off one of the blind sites for $66. The parking however was $40 but other than that no complaints. The rooms were clean and well appointed, the staff was attentive. A difinate redo.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but not upto the mark”
Reviews.Author: 100nights
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the heavenly bed, but other service failures made the stay would have been below par. We received a wonderful smiling welcome from Laura, but the room was missing components, the lobby in under renovation and our room (north tower east facing) suffered from noise from the elevator shaft which was only quiet between 3 ~ 5AM and never did get that light bulb replaced....

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: sf6677
Reviews.Content: I read there was valet + self parking available : after a long drive, I finally arrived to the hotel, to be told the self service parking was 2 blocks away. It is -5 C, and I'm wearing high heels. The parking is an outdoor one. I'm suppose to walk, and then leave my car outside for 3 days and hope no one smash a window meanwhile ? It was this, or use their 40.00$ per day valet service. Total of 120.00$ just for parking. What a start! After checking-in, I ask for one key and told them I'm by myself. I get to my room to find 2 Queen beds, no sitting area except for a chair crammed between the window and one of the beds (1.5 inches of space on each side). Mmmm. That's gonna be a long 3 days. My room being connected with the 2 rooms next to it, even if the connecting doors are shut and locked, I can still VERY clearly hear everything they say on the other side + everyone who walks in the hall! The room is nicely decorated, with up to date facilities. The bathroom is big and well equipped (although I wake up the entire floor when I flush the toilet, it is extremely loud!!) Compared to the Intercontinental (Front or Bloor) and the Le Germain, this hotel was a disappointment to me. I will not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeeter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I priceline.com'd two nights at the Westin Harbour Castle Hotel in Toronto over the Valentine's Day weekend. While parking was expensive, we parked in a nearby surface lot for $10 per day instead of valet which was $40. We were checked in almost immeadiately, and recieved a beautiful 22nd floor room overlooking the harbour with a flat screen TV and King Bed. The room was very comfortable and nice. The service was good too. We asked them to clean our room after accidentally leaving our 'Do Not Disturb' sign on all day and they cleaned it at our request at 9:30 p.m. The hotel was under renovations, but we heard no drilling and all the amenities were available as advertised. Furthermore, the location was great, easy walking to all of downtown and a 5 minute walk from the Subway. All in all I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family as a solid 4-star in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce Property with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: rskblueyes
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Hotwire and was happy I scored a Westin Property. I then reading the reviews on this site and regretted doing so as many reviewers complained about get substandard rooms when booking through priceline and hotwire, and also many complained about the ongoing renovations and service at the hotel. I arrived at 6am, way ahead of the 3pm check-in. Not only did the receptionist check me in, I was given a great room on the 32nd floor with both City and Lake views. I was very gratefull for this! The room was large, and had a Flat screen TV. The bathroom was also large with many towels and toiletries. The health club was great, lots of cardio machines, and several weight machines. The only evidence of the renovation was the sound of drilling and hammering off the Lobby. Although a 10 minute walk from the subway, there was very little in resturants nearby, My only complaint was that they charged $19.00 for Internet service, and I was told there was free interent access in the Lobby. However the two times I attemped, I could not get on to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but no parking and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Prupas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for Valentine's Day. When we pulled up, we saw a "Lot Full" sign and when I asked about valet parking, we were rudely told that "the lot is full" so we'll have to "find another lot" and park the car ourselves. We were shocked that a hotel such as the Westin would treat its guests so poorly. The valet suggested a lot nearby which he claimed would cost $10. I drove over there, only to be told that it would $20 if we retrieved the car by 7:00 the following morning. Otherwise it would be $40. Eventually I found a lot nearby for $20. When you pay this much for a room, and stay at what is supposedly a high-end hotel, you should not have to drive around looking for a parking lot. If their lot is full, they can have their valets arrange parking. For $40 (the cost of valet parking, when it is offered), they can earn their money! When we checked in, we found that a lamp in our room was missing the knob to turn it on - it had literally been removed. A call down resulted in a staff member coming up with a lightbulb - clearly not the problem. He eventually returned and fixed it. The room was too cold when we arrived, too hot later, and the heater was very noisy. As well, the doors are very loud - we could hear it every time our neighbour closed theirs. All in all, a disappointing stay. Would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: kidCar
Reviews.Content: Love the Westin! This hotel was huge, yet very very clean. I used the gym, which was nice and the pool and sauna. Nice! I loved the beds and the view. The room service was good, as it usually is from the Westin. The location was DT which was also nice. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “So Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: amandalloyd
Reviews.Content: I was able to check-in early, there were some lobby renovations going on but nothing bad at all. Upon entering the room, I was immediately impressed. The room has huge windows that let in a lot of light and provide a great view of the lake and city. The room was very spacious for a standard room, and even had a small "living area" with sofa and coffee table. The TV was a huge flatscreen, the king bed super soft and comfortable and the room coffee was Starbucks brand. The bathroom had two adjustable shower heads. I ordered from the restaurant 3 times, and everytime the food was great. The steak was fantastic. Service from the waiter, concierge, and room service waiter were all fantastic, front desk was fine but not as impressive. My favourite part of the hotel was the gym and pool area, very large with all the recreation facilities you could want. The location is almost perfect; if you're on foot it is a few blocks away from the very core of downtown, but close enough. The view and comfort the hotel provides is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room, Bullish Security Guards , Expensive Parking”
Reviews.Author: DefiniteOne77
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean with a standard layout and a view of the lake. It had a large flat panel TV and seemed to be well maintained. Nothing too special. What was did not like was when two very large, scowling security guards armed with flashlights showed up at the door and gave us a 'warning' about the noise level. Although it was late we were just having a conversation at a reasonable volume and the TV was on with the volume way turned down. Certainly not the kind of activity that would warrant a 'warning'. Another thing about the hotel is that the parking is very expensive, $30 or more per night and we didn't even valet. Other than that its not a far cab ride to the club district.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable at the Westin.”
Reviews.Author: missyoulikegravy83
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the Westin via priceline.com. My aim was to get a 4 star hotel at a much discounted rate. I have been to many Toronto hotels and the Westin disappointed. I ignored the negative reviews on this site, because I had a positive experience with the Westin brand in San Francisco. The first reason is that the rooms were standard for a 4* hotel and very basic. When I called down to request a few more towels, the woman on the phone responded, "There are two people in your room, you only need one bath towel each". The second reason is the rude service I received at the coffee shop. This isn't a four star. If you want two towels, and some half standard service, go ahead. I am glad I payed a discounted rate. I would have rather stayed at a Super 8. If you want a four star, go to the Intercontinental. It won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Does Not Live Up to Westin Name”
Reviews.Author: nixgirl
Reviews.Content: After spending a few days at the Westin Tremblant I was really impressed and assumed all Westins were created equal. I was thrilled to book a room at the Westin Harbour Castle based on that experience alone. I was wrong. So much so that I was moved to write this review. I hate writing and I never write reviews on these websites but I signed up here specifically for this purpose. The check-in guy was extremely pleasant. When we arrived at our room I immediately noticed our bed linen was dirty. I called down to have them changed and housekeeping was sent in immediately. She was courteous and did a great job. Next, I called down for two bathrobes (something I never had to do at the Westin Tremblant or any of our other favorite hotels as the robes are usually already in the room when we arrive). The man who brought them up looked like we were inconveniencing him. Worse, one of the robes were also dirty and had to be sent back. On a side note, and this really speaks to the "cleanliness" of this hotel, we went to get some ice in the ice room later that day and found the same dirty bathrobe laying on the ground outside the laundry area. The ice machine was kept in a room across from what looked like a laundry area. Still, it's nothing a guest should see when going for ice. I know it was the same robe because I saw the same disgusting brown stain on the hem. The dinner we had from room service was great. Breakfast was a whole other story. A $20 breakfast was ordered. It was supposed to come with eggs, toast, bacon, sausage and ham. The breakfast arrived without the sausage or bacon. I called to confirm that it was indeed supposed to come with those items and I was told yes and they apologised and sent the bacon and sausage separately- 40 minutes later! My husband's breakfast was cold by then. Finally, I wanted to go out on the sun deck for fresh air but was told they lock that door in the winter and not given a reason why. If a guest wants to go outside on the sun deck they should be allowed- even winter. Furthermore, the lady at the service desk was very rude about it. The clerk we checked out with was very friendly and apologetic and comped our room service 50% but I definitely will never stay at the Westin Harbour Caslte again and I will be a little more reluctant to stay at any other Westins in the future. I want to end with something positive. The gym was nice and I thought it was really neat how they had a Wii area there. Also, each machine had its own tv. The gym was the best part.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: DrSquirrel14
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend getaway at the Westin Harbour Castle. We booked the stay on Priceline through the bidding system and paid only $75 per night. For the price, it was fine, but had we paid full price I would have been profoundly disappointed! When you pull into the front entrance, you are immediately besieged by valets who basically try to toss you out of the car and snatch the keys. The only on-site parking is valet ($30 per night) and apparently there is an off-site parking lot that is cheaper but nobody is keen to hand out information about that. We were a bit taken aback and ended up with valet parking almost before we knew what had happened. I'm not a pushover by any means but found their aggression surprising. Also, there is a charge of $11.50 anytime you would like to get your car out of valet parking before your departure. The staff member at the front desk at check-in was unfriendly and unhelpful. He was mumbling, condescending, not forthcoming with information, and generally unfriendly. The room was small but very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. Bathroom was clean. The shower had very little pressure and they didn't leave us enough bath towels (1 towel for two of us), although they did deliver more quite promptly when we called. There was a minibar which we did not use, as well as a 1-cup coffeemaker with enough coffee for only one person. We had looked at the hotel website ahead of time and were looking forward to using the pool and hot tub, which looked lovely in the photos. However, it turned out that it was closed for renovation during our stay, a fact which was conveniently omitted from the website. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from Union Station, although there is a streetcar station closer. It's not terribly inconvenient (and would be great if you were only going to the Air Canada Centre which is virtually across the street), but the location is a bit of a pain compared to other upscale hotels in town. Overall, for $75 per night, I can't complain - it was comparable to a run-of-the-mill Best Western in a small town. But for a four-star, downtown, "upscale" hotel whose usual rate is $250 per night? Disappointing. I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FutureExpatriates
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel did show some aging in the hallways and pool area, it did not detract from our enjoyable stay. The room was very clean, nicely updated and had incredible views. Including a nicely stocked, albeit expensive, mini-bar and complementary Starbucks coffee. I thought it was a great location for a city hotel, only a few blocks from all the action, but once you were in your room you felt like it was miles away. Plus, you've got to love that Heavenly Bed! We found the front desk and especially the concierge extremely helpful and friendly. However, I think that cordial behavior is a given for Canadians.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, good views”
Reviews.Author: Mugsydogg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 weekend night. I had a high floor, corner room looking over the lake. The hotel had some construction going on in the lobby but I couldnt hear any of it in my room, and it was mostly out of site, blocked by temp. walls. The check-in was quick and I was in my room within 5 minutes. The room was large and comfortable. No complaints about the Westin's beds, as they're some of the most comfortable out there. The bathroom was decently sized and had a great showerhead. Location is right on the waterfront. You can walk to some downtown locations, but its across some busy streets/overpasses. I would recomend taking a cab from the hotel rather than walking..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service From Front Desk Manager Nov 21st”
Reviews.Author: GratitudeCanada
Reviews.Content: I am very dosappointed with the customer service at front desk at This hotel. I left a package to be picked up for a person, when the person arrived to pick up they did not have it and told him there was nothing there even though I had them register it in the computer. I called Front Desk manager on duty and he was very rude and would not even allow me to explain my entire concern and immediately passed the blame to others and did not listen to what I had to say. Very unprofessional and not friendly. I did not find consistency when speaking to the staff there. I must say not worth the money, hotels nearby have better customer service. Disappointed Customer

Reviews.Title: “Peasant stay, yet lacks service excellence”
Reviews.Author: Shahpar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel early November for 6 days, although the room was generous with a good harbour view I wont give a 5 star rating to this hotel. Reading so many reviews before deciding to pick up this hotel I was rather shocked by bad attitude of some guys in the front desk. These two guys were short, and almost rude. The breakfast service wasnâ€™t welcoming either. Since I am a frequent traveller, and I always make sure to read reviews before picking up a hotel, I was rather surprised but on second review I noticed other guests havenâ€™t raved about the front desk peopleâ€™s attitude either. A bit late now! Apart from that the general quality was good, and hotel is conveniently located in harbour-front district in Toronto, with good view, and relaxed atmosphere. But if these guys are looking to be rated for service excellence they are far cry from a 5 star service they are claiming for.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for V festival”
Reviews.Author: joel76
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Westin as we had tickets to go to V festival and the Hotel was right next to the ferry terminal to go over to the island where the event was. First impressions from outside are not so good as the hotel is a bit of a 70s abomination. That said, the inside is much better and although obviously dated in some areas it was in good condition and clean. We had a very large room with huge LCD TV and lots of room. The safe jammed on several ocassions but they were very quick to come and fix it. We ate at the bar one night and it was ok, food was reasonable although like everywhere else inToronto, drinks were a little on the expensive side. We ate twice at a really good steakhouse called the Keg! The Manager there was really good, even giving us directions to another bar where we had been recommeded to go to. He remembered us the following night and gave us a discount on our meal. Overall hotel was ok but a bit far out as you had to walk through a bit of a seedy area under a freeway to get to town. Not that far though and I would imagine if you were going to watch ice hockey the hotel would be very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service not so nice”
Reviews.Author: pauliepalms
Reviews.Content: The Westin is beautiful and the rooms are very very nice, although somewhat small- but I would not consider this hotel again because of the poor attitude of almost all of the employees. We had a group of 9 ladies for a girls weekend. The first thing they told us was to be sure to use the valet because our van was sure to be broken into and stolen (valet per night $30 - self lot $17). When we checked in one desk employee was pleasant and quick, the other kept saying everything was extra- a room with a view $30 more, 3 people instead of 2 - $30 dollars extra (even though we booked with Hotwire and payed the 3 person rate) This man was a real jerk! We noticed that all throughout the stay not one employee said "good morning", or "have a good day". Even when we were departing the hotel, loaded down with bags no one even offered to hold a door. Believe me, I'm no princess but show a little concern for your guests! The only people that seemed friendly and helpful were the ones at the Concerige desk. Toronto as a whole was a little dirter than 10 years and the people do not seem to care for Americans. If you want to visit a great city try Chicago or DC, they have wonderful hotels and the people are super nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Lawson911
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, right on Lake Ontario and a 5 minute walk from the Hockey Arena. Rooms are top notch and the ambiance is great. Rooms are a little pricey, but you get what you pay for. Food in the main lobby is very good. The rotating dining room on the roof leaves something to be desired, there are a lot better choices within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mkgesq
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough great things about this place! Check in was fast, efficient and friendly. Room was immaculate and upgraded, i.e., new carpet, new modern furniture, granite bathroom, flat screen TV. Entire staff was very friendly and could not do enough for me throughout my stay. Will definitely be back here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hardybandit
Reviews.Content: Superb Hotel, one of the best I have stayed in ( and I have visited many ). We went on a family trip and the Hotel staff were fantastic and accomodating. I highly recommend this Hotel for any visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: JMOP1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Excellent staff. On the Harbour, so not city centre but would definitely recommend. City Centrre is within walking distance and the Airport bus pick-up was outside the hotel. The Island is worth a day visit and we recommend hiring bikes for the day. Recommend visit to Spandina House and Casa Loma. Fairmont York Hotel also worth a visit if not a stay! Roof sun terrace on 5th floor as well as swimming pool was a welcome rest at the end of the day. Italian restaurant worth a visit. We encountered a problem with our safe and would consider the security offered excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cunuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although well located in the heart of Toronto, lacks atmosphere and is in bad need of repair. We have stayed at this hotel once before several years ago, so decided to give it another try. This time, we stayed for one night since we were just passing through. Check-in went well, since they had everything already sorted out with my reservation. However, they put us into an odd-looking room on the same floor as the spa. The room looked out onto a roof deck with absolutely no view of anything but the windows of surrounding buildings. The room had a huge hole in the ceiling that had been patched by someone who seemed to be trying out for the show, "Canada's Worst Handyman". We immediately asked to be switched to another room and that was done without any problem. The next room had a great view of Lake Ontario and the ferry service, but there was a large crack in the bathroom sink that was repaired with a lot of caulk and most likely by the same amateur handyman some time ago. (See both photos with this review.) The bar and lounge area of the hotel, just off the lobby, had all the warm ambiance of center ice at a hockey game. The food was lack lustre. Breakfast next morning was a buffet, but we were allowed to order off the menu. Unfortunately, the food came more than 25 minutes later and was not at all up to the standards set by other Westin Hotels that we have visited in Montreal, Ottawa, Ft. Lauderdale, Chicago, Boston and Philadelphia. Next time, we will be going back to the Royal York Hotel when visiting Toronto, a place that always delivers top quality.

Reviews.Title: “NIce renovated room”
Reviews.Author: titiyo
Reviews.Content: Very nice room. Completely renovated boutique style. Comfortable bed. Good bedding. Beautiful view on Ontario Lake. Big flat screen. Very clean. Climatisation noisy. Have to cross the highway to get downtown. Not much restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: TheLainster
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbour Castle Hotel is the place to stay if you're in Toronto. It was clean, the rooms (and overall hotel) were gorgeous, and the staff was helpful and friendly. You'll be right on the lake. If you can swing it, go for a view of the water. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: nmc64
Reviews.Content: Young couple - stayed for 7 nights beginning of September. We booked this mainly off the reviews given here (and the fact that we got a good deal!!). The hotel is within a 30 min drive of the airport. The hotel is a large twin tower hotel situated on the harbour directly beside where you would get the ferry to the islands. It was recently renovated. We found the staff more than friendly and service was very satisfactory at the bar. We ate at the Toula Restaurant on the top of one of the towers which was quite expensive but service was excellent and the food was tasty. With regard to the room, it was spacious and clean. We had a partial lake view. The bathroom was quite large and again, clean. The rooms were cleaned everyday. The bed is very big and comfortable. One word of warning - be careful of the expensive add-ons. e.g. Drinks, internet etc. The area is fairly quiet but the CN Tower is 15 min walk and the Eaton Centre is a 20 min walk. There is a desk in the lobby that deals with events and tours which is handy. There is a shop across from the hotel and also a sports bar, Japanese Sushi Bar and also a deli. The subway stop is 10 min walk and will bring you almost anywhere. There is a small gym and a pool on the 5th floor of the hotel along with a tennis court. These are adequate. This hotel is decent and we enjoyed our stay. However, we got the slight feeling that the hotel might be slightly geared towards business users and not your average tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Average”
Reviews.Author: blackmidnight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin whilst visiting Toronto on holiday with my partner. When checking in they thought we were staying for 12 nights when we had only booked for 4. Took about 5 minutes for them to believe us despite having paperwork to show what we had booked for! Room was on the 33rd floor of the North Tower - we didn't pay the $30 a night to upgrade to lake-view so we got a 'partial lake view' with views of the expressway. Wasn't great but we couldn't hear any of the traffic. Bed was comfortable but I'm not sure why everyone thinks they are so wonderful. Room was large and starbucks coffee was a nice touch. Bathroom was clean and bright. I have no complaints about the cleanliness of the rooms or the housekeeping staff - the room was cleaned well everyday. It's a shame they charge for the internet though. There were drinks charges added to our bill when we were checking out which we did not have and it took them about an hour to sort these out - eventually they just removed them without telling us why. Good job we had time to sort it out there as it seems people have difficulty with sorting out extra charges. Make sure you check your bill properly as soon as you receive it rather than waiting until you check out! The most annoying thing was the location of the hotel - it wasn't far to walk to many places but at night it was further than I'd have liked. Not much in the actual area where the hotel is although there is a deli and a coffee shop within a 5 minute walk. The rooms were nice, just a shame about the service personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Conceirge desk not so helpful”
Reviews.Author: kvcrom
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was great but the concierge desk was terrible. I asked for directions to get to the Toronto Zoo and got directions to the Science centre. And was told that Ontario place was within walking distance and not far at all. It was over 5kms away and took 2 hours to walk with cranky kids and the hot sun. Other than that the service was outstanding. Just ask for directions from someone else..

Reviews.Title: “weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: SirTeddy
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the WHC during the end of August, the main reason being for my son to see his first baseball game. We booked our room a while back with Travelzoo ($169 per night for a lake front room with two beds and including breakfast for two adults). Check in is said to be at 3PM. We arrived after 4PM and were told our room was not ready and that we should check back in 30 minutes. They offered us a room with one king bed but we explained to the front desk that this was not acceptable since we had two children and that we reserved a room with two beds. When we returned 30 minutes later, another person at the front desk served us and we were then told that we would have to wait at least another hour (almost 6PM) for our room to be ready. We were told the hotel was very busy and that they were having trouble getting all of the rooms ready for the weekend. When they said there was nothing they could do, I asked to speak to the manager who magically found another room that was ready and had two beds and a lake front room. He apologized for the delay and extended the free breakfast for both children as well. The hotel provides children who stay there a small kit which includes a hat, crayons, and activity book (we had to remind the front desk to provide it to us since they forgot to do so). The room was a decent size. The bedding, like all Westin hotels, was very comfortable. The lake view was pretty and we were able to see boats arrive and depart during the day. The large 32 inch LCD TV was mounted on the wall. The bathroom was a good size and the shower had a curved shower rod to give you more room. There was a fee for internet service which although disappointing seems to be the norm for higher end hotels We had the breakfast buffet each morning since it was included in the price of the room. It had a nice choice of cold cereal, danish, mini muffins, fresh fruit (surprisingly no fresh berries of any kind), eggs, pancakes, bacon and a station where omelettes were prepared to order. My family used the pool several times. It is a nice size and the hotel provides plenty of towels. Unfortunately, the hot tub was not working properly the first two days we were there (warm water but no bubbles) and it was closed for repairs the last day we were there. The wooden chairs around the pool all have seat cushions to make lounging comfortable. One side of the pool overlooks the lake while the other side opens to the outside where there is an outdoor area to enjoy the sun and the view of downtown as well as an outdoor tennis court. Parking was a choice of valet in the hotel ($35 per day with in/out privileges) or park yourself in an outside lot ($17 per day with in/out privileges) 5 minutes away from the hotel. When I told the hotel Ichose the latter option, I was told that it was not guarded overnight and that they were not responsible for any damage that might occur. In the end, I was happy I chose this option. I liked the location of the hotel. it is located on the harbourfront and a close walk to the Air Canada Center (5 minutes), CN Tower and Rogers Center (15 minutes). Even though you need to walk under the Gardiner Expressway to get to downtown, I did not see this as a problem or a safety concern unlike other past reviewers. Other than the problem at check-in, my family and I had a nice weekend in Toronto and enjoyed our stay at the WHC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeet57
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights. It was an excellent choice....check in and check out were a breeze. My room was great, the bed was sooooooooo comfortable, the bathroom was nice and I loved the TV...32 plasma (I think). I didn't eat in the hotel because the restaurant on the first level was a bit pricey but there are a few places nearby for a quick breakfast. Another good thing about the hotel is the proximity to CN Tower (I walked to it this morning), the harbourfront is wonderful and so many things to do and see. Also, you can catch either a ferry or a tour boat to Toronto Islands. Great place for kids ...I will bored. One thing to note, I called housekeeping because my remote wasn't working and within minutes the maintenance man appeared at my door. I will DEFINITELY stay there again when I return to Toronto. TORONTO IS A BEAUTIFUL CITY......laid-back, clean, safe and diverse. This was my first trip and won't be my last. I recommend doing the "jump on/jump off" bus.

Reviews.Title: “Lakefront and Renovated”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been recently renovated and were clean and came with a great view of Lake Ontario.
