The pool area must have escaped the renovation as it was quite dirty on the day we went swimming. The buffet breakfast had a large and very good selection. The Hotel was not as close to downtown as we initially thought, it took about 10 minutes to get downtown. The harbour front location was excellent if you were going to Ward island, or if you just wanted to walk along the lake. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view - I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueG105
Reviews.Content: What can I say? I'd booked this hotel for my last day in Canada and it was well worth the wait. I woke up in a comfortable bed, in a clean and comfortable room, with a view over the Toronto Islands to Lake Ontario. My breakfast was delicious and I ate it looking at the lake from my room. My flight wasn't until the evening, so I left my bags with the porters who booked a car for me to the airport, and went to spend my last day on the Toronto Islands from the ferry port next to the hotel. It was a lovely day and quite different from my earlier trip to Toronto. I felt very relaxed walking back from the ferry to the hotel to find my bags ready for the car to the airport. This hotel kept me relaxed and in a state of bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Bill139
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin so we could walk to Rogers Centre to see the Boston Red Sox BEAT the Toronto Blue Jays. While the sign at the drive-up entrance said parking-full, the bellman said he would get our car parked for us. Check-in was swift and smooth; they had our reservations and when we got to the room, we could see that they had correctly given us hypoallergenic bedding, as requested, in advance. The room was in the North Tower and we had both a view of the Spire and Rogers Centre out one window and a beautiful view of the lake out the other. Bathroom was quite nice. Our room was very quiet, despite the fact that there were three (I think) young men in the next room smoking wacky weed; a slight odor crept around the locked, but connecting door; didn't bother us at all. We had breakfast at Mizzen, the hotel restaurant on the main floor. While the buffet was delicious and the service excellent, we thought it was over-priced; $52 for two. Front desk personnel were extremely polite and cheerful. We walked around the Toronto waterfront and found a free stage presentation three blocks one way and a neighborhood street fair three blocks up town. Lots of people were out walking with children; very friendly, casual atmosphere. No visible police presence, which I took to be a good sign, since if we had seen them it could have meant they were expecting trouble. All in all, a great stay in a very nice section of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nwhiteiii
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean people were friendly and this was in a nice location. Walking distance or a short cab ride away from many attractions. We had a view of the Lake Ontario which was very nice. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: boardinbob
Reviews.Content: The Westin was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. The room is nicely furnished, with cool touches like a cordless phone and a large LCD tv. The room was spotless, and the view from my room was unbeatable (CN tower, Lake Ontario, Centre Island...). The staff were very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and I hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great views. Good hotel with an Ideal location to enjoy Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Rabz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel because it is located right at the lakeshore near Center Island, harborfront and Downtown Toronto. We had a queen size room with lake view. The rooms are very nice. The bed is comfortable. The washroom also nice as well. The service is exceptional. There was a welcome snack reception when we checked in which was great. The breakfast buffet was really good. And if you want a real treat, a dinner at the restaurant on the top floor which turns so you can see all of toronto, that is truly a great experience, but also costly. There is so much to do around this hotel. The ferry to Center Island is right behind the hotel. The harbour front is there for you to walk, bike, jog, whatever you want to do. Downtown is close by, by subway. You can walk to the CN tower, the Rogers Center, the Air Canada Center, Hockey Hall of Fame, just so many to go to and to choose. There is limited parking. We had to park outside of the hotel, near the Captain's Restaurant. It costs about $20 each day. Make sure to lock and secure your car if you do park outside. If you find the cost of the restaurants too pricey, there are good restaurants to choose from right there at Harbour front. If I wanted to spend time near Center Island and the Harbor front again, I would stay again here in Westin Harbour Castle

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TuscanSun84
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and yes I reccomend it! It's very fancy when you go inside and very, very large lobby. We had to wait in line to check in, people working at the front desk were really nice. The room was FANTASTIC! While on the small side (not too small) it had upgraded amenities including a wall-mounted flatscreen plasma tv facing the bed, a pull out couch beside the bed, a desk, and all the finishing touches to make you really happy and excited to see your room. It looks terrific. Beds are VERY comfortable with great bedding as advertised. You can walk to downtown REALLY EASILY from this hotel- very convenient if you need to walk to the eaton centre or the greyhound bus terminal. We took a cab to see We WIll Rock You (too far to walk). It is literally as close as can be to get the ferry to go to the toronto islands, and easy to get to any other toronto attraction you may have had in mind. The only drawbacks as I see it are 1.) Walking under the gardner expressway at night? No thanks. You have to walk under here to get to downtown from the hotel and it's a dark tunnel that feels safe during the day but you wouldn't want to walk there at night. I was sad to have to step over sleeping homeless people during the daytime here. 2.) The bathroom sink and mirror are gorgeous but turn around and look at your bathtub and you may be disappointed. It's very basic, a ruststain was smeared on the wall under the handrail, and in our bathroom, the bathroom wasn't perfectly clean. In hotel rooms we all like the "perfectly shining" look since you are coming in after strangers after all, and there were two eyelashes on the toilet seat when I first walked in, and from looking at the floor I saw that it had dusty corners on the floor and just needs to be much more thoroughly cleaned. Thought that information may be helpful to you but I honestly loved this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat. Great dinner at it's restaurant Mizzen as well. Wanted room service breakfast but prices were insulting ($16.00 for one coffee, 1 bread product (muffin, croissant, danish) and one glass of orange juice. If you wanted "just orange juice" one glass is listed at $6.00. We went out for breakfast instead.

Reviews.Title: “big hotel with great vews”
Reviews.Author: KenRoss
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice relaxing hotel. The beds are really comfortable and while the rooms are not the biggest I've ever had the view across the lake is simply brilliant. I had a corporate rate and that made it really good value. I've seen the full rate and would be reluctant to pay it. Location is great right on the waterfront. I recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: 4intltravelers
Reviews.Content: We are SPG gold members and have stayed throughout the world at Westin's and generally are pleased by the exceptional service, however while the rooms and beds were great, the service throughout the stay missed the mark. Our safe was locked when we arrived and we asked for them to unlock it as we were headed out for the evening and we waited for 30 minutes and left the room. Similiarly they only provided us 3 towels and when requested more they didn't arrive to after we left.(Maid never replinshed with more on additional days nor did she replenish the shampoo, etc. Concierges were rather inexperienced with the exception of one gentlemen. When we asked for restaurants with good food and good value. They thought that those two concepts were mutually exclusive. In outlining my complaints to the manager upon checkout, she said that they would contact me and have not done so - three weeks later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tiamaria865
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We frequently visit the city of Toronto, but this is the first time we have stayed in the harbourfront area. We opted not to pay for the upgrade to a "water view" room ($30 per night), but ended up with side water views of the Toronto Islands all the way out to the big lake. We could also see quite a bit of the city from our window as well. The morning sun shone into our room, but the room-darkening blinds kept the room dark until we were ready to start our day. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. You can park your own car in a lot near the hotel for $15 per day or you can use the service at the hotel for $30. I''m not sure what the in/out privileges were at the other lot - but if you are planning to park the car for your stay, I would go with the lot next door. The Heavenly bed, shower, soaps, towels, were all very comfortable and made our stay that much more enjoyable. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not great for infants”
Reviews.Author: MCGKingston
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is beautifully renovated, we were frequently frustrated by communication problems. Despite emailing, then phoning, then asking again at check-in, we did not receive our crib until we called again several hours into our stay, only to be told that they had no record of this request. The crib is completely useless for a newborn, as the mattress is 3 feet below the top of the crib, and an average-height person would need to basically drop the baby in, and it's not clear how you could get it out! It would have been helpful to have notice of this. We ended up putting the mattress on the floor. Nothing "heavenly" about it. Also, we used valet parking, only to have long delays, and have the staff get the wrong car once - concerning! The business centre tried to give us the wrong package. Despite this, the food was good, and the room was lovely. For the price, however, we will likely not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Love What You Have Done!”
Reviews.Author: martythemonkey
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and the stay was wonderful! In comparison to it's pre-renovation days, you would never think it was the same hotel. Bravo! Check-in was flawless and Rebecca did an outstanding job checking me in and answering my questions. Apparently the hotel was full, but you never would have thought so by the few people in the lobby and bar. I did not eat in the restaurant this trip, but have in the past and it was wonderful. Staffing levels were more than adequate and all staff I encountered were pleasant and knowledgeable. This is my hotel while in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: joyful82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Habour Castle in Toronto for 3 nights and it made a fantastic base to explore the city. Right on the habour front it has excellent views over Lake Ontario and Toronto Island as well as the Toronto City skyline and is only a 10 minute walk to the CN tower, 20 minute walk to the Eaton shopping centre. The rooms are stylish and very clean and the swimming pool and sun terrace area made a welcome break after a long day exploring or for a quick swim before breakfast. Staff all very friendly. Whilst staying in Toronto, I would highly recommend a boat tour of the habour and trip to Toronto island. It's a wonderful contrast to city life, with open parkland, beaches, cafes, a little fun fair and bike hire. We hired a tandem for an hour and had a great rid around the island. We also went up the CN tower- fantastis views if you don't mind heights, and hired a car and drove down to Niagara for the day, although you can also get coach trips. Oh and there is a great little store across the road for supplies or a lovely fresh breakfast on the go! A stylish, friendly hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “toronto in may”
Reviews.Author: cath_and_rob
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, very clean, helpful staff, brilliant location no negatives at all. not even the cold weather could damp the spirit

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: voorheesians
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle during a business trip to Toronto. I'd made the reservation through a conference reservation agency approximately 4 months previously, reserving a higher-priced "corner king" that would afford me some more room. The front desk staff was very friendly and tried to be helpful, but stated that the "corner king" was unavailable. They couldn't lower the price, so they gave me a standard room "with a better view." I'm not sure that this was quite a "fair trade." The room was pleasant, nicely furnished, with plenty of workspace for my computer, paperwork, etc. The desk chair was comfortable, and there was a chaise lounge near the window that was also comfortable. The bed was "heavenly" - as advertised. The bathroom was modern, clean, with a good shower. The public areas of the hotel, however, were a disappointment. The halls were dark (with numerous fluorescent bulbs requiring replacement) and were very hot and musty-smelling. The ice machine was located in a dirty service hallway. The front entrance and lobby were dated and tired-looking, and could use a major upgrade. The multiple large "theater bulb" lights and fluorescent chandeliers looked very "early '80's" and didn't give the upscale feel that I have come to expect from Westin hotels. Room service was prompt, and the food quality was generally good. The soups were excellent, and the chicken caesar salad was superb. The "sirloin" burger, however, was TERRIBLE - spongy and tasteless. Overall, my stay was pleasant due to a well-appointed room with a lot of workspace. However, Starwood should spend some $$ upgrading the public areas to Westin standards.

Reviews.Title: “The 38th floor restaurant makes this hotel special!”
Reviews.Author: Thunderpunch
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It is located right on the waters edge and in the heart of downtown. When you stay here you are a quick walk or cab ride to lots of activities including Hockey Hall of Fame, CN Tower (could see this from my room), Toronto Entertainment District, Union Station, Island Ferry Terminal, and the Rogers Center. The rooms are spacious and clean. Staff friendly and helpful. I visited the pool and hot tub mostly because they were really nice with the added bonus of being included in the price of the room. There is an on-site spa but I didn't have time. Rats. I dined both evenings in their restaurant, Toula, on the 38th floor! I don't think you can beat it. The view of the town and the harbour is exquisite. Chris is the evening bartender and I must say he did an over-the-top job! Our entire group would return to the hotel just because of him! I would recommend the Lychee Martini and his special after dinner dessert shots. They are his secret blend and absolutely delicious! If you go make time to check out this restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: mazzaz
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to say this hotel was really excellent. The room we had overlooked Lake Ontario and we couldn't fault it. The hotel was really clean and the facilities were good, there was a swimming pool and jacuzzi that you could use free of charge. The conceirge was great and booked us into the CN Tower Restaurant no problem. The hotel's situation was right at the bottom of Yonge Street and for those of you who are ice hockey fans the stadium was literally a two minute walk. With regards to restaurants nearby it was a bit limited but we found a really good sports bar across the road very TGI's and there was also a supermarket should you need some midnight snacks. All in all a brilliant hotel to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “A Castle with a view”
Reviews.Author: Rhodesian
Reviews.Content: The Westin Harbour Castle is a large Two-tower building right next to the ferries going to unspoilt Toronto Islands. Toronto Downtown as such is lacking charm and the waterfront location at least gives You a beautiful vista to look out over when You wake up, thereby brightening up the day. In spite of staying during a very large conference I got a nice, large, full water view room at an acceptable rate. There was a minor maintenance issue but Gus, the front desk Officer and his superior, Scott, solved the problem in no time going above and beyond their duty in order that I would be satisfied. My rate included breakfast in-room for two even If I stayed as a single traveller and consequently I gained a couple of pounds in weight. In-room breakfast was always warm and well presented. The buffet breakfast was decent, but for some reason espresso was charged for. The hotel is kept in nice shape and the rooms renovated. Everything works, but it is of course not a charming boutique hotel. The only gripes I have is that You have to call housekeeping for a shoe shine instead of putting shoes outside Your door and that there is no Club floor for Starwood Gold and Platinum members. I will choose Westin Harbour Castle again for the next conference, if only for the fact that, if anything goes wrong, I know I can count of the problem being solved immediately, to my satisfaction, and with an added bonus to sweeten the deal!

Reviews.Title: “An impressive stay”
Reviews.Author: sonia_london
Reviews.Content: We were overwhelmed when we entered out hotel rooms! The view of the lake was breathtaking and we obtained an upgrade without paying extra. The room was well-equiped with starbucks coffee and a wide LCD TV screen which has a range of channels. We ordered a movie for $10; one of the nights. The breakfast is $25 for both hot and cold buffet. It is truly lush and covers everything from pancakes with maple syrup and hot English fry-up to a simple continental platter of cheese/meats. The array of fruits are ample and delicious. Location is ideal as you get the beautiful harbour scenery and walk into town is 10-15 mins away. As Toronto is fairly compact- you can walk everywhere. Taxi into Elm Street (many great dining places) cost around $8. The passion for customer service at the Westin Harbour Castle Group is evident. I informed them of an incident occuring when calls were being put through of friends/family. My concern was taken on board and investigated. The matter was handled in a professional manner and resolved shortly. I am utterly impressed with the level of service I have received and would stay with the Hotel on another visit. Thank you making our stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Wins!”
Reviews.Author: ChinoLoco
Reviews.Content: This is truly a Westin Hotel! Fantatsic service, a beautiful room with an awesome view, fantastic food, awesome location. No complaints. **ATTENTION TO THOSE WITH ALLERGIES TO DOWNE: You Must request hypoallergenic bedding. Pillows and blankets are downe!

Reviews.Title: “Pampering of the hotles of days gone by but all the modern convenienes”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJock
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Every detail is taken care of. From the lavish morning fruits and juices to the Westin Workout Facility, this is the place for leisure. When traveling on business I recommend the Westin Harbour Castle. In the morning when I need to make a presentation I have had a full, restful nightâ€™s sleep. I have energy food items and everyone greets me by name. This is truly a hotel of days of long ago yet with all the modern conveniences. On each of my visits I am treated like royalty. The hospitality services know how to cater to the working man and a working stay. At the end of a long day it is enjoyable to get a haircut and shoeshine. I recommend the pool, the spa and take full advantage of all the pampering that the Westin Harbour provides.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gobluegirl
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Castle was a nice spot to rest our heads after a long days of baseball watching, shopping, eating and drinking. It was located right on the Harbour and was within walking distance of the Rogers Center, Starbucks and more then a few bars and restaurants. I went for a jog in the morning starting out by the hotel and ending up a ways down, I thought the Harbour itself was a bit dirty and needed to be cleaned up. That is no reflection on the hotel, just an observation. The room itself was very roomy with a nice view, the beds and pillows were very comortable. The bathroom was very roomy as well with a nice massaging shower head. The staff was very accomadating and the concierge was very knowledgeable. I thought the bar was a bit pricey and would elect to go to the sports bar across the street. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Harbour Castle and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip in junior suites with fantastic views from the huge windows. The rooms were bright, spacious and well equipped and the staff was friendly. We had good suppplies of tea and Starbucks coffee in our room. We didn't eat in the restaurant though we had a meal in a private room as part of our business trip and the food was mediocre. My only quibble with this lovely hotel was that there was always a wait to speak to a member of reception staff due to the large number of guests and relatively few reception staff. If you want somewhere central then this hotel is a little out of the way, but it's still only a 15 min walk to the central Yonge/Dundas area or $11 with tip in a cab to the University.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Avid_Traveller_101
Reviews.Content: I actually live in Toronto and have gone to this hotel all my life for the pool alone. Let me explain further. The pool is the largest and deepest pool I know of for a downtown hotel in Toronto and it can't be beat. Ever since I was 8 years old I always went here through a pool membership. Every time I passed by when a door was open, I saw how beautiful the rooms were. For some reason, almost every time I passed by a door, a lot of people ordered room service. The view of the lake and islands is simply beautiful. Seriously, if I had all the money in the world and I had my choice of staying at any hotel I'd pick the Westin on Queens Quay, or perhaps the Royal York Hotel on Front Street. Four Seasons is highly expensive and over rated IMO. One disadvantage is it's location is far from the action, but you are honestly within a ten minute walk from the subway and you are beside the largest liquor store in Toronto, also a ten minute walk. Good for the party crowd. You are also beside a few nightclubs, The Guvernment, Kool Haus and The Docks. I also love the ramp style outer lobby. Reminds of a Vegas style exterior. Can't comment on the hotel restaurants but if you take the subway you can get to several on King St, super fast. Only one subway stop from the hotel. It's also quite close to the ACC and Skydome, a.k.a. Rogers Centre, so if you are going to catch a sporting event,the Westin can't be beat. This is a great hotel to stay at during the spring or summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, but with issues”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here in April and, due to some issues on which Iâ€™ll elaborate, stayed in two different rooms. First, the positives. The people are great. From the parking valet to the housekeeping people, everyone was polite, engaging, and â€“ as I expect at a Westin â€“ make guests feel at home. The hotel has a nice bar and lounge and a couple of restaurants. We enjoyed snacks in the lounge one afternoon and found them fresh and well-prepared. We did not, however, didnâ€™t try either restaurant, opting to enjoy some of Torontoâ€™s other culinary offerings. We spent the additional $30 a night to upgrade to a lakeview room and were not disappointed. The views were stunning. And the Heavenly beds were, well, heavenly. On the down side, both rooms (3223 and 2922) had noise issues. Both seemed to have â€œwet wallsâ€� and the sound of water running through pipes was almost a constant, even throughout the night. I asked the desk clerk about the noise when asking for a different room but neither she nor her manager was able to tell me whether it was a factor in every room or just certain rooms. Not good. Also, the hotelâ€™s waterfront location means a walk of several blocks to the nearest subway station or the underground PATH â€“ a system of subterranean walkways to keep pedestrians out of the weather. The location is not an issue during the day when weather is good, but itâ€™s a little dodgy at night (unless there are crowds attending a game at the nearby stadium). That said, a $5 cab ride will quickly get you into the heart of the action. All told, the Westin Harbour Castle was not my favourite Westin.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Westin Harbour Castle”
Reviews.Author: nicaribbean
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms via hotwire.com and got a really great rate. We were returning guests from 10 years ago but I had forgotten how great this hotel was. Check-in was fast and we were eager to check out our rooms. They put us on the 28th floor. Our rooms were one next to the other. Our rooms were tucked in a corner. We could close off the corridor door and leave our room doors open (better than adjoining in my opinion). The views of the harbour was amazing. The rooms are very nice and somewhat modern in style. The beds were very comfortable. A few extra touches makes this place a notch better than most hotels like their heavenly beds, the wonderful showerhead and quality toiletries. The staff were all very nice, especially Mr. Steeves. The hotel is not too far from Union station, which connects you to the whole downtown area by subway. You can walk to Yonge street, it starts right next to the hotel. It's location is very handy to downtown. If you go to this hotel, you must go up to the 35th floor and catch the views from up there when it's dark. Incredible!!! We had a fabulous time and this hotel is by far the best we have stayed in in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: nctrips
Reviews.Content: We picked the Harbour Castle for a girls weekend. We contacted the hotel direct and received wonderful service and a very good deal on our room, lakeview room with two double beds. Upon arriving, we were a little disappointed with the mandatory valet and bell boy service. We would rather have unpacked and parked the car ourselves. Just a convenience for us. Check in was fairly quick and courteous. Our room was lovely, great view. But only one comfy chair to sit in to enjoy the view. Large water stain on the carpet. There was only one bathrobe. The next morning, our facecloths, hand towels and glasses were not replenished. We ran out of toilet paper. Thank goodness for the kleenex box. We did talk to a housekeeping lady and she told us to call a number. The "heavenly" beds felt like a normal bed. It was worth being the 15 minute walk to downtown for the view. These are all little things, but the hotel could easily improve in them. We will look for somewhere else to stay for next year's girls w/e. The hotel spa was well worth the $$. We had the Re-energizing trio.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, no disapointment”
Reviews.Author: ShaggyNottingham_UK
Reviews.Content: Well, what an extremely pleasant stay we had here, 4 nights here and what a pleasure it was. After a very long day, a delayed long haul flight, followed by a connecting flight we finally arrived in Toronto about 8.00pm ish local time. The bus to the hotel was easy and straight forward and dropped us off right outside. The hotel checkin staff were polite, friendly and effecient in there works and the lobby area to us was fine. The first night we ate in the bar area as it was late when we arrived and the food was served hot and delicious, the staff were friendly and looked after us. The room was fantastic, the bed was huge which was great for a good nights sleep. The room and the bathroom was very clean on arrival and was kept this way throughout our stay, it was nice to actually have a coffee machine in the room to make yourself a coffee in the morning. We had a problem with the safe being locked when we got to the room, no problem for us, reception sent us a security chap up to resolve this within minutes. The location of the hotel for us was fine, we walked everywhere with the ACC in walking distance for us (we had tickets for a Maple Leafs Game), the CN tower and to walk up Yongue Street was ideal!! All staff were pleasant and were pleased to help you if needed, no pressure from bell-boys to use them and no hassle. We also walked to the exhibition centre and to be honest wasn't that far, however would recommend wooly hats and gloves if its cold as the wind off the lake is chilling but a great walk!! Recommend the sports bar next to the hockey hall of fame for food and friendliness also if you manage a trip. Would definately return to Toronto and would have no hesitation in booking and staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “expensive ammenities”
Reviews.Author: atlanta91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Excellent rooms, pool, exercise area, lobby, restaurants. The add on costs were ridiculous. The internet was $10 per day. It was $2 to make a phone call to a 1-800 calling card #. This is stuff that should be included in such an expensive room. (over $200 per night)

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay at the Westin Harbour Castle”
Reviews.Author: notacokefan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a convention for work. The lobby is a little dated but the rooms are very relaxing and offer a great view of Lake Ontario and Toronto Island. Gotta love those heavenly beds! They also have a little bit of a larger shower area which is great for people like me! As well as dual shower heads called the heavenly shower. While the parking was a little bit hectic because of the number of people arriving the bellman quickly put my luggage on a cart and handed me a ticket. Mike checked me in and I mentioned I was really looking forward to being able to spend some time by myself, relax, and pamper myself. Later on when I was coming back from a swim I entered my room and found a card, a miniature Bailey's with a miniature glass and a glass of chocolate almonds waiting for me on a tray with little flowers. The card was a message from the check-in agent wishing my stay be enjoyable and that he thought a bed-time treat might help. Wow! I highly recommend this hotel and I hope your stay is as great as mine was. Although it is downtown it is not right in the heart of the shopping area and it gets very cold outside. I am already making plans to come back in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, very nice Westin... not the best locale...”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: I had two nights here in late January, as I was presenting to a professional conference. First impressions were of a serially renovated lobby, with two room towers rising above. Not sure when this was constructed, but the lobby design, even with very nice renovations, shows itâ€™s age. Check-in, via an SPG Elite lane was fast, and I was upgraded (Iâ€™m SPG Gold) to a very, very nice room. I was in the tower nearest the check-in desk. The way this tower is structured, there seem to be two wedge-shaped rooms on each floor which have terrific spaceâ€¦ On the 10th floor, they were 1024 and 1019. These are quasi-corner rooms, with a LOT of extra space. The room held both a settee and a chair, as well as desk, King bed, and low dresser with large flatscreen TV. There was an adjoining room door in my room, and I could hear everything the folks next door were saying. That was annoying. Internet access was fast and solid. There was free Starbucks in the room, along with free bottled water. The room had the requisite Heavenly Bed and Heavenly Bath, and was sparkling clean. I had windows across two full walls (of the five walls in the room) which was really niceâ€¦ Spectacular view of the lake, just gorgeous. I grabbed a cup of Starbucks in the lobby en route to my conference, and was stunned at the prices for orange juice and coffee. In the evening, I met with some colleagues for drinks, and found the bar wine prices to be far more reasonable (ounce for ounce) than the coffee. Nice wine list in the bar, with a good many VQAs available. I had one meal at The Mizzen, their generic restaurant, and was delighted with a seafood on pasta dish. I explained to the waiter that I needed to eat and head out quickly, and he delivered my meal as fast as I could have hoped. Not spectacular from a â€œlook and feelâ€� standpoint, but great service and excellent food. Check-out was fast and the bill was accurate. Location was fine for me, as they had shuttles running to/from the conference I was attending. It is not centrally located for the business district, and would need a couple of blocks hikeâ€¦ and not connected to PATH, so in January, that might be a bit unpleasant. I had a group rate here, so that worked well for me and my business here. Do I go back? Probably not. The excellent room, and the good staff is not enough to offset the distance from Front Street and the CBDâ€¦ especially in the winter. If you have business downtown, you might still be better off at the Royal York, the Intercon, the Renaissance SkyDome, or (with a PATH hike) the Marriott Eaton. Summertime and this would be less of an issue, but I didnâ€™t think the surrounding neighbourhood was the best. To be clear, you wonâ€™t mistake this for the Park Hyatt/Four Seasons area. All that said, if you get a good rate here, and distance isnâ€™t a concern, this is a really solid hotel. If you donâ€™t value a Grande Dame like the Royal York, youâ€™d be happier here or the Intercon.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carlton79
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Westin Harbour Castle. Checkin was easy and quick. I though the lobby was a bit sterile and not very welcoming. Room on the 20th floor had a great view of the water and the CN Tower. Furniture and decor were very dark and the room could have done with a bit more in the way of lighting - it was difficult to see what you were doing when packing and unpacking, but otherwise it was fine. Room was nice and warm. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. There was an interconnecting door to the next room and I did hear next door's TV a bit as a result. One of the lifts/elevators was noisy in operation and I could hear it from the room, even though it wasn't that close. The bathroom was modern, but small and with one of those tiny baths, which seems to be the norm in these large hotels. The shower had two heads, which was a little strange, but it worked well and had good pressure. Plenty of nice soft towels provided. I didn't have dinner in the restaurant, but I did order room service - I don't remember exactly what, some sort of sandwich - it turned up in around 20 minutes and was good. Breakfast buffet was average, though. The gym was well above average for a hotel, with plenty of cardio machines and lots of free weights. The pool was big and looked good, but I didn't use it. Would I stay here again? Yes I would - in spite of some of the negatives, it was comfortable and I enjoyed my stay. It's certainly one of the best hotels I've stayed in in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a luxury hotel; hidden charges galore”
Reviews.Author: symbiosis379
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'll start with the compliments. The Westin Harbour Castle is a modern, aesthetically pleasing hotel situated right on the waterfront in Toronto. You'll probably get a pleasant view, whether you're facing the lake or the city's bustling skyline. All of the expected conveniences of a major luxury hotel are available on-site. But you'll probably read all of that glowing praise in the other reviews here. Now, for the less sparkling review. Unless you're booking on Priceline, you can expect to pay $200+ for any room in this hotel. This is not surprising for a Westin, but the charges don't end there. Other reviews noted the $30/day valet parking. Let me describe some other charges: internet access ($10.65 per day and per computer), business centre computer access ($0.25/min), local and toll-free calls ($2 each with additional charges after 60 min), and buffet breakfast ($26), to name a few. Even the refrigerator was locked...presumably you have to pay to use that, too. Basically, with our $250+ room rate, we got an average size room, 2 double beds, a "partial" lake/city view, a flat-screen LCD TV (which actually shows no HD channels), and a modern decor bathroom with a loose toilet seat. Everything else was an additional charge. Those of you who have ever worked in the hospitality industry know that the profit margins for hotels like this is already extremely high. Is it necessary to then nickel-and-dime the customer for every modern convenience that would otherwise be available for free at some other business class hotels? By the way, I'd also like to agree with another reviewer that many of the staff were rather snobby. Generally, the people of Toronto are very warm and friendly, probably moreso than any US city I've visited, so I'll have to say that many of the staff at the Westin were the coldest people I met in Toronto (with the exception of the housekeeper, who got a nice tip from us for being so kind). Also, they had a strange "security" and "no entertaining" policy for New Years Eve, where people who were not registered in the room were not allowed up to the guest rooms after a certain time - not even when accompanied by a registered guest. There was no warning of this policy until when we checked in. I think it was instituted not as a security measure, but more for the benefit of some of the stodgy old people who stay in hotels like this and expect to leave their new years parties promptly at 12:30 and be in bed by 1:00. I must admit that I haven't stayed in enough luxury hotels to know if the above issues are typical, but if they are, I'll stick with midrange and business class hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic retreat in the city.”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: I have yet to stay in a Westin hotel and have any problems. The Harbour Castle is no exception. Everything about the hotel is top quality and the rooms are well decorated with nice views of Lake Ontario and the Toronto Island. Parking can get pretty tight when the hotel is at capacity, so we had to park a block away near the Toronto Star building, but the walk wasn't really that bad. There is a condo building to the right and across the street that has an outstanding Japanese restaurant you should try out! I would have never found out about this place had it not been for my walking excursion to the public parking lot! There are no surprises here at this facility and I would recommend the hotel for a romantic escape for the weekend. The hotel is also well situated if you plan on taking in a hockey game at the Air Canada Centre. In the summer months, the area is much more attractive and Queens Quay is just down the street. If you visit during the summer, make sure to bring some roller blades. If you plan on doing more in the city and are mostly getting around by foot, then I would suggest that there are better options in terms of location. But if you want to get away from it all, then the Westin can be a good choice because it is right on the water. The Westin is as consistent as ever, and you will enjoy your stay, as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaysfan21
Reviews.Content: Ever since ive been to Toronto ive wanted to try this hotel. I went with my wife and 2 friends and was not disappointed. I had a room overlooking Lake Ontario which was awesome and clean too. Check-in was nice, the valet service a little slow. We were able to get a taxi to Eaton Centre pretty quick though. One of the best parks about this hotel is the pool. When in Toronto check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Westin Harbour Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sukyee28
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days late Nov 2007. We got a room on the 15th floor with 2 double beds. The room is small but clean and houskeeping always left extra towels for our 1 year old son. The room is sized really more for 2 people than 3. We had a view of the water but also the roof of the other buildings. The nice thing about this hotel is that it is near the waterfront so the view is great. HOWEVER, the hotel is very far from the sites and there aren't very many choices to choose from for a place to eat. This hotel is in a great locale for a business traveler but for a tourist, you are better off staying elsewhere. We valet parked our car because the self park though is significantly cheaper is not anywhere on the property. It is in a parking lot several blocks away and you cannot come and go at any time. The walls of the hotel are thin as the last night we were there, the people next door were quite loud. They were having a get together in their room and we heard their entire conversation.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: Holnek
Reviews.Content: First of all, definitely use priceline to book it if you're on a budget...I got my $300 room for $80 :D In every aspect, this hotel is excellent 5 stars!!! It's ideally situated in the heart of downtown Toronto, minutes away from the subway system with buses nearby. If you're driving in town like I did, you can always use the $30 valet service, but I'd say do self-parking for $17, or use one of the lots next door for $10 or $5 for a 12-hour overnight parking (usually 7 pm - 7 am). You are close to tons of good restaurants, within 2 blocks from the Richtree Market (go check it out!, it's like Marche's in Boston). Now, inside the hotel: the hotel is very nice, with a state-of-the-art gym (Reebok gym), large pool that's great for kids, friends, or couples, hot tub, spa, among other things (open 10 am - 11 pm I think). The rooms are awesome - u simply can't beat the Westin's Heavenly bed...just heavenly, nothing more nothing less. All basic rooms come standard with a 32" plasma/flat screen TV, with all the amenities you'll need (e.g. refrigerator, starbucks coffee, etc.). You will not regret staying here (and I went during a snow storm too). By the way, I recommend this place for couples and families. If you're traveling with friends, I can see how people can get annoyed if you're having late-nite drinking parties (although I could not hear my neighbors whatsoever).

Reviews.Title: “Grey Cup Weekend. Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaDevine
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in town for the Grey Cup. We enjoyed this hotel thoroughly. The room was very clean and had a flat screen T.V. facing the lake on the 6th floor in the south tower. The pillow top beds were very comfortbale and we also enjoyed the turn down service. The only complaint I would have is the bath tub filled up to your ankles when taking a shower, so there is obviously some type of plumbing issues with the drains. Otherwise no issues. Although the hotel was packed full of Grey Cup fans and housed the winning Saskatchewan team, I was never disturbed at night by any noise. I was very surprised as I was certain I would not be getting much sleep as a result of the festivities. So this attests to excellent management. We dined Saturday evening at Toula ( fine dining) which is located on the 38th floor and offers spectacular views of TO. We also enjoyed the CN tower light show that happens Fridays and Saturday nights from the conveniece of our table. Food was amazing and service also excellent. Good wine selection. Breakfast at Mitzen ( located on the lobby floor) offered a spectacular breakfast buffet, made to order omlettes, eggs, selection of fruits and sweets, cheese, breads, salads and chocolate fountain to dip strawberries! Fast service, which is exactly what you need in the morning and for business travellers. The Bar/Lounge was also very relaxing and offered pub fare and cocktails. Large wing back chairs a nice touch. Room Service was also fast and excellent. Food was hot and well presented. I also took advantage of the Spa located in the north tower. They have an array of services for ladies and men. They also will provide massage service in your room for those whom prefer not to go down to the spa. Hotel also offers a pool and excercise room. The location is also amazing. 3 blocks from Union station, minutes to many attractions CN tower, Rogers Center, basically across the street from Toronto Maple Leafs for hockey fans. Taxis always available. I would reccomend this hotel to families, business travellers and couples looking for a relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: idontemail
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 11/9-11/13 for Hall of Fame weekend. The room was very nice. There were 4 of us, so it was a little small for our purposes, but I didn't get the impression that this was a hotel that really catered to families even before I booked it. It is the official hotel of the Hockey Hall of Fame, so we hoped to see some hockey players during the big weekend, and we did. It was also a very short walk to both the Air Canada center and the hockey hall of fame. The room was very clean and modern, the heavenly bed was definitely heavenly. The double shower head was real nice too. They have starbucks coffee supplied for the in-room coffee as well. The flat screen tv was also awesome (though they didn't get the induction ceremony on any of their channels!) When we arrived, we were prepared to pay the $30 parking fee per day, but the lot was full. We were sent to a public parking lot about 3 minutes away, which was actually better at only $10/day and we could see our car from our hotel window. Pool and hottub were very nice. We didn't eat in the restaurant, so I can't comment on that. All in all, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Everything”
Reviews.Author: zngcat369
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my first trip to Canada, while attending a convention. The location is excellent. We were given a room with a beautiful view of the lake. The hotel is walking distance from public transportation (the subway is just a few blocks away), many restaurants, and the Yonge Street shopping district. There is a small grocery store a couple of blocks down the street, for those who like to keep food/drinks in the room. The room itself was nice enough. Standard furniture (bed, table, desk, etc), in good condition. The room was clean. The flat-screen TV was nice, and we got channels from both Toronto and Buffalo. The cable didn't work for a few hours one day, but we were notified in advance. (And who stays in the room all day anyway?) The only disappointment was not having a refrigerator. The bathroom was very nice and modern-looking. The dual showerheads were a nice touch, although the tub was a bit small. We didn't sample the restaurant, but the catering was good. Overall, a good experience. I would definitely stay here again. Can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: anlo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the last night of our trip. It was clearly the most expensive hotel, but the experience was great with just one exception. We got a room on the 25th floor in the north tower (normally it would have been 'partial harbour view', which is not very attractive because you do not see much of the harbour and more of an ugly power plant), but we were fortunate to get a corner room with additional windows facing downtown and offering a wonderful view of theToronto skyline. We were afraid that it might be noisy at night because the Gardiner Expressway was just in front of us, but this was not the case. The room was surprisingly quiet, it seems they have good sound-proof windows. The beds were really 'heavenly', everything was clean and efficient, but you had to pay for Internet access. Best of all was the breakfast buffet, we chose the continental one, and the selection was really great, and for the first time in Canada 4-5 different types of delicious cheese were on offer. Obviously they are more geared towards the international traveller. In additon, lots of fresh fruit, yoghurt and good and strong Starbucks coffee. What we did not like was the parking situation. We arrived at around 4.30 p.m. and first had to wait in a queue in the drive leading up to the garage. When we had arrived at the unloading point, we had to unload our luggage very quickly (we had many different items, so it was a nuisance), the car key was taken away from us, and before we were fully aware of the situation the valet was off with the car. Only then did we notice that our mobile GPS was still in the car and still turned on. It took us some effort to convince the people that they had to bring back the car so that we could properly de-install our GPS. Apart from this somewhat hectic start the stay in the hotel was a pleasant conclusion of our trip through Eastern Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Bland”
Reviews.Author: matts99
Reviews.Content: Average for the price. The usual bland business hotel, and particularly snobby staff. The rooms are nice enough but lack somewhere suitable to eat. The bar is bland and has a suprisingly small selection of food. Location is away from public transportation and there is a short walk to downtown sights. Fine for business travel but would not choose to stay here for personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyMcNamee
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night on a flying visit through Toronto, but was very happy with what I got. We ended up in a plush, modern, 30th floor room with a nice view over Lake Ontario. Could have absolutely no complaints about the room whatsoever - in fact the bed was as comfortable as any I have stayed in. Staff were genuine and helpful. The hotel is in a fair enough location, and is easily found coming off the QEW interstate. There is not a whole big pile to do in the immediate vicinity (Coco Berry does a good breakfast), but it is only about 10 minutes walk from the entertainment district, and possibly a little bit more to the Skydome/CN Tower. My only problem was the parking arrangements. They recommend parking a block and a half away ($17 per night) of use the valet service ($30 per night). The first option isn't really an option if you've any sort of luggage, so make sure you add the $30 into the real cost of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: wwills
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin during a company conference for about three days. The Westin is situated right on the lake, just north of the center of downtown. It's within walking distance of the BlueJays baseball stadium and the CN Tower. Toronto is a very walkable town, with a mall underground, etc. The hotel itself was in average condition. The room I was staying in was rather unique, located on the 5th floor just down from the fitness center. I looked out just one floor above street level without a view of the lake. The room I was in was rather large, but others I was traveling with indicated their rooms were average sized. The fitness center is very nice with updated equipment, an indoor swimming pool and a spa. The rooms were generally clean and in good shape. There were a number of defects in the caulking, painting, etc. that made it look like someone did a slipshod job in trying to refurbish the room. The rooms have central A/C and heat, though the A/C would not cool my room below about 76 degrees F. (I like it cold!) There is a minibar/fridge and a desk area. Internet is available, but it's about $12 per night. I used it and it worked well. There is a safe, an ironing board, etc. the usual fare. All the rooms have large flat screen TV's that are very nice, but in my case, because the room was so long and narrow, it was situated quiet far from the bed. The lobby is very nice, with a bar and a restaurant and a helpful concierge. Walking up to the hotel from the street can be rather tough because you end up walking up the driveway where cars are pulling out. Across the street is a sportsbar that serves reasonable food. All indoors are non-smoking in Ontario at this point, so the dining was pleasant. There is also an outdoor mall across the street where you can by food and refreshments for your room. Room service was okay - but of course, expensive. As a snack I ordered the cheese and fruit plate and it was very good. The staff was generally friendly and checkin/checkout was easy. The meeting accommodations seemed a bit dated and worn. The all glass walls looking out onto the lake were very dirty, the ceiling tiles were stained, and a lot of the paint near the A/C vents and other areas of the ceiling was chipped or completely gone. If you looked around, things looked in rather rough shape in the meeting rooms (which are mainly across the street, connected by a walkway). There is a bus that runs from the airport to the hotel. It's about $25 per person round trip and takes about 30 minutes each way. It runs about every 30 mins. Good news is that it's the first stop after you leave the airport, and the airport is the first stop when you leave the hotel. The bus ride was comfortable and safe. I would recommend this as a family place to stay, if you wanted to be downtown and convenient to the downtown Toronto attractions. For business meetings, it was okay but again, what I noticed, and the comments I heard were that it's a bit long in the tooth.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTripmaster
Reviews.Content: My experience in this hotel was terrible. I live in Toronto and my relatives came from Japan to visit me and stay for a week in Toronto. I made a reservation through Westin official website 2months prior to their arrival. I asked for a room with two double beds. Few days before arrival, I made a phone call for reconfirm my reservation. On the day of arrival, when I went to the front desk for check-in around 11pm, the receptionist told me that there is no room with two beds left. They had only one, single room and any other rooms were full. The single room turned out to be pullout bed from a couch and the extra bed was extremely narrow. I couldnâ€™t believe it! How the guests from Japan can take a rest? And I was embarrassed in front of my guests because of this hotelâ€™s mistake. I went to front desk to complain, but her attitude was not professional at all. I know it isnâ€™t her fault, but she said that, because I checked in so late, there is no guarantee for the room I want. So why did I make a reservation? If they have â€˜first come, first serveâ€™ policy, they should have put in their website, so that I wouldnâ€™t have chosen this hotel. I do not want to call this place â€˜hotelâ€™ because hotel means hospitality, and I didnâ€™t see any hospitality in them at all. And this hotelâ€™s impression equals Canadaâ€™s impression to my Japanese guests. This hotel should have known that they represent entire Canada or Canadian people. I certainly would never go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Only For The Uncosmopolitan”
Reviews.Author: 1111NewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and child stayed here with me for three nights. It was not what we hoped for. The entrance to valet looked like a horribly lit Vegas casino. Our car was scratched during it's return from the valet on the last day. The place is huge and unpersonable. Generic furniture and generic service. We're from Manhattan so being in a place where you felt as chaotic inside (restaurant and waiting area) as you did outside was not much of a vacation. The room was cramped with two double beds and the bathrooms are overstylized but the final result is unimaginative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tac1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of nights recently and have no complaints. I did not eat, workout, etc. there at all so I can only really comment on the room itself. I had a room on the 30th floor overlooking the lake...it was huge with a chaise lounge and large bed. Everything was very clean and there was a large flat screen tv, mini bar and coffee/tea. Westin's are always nice and this is no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Location Good For Familes, Maybe Not As Good for Others”
Reviews.Author: 77Man
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin Habour Castle recently. I was "upgraded" as SPG Member to an upper floor room with a full lakeview. It was a very nice room, with a flatscreen television and updated furnishings. Bedding was "Westin Heavenly Bed", as typical for Westin properties. Staff was very friendly. If I had one complaint, it is that I found the location to a bit isolated. The hotel is directly attached to the Toronto Harbor Islands ferry terminal, and within walking distance of the CN Tower. But it's quite a long walk to the "trendier" neighborhoods downtown and north of downtown. So if you are interested in the "waterfront" activities (including the Harbor Islands, as well as various amusement parks, etc), it's a great hotel. But I might stay at Four Seasons next time given its proximity to shopping and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: paluvsnyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. Rooms small, but beds were very comfortable. Nice LCD TV. Air conditioning didn't seem to cool the room or hallways, until staff had to come up to open our door because they deactivated our room card. After he left area seemed to get cooler. Location was okay short walk to ballpark and CN Tower, but a much longer walk to anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view of Lake Ontario”
Reviews.Author: bexcy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights as it was near to a clinic that my partner was visiting. The reception is very grand and there were several lifts which were very fast. The room had an excellent view of Lake Ontario and the bed was possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Didn't eat in the hotel as it was VERY expensive. Instead we ate out. The meal at the top of the CN Tower was fantastic and very romantic! The gym was small but again, looked out onto the lake. It served its purpose but he website photos make it look better than it actually is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent-Great Location-Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: bolityzo
Reviews.Content: We (husband, two kid aged 5 & 7) spent three nights in Toronto during our road trip from DC. I booked it via Hotwire and spent less than $100/night including taxes and fees. The hotel was excellent. First, the location is perfect for us. The ferry to Toronto Island was behind us. We walked to the CN Tower in 15-20 minutes. We took the tram to the CNE and Ontario Place - the kids enjoyed the tram ride. The stop was right near the hotel. Since we got it via Hotwire, didn't expect a view. However, we did get a partial view of the harbor. We also drove to other areas in downtown, Chinatown and Markham to meet friends. The drive was fairly easy. We used valet parking which was $20/day. As in all Westin Hotel, the room is clean, comfortable and offers a sense of luxury. The swimming pool is of very good size and they always seem to have the best swimming pools. The gym had such great views and equipment that almost motivated me to exercise but just for the lack of time, we didn't. The stay was unbelievable cheap ... the only thing that shocked us at first was the taxes and taxes ... and fees. The valet parking per night ended up to be much more than $20 due to taxes and more taxes. I will say the parking is a must if you have a car. There seems to be some problems with the valet when we were there. Sometimes the car was delivered pretty quickly and sometimes you left a message and when you got down there, they forgot you were supposed to pick up the car. Of course, their attitude was always very apologetic in those situations. It is not a hotel that gives you a warm and fuzzy customer service feeling. It is after all a business hotel. The service is prompt and professional. I will highly recommend it whether it is a Hotwire deal or not.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish room and great view”
Reviews.Author: ThemisBacchus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and enjoyed the room very much. We stayed in the South Tower on the 34th floor and had a view of both lake Ontario and the CN tower. The room itself is a welcome relief from the outdated gaudy flowery decor of the average city hotel. It was spacious, clean, and relaxing on the eye, which is really what one looks for in short term accommodation. The bed is really very comfortable. We used the pool as well which is clean and pleasant overall, though a bit small than it appears in the website photos. The staff very quite friendly, though they did forget to deliver something up to our room... luckily nothing important. The one thing we were not quite impressed with for the price was the shower - the pressure was not great, and it was very slow to drain. Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: volatileagent
Reviews.Content: Great experience all around. The view was extraordinary and the staff very helpful. The rooms were clean and beds comfortable. The cleaning staff are so efficient! I remember the clean white bed sheets and not waking up with back pain. I was at hotel with my family for a meeting and we will go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Deserving of all Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: winter-schminter
Reviews.Content: I will start off my review with a disclaimer. I booked this hotel through Priceline.com bidding and only paid $70 US a night for it. As a result I didn't expect to receive the best room with the best view, but I was wrong. We drove to Toronto from Michigan and when we arrived we were tired and ready for a shower. The valets took care of our car and we were checked in and up to our room less than 5 minutes after arriving. Our room was number 2815 in the south tower. It had a partial view of the harbor and going east down Queen Quay. The best of both worlds! Westin recently switched to a total non smoking hotel, but the room we were in was obviously a former smoking room. It smelled faintly of it which did not bother us. However, if you are sensitive to smoke you should request a former non-smoking room. The decor of the room was modern (which is my taste) and everything is well appointed. The linens both bed and bath were better than average and the TV was lovely. The dark wood contrasting with the white linens was very appealing. While I have stayed in larger hotel rooms there was still plenty of room for the 2 of us. We did take advantage of the pool and hot tub. Both are larger and nicer than average. While there my husband did have a 50 minute deep tissue massage and said it was the best one he has ever had. The lobby bar was a nice stop on the way up to our room. The piano player on Friday is an excellent jazzman and his rendition of "Take 5" is beautiful. The location of the hotel is perfect for us. The harbor district is developing and there are a lot of things to do, see and eat while walking the few blocks. We took the boat tour around the harbor and islands and it was great to see the skyline from that vantage point. When I am visiting a city I walk a lot. The CN tower, Rogers Centre, the Entertainment District, Hockey Hall of Fame, The Esplanade, and Union Station are all a 5-15 minutes walk of the hotel. Like any big city Toronto has a public transportation system and it is run efficiently and is safe. The trip was a lot of fun and the hotel a wonderful place to consider our "home base".

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hn_Ng
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be Hilton Hotel according to the bell man :=) when we chated about Paris Hilton... Got excellent price from hotwire.com. I have to called the Hotel and confirm for the two beds as I specified from the hotwire.com option. The hotel front desk said the the room booked had a king bed only but was super helpful and confirmed the room with two beds right away. Therefore if you booked with hotwire.com and you have a party of 4, please beware and confirm. We stayed here for 6 nights. The hotel is very clean. The room was recently upgraded with LCD screen TV just like in the pictures. The room was design with contemporary taste. Bath room is super clean. Staff from front desk and especially at the concierge desk was awesome! If you rent a car and don't want to pay for 30$ a night at the hotel, go to other parkings toward the right of the hotel paid 10$ for 12 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SarahandJames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights in August with our two teenage boys. The rooms were large and clean. We stayed on the 33rd floor which I wouldnt recommend if you have any issues with heights. They placed us next door to our boys and our rooms had views of the harbour and the city. The hotel was much larger than we thought and clearly mostly a business hotel. The facilities were good with a large pool , tennis courts, spa and gym etc. There was a nice sun deck but no where to buy a drink whilst soaking up the sun. We didnt eat in the hotel because there were plenty of places near by. This hotel is on the harbour and very handy for the CN tower and other downtown attractions and right next door to the ferry for the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but partial to certain guests”
Reviews.Author: tiz78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin last week for 4 nights. Had a great view on the 32nd floor overlooking Lake Ontario. The hotel is very nice and clean. For the most part the staff is very professional, however, I left like less than a guest when I was cited for noise violations twice, for mere conversational chatter. The hotel manager even agreed the noise level was fine, but that he had to appease the guest that complained. As if I wasn't a guest. This was very upsetting that some guests seem to recieve preferential treatment. Other than that, I'd stay at the Westin again and definitely refer anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Swank”
Reviews.Author: MillenniManny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for four nights. This hotel is right on Lake Ontario, and the ferry to Centre Island (a playground of sorts with a beach, zoo and amusement park) is right behind the hotel. Most importantly, the hotel is part of the Toronto harborfront, which features many restaurants, stores and entertainment venues. My room was very modern and swank. It featured a flat panel television and a nice bathroom with granite countertops. There was also a desk and couch. The room size was ample but not large. The housekeeping staff did a solid job of maintaining the room, though there was one day when the room attendants appears to have stepped out and forgotten to return to finish! The hotel has athletic facilities that are better than most hotels. There is an indoor pool, half of which is as deep as 9 feet. It is wide enough for perhaps 4 laps, although it is not set up as a lap pool. There is also a large hottub and a fitness center that offers more considerably equipment than that of most hotels, in addition to a steamroom and sauna. There is a small coffee stand in the lobby that sells Starbuck's coffee and pastries if you want something quick in the morning. I was very pleased with this hotel and its service overall. I felt that I good value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrPsyd
Reviews.Content: This is your typical "Good" hotel. My wife and I were checked in on New Years Eve and were amazed at how efficient the service was. There was a long line of 10 people and we managed to be checked in within 7 minutes ( impressive for one of the busiest days). We were not fortunate enough to get a newly renovated room, so I was a little worried. The room we got instead was much bigger than a newly renovated room. The only feature this room lacked was a flat screen tv. The room was almost big enough to be a suite... there was a HUGE living area with coffee table, couches and tv. The bed as off to the side in a different area. The bathroom was big and clean. Plenty of room for two people to get ready and not bump into each other. They said the shower was a "heavenly shower" but we did not notice any difference. The bed was very comfortable and we slept very well. My only issue with the stay was unrelated with the actual place. Apparently I was charged for over $80 of alcohol, when we did not touch any of that stuff. I spoke to the managment and it was cleared up after a couple days. The location was a bit away from all the downtown action, but easy to get there via TTC ( public transportation)... Overall it was a good place with very little to complain about... However, it was fell just a little short of being an excellent place.

Reviews.Title: “at Westin room was clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: David_Mina
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Westin at Harbourfront. What a pleasure! Very comfortable bed, clean bedding, nice towels. Room was clean, bathroom was clean. We loved the location. Staff was very nice and friendly - we asked for some extra towels and got them in 3 minutes. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Westin Harbour Castle”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the Harbour so you easy access to the ferry going to Center Island. Although the hotel is not in the heart of downdown you are only about a 15 minute walk away from this area. My wife and I both love to walk around in a new city so this was not a problem for us. The room was well appointed with a very comfortable bed, and a renovated bathroom. The room was a very good size and we still had plenty of room to move around even after adding a crib for our 16 month old daughter. I did not eat at the hotel so I can not comment on the quality of the restaurants. The hotel staff were very helpful and courteous. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again on a future visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Love the Westin Beds”
Reviews.Author: ProSpotter
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Harbor area is like a special and different experience when visiting Toronto and this hotel is just the perfect location to experience and to take it this region and its varied offerings. It is in close walking distance of many attractions like the Hockey Hall of Fame, Harbor front shops, Art exhibits, flea market and ferry to the Islands. We even saw the National Canadian Ballet company practice at the outdoor theater for free. ( It is not close to the train station or the theaters, so it is worth the move to spend about 2-3 days in each of these neighborhoods at a different hotel to get a enhanced Toronto experience.) The restaurant on the first floor has a wonderful Sunday Brunch. Outside near the Harbor shops are some great street eats. It is close to the Marche Movenpick restaurant which is a unique adventure in eating in a market like setting. The views are spectacular. The hotel is in great shape and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family resort”
Reviews.Author: boxermom4
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Toronto to see the Hockey Hall of Fame as a college graduation present for my son. Hotel is in walking distance of Hall of Fame AND harbour side shops and restaurants. Our dog was even given a " heavenly" soft bed just like ours. Room faced the harbour and was delightful. Service was impeccable. Valet parking reasonable and they even allowed us to keep our car there until 3pm or so. After we had checked out. A delightful trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: maleekataher
Reviews.Content: When arriving to our room we were pleasently surprised with the modern plush room that awaited us.The bed was so comfortable, fantastic plasma tv screen. Great view onto the lake too.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: nydragon
Reviews.Content: I bid this through priceline for $100 plus taxes. Not bad for a 4 star hotel. But I saw some people bid for $75. Any way, it is located at the far end of the harbor. The best feature of my room was the view of the harbor. It was spectacular to see the ferries leaving underneath the hotel and sail boats on the harbor.ITt was a short walk to the nearby restaurants, but we did not want to leave the room, just chilled and let the time pass away. The bed was comfy with deluxe linen. Great flat screen tv despite not very big. Bathroom and towels were quite clean. No wireless internet. The alcohol beverages were expensive. We did not drink . But there was a big liquor market near the hotel if you want to save some money. One bad thing was it was recently renovated. What I mean that I could actually smell really strong ordor from paint. I did not have any problem with allergy but other people might. The staff was decent. Parking fee was expensive more than $20/ day but you can park at nearby lots for $10 Overall it was not that bad. I would stay there again after the paint smell gone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views and excellent room”
Reviews.Author: mrsje
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday travelling on the Queen Mary2 to NY with two nights in New York and two nights in Toronto. The accommodation was part of a package - I did not research the hotels as I usually do - and after experiencing a ghastly hotel in New York our hopes were not high for Toronto. However the Westin Harbour Castle was excellent and made up for the previous New York accommodation. We had a beautiful room, on the 21st floor, it was huge and spotless and overlooked Lake Ontario. The bed was heavenly - so comfortable. We have previously stayed in a Westin hotel in Vancouver which seemed huge and soulless, but this was a lot better with a nice, popular bar area with charming staff. The breakfast was good and we enjoyed a dinner in the restaurant with a lovely friendly waiter in attendance. My only crtitism with the hotel is the trouble we had with the safe being permanently locked, and the front desk staff. On arrival I reported the safe and also asked for soap for the bathroom, the soap arrived straight away, but the safe was never fixed. Also I asked two different people on reception if they had an airline check in facility and they both directed me to the business centre on the lower ground floor, where there was no sign of it. I didn't feel the reception staff were particulary warm and helpful. However, on our last day we very much appreciated the late check out we were given and our thanks to the young lady on the concierge desk who very kindly offered to mail my postcards for me at no expense - I had been waiting to be seen for some time, and our coach was waiting. Being by the lake the hotel is not right in town but everything is within easy walking distance. To save time on our last day we took a taxi to the CN Tower and it cost only $6 (Canadian), roughly Â£2.60. We enjoyed our stay at Westin Harbour Castle and would thoroughly recommend the excellent accommodation, and the lovely views.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: Jono_T
Reviews.Content: We had a lake (Ontario) view high up. The room was fine - well appointed and had everything we wanted. It was a little on the small side, but had great views, right on the harbour front. It was very clean & well maintained, and we didn't have any problems during our stay. It represented good value for a quality hotel. The ferry to Toronto Islands goes from very near the hotel. It's only a short walk to get into the centre of Toronto, and all the main sights (CN tower etc) are within an easy walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Nice Hotel - Will come back!”
Reviews.Author: TomNg
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and nice. I'd come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed performance”
Reviews.Author: yhzhuo
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend over at this hotel overlooking Lake Ontario. The view was excellent, and its proximity to the nearby harbourfront shops was ok (even though it's relatively far from where most of the activity in the city take place). The bed in the room was incredibly comfortable, and the housekeeping services were commendable as well. However, the bath just didn't do it for me, with a pathetically small bathtub and semi-working stopper (even after I called for service). The front-desk staff could also have been much friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “A plasma screen and designer bathroom do not a great hotel make”
Reviews.Author: Big_Rich_Sheffield
Reviews.Content: Disappointing stay at this "highly rated" hotel, the staff were not overly helpful and lacked warmth, the hotel seemed to be designed for the business visitor rather than the holiday-maker. The location though can not be faulted. Personally we would not re-visit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good views from non lakeview room...”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at five other Toronto hotels, the points to commend the Harbour Castle are quality of rooms and fixtures plus reasonable views of lake and Toronto island even from 'non' lakeview rooms - whether this can apply to all rooms, I don't know but when I asked for a lakeview room at check-in I was told it was an extra $30 per night and, so, I did not take one but had a very acceptable view nonetheless. Beds are great. Bathroom possibly recently renovated. LCD TV screen and so on. The only downer was that, despite bed being made up every day, bathroom cleaned and so on... the room did not seem to have been vacuumed during the four day stay - an obvious feather and other 'bits' on the floor stayed in the same place for the duration! I'd stll recommend the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: godsfavdiva
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend; he, for work and me, for fun... and thoroughly enjoyed it. As Starwood members and frequent visitors of W Hotels, we definitely felt the upgrade and renovations that have taken place over the past few years have elevated this site and made a huge franchise feel like a boutique hotel. Every one that we encountered was friendly, helpful and accurate. The reps at the concierge desk were helpful, cheerful and eager to assist, even by phone. We had occasion to contact the concierge while in a cab, searching for our restaurant destination and they eagerly solved our issue. We enjoyed breakfast at the Mizen Lounge and also, working out at the comprehensive gym. I would also recommend that while in Toronto, one should visit two delish restaurants: Rain and Jump; both in the 5-star range and well worth it.
