Our waiter, Robert at Jump was phenomenal and honestly, the best service and accomodation that we received in a long time!! Enjoy....we certainly did!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, If You Don't Think Of The Shooting!!”
Reviews.Author: lovexxstoryy
Reviews.Content: First off, I want to tell you I am a fourteen year old girl, but don't think of this as a bad review. Please don't stop reading because of my age. SO. My parents and my best friend went to Toronto over Fourth of July weekend for a fun getaway. At first we stayed a TERRIBLE hotel that wasn't in a good part of Toronto. Bums would approach me and and my friend (who is also fourteen) and asked us to light their ciggarette. Considering this was a recommended hotel, we quickly fled to the Westin. Let me tell you, this hotel was gorgeous. My friend and I shared a room that connected to my parents' room. Our beds were SO luxurius and we could see the lake and parts of the city. It was such a contrast from the previous hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable and and everything was clean! Well, let me tell you of the good things. The pool is absolutely stunning. Also, they have tennis courts and basketball hoops. They also had an amazing gym where most excerise equipment had a TV to watch while you were working out. (The hotel provided headphones.) The hotel rooms came with Starbucks coffee which was very nice. Now for the bad things. Our toilet broke, but it was quickly fixed by hotel staff. But, then out door broke! We could not get in with our key! So, the maintenence said they could fix it the next day. We declined because we would be leaving soon. We jsut entered through my parents room. The concierge recommended a very expensive retaurant even when we told him that was not what we were looking for. Everything was going swimmingly until out last full day there. We left late to go get some dinner and when we finally got back to the hotel, it was around nine. To our shock there were police cars, ambulances, and news vans all around our hotel. My Dad asked a newsman what happened and he simply said, "A guy got shot in the elevator." We passed tons of cops and got into the hotel. People flooded the lobby. We went to the concierge and asked if we could go to our room. He said it was fine because the shooting occured in the other tower. We went up to our room and after my Dad checked the room, we went in. Since we were leaving the next morning (and because we didn't know if we had to leave that night) we started packing. We turned on the news to hear something about the shooting. Something about it came on and we listened carefully. The report said that the shooter might still be in the hotel. (It turned out he really wasn't.) Around ten o'clock, there was an announcement on the loud speaker saying that the hotel was under lockdown. We went to bed a little freaked out, but with all the cops, we felt safe. The next morning, everything seemed normal. We checked out as planned and we heard about what happened. It turned out to be a drug deal gone bad. They found ten of so pounds of cocaine in an ice room. The man that was shot was not killed and his shooter was found. The both are now facing criminal charges. This hotel was very nice and you should not be worried about safety. In my opinion it was handled very well and it did not wreck my stay. Crime can happen anywhere. So, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Overall Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: ctrese21
Reviews.Content: We were headed to Toronto for our 3 year anniversary. I booked the room via Priceline for $70! After encountering a snow storm on our drive up, we arrived after midnight very fatigued. We ended up using valet because it was convenient and the snow was still coming down. The front desk clerk was very nice. I asked for a room with a lakeview and she obliged. We were in the North tower in room 2818. The pictures don't do the rooms justice, they were gorgeous. My hubby just loved the flat screen tv and I loved the view from the chaise situated next to the window. The next day we went to go eat and had to walk all the way outside to give the valet our ticket. When they brought the car out, they pulled it as far away from us as possible and turned it off. I had to walk over muddy puddles to get to the car and we were the only ones out there. They could have left the car closer so that we could hop right in and they could have left it running. When we came back the room hadn't been cleaned because my husband left the DND sign on the door by mistake. When I went to get ice I saw a cleaning lady and asked her if we could have the bathrobes that were supposed to be in the room anyway. She brought them. We went down to the gift shop and when we came back another cleaning lady was in the room cleaning. We left her a tip and went down to the bar. The bartenders were literally competing on who would serve us. I suppose they were competing on who would get the tip. This display of behavior was unwarranted and especially not so the customer can see. It was an uncomfortable feeling. On the day of our departure, they were pretty busy so we expected to wait a while for the car. When I saw that they had brought the car out we headed out with our luggage and there was no valet able to tell us where the keys were. They had just driven the car up there but no one knew who had the keys. So, we are standing there waiting for someone to bring over the keys. We usually tip very well to those in the service industry but at this hotel they were lacking in service. I hope that in the future they willl learn to live up to there 4-star expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Practical business hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelator
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business as it was close to our offices. + The room was nice and spacious with a large flat screen and a good selection of PPV films. The bathroom was well lit. - The broadband internet connection was rubbish. The hotel food was poor The reception staff was not interested in making you feel welcome. Go there for business don't bother if its for leisure as there's nothing close by.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Break”
Reviews.Author: SL.123
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as the location was what we needed. The hotel sits on the shore looking out to the lake & Islands. Nothing to say other than to compliment the hotel & staff on a great visit. Paula in the Business Centre & Sue, the concierge were particularly helpful. The renovated rooms are very comfortable with large flat screen TV, safe & mini bar. Pool & gym are clean & a good size. We've used the Courtyard Marriott before & it's good but this is a cut above. If anyone was to come in the summer then I'd definitely recommend this hotel. Access to the Islands couldn't be easier, it's a short walk to Union Station, Air Canada & CN Tower. The Eaton Centre is about 15-20min walk, the best way to explore a city. A taxi from the hotel to Pearson is a flat $46 + tip & takes about 30min, we left the hotel before 4pm & didn't encounter any hold ups but the roads were getting busier. Try the Richtree in the BCE, great food experience.

Reviews.Title: “You cant beat Westin Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Blasphemystic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about luxury and Service. Me, my wife and my 5 year old son stayed here for 3 nights. The staff is very friendly and courteous. We had no complaints so we never needed to call anyone. The bed is amazing and so is the sleep you will get on it. The view is awsome, depending on the location of the room you can see lake ontairo and part of the city. The rooms are clean and very inviting. The bathroom is also amazing. I felt like I got more than I really paid for. This is the place I will be staying the next time I am in Toronto and I need a hotel. The restaurants are amazing, a bit pricey but you get what you pay for. The parking garage is a bit tight. I had rented the Volvo S80 which I left in the garage and was a bit scracthed up by someone else. I informed the hotel, but they do not manage the parking facility and I was told to take it up with parking garage owners. I didnt bother and Hertz didnt notice. The location is great, as you are only a 5 minute walk from center of the city. We enjoyed this restaurant called Marche Restaurant. Its like an open europen market, where you pick out the fish, chicken what ever it is..and they will prepare it right infront of you. Its awsome, we always make sure we go here when we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SteveBazakas
Reviews.Content: Booked this on Priceline. Although I prefer to be in Yorkville, how can I complain about this place, especially at $75 on Priceline.? Be sure to ask for a renovated room -- they did a fantastic job, including a huge flat screen TV. Also, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Average/Decent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great location and a great view of the lake. Lots of food nearby and nice breakfast at hotel. I was in unrenovated room in older tower and the room was average, however heating unit didn't work at all. Room seemed old and tired, but a typical 3-star quality. Desk was VERY helpful when Ireported the problem after the first day and moved me to a renovated room in the new tower. Decor was Euro modern, very dark. Awesome plasma TV in the new room, and of course, the heater worked. Overall, I was happy, but it was essentially an average business class hotel in a large motro city with no remarkable features. Valet parking is $30 a day (plus tips) and that seemed a little steep compared to other cities. $11 a day for internet. $5 bottles of water in the room, and additional misc. charges. When you check in, ask for a new room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spa”
Reviews.Author: clf1967
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with fabulous views and all the luxuries. Made full use of the spa (I'm a spa junkie) and had one of the best body wraps ever. Not cheap but worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: dixieandspirit
Reviews.Content: Good location for downtown activities, room was one that was not renovated yet, apparently they are in the process of renovating all rooms. Room was clean, good coffee (Starbucks) for in room coffee maker, we were cold though, furnace took a long time to warm the room and morning shower was COLD. Expensive for what you get. Great Japanese restaurant in the plaza directly across the street, go to the crosswalk, cross over and take the path between the buildings, very good sushi and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mintrob
Reviews.Content: Very good service, view from hotel is amazing and location is right on the waterfront - room ok but some parts of hotel could do with updating

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, especially if you're into hockey”
Reviews.Author: crst81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for little a week in March 2006 during a North American hockey journey. Friendly staff who helped me out wonderfully with my misplaced luggage (American Airlines, sigh........), perfectly cleaned room (daily, of course), the paper waiting outside the door each morning, and last but not least - perfectly located. It's a mere 10 min walk to the Air Canada Center and walk another 5 or 10 mins and you're in the dead center of To. A very cool surprise (and definite sell-point if you're a hockeyfan) is the fact Westin Harbour Castle houses the visiting team. So bring a pen and paper if the season's right! ;-) As for negatives I found the breakfast to be overpriced but soon found a nice little breakfast diner some 100 metres away with more humane prices. The "harbour quarters" are by no means desolate with more restuarants to be found in the surrounding area. A very nice hotel, a beautiful city and an amazing bunch of friendly citizens!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, location OK”
Reviews.Author: LostRailroadTrack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for a few days right before New Year's Eve. The hotel has a great pool area and locker room, and the cafe price for coffee was really reasonable considering what most hotels charge. Our king size bedroom in the North Tower was very nice with the flat screen TV and comfortable bed, but the tub and shower were just OK. We had a view of the apartments across from the hotel, and a bit of a view of the lake and city, so nothing spectacular. But the best thing about the room was it was quiet! The location was OK, a bit out of the way from a lot of the major attactions of Toronto, but not too far from the transit car, so it was not so bad, it would be a great place to stay in the summer I bet. I would stay again for sure, if I got a good rate again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: JMC_TWC
Reviews.Content: My husband & I with our two children, ages 12 & 15, spent the first weekend in December at the Westin for a mini-getaway. Booked thru Priceline for $80/night. We thought the location was fine and walked to the CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, Hard Rock Cafe, etc. and thought it was fine. Our room was newly renovated and had a beautiful view. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: LosingLuggage
Reviews.Content: This review might come a bit late but maybe it will still be helpful for some who read it. I spent Christmas and New Year's 2004/05 at the Westin Harbour Castle. It started out that after a long flight (2 hours more than originally expected) in horrible weather from Frankfurt to Toronto, my luggage had been left behind. When arriving at the hotel (at around midnight) it took a while until one of the receptionist finally had the energy to arrange my check-in. I asked whether they had some "emergency gear", e.g. a t-shirt or similar since my luggage would only arrive the next day. No effort was made at all to make me feel comfortable. I did, however, get a very nice room on one of the higher floors, facing the lake. As in most of the Starwood properties, the bed was heavenly. I finally got my luggage late the next day and did enjoy my stay. The concierge did not seem to be very familiar with the area so I ended up walking forever in the freezing cold. Overall, its a nice hotel if they start working on improving the service. The location is not very central but it's fine, considering that the hotel runs a shuttle bus to various places in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: PickeeMe
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle on a business trip. The room was more than adequate for my purpose. The location is perfect for anyone whose trip requires them to be situated in the downtown core. It is conveniently located close to business, shopping, restaurants, theatres, the train station and the Island Airport. I was assigned one of the upgraded rooms that included a large, LCD television. Rooms also include their famous â€˜Heavenly Bedsâ€™ and fluffy, duvets. If I had one complaint it would be that despite the above average rate you pay to stay at the Westin, minor conveniences such as phone calls and high-speed access are extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buchba
Reviews.Content: Westin was a great hotel. Located right on the harbour front, we had a room that overlooked the lake. It was very nice and clean. Also walking distance to CN tower and the ferry to the islands goes straight from the bottom of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience- Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travvvelller
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel on Canada Day, a day where there was a lot of activity outside of the hotel. I thought the hotel seemed a little loud - I could hear people in the room next to me, in the hallways, and I heard a dog barking. I could also hear the fireworks outside... not a nusiance but I was very tired from my flight. I was settling in to my bed and heard an announcement over the loudspeaker that there was an emergency in the hotel and to not leave my room. This announcement came on several more times and finally a few hours later and well into the night I called the front reception to find out what was going on since I was frightened and tired. I was told basic information and only found out what happened the next day in the news. Regardless, the point of the story is that the hotel NEVER told me that it was safe to leave my room or ever even acknowledged what happend or tried to compensate me in any way. I did leave a detailed comment card - still no reply from Westin or Starwood. I am sure if I complained or told them that I would have changed hotels that they would have reacted differently but I was trying to give them the benefit of the doubt. Otherwise, I had a great view, an older room that needed some ductwork fixed up, liked the apples at the reception, the main part of the hotel needs sprucing up, the gym was excellent for a hotel, but I would be reluctant to stay there again. I also agree with other posters that the area is not ideal for walking to nearby shops or dining.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: mtlgirl21
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel on Priceline with the 'Name your own price' option - which is how I got an amazing rate on a pretty great hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful - I had a corner room, so I had a gorgeous view of both the city and the water! The only bad point is the hotel's location. Parking is incredibly expensive, but the cheaper option is to park at an outdoor lot 5 min away - unfortunately, the area is very industrial and not very people-friendly. there is a major highway next to the hotel. the hotel is pretty far from all the happenings in the city (you cannot leave your hotel to go for a stroll - there is nowhere to walk outside!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: fountaingirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night. I made the reservation for a room with a king size bed. When we arrived I was told we had a room with two double beds, but that we could "upgrade" for $30 to a room in the North Tower with a king bed. I felt this was a scam and was very unhappy with the hotel clerk's attitude. No where on the reservation confirmation did it say "based on availability," and isn't that the reason you make the reservation in the first place? We did have a nice room with a great view of the city, but I would never stay here again. $30 for parking in their ramp, unless you want to walk 3 blocks and park in a lot down the street. We had a drink at the bar at night and paid $10.50 for a 4 oz. glass of cabernet. I don't mind spending money, but they really take advantage of you here.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: jendon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for Labor Day weekend 2006 - 3 nights. Took the Airport Bus in from Pearson - a great deal and the Westin is the first drop-off downtown as well as the last pick-up on the way back to the airport. Very prompt -usually runs on-time. Check-in was smooth and friendly. Had to stand in line for a bit but nothing concerning. We were upgraded to a renovated room in the North Tower. Room was fantastic with a Heavenly Bed, chic furnishings, chaise at the window, plasma wide-screen TV and view of the harbour. Even though the weather was miserable most of the weekend (the tail end of a hurricane), the room was warm and cozy. We did not use the mini-bar - prices were high but would have liked to have the use of the fridge. There is an in-room safe in the ample closet. The bathroom was lovely, and again, upscale. The Heavenly Shower really was heavenly although the towels could have been more ample. The shampoo, lotion and soap were great. All amenities can be purchased through the Westin website. Did have a small problem with our room lock being recoded on the second day of our stay and we were unabe to get into our room. Security came up and fixed the problem promptly. Considering the size of Cesar, the security guard, I certainly felt safe in the hotel! The store in the lobby has souvenirs, snacks, pop, water, newspapers and lottery. Staff are very friendly. Each evening, we enjoyed the bar in the lobby. Live piano entertainment, cold beer and munchies. Great service from Danny! Ate Sunday brunch at the Mizzen - buffet $24.95 for adults and worth it. Individually made omelettes by Alex, lots of hot food, fruit, breads, cereal, cheese, unlimited juice and other drinks. The pool area is large, bright and well-equiped. The attendant will even rope off a lane of the pool if you want to do laps. The hot tub was not very hot, though. Did not use the exercise room overlooking the pool. This area is accessable from both towers. My husband and I had a couples hot-stone massage in the spa. Expensive but again worth every penny! Very friendly staff - a relaxing way to spend a Sunday morning. Will definitely do that again! Hotel is location within walking distance from the ACC, Entertainment District, CN tower, Hockey Hall of Fame and Yonge Street Shopping. If you don't want to walk too far, there is an underground streetcar entrance across from the hotel that will take you to Union Station. From Union Station, take the Exhibition Streetcar one stop - you stay underground the whole time - very convenient and they run late. Will definitely stay here again - truly enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Views”
Reviews.Author: FennyMan
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here and really enjoyed it - a lovely hotel in a stunning harbour front location. You have the choice of self parking which I think was $17 or valet parking which I think was $30 (sorry I can't be more specific but it was almost 3 months ago) - For the sake of a few bucks we opted for the valet and the car was returned unharmed. My wife being a member of the Groups Preferred guest program ensured that both rooms had harbour views - a must. Be aware that there are 2 towers of this hotel (North and South) - one being on the harbour front and one on the other side of the main drag. Can't comment on any of the facilities as we didn't use any - apart from the bar, but I'm sure they were a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect from a Westin....”
Reviews.Author: MonikaB
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights whilst attending a conference. The conference facilities themselves were very well organised but the rooms and service were a different matter all together! I stayed in the South Tower - paint was peeling from the skirting boards and the windowsill in my room - the room felt more like a motel room than a 4 star hotel. Their "Express service" was extremely poor. There was also no showergel - so I called for some - after a further 20 minutes nothing arrived so I rang again and was then told that the hotel only provided soap and not gel. Therefore I decided to take a shower when suddenly the door of the bathroom opened and 2 bottles of showergel appeared! I screamed for the guy to get out.....so they did have gel after all! On another occasion I called asking for towels as they had not been changed - after 30 mins I called down again and this time they arrived. Poor service, lies and room staff who over step the mark - not good. Additionally one morning there was no hot water as the boiler had broken - and let me tell you that "cold" water in Toronto in October translates as FREEZING!!!!!!!! I raised my concerns and to be fair to the management they gave me one free night but this was not enough to persude me to ever recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerEm
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in September 06 and had a really nice stay. We requested a high floor room and we were on the 32nd floor, with a corner room that had wonderful views of Lake Ontario on one side and the CN Tower on the other. The room was spacious and clean with the only downside being that the toilet was close to the bath so you had to manouver a bit when you got out of the shower! The location is good, we managed to walk practically everywhere we wanted to and Union Station is only about a ten minute walk away if you need a train or subway link. It was a bit of a treat for us as it's a bit more expensive than we usually go for but if you've got the money to spend I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: pkane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on October 7th 2006. Booked through Hotwire. Got the room for less then $100! I arrived early to set up a few surprises in the room for my g/f. The front desk clerk noticed I was doing that, and she gave me a free upgrade to the 30th floor with a lake view! The price of that room is quoted at over $400/night!! The room was faboulous! Comfy bed, great view, clean! Only problem, seemed the housekeeping forgot to replenish a few things...corkscrew/bottle opener, shower cap...and we happened to need those items. They took a while to send them up. Lobby is beautiful! Great location! About a 5-10minute walk from the ACC.

Reviews.Title: “Be alert”
Reviews.Author: Chiorazzi
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I was checked into the South Tower. These rooms are older and not refurbished. There is an odor in the hallways and the in the rooms. The smell is of a low budget hotel. By chance a friend of mine was checked into the North Tower and later he happened to mention his Flat Screen TV. Flat Screen TV? My room was circa 70's and there was no such thing. Was he in the same hotel? After a bit of investigation I discovered that the newly refurbished rooms were on the South Tower. Needless to say I was promptly moved. I wouldn't have minded the smelly room but not at the same price. Not alerting guests to this fact is very unfair. I would have never known. If you saw the difference in the rooms you would understand why I am making an issue of this. The new room are very modern and comfortable. While the older rooms still comfortable the decor is just as old and dated as a hotel on the Jersey shore and should be priced accordingly. As far as front desk service, the gentleman in the morning very unhelpful - they spend a lot of time telling you what cannot be done and what they cannot do. Reminded me of robots. A terrible lack of customer service. The food in room service and the bar food was grossly over-priced. A hamburger can go as high as $30 once they add all there fees. Ridiculous. At $200 plus a night there are other hotels with a much better value. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished with plasma tv overlooking the harbour”
Reviews.Author: Flowerfairy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We booked through Canadian Affair for gbp78 per night. I had noticed that other people had mentioned lesser amounts on their reviews but when we arrived at the hotel we thought every penny was worth it. Check-in was quick and easy, we'd arrived at 8.30 in the evening. I asked at check-in for a room with a view of the lake and I was told one had already been allocated for me - it was a newly refubished room. When we got to room 740 we could smell the new paste and wallpaper smell - which I dont mind as my dad is a painter and decorator. Good size room with two double beds, plasma tv and very tasteful bathroom. The colours used for decorating were slightly dull - taupe and dark brown but with such a fantastic view we didnt look at the walls too much. Of an evening we could see all the little ferry boats lit up which was very romantic. The Concierge desk was very useful and advised us that about 100 yards out of the hotel and turn left was Cocoberry's cafe and we had breakfast there every day - Eggs Benedict with a lovely fresh fruit kebab for CAD6.95. Top Tip - check on the internet what time sunset is and book a table at the CN tower 360 revolving restaurant about 15-30 mins beforehand. What a great view - very romantic watching the sunset. We had the fixed price menu for CAD64 each.Nice choice of menu and this price includes the express external lift and also a stop off at the glass floor level - my husband stood on it but I wouldnt go anywhere near ! However, the wine is expensive in the restaurant , we wanted a red Merlot and at CAD64 it was the third cheapest bottle on the menu. We found the people of Toronto to be really pleasant - some of the friendliest people we have ever met abroad and we felt safe wherever we walked. No litter about to speak of and if we accidently bumped into people -as we were gazing skywards taking in the views - it was they who apologised to us ! . About those steps outside the hotel , we've counted them for those of you who may be curious- there are 30 in total which we found no problem - we also walked up the ramp several times without any bother from cars - stick to the sides and you;ll be ok -there is actually a strip marked with paint on the left side for pedestrians. About those beds - yes they are comfortable but the sheets are far too small. Once in bed they only just cover you at the sides and if you fidget about at all you end up uncovered. There are two padded quilts on the bed. One is sandwiched between two sheets and then there is a top decorative quilt, which, because it is covered in a satin type fabric, ends up sliding onto the floor during the night. We found it odd that we couldnt find much information in our room about hotel facilities.i.e. if we had wanted breakfast they didnt promote it very well - we couldnt find anything to say how much it was or where to go and get one in the hotel. The swimming pool was lovely with a large glass wall overlooking the lake and really nice sun loungers to relax on. They offer a free shoeshine service from your room. We did order room service one evening and it was lovely food, well presented but expensive at CAD18 for a burger and fries. Dont miss Niagara falls and definately dont stay in a hotel there - It really is like Blackpool , all amusement arcades -cheap and tacky. However, you must try to get to Niagara- on- the- Lake a beautiful small town just about 15 mins from Niagara. Really ,quaint shops with window boxes full of flowers everywhere. Had a fantastic time -would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms nice but furniture changed”
Reviews.Author: Jason Koulouras
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this property this year. Decided to go for a one night stay on the last weekend that the Centreville amusement park over on Centre Island was going to be open. We checked in early (about 11ish am) and were given a renovated room in the North Tower - room 939. These are larger corner rooms - on the website the rooms are promoted as having a king bed and a double sofabed. This is the case in the older rooms but not in the newer rooms. When we arrived at the room (2 adults and 2 kids), there was a King Bed and a small divan/chaise thing - it was nice but was not a double sofabed! We had to request 2 rollaway cots as a result (there were pretty comfortable at least) - the renovated rooms have nice warm colours and plasma tv's and have been refreshed so the room was nice - the furniture configuration change was a surprise. Hotel staff were helpful and polite and took care of our service needs. The breakfast buffet is nice but seems a little pricey at $23 per adult. The indoor pool was set to a decent temperature and the exercise room is well equipped. Parking seems expensive as well at $30 tax included for mandatory valet and the resort marketing fee at 3% feels like a nickel and dime tactic. We like staying at the Westin Harbour Castle when we want to be on the waterfront and then stay at either the Royal York or Sheraton Centre in the off summer months when we want to be right in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: Paula215
Reviews.Content: Got a very good deal on this hotel through Priceline. We were lucky to be offered a newly renovated room (at no extra cost) with partial view of the harbour front. The room was very clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel I found to be excellent, i was a little scared after reading the reviews that it was out of town and not walkable...not the case at all. it was near Union station a quick 10 minute walk..and I felt safe walking to the hotel even though we arrived in the dark. Walking distance to the Yonge Street and the main shops..no problem at all. The buffet breakfast in the Mizzen Restaurant was wonderful, i would certainly recommend it. Used the swimming pool which was a real plus. If I get the chance would definately stay there again...but as I book through Priceline I dont have the choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: gmarie99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite on the 33rd floor...the views of the island and the harbor were incredible. The property is like most Westins, just fantastic. The service was excellent, the room ready with spa towels and spa robes. An LCD TV on the wall, internet access (at a fee) and the heavenly shower and bed were great. Walking distance to the CN tower, to downtown shopping area, there is a Harbor Bar and Grill across the street which came at the recommendation of our bartender. Toronto is expensive so bring losts of $$$. A round of beers at the hotel bar ran about $15 CA. Valet parking was $30 per day plus tipping. I guess there is self parking 2 blocks away for $17. The harbor cruise was nice and quick, but everything on the island was closed during the week after Labor day. Since we traveled in October it would have been nice if the hotel concierge would have told us that. Overall, it's a 5 star property, I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: We received this hotel through a Priceline bid! Half of the hotel rooms have been renovated so far. I was hoping to upgrade to a renovated room and I knew that past reviewers said they were charged additional $30.00 per night (no problem...I love new rooms!). I asked the check-in person if I could have a renovated room and she said it would be an additional $30.00 per night. After a little sweet-talking, she gave us a renovated room at no extra cost( I consider myself an expert at getting free upgrades!). She was very nice and efficient. The front door personnel were excellent...very attentive and eager to help with luggage. Rare with many hotels these days...way to go Westin! The room was fabulous! It is a standard North American size room, but it had a plasma TV, great furniture, terrific bed, wonderful partial-view of the lake and the city. New carpet, new wallpaper, new everything...great! The hotel location is on the lake which is nice. It is an area of high-rise lakefront condominiums and some tourist shops. The area is VERY popular in the summer but in the winter is becomes almost desolate. You will have to take a cab to the shopping areas or restaurant areas. Walking to the closest subway station (Union Station) takes about 15 minutes. This hotel is walking distance to the Rogers Center and the Air Canada Center (both concert/sports venues). There is an excellent huge grocery store (Loblaws) a few blocks away. Valet parking is $30.00 per 24 hours with in-and-out privileges. Would I be happy to stay here again? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “horrible room!”
Reviews.Author: cnuckian
Reviews.Content: Booked a room via priceline for a business trip. I found the hotel advice on parking to be very misleading, as they directed me to a lot that was waaay overpriced and 2 blocks from the hotel. I recommend taking a quick walk around to find a better underground option on queen's quay. Check-in was efficient, but I was shocked when I got to my room and discovered they had given me a room with one of those crazy beds that folds up into the wall. Yes, that's right. The mattress was heavenly nothing. It was a lumpy unsupportive junk-heap, about 6 inches off the floor, giving me an excellent view of the stained carpet. the front desk was almost smug about depositing me in this weirdly shaped coffin of a room. I stayed in hotels in Toronto for almost two months around this period, and this was the worst hotel of the 6 4-stars that I stayed in. Everything from the room, to the service, the parking, location etc etc was offensive, considering the room costs. I recommend any of the others in that range - sheraton center, marriott, intercontinental, etc - rather than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: LKR
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a conference. Don't get me wrong, the hotel was nice, but for $250/night, it wasn't THAT nice. I've stayed in cheaper hotels that were nicer. The hotel restaurant was nice, the rooms were clean, and I had a great view from my room. Only a few things to report: 1) The concierge didn't know when the hotel restaurant was serving buffet meals. 2) Construction on the front of the hotel. 3) The hotel charged my personal credit card for my room rather than my corporate credit card. Overall, Toronto is a nice city. Customs was relatively smooth to get through and it was easy to get around the city. I used the Airport Express bus to get to and from the airport. It was very nice and always arrived on time. The cab drivers lacked personal hygiene, but were all very polite. Shopping was expensive, but there are definitely some cool places to check out. Some very good restaurants, too. I recommend the Harbour Sixty Steakhouse. Best steak I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Fine -- But Go Elsewhere if Cleanliness Matters”
Reviews.Author: sfwork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough, and well located, and we generally didn't have many complaints... except the cleaning service. Uhg. We stayed there five nights and as far as I could tell, all they ever did was make our beds each day and replace towels that we left on the floor (volunteer conservation program). They never wiped the sinks down, they didn't replace the shampoo, they didn't vaccum. We complained a few times, but there was no change in service. We weren't too messy so it wasn't THAT bad, but you'd think with a Westin hotel you'd get different service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT ONLY during the day”
Reviews.Author: Wirral-GB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located alongside the ferry terminal and has rooms with harbour views. We stayed in the south tower and it was very comfortable. As others point out, access is strange and not very user friendly unless you arrive by car each time. There are a few restaurants nearby at the Queens Centre which is an easy walk but for more selection you have to go towards the city centre, Front Street and beyond. This involves walking under two underpasses (the expressway and the railway) both are long and dark. I was concerned over safety and asked a policeman about it. He said it's quite safe during the day as there are lots of people about but after 8pm it's another matter. We ate in the Queens centre at a grill which was quite good and also at an italian which was really just a pizza pasta place but calls itself "one of the top 10 restaurants in Toronto" to which I would not agree. I would stay closer to the city centre next time. The Sheraton Centre looks a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: lotusboy
Reviews.Content: We visited the Westin in September with a baby and pram. The hotel is situated well above street level and it was very tiring pushing the pram up the long ramp. We soon figured out that we could access the side door with our room key and take the elevator so it was not a problem from then on. We booked the hotel directly through the Westin website and this was slightly cheaper than calling the hotel. Upon arrival we were offered an upgrade to a refurbished room free of charge which was lucky as days before we received an email offering an upgrade for an extra $30 per night!!! The refurbished room was very nice, we had 2 doubles (the baby had one) and these beds were very small for 2 adults!!! The walls were also very thin and we could hear everything next door were saying. Other than that, the service was great, the pool was never busy and neither was the well equipped gym with TV's on the machines. The location was perfect for the harbour. The ferry to centre island is next door to the hotel and there are some nice restaurants nearby. The city centre is about 15 mins walk which is not too bad and its nice to be out of the hustle and bustle although you do have to walk under a freeway which I wouldn't like to do late at night. All in all the Westin was a very nice hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No rave review here”
Reviews.Author: Ra_C_7
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a convention and stayed at the Westin and Sheraton Centre. The Westin was nice enough except when compared to the Sheraton - Sheratons rooms were bigger, nicer, more comfortable, in general the hotel more attractive and was cheaper. The Westin's location on the Harbour was nice. If I had the option for the same or similar price, I would choose the Sheraton Centre over the Westin Harbour Castle.

Reviews.Title: “It was Nice”
Reviews.Author: LRSLAC
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a lovely hotel with a great location. We really enjoyed being near the harbourfront, with easy access to just about everything else within a few blocks' walk. We had a room in the South tower and thought it was just fine. Our view of the harbour and the islands was great from the 18th floor. We stayed there during Caribbana, so the area was packed with people most of the time. Not necessarily a good thing, but it was manageable. The biggest problem was access to the hotel. The entrance is located far above street level, so you have to either climb a mountain of stairs or walk up the vehicle ramp (there's a cobblestone/brick walk along the side, but they often had cars parked on it). This made getting in/out with luggage a chore. I can't imagine what it would be like for someone with more limited mobility options. The hotel is one of the major downtown hotels, so it's a stop for several sightseeing tour buses, which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: drumlin
Reviews.Content: Only 1 towel was provided for 2 people. We requested an add'l towel to be brought up right away so that we could shower and make our dinner reservation. Couldn't wait and dried off with a hand towel -- towel was delivered about 45 minutes later! Someone set off the fire alarm went off at 4:30am so we trudged dutifully down 26 flights of stairs. Apparently on weekends this is the "norm." Received no refills of water bottles or coffee on the 2nd day of our stay. Reception was also understaffed; parking a disaster; you almost get run over by taxis or guests as you try to enter/exit the hotel. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great vies”
Reviews.Author: fieb8138
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days recently after booking the same day on Priceline for $85. The hotel is directly on the water a few blocks from the center of downtown. We were checked in immediately and given a King room on the 18th floor of the South tower overlooking the Toronto Islands to the south and with the CN tower to the west. The room was fairly large and very clean. There were some updates necessary, paper peeling by the windows, but nothing awful. We made one request for an extra bathrobe which was brought promptly. While the hotel is slightly away from downtown the Harbourfront area is great for walking and there was alot of action at the Harbourfront center a short walk away. There is a streetcar station right across from the hotel that runs right to Union Station, to connect with the subway, or that runs opposite up to Spadina Station, right through Chinatown which is a great area for grabbing dinner. This stop is underground thought at the corner of Bay and Queens Quay though so it is easy to miss! I believe this connection makes the hotel an acceptable location. We visited the pool which was clean but the hotub was not working. It was hot, but the jets would not turn on. And Valet parking at $30 was a little steep. Overall, for the price I paid I was quite happy with the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More From a 4-Star”
Reviews.Author: Tournament_Dad
Reviews.Content: We had a room in the pre-renevated tower. For the price ($89USD) it was satisfactory. However, being the Westin Harbour Castle - a FOUR star hotel we were let down as we were expected much much more! The room was fairly small. 2 Double beds, normal TV, and workdesk. The bathroom was relatively large. The entire room was clean, but in dire need of rejuvination. The beds are EXTREMELY comfortable - I will give them that. All in all, our stay was ok - but if you book request a renovated room as they sound far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: chollinger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle the first week of Aug. After reading reviews on this site, I was a bit apprehensive at what I'd find. Those fears were unfounded once we checked into the hotel. It was very easy to find, as we drove from Michigan. Check-in was a breeze and the front desk staff was very helpful. We stayed in room 2327 in the North Tower. It was right by the elevators, which concerned me at first, but we never heard a peep from the hallway. Although my travelmate loved the Heavenly Beds, I wasn't all that impressed. Soft comforters and pillows are great, but I thought the beds were hard as a rock. The Heavenly Shower, however, was to die for. The water pressure was great, and the marble and lighting in the bathroom was a beautiful touch. Some have had issues with the location of the hotel. I didn't find it to be a problem at all. Three blocks to Union Station was nothing compared to the rest of the walking we did all week! I thought three blocks from everything was extremely convenient in a city like Toronto. I didn't notice or hear any construction going on, so I can't comment on that. We did, however, use the valet parking and felt $30 per day was ridiculous, although appreciated the car staying at the hotel under security. Overall, I was very impressed with the hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat, especially if I got it through Priceline again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LyndsyStw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for 3 nights at the end of a two week holiday in Ontario. The hotel is situated, as the name suggests, on the waterfront and we upgraded to get a newly refurbished room with a view of the harbour. For what we paid for the room ($270 a night) I don't think the hotel is marvellous value for money however the nearby harbour area is very pleasant at all times of the day. Staff in the hotel were friendly and knowledgeable - there was nothing that was too much trouble for them. The room we had was not the biggest but was adequate for our needs and the view was great. The leisure facilities are also good with an indoor pool, tennis courts and a decent gym. I would recommend the hotel for others and although there is refurbishment work taking place - we certainly didn't notice anything untoward during our stay. However, this may be because we didn't want to take any chances and paid extra for the refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant enough stay, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: gasman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June 2006, as it was the venue for a conference I was attending. As far as hotel conference venues go, it was above average in terms of amenities, audiovisual etc. As a hotel, it was fine, but nothing special. My initial room reeked of cigarette smoke to the extent that I was compelled to walk straight back to the lobby to change rooms, which they did expeditiously. A colleague of mine had an identical experience. My room was clean and well equipped, but a little tired around the edges and looking like it wouldn't be too long before a refit became urgent. In fact this could be said of the hotel in general. The "Heavenly bed" was fine, but not up to the standard of those at the Westin Bayshore in Vancouver, where I have also stayed. The location of the Hotel is also somewhat less than ideal - being a good ten minute's walk away from the nearest subway station, or anwhere you're likely to want to be in Downtown Toronto. This is probably why the Hotel rates are somewhat cheaper than you'd expect for a top class place. Overall - a fine hotel, in a less than ideal location (but not too bad either!) which is getting due for a refit.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in older and renovated rooms, great gym”
Reviews.Author: cjones8778
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3-day stay at Westin. First night was in an older room, other 2 nights were in a recently renovated room (which cost an extra $30/night). The renovated rooms are more aesthetically pleasing with a more modern feel and a flat-screen TV, but that's the only major difference. In fact, I thought the renovated room was noisier because I could sometimes hear the elevator. The bathrooms in both rooms were only ok--fairly standard, nothing luxurious. Both rooms had fantastic beds. The gym was great--never crowded, all cardio equipment had TVs with clean headphones supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynMike
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on par with any Marriot or Sheraton Ive been to. The pool is great, real nice roof patio, staff was quick and effecient, the rooms big and clean. TV had great channels. The rooms are perfect for romance, buisness, or value (especially if you get from priceline/hotwire). Location is on harbour, 5-10 niute walk to skydome and downtown, so technicaqlly not in the center of everything but a $5.00 cab ride will get you where you want to go. lots of stores right across the street and a bunch of restaurants and cafes. I love the city, its got a great pulse and many things to do. If you like to wal;k than this is a great hotel and city for you. Ihad no problems at all with hotel, self parked for $17, a block away, I satyed in the south tower where there were not any renovations going on so maybe taht helped, alll in all it was a classy, well maintained, nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cwb27
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Harbour Castle, overall the hotel and staff are quite nice, but does have its problems in certain areas. We checked in later in the evening (9pm on Friday) without a problem, the Front Desk staff were excellent, the room was a semi lakeview, looking east on the 35th floor. Upon entering the room we both immediatly noted how the room was warmer than the hallway even though the room Air Conditioning was set to cold and the blow set to high, we decided to give the AC a chance to see if there would be any change. A short time later I was about to sit down to do some work on my laptop only to find very prominent stains all over the chair, as well as other dried solid substances (don't even want to venture a guess at what it could have been). Other negative points of this room that didn't bother much, but should be mentioned include a non-functional light switch, dirty light switches and somewhat dated/well used furniture. After seeing the chair and still not feeling any change in the room temperature I called the Front Desk and informed them of the problems. Without even asking me I was informed that they would upgrade me to a full lakeview room on the 18th floor, they even asked if we would like a Bellman to be sent up to help with our bags (we declined the Bellman as we were both able to manage ourselves). Our new room was much better in all respects; clean chair, ice cold AC, a small bit larger and an excellent view of the water. Overall I found the staff to be friendly and more than happy to assist you. Also on a positive note you do get free Starbucks coffee for your inroom coffee maker, a delicious way to start your morning. In comparison to other high ranked hotels I have stayed at I found the Harbour Castle to be lacking in the simple areas, this includes bathroom amenities (you're only given the basic shampoo, conditioner and hand cream) and replacement of burned out lightbulbs in the guest rooms. Our stay at the Harbour Castle was good, but I would not called it exceptional or outstanding, the Hotel is showing its age but hopefully in the near future the ongoing renovations will be completed and the hotel will become much more modern.

Reviews.Title: “stay away until refurbishment is complete!”
Reviews.Author: qprjames
Reviews.Content: stayed here june 2006. i got a good deal of priceline (about 100 dollars a night). unfortunately during my 4 night stay i had to move rooms 4 times. firstly they sent me to a twin room even when i specifically requested a double room on the pnone and at reception. then when i was moved i was put into a double room, except this room only had a pull down bed which was far from uncomfortable and really coudnt fit 2 people on it. but the worst was yet to come.......my third room i was moved to (this is still the same day!) was a beautiful modern room, with plasma tv, great view. these are their new standard rooms. i thought i had fallen on my feet....until.....THE DRILLING STARTED!!!! oh yes....constant drilling (even on sat and sundays) as they are changing the old rooms into what has to be said very stylish (male orientated rooms). when i was there they had only just started on one tower, and although the drilling was several fllors down from me, and i could still hear it from my room. even enough to wake me up and keep me from going back to sleep. the second tower there is yet to be completed. I URGE YOU NOT TO STAY HERE UNTIL AT LEAST 2007 WHEN HOPEFULL THE WORK WILL BE FINISHE and then u'll be able to enjoy these great rooms IN PEACE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: FLSMARK
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay and the location is very accessible to commuting against traffic to our suburban office. During my first stay, I found the service to be excellent, but the rooms to be dated (1980's decor). This time I recieved a newly rennovated room which rivaled much nicer hotels, equipped with large LCD TV, plush modern furniture and an excellent work desk. There was a convention going on and the hotel seemed to be short staffed because of it. I would reccomend this hotel. If you plan on eating in the hotel for breakfast... budget $30 CDN, a little high. I also ate dinner in the hotel, an average hotel meal for $50 CDN... I suggest going out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon spot!”
Reviews.Author: madmprez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our stay at the Westin for four nights for our honeymoon. Upon check-in we requested a bottle of champagne be sent up to our room and they upgraded us to a harbor view room because it was our honeymoon. The view was great, you could see a little airport where planes and helicopters land and all of the boats coming and going all day. The best part was that at night when it wasnâ€™t cloudy the moon cast such a bright light across the water that you could sit on the couch with all of the lights off and still be able to see. We ate at Toula, the restaurant at the top of the South tower for dinner the first night. The view was the same from our room and the food was OK, but just ordinary. We learned that they seat in this circular, glass-walled restaurant depending upon the season and time of day. In the summer, if you make your reservation before nine, you will be seated with a view of the harbor; after nine with a view of the city. We had a bottle of wine sent up to the room and it arrived quickly. The second day we ordered room service for breakfast. We each had eggs over medium and they were cold when they arrived. The rest of the meal was fine, but for the price, Iâ€™d recommend walking down to Queenâ€™s Quay for breakfast. We visited the spa that afternoon and each received an hour massage and pedicure. The prices were comparable to what you pay outside of a hotel and the service was just as good. My husband was able to overcome his shyness and had a great time. That night the concierge recommended Harbour 60 for dinner. Itâ€™s a steakhouse within waking distance of the hotel and was absolutely wonderful! Be prepared to spend quite a bit, we spend around $450, but the meal was worth it. Their wine list is the size of a Bible and carries bottles from between $60 and $3000. (we stuck with an $84 McManis Family Cabernet Sauvignon) The steaks are wonderful (best I have had in a long, long time) and very large! We ordered salads to start a few sides (everything is a la carte) and I couldnâ€™t finish my steak. Lauren was our waiter and he was great! Very friendly! The next night we decided to venture further from the hotel so we went to the Ontario Science Center, which my husband remembers fondly from his childhood. Itâ€™s not within walking distance and is a $25 cab ride from the hotel. In our opinion, the museum was not what it was in its heyday and the $14 admission per person was nowhere near worth it. There were only a few exhibits and most attractions were broken. The building itself was very dirty. I would not suggest anyone, even those with children, go to the Museum. Dinner and a movie this night, Paramount on Adelaide for MII: 3 and drinks and snacks at Milestones next door. They invented the Bellini and the service is wonderful. Each night we returned to find our room very clean and orderly. The beds are wonderful, my husband said almost evil, because you will be tempted to stay in them all day. We will definitely stay again; this hotel was a bargain on Hotwire!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marshalex
Reviews.Content: Frankly speaking, I could not find anything lacking in the hotel at all! Had booked through hotwire and was still treated very well! A good hotel in a good location! The only problm could be to the smokers as the entire hotel is non smoking with no smoking rooms at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. The bed was comfy, huge plasma tv, room was clean and updated and great location. Only drawback was that the internet cost $10/day.

Reviews.Title: “Westin: Ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the last weekend in May, 2006. Overall the stay was good. Bed was comfortable, staff helpfull. Only two problems of any significance: Concierge took a little over three hours to check on reservations. Restocking of room was spotty. If you require dead silence for sleep be aware of the background elevator (I presume) noise throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: jsd2643
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average. The room was clean but outdated. The location is decent, only a short walk to the tourist spots. My only complaint was when I asked about self parking the front desk told me it was about 2 blocks away and she wasn't exactly sure where it was. Valet at the hotel is $30 per night. We paid $100 / night through priceline and it was worh it ($250 on Westin site). I would not spend more than $125 for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: yuwaltz
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights for a business trip in January. The location was good, but I can't say the same about anything else. I requested a high floor room but was told nothing was available, so I settled for a room on the 5th floor. After I checked in the room at 11pm, I found that the toilet in my room was used and it was NOT flushed! It's really disgusting and unpleasant experience. I don't think I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lesley
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 teenagers and the room seemed very small after just one night!! Great location right by the ferry port that takes you over to the tranquil Islands and the harbour front that was quiet at the time we went but I believe wakes up in spring.Staff V helpful, we had a problem with noisy neighbours partying til 3am! and they sorted it immediately and then checked the next day to make sure it was still OK.Convenient walking distance to other attractions. The kids enjoyed the pool over all the other hotels we visited on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend At The Westin Harbour Castle!”
Reviews.Author: ExchangeRates
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful during our stay here. On arrival, there were plenty of staff who were willing to help with the luggage. If you're walking into the hotel, I would recommend taking the stairs just beside of the main hotel entrance. There is another door there and a separate set of stairs. The car entrance is not really designed for travellers on foot. Entering the hotel, by foot, with luggage is definitely a pain. We stayed in a corner room. This included a partial view of the lake, a view of the CN Tower, and a partial view of the skyscrapers. I have included a few photos of the view. Unfortunately, the view of the CN Tower did not turn out. We sat and watched the boats sail up and down the harbour. The room was very clean. The bathtub was really comfortable. They provide a rolled towel, so that you can relax and rest your head while soaking. The shower was the usual Westin Heavenly Shower with message or spray features. The bed was a soft heavenly bed with plenty of pillows. She loved the bed. We ordered room service all weekend, and the food was delicious. The quality was above every day restaurant food. I found that it was delivered quickly, and that it was still very hot. The menu selection included choices like: Real Cod Fish and Chips with Malt Vinegar (excellent!), Sirloin Hamburger (mmm!) With Chips Or Caesar Salad Chicken BLTs and wraps (needed for some dressing) NY Striploin Steak (really tender and juicy) with Mashed Potatoes with veggies. One evening, we relaxed and had drinks in the lobby, while listening to the piano. We also ate Sunday breakfast at the buffet in the Mizzen. I LOVED the fresh scones with butter and excellent strawberry jam. Breakfast was $23 each plus tax. There was a minibar that was included in the room and a coffee maker in a separate area. I found two or three Starbucks coffee pouches. Someone said in a previous review that the coffee was not free. However, we did find a card that said that the coffee was complimentary and that there was more in the minibar area for purchase. The location of the hotel, down by the water, was very nice. We took evening strolls along the boardwalk, and fed the ducks. In the general area, there are some harbourfront shops, and a Second Cup coffee shop a few blocks away. If you need a convenience store there is one about three blocks down towards the CN Tower. It includes a deli section as well. If you would like to spend a quiet day relaxing, take the harbour ferry across the lake. It's right by the hotel. Rent a bicycle and ride through the peaceful country landscape. Have a picnic here, and checkout the amazing views of the entire downtown area from here. We did that last year, and loved it! There is a subway station about four blocks from the hotel. From there, it's an easy ride to most places in the city. If you're having trouble walking, I would recommend a short cab ride to your destination, or the subway station. For most people, it shouldn't be too much, though. Parking shouldn't a problem either. There's at least four separate parking lots within walking distance. Seventeen dollars a day is probably the maximum you'll pay. Parking is actually a bit cheaper here than closer to city hall. The only bad moment of the trip was when a Toula restaurant employee was snarky with us. But that's not the Westin's fault. Because of that we ended up having a romantic dinner in our room, with a wonderful view of the lake, and a background of skyscrapers. The prices on the room service menu were less expensive than Toula, and the privacy was wonderful. Toula lost a customer, but I gained a new appreciation for hotel room dining. Before we went to this hotel, I was interested to see how it would compare to the Sheraton. They are both excellent. If you want to walk to the Eaton Centre all the time, choose the Sheraton. But if you're looking for a relaxing room by the lake, then go with the Westin Harbour Castle. We now have two favorite hotels in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Fair Stay for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: brentholio
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference. Thankfully the company paid because it was CA$250/night! The room was clean but the furniture looked like it was just painted over to give it a few more years use. The internet connectivity was a joke. Amazing that they charge so much and it would work probably 10 minutes. Then they wanted to charge more for use in the conference area. It was an internet technology conference and all of the presenters had major issues with connectivity. I would say though that it was tremendously covenient to be staying in the same hotel as the conference, which in the end made the stay worthwhile. Getting around was a bit of a challenge. We stayed a couple of extra days at the Pantages. A HUGE difference in room quality, price and in access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gillie86
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews for the westin harbour castle on this website I was apprehensive as to what to expect when I arrived at this hotel. My fears were totally mislaid. The rooms were very clean and spacious, staff extremely helpful and attentive. The location is good as the hotel is located within easy walking distance of the Air Canada Centre, and not far from the city centre. I would definitely stay at the Westin Harbour Castle again when I visit Toronto, and cannot recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place...”
Reviews.Author: catjean63
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night. We got the romantic package which included sparkling wine and strawberries. It was very nice. The room was a little small but we had a balcony and faced right onto the water, very lovely. The pool was great, the hot tub was scalding, no one could go in it, so I mentioned to the staff about the heat, and they fixed it within minutes. The staff was very friendly and very attentive. The valet parking is quite costly $30, but that's quite common when you are staying downtown. We had breakfast delivered in our room very promptly. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Substandard for a Westin Property”
Reviews.Content: I reserved 3 rooms at the Westin Harbour Castle April 8, 2006. I asked for double beds in each room. We received a king sized bed in each room. We had it switched with no problem, but it was just very time consuming and annoying. Upon arriving at the hotel I was called a "liar" by one of the valet attendants. He asked me how I was doing as I was taking the luggage out of my trunk, and I said fine. As I went to grab a cart for our luggage, he GRABBED me by my arm and told me not to touch the cart without asking. We then got into a verbal confrontation. Nice way to start a vacation. Very unprofessional. Once we arrived in our rooms, we found them clean, but very small. The beds were small but comfortable. The most impressive part of this hotel is the lobby. Valet parking was a little pricy, 30 dollars, and I paid cash for 2 vehicles. Good thing I kept the receipt, because upon checking out, the woman in charge of the valet told me that I hadn't paid. So this is when verbal confrontation number two happened. After producing my receipt, she just looked at me and then said, "well we have no record of it, but I guess you did pay if that's what this says". What kind of comment is this? Does she think I made a counterfeit receipt on Westin stationary? Unbelievable. How is it acceptable for ANY hotel to have their employees talk to customers this way. At Westin's in the past, I have had nothing but excellent service. This is definitely not what to expect at the Westin Harbour Castle. I would highly recommend staying at one of the DOZENS of hotels in close proximity with better rooms, service and amenities. I will not be staying at the Westin Harbour Castle in the future. Ever. I do not enjoy arguing with hotel staff when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “A fine space for a fine stay”
Reviews.Author: Throbbert
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this location, and this time we got lucky with a very nice room. We had a full view of the lake even though we had booked on Priceline, and our bed was exceptionally comfortable. The cable channels are limited and our remote control device didn't work. The location requires a short walk for things to do in Toronto. All the attendants in the hotel, however, are helpful. A massage at the spa was not a pleasant experience although a dip in the pool was nice. Starbucks coffee in the room was a bonus. We would definitely return to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Unauthorized Charges”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was pleasant and the stay - fairly uneventful. Until almost 2 months later when the hotel made unauthorized charges to my account! Something this outrageous had not happened to me when staying in a motel, let alone at what calls itself a classy hotel. My overall experience just went from "Average" to "Won't set a foot there ever again".

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly bed is missing”
Reviews.Author: IslandMate
Reviews.Content: I always look forward to my heavenly bed, but this Westin doesn't seem to have the correct "heaven." The sheets and comforters were correct, but the actual mattress wasn't. The room was also a little dated and not up to par with other Westin Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Been to way better places”
Reviews.Author: sugarplum99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on new years eve with my boyfrined and we wish we never did. We stayed on the 32 floor. There was a dirty toothpick on the floor of our room, which made us think do they vacume? The bathtub anti slip things were BLACK and the bathmat was very dirty too. The room was small nothing special. When booking the "manager" she was very rude too. We filled out the card upon leaving and got a call from the manager who was SUPER nice to us. She offered us a free night stay, which was nice of her to do, but if the room is anything like the one we stayed in i do not want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cold_in_kitchener
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Westin to celebrate New Year's and found the hotel to be very average. The room we had was small (easily the smallest room we've ever had in a hotel) but very clean. The whole hotel seems to be in need of a renovation, as the wallpaper and design seems a bit dated. The bathroom was also extremely clean, which impressed us. The location was good. It was nice to be away from the core of the city, while still being within walking distance to all main attractions. It is worthwhile to upgrade to a lakeview room, as it was nice to be able to enjoy the harbour views. The lobby was large and impressive. All staff we dealt with were friendly. Overall, a nice hotel, but nothing spectaular.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Nice beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was bit worried as I checked into this hotel. I booked a room for one night via Priceline. I paid about US$92 (including taxes and fees) for a room. Many hotels will give you a shoddy room if you have paid via Priceline. But not this time. The staff was pleasant and replied to my request for a room with a nice view. We were in room 3331 and it was perfect. We could see all of downtown lit up at night from our plush beds. We took taxis to the entertainment district for dinner and drinks (worth it) and the next day to Eaton Center Mall (skip it).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Westn Harbourcastle in Toronto, Canada. We were in Toronto for a concert at the Air Canada Center so the location was perfect. We had a small room overlooking the harbour. Rooms are clean....though small. Everything was very clean and comfortable. The lobby area was pretty and the staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We were underwhelmed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is expensive for what you get--some staff members were quite professional, and others were, in a word, NOT. Our room had a lovely view, but was not especially clean, and the bathtub was a frustrating 'adventure' in trying to get comfortable due to the odd configuration of the tub and the shelf. Apparently it is the same in all the rooms--a short tub and a shelf directly behind your head. Everything costs (a lot). The breakfast buffet for two was $60 tax and tip included (there was a reasonable, but not great selection, and the pastries were stale). Water is $5.95, valet parking is $30 and self-parking away from the hotel is $17. Tea was not replaced in the room, but extra coffee was left--gee, thanks. The sugar had gotten wet at some point, and this is picky but I wish there had been real cups. At $150 per night, why must we use paper cups? We arrived in TO by train, and the hotel is conveniently located to the station--we walked over. However, the concierge was not at all interested in helping us sort out the bus/subways. Eventually we walked back to the train to rent a car for the day.

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem with this one?”
Reviews.Author: shaun1967
Reviews.Content: After playing internet ping pong for a couple of weeks to see which hotel between this one and the Radisson (we like waterfronts) was going to offer the best deal, we found this one blinked first. The best rate (C$149 ex taxes) finally being secured via the Starwood web-site on a non-refundable basis. To be truthful I was wanting it to be the Radisson as some of the reviews on the Westin were less than complimentary, so we arrived with some trepidation. All this nervousness however was unfounded. The staff were accessible and friendly and not rude or inefficient, the air-con was neither deafening nor pemanently required and the room was clean and fairly spacious and not cramped or dirty, and in a great spot with a perfectly safe walk in all directions. Restaurant was pricey, but Toronto gives plenty of options, so we ate elsewhere. I must say that we are not "high maintenance guests", so we don't exactly put the peripheral services through their paces for the sake of it, but if you're looking for a reasonably smart hotel with great views in a great location you could do a lot worse. Maybe they don't do so well for people who want a pampering? We'd certainly go back at the same rate and I struggle to reconcile some of the reviews with our direct experience. Is this the same hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the south tower”
Reviews.Author: nycdannyboy
Reviews.Content: Spent one night recently at the Westin. Was very disappointed in my original room, but was (not too easily) able to get my room changed to the south tower (closer to and with a better view of) the water. If you're staying at this hotel, it is worth spending the extra money for a nice view, otherwise the location isn't exactly prime (though there are lots of taxis awaiting) and the not-so-great-views are, well, not so great. Nice gym and indoor pool area and I treated myself to a hot stone massage in the spa which was nice and had very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Up to Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: McMax
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Westin hotels (and other Starwood-brand hotels), the Westin Harbour Castle is not quite up to the normal Westin standards you would expect. The hotel is definitely showing its age (1980's era decor in the lobby), and the rooms, while nice, have some fraying carpet and stains in the bathrooms. The service is very good though. There are a couple downsides to consider though. First, the hotel is located on Lake Ontario (it has great views), which means it is about a 10-minute walk to the subway station...in the bitter cold. Second, if you have a car, the parking is very expensive here. It was C$34 a day for valet, but only C$17 for self-parking. The problem with self-parking is the lot is about 2 long blocks away, and is not covered and not guarded. Overall, the value level for the hotel is ok, and is a safe choice for a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: GatorDocs
Reviews.Content: One of the north tower elevators closes very quickly...if you are facing the elevators, it is the first one on the right. Our bellman was very friendly and helpful. However, at checkout, the bellman brought our things down while we stood in line to check out. It took about 5 minutes. We went to the bellstand, and the bellman (not the one that had helped us) said that we had to wait for our original bellman to take our things outside. So we waited, while 2 other people who had been behind us in line got their taxis. The restaurant on the top floor was amazing. Delicious food, and beautiful views. Be aware that the restaurant no longer rotates...it is now stationary. :-( There is a nice little grocery store close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If your expectations aren't high, you won't be disappointed :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel, as I hear Westins are nice hotels. This hotel was nice, but it was not spectacular. I booked through Hotwire and stayed in a non smoking, king sized bed, harbor view room in the South Tower. I paid $30 CAN a night to "upgrade" to a Harborfront room, and with taxes it ended up costing $35 CAN a night. In the end, I thought it was a total waste of money. The front desk staff were friendly and actually let me check in 4 hours early (check in time is at 3pm) free of charge. Check in kind of took longer than normal, but I can't complain since he let me check in so early. We opted to do self-park since I couldn't stand paying so much for valet (we never use our car when we're in TO anyway). I actually would not recommend you do self-park. The valet lady told us that it's not safe to park your car there; I thought she was just trying to get me to spend money on the valet but really, it's not very safe. You just park in a random, uncovered lot. Your car is just out there in the open. I put "The Club" on my car and felt the need to check it every few hours. I usually feel very safe in TO; if I had to park like this in any other city, I would definitely not do it. But, you pay the lady at the hotel for the total nights you are doing self-park (at $17 CAN per night) and she gives you a bright blue piece of paper you have to put on your dashboard while you are parked. Otherwise, they say they're going to tow your car. The elevators in this particular hotel are extremely fast, so that was great. There are a lot of elevators as well, so you never really have to wait. Our room was really small but it was clean and comfortable. Nothing at all spectacular. If I had paid the price they post on the door, I would be pretty upset.
