And yes, for some of the people who are paying more than us Hotwire and Priceline people, if I saw that I had to pay $5 for a bottle of water and $13 for a shaving kit containing things you wouldn't even find at a dollar store, I would be irked as well. When we settled into our room, we quickly found that our coffee maker was broken and the tv remote was out of batteries. We called down to the front desk and they sent replacements up in a matter of minutes and then checked again to make sure everything was okay. I thought the service was very nice. I didn't think the hotel was as far away from the subway as some other reviewers made it out to be. 5 minutes at the most. Yes, you do have to walk under the Gardiner Expressway but it's paved, lit, covered, and safe. At night, there are people begging but they are in no way aggressive. If you don't want to give them anything, just acknowledge with a nod and they are on there way. If you don't want to walk under the Gardiner, and want to take public transit, go to the TTC streetcar stop that is in front of the hotel and take the 509 or 510 to Union Station. It's quick, but you might be waiting there longer than it would take you just to walk to the subway stop. The pool area was nice, but I didn't see any changing rooms in the locker area. Did I miss that or something? Before you go into the locker rooms, you have to grab a towel from the pool desk because that's the only place they're located. This is one of the best indoor pools I've seen at a hotel. It goes from 3' deep to 9' deep and it's heated. The whirlpool bath is also nice, but really hot. The pool maintenance guys told us that they check the water quality and temp. every two hours to make sure everything is good. There is also a steam room and sauna in the locker rooms. Workout area was closed while we were there. I did not use any of the hotel dining but there is a first floor restaurant called Mizzen and a top floor restaurant called Toula. Hope this helps and enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Want great views - look no further”
Reviews.Author: jefflad
Reviews.Content: We had a lake view room and what a view. Location? excellent. we were worried it may be a little too far out of town as we had two young children but the Toronto transport infrastructure is really good and not a problem nor was it too far to walk. Rooms were great. If your feeling flush or tired and can't be bothered to go out get room service like we did, Cod and Chips for all four of us. Quality is all we can say great service with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gallaron
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 year old son stayed here for 4 days at the end of our stay in Canada. The hotel is in a nice location on the waterfront. It's a walk from downtown but that was ok as there is quite a lot to do around the hotel. The ferry to Toronto Islands is just behind the hotel and there are some restaurants along the harbour front. Room was very nice with partial lake view. Hotel isn't cheap but got a 4 for 3 deal from spg which made it worthwhile. Would watch out for extra charges, we were charged $5 for the hotel receiving a fedex package and also flat fees for phonecalls charged to credit cards. This was a bit disappointing. Excellent childrens room which allows young children to run around and play with lots of toys.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations - Terrible”
Reviews.Author: WT50
Reviews.Content: I just tried to book 2 colleagues into the hotel. After 45 minutes of trying to have them get the reservations right and email'd to me, I found that the rate had changed from what was confirmed. I cancelled both reservations - would rather stay farther away and take a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: navigator
Reviews.Content: My period of stay was 13th to 18th sept 2005. Location of hotel is what I would consider a quiet area on the harbour front. I had heard that it was miles from anywhere but those who wrote that must be lazy and can't put one foot in front of the other. I will say though that I like walking as you see more and to get to the main shopping area will take approx 20-25min. I suggest walk to Yonge st (which is the longest street in the world or so I was told) out of hotel to the right and take first left but taxi back. The hotel itself was excellent. Check in staff were very pleasant and helpful as were the customer servce desk staff. It was very clean. I stayed on the 5th floor which is very convenient as the pool and spa are on that floor also. Pooll is indoors with hot tub, good sun terrace and tennis court, again clean and quiet. Room was spacious with excellent bathroom facilities. Shower and tiolet seperate from was basin area and for the females plenty of mirrors and lights. Beds are to die for. Restaurants: The buffet restaurant off the reception area is fantastic. It is a bit priceybut you can eat all you want and it is cooked fresh in front of you. The restaurant on the 38th floor does have a strict dress code, expensive but great views and relaxing atmosphere. Parking: 30 dollars a night for hotel but if you drive 200 yards down the road to the public parking and tell them you are at the hotel it works out at 15 dollars a night. The hotel is full most of the time with people from conferences but it is not a problem. The drinks at the bar in the reception area are reasonably priced but not a place to drink and relax for an evening. I suggest that you take a taxi into town. If you are looking for night clubs and lively bars get the taxi to take you to Queen st area and I promise you will find something. If you are looking for a relaxing meal the hotel is just a five minute walk away from the boats that will take you out around the harbour or there are some restaurants on the dock side at Queens quay centre.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: muddyjeep
Reviews.Content: had a wonderfull overnight stay with my daughter (9) pool was great rooms very clean room service fast checked in early with no problems very good hotel close to everything alot better than some 5 star I have stayed at

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: thetedsterguy
Reviews.Content: We booked a special? for $140 US. Our room was not small...good size with small desk ad sofa and great view even though we did not opt for the $30 upgrade to a lakeview room. We ate at Toule's at the top of the north tower. Meal was delicious but entree's were $25 to 38 US...ouch. We did not use any amenties. Location was great for us...walk to boat rentals, plethora of ferries and boat tours. Try the Hippo tour.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at Westin Harbour Castle”
Reviews.Author: gomexico
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay at the Westin for 8/19/05, through Hotwire, thanks to the comments about the hotel/Hotwire I'd read here at TA. My rate was US$79 + tax (and booking fee) for one person (US$96.95). My journey from Pearson to the hotel was accomplished by travel on the Airport Express bus. Fast and efficient service (especially when you're the first off the bus!). Judging by some of the reviews I'd read about the rooms, I expected a small room. However, I thought my room (22nd Floor) was large. It included a king bed, large desk/chair, sofa/love seat (pull-out bed) and a couple of large comfortable chairs, large bathroom, closet area, etc. The room faced east, overlooking a dinner boat - but it had a water-view or sorts; fine for a one-nighter. The front desk staff was attentive and professional when I checked-in/out - just what I expected from a Westin. The incidental charges for water, mini-bar, shaving kit in the bathroom (tooth brush, tooth paste, razor, shaving cream), etc., didn't offend me and I don't see why it should offend others. If you want the convenience of things you pay a premium price. There was no charge for expected toiletries of soap, conditioner and shampoo in the bathroom. The iron and ironing board came in handy. And, after reading earlier comments here, I was surprised to see the complimentary Starbucks coffee in the room (three 20oz. serving packs (making 20oz of coffee that is) together with the coffeemaker). Additional coffee supplies were available for sale from the hotel. I didn't eat in any of the restaurants, use room service, or the pool . . . but I did stop by the concierge station and found the two people to be very accommodating and sensitive/responsive to requests from the many people stopping-by to ask for assistance. The convenience store offered the basics, and was adequate (and a bit over priced as I expected it to be). If you like to walk (as I do) the hotel's location shouldn't be a bother to anybody. Busses/trolly and the subway system are not far away, either. This is a convention hotel and appears to get lots of use Monday > Friday, and that's probably why rooms are often deeply discounted on the weekend and during non-peak periods. Some things about the hotel seem to be a little worn, but for the price I paid I'd have to be a nit-picker to point the things out. On my way out of Toronto (after spending 10 days with family elsewhere in Ontario) I stayed overnight in the Travel Lodge at Pearson. My rate was CDN$90+ tax for a worn room in a hotel that was no where in the same league as the Westin. Maybe I was lucky - I got a large room and I was traveling alone (lots easier than traveling with a family/group). I don't often stay in hotels in this high of a price range, but for the occassion my expectations were exceeded.

Reviews.Title: “Aging conference hotel that is average in all but location”
Reviews.Author: NW_Raven
Reviews.Content: This tall hotel sits so close to Lake Ontario that the rooms on three of four sides have water views. The view of downtown is also good because the hotel is separated from the central business district by low buildings and a freeway. Among the low buildings are the hotel's attached conference centre, shops, and restaurants (including a sports bar and handy convenience store across the street). The hotel is very close to, but offset from, downtown. Air Canada Centre is a 10-minute walk away, and a subway station a little further. The Air Canada Centre route offers safe walking to downtown, with only a couple of busy streets to cross before heading underground. Otherwise, one might take a 5-minute taxi ride. I never saw the hotel's advertised shuttle, which supposedly went to the Eaton Centre. My room was of an ordinary size and standard design. The king-size bed was superb, as was the over-large bathroom. Since the windows were sealed, I had to have the noisy air system on most of the time. The elevators were fast to my floor. Check-in and check-out were smooth. My appreciation of the room was marred by the bottled water for sale on the coffee table -- very tacky. The general dÃ©cor (including the exterior) seemed to be dated and a little musty in spots. The lobby is very large and thus felt cold all the time in the winter weather. The bar area is large and pleasant. The dining room off the lobby is window-less and cavernous. The hotel entrance, which is at the top of a long concrete ramp, was under renovation during my stay. Nevertheless, it is a bleak approach to the hotel, cool and windy, and extremely unfriendly to pedestrians. To get the bus to the airport, I had to drag my luggage down to the street and wait in the slush and weather. I was disappointed that an enclosed walkway from the hotel to its conference centre was not available to guests to use to cross the busy road in front of the hotel. During my week's stay on business, I ate only my first night's dinner and room-service breakfast at the hotel because the price of any food service was outrageously high. I would have preferred the breakfast buffet but its price was no incentive to forego room service. Even when travelling on an expense account, I like to get good value. Fortunately, there is a choice of a few restaurants with a couple of blocks. Apart from the great views and pretty convenient location, this hotel felt very average, almost like an oversized motel. I suspect the Westin's 5-star rating is earned by the range of services offered and its location.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers mentioned, I was nervous when I found out our Hotwire hotel was The Westin Harbour Castle. I'm a hotel snob, so I don't like to hear any negative reviews of a hotel I'm going to be staying at! After reading reviews @ TripAdvisor & Hotwire and researching hotels in downtown Toronto, I was hoping for The Hotel InterContinental, since someone had mentioned they were booked there for $85/night. Let me start by saying that The Westin Harbour Castle is a very nicely appointed hotel. The lobby and it's layout and decor are very appealing and attractive. Nothing shabby about the place at all. As hotels go, the staff is quite accomodating. We, as Hotwire purchasers, weren't treated any differently than guests who paid full price. But, why should we be, since the hotel sells these rooms to Hotwire! We were originally booked a double/double room through Hotwire for $85 (US)/night. I called the hotel myself, prior to check-in and asked if they would switch us to a king room w/sofa bed to accommodate myself, my husband and son. Upon check-in, I asked the gal at the desk if we had a "nice" room. She stated that our room had been upgraded to a water-view room which was a considerable upgrade. When we got to our room though, there was no sofa bed, only a king sized bed. I went back to the desk, explained the situation and was re-assigned another room with the promise of a "comp" to any room charges for the "inconvienence". We were, in the end, comped for a movie rental we purchased. As other reviewers mention, the room was small. But, it was CLEAN, fresh smelling and nicely appointed. Sometimes, looks ARE everything and IMO, if you're spending that much time in your room, you're not on vacation!! As other reviewers mentioned, there were, in addition to the keyed mini bar, two bottled waters placed on the coffee table and a toiletry kit on the bathroom sink, but honestly, I don't know how anyone who has traveled or stayed almost anywhere (especially places with an honor bar) in the past several years, could mistake a bottle of anything, with a huge hang tag of specifics on it, for an amenitiy. The hotel valet parking is $30/night. Thanks to a previous reviewers advice, we parked in a self park lot w/in and out privliges that was on the same block (same side of the street, just west of the Westin) as the hotel for $15 dollars/night. What a savings! The only fault I can find with The Westin is it's harbor front location. There really isn't too much to do or see in the general vicinity, it's mostly industrial, although you can get around via trolley, subway, etc., if you do some research. If you stay here, plan an itinerary of what you want to see in the city and how you're going to get there. If you're walking, like I did, you may want to reconsider, especially if it's an unseasonably hot August. LOL Overall, the hotel is an excellent value through Hotwire, at $85/night. But, I would never pay rack rates here due to the locale. I'd rather pay more for a hotel where "the action is"!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Westin Harbour Castle”
Reviews.Author: Ambergirl
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who helped me with my trip to Toronto, my 10 year old son and I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for 3 nights and were so happy there. I asked at the front desk if they had a harbor front room, and we were given a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful corner room overlooking the harbor where the boats take off for Centre Island. Knowing through this website about the extra items in the room that weren't included, we stayed away from the refrigerator and bathroom extras. I found it interesting that the coffee wasn't complimentary, but knowing that beforehand, I brought tea bags and used the coffee maker for hot water and soup. The front desk was very nice and helpful, especially after my wallet was stolen at the Blue Jays game. They suggested my husband fax them a copy of another credit card with permission for all hotel charges to be put on it, and he did immediately (at 1:30am). They had it in their hands within 5 minutes and we were set. So the next day, not having any cash, we swam in their pool and hung out at the hotel and ordered room service. I ordered the children's menu along with my son, and found the Hamburger and fries was enough for me for $4.00 instead of $16.00 for an adult menu salad. The travel desk downstairs had girls there that were always very helpful and pleasant to everyone, no matter if they bought a tour or not. We had planned to drive to Niagra Falls, but since it was a holiday weekend, no cars were available (a good thing anyway with my drivers license being in my wallet that was stolen) and their tours were at least $130.00 and 9 hours long. The beds were to die for, those heavenly beds are the best thing about the hotel. The pool was not busy and had plenty of comfy chairs. We tried the business center downstairs and used the internet. When we left yesterday morning at 4:40am, the airport express bus picked us up right in front of the hotel and since we were the last stop, we arrived at the airport by 5am. Plus, children under 12 ride free, something I didn't know when we arrived, so it was only $15.50 for me. Would I stay there again? I was very impressed with all the hotel staff, so absolutely yes. Now, I did get this hotel through Hotwire for $88.00 per night, so I feel we got excellent service for this. We were not treated any different than someone who paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: first of all, rooms were small, verrry small. view was amazing. had room 3220 and view was simply perfect. did i mention rooms werr small? anyway, several things not too my liking first of all; went to Toula the alleged italian restaurant on the top floor? would not even let me look around to see if i woudl like to dine (hmm yeah sure, i shall buy a car without test driving it) concierge did not know much about anything. it was caribana weekend and despite my eagerness to enjoy the event(s). i was blindly on my own with the typical answer to anything being along the lines of "i dont know". well, for about 300 per night...you should know! pool setup is pathetic; hotbox bacterial breeding ground and sundeck is separate with most of it in shade by high noon. fitness center even worse. makes me remember my inner city YMCA days in the 70s in the 100sq ft facility with waaay too many people waiting to get on the outdated universal machine for its three exercsies capability. the bed, as is westin tradition, was excellent. the ac however sounded like a wwII warplane on the fritz. shower nozzel was horrible with buildup and accumulation fo whatever is in the water, half the openings were blocked. overall, a decent stay, however i am used to much better accomodations for a complete experience. bottom line thoguh is the bed was awesome and thats the main priority to a good room and that is why my rating opinion was saved from a definitely dismal ZERO.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Castle is great.”
Reviews.Author: blackterrier
Reviews.Content: Beats me where previous reviews get their facts and give poor reviews. My family and I stayed here for a week from 16th July and had a great stay. Our room had a corner situation with views down town and towards the lake. It was spacious and had two ultra comfortable Heavenly double beds.Standards of housekeeping where excellent and everything was present and correct. OK the cost of the bottled water provided in the room was high, but all you have to do is get in the elevator and go to the hotel shop - not too difficult! The views are great and the situation for a summer vacation is excellent.All the waterfront summer activities are close by and the boardwalk is lovely to stroll along on a summer evening. Downtown and the CN Tower and Skydome are within walkind distance. The Toronto Island ferries are right beside the hotel - the hotel is almost a summer resort. Staff were good and valet parking was helpful. As for previous reviews of the breakfast buffet, we found it delicious and unmatched by many more expensive hotels. If going to Toronto in the summer stay here - the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: motego
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nites in late July w/ hubby and 2 teens. I booked through Priceline and got a great rate of $86/nite. This was for a corner room on the 22nd floor w/ views of both the city and lake. 2 double beds, non smoking. Very pretty decorations and furniture, but overall a bit on the small side. The beds truly are heavenly. Hubby never sleeps past 5am at home, and he didn't get up until after 8am! Loved all the pillows and down blankets. Overall, the location was good. Right next door to the HarbourCentre and outdoor International Market about 1 block down. About a 15-20 min walk to the Eaton Centre. (or a $7 cab ride) Staff was very nice and friendly. Yes, the mini bar/snack basket is way too expensive but they usually are no matter where you stay. Parking was $30/day-ouch! But again, if you have ever stayed in Manhattan or LA, you expect this. The only service problems we had were the concierge and housekeeping. First the concierge: took at least 15 rings before answering the phone, then put on hold for at least 10 mins. This happened EVERY time! I inquired about tickets for Blue Man Group and he said he couldn't help me. Just gave me the theatre phone number and told me to call them! What??? Isn't the whole point of his job to do this for me? (And there was a $2 surcharge for local calls to boot!) In addition, he directed us to an Italian restaurant that was out of business. Obviously not in tune with what's happening in town. Second, housekeeping didn't make our room up until about 6pm the 1st day. They claimed we had out a DND sign on the door. The room didn't even have a DND sign! They finally came and made the beds while we went down to the pool, but didn't bring fresh towels, cups/glasses or coffee!! Had to call a 3rd time for this. Lastly, the water temp in the shower sucked big time. Bursts of hot then cold. No way to keep an even temp. Not what I would expect from a 4 star. Would probably stay again if I could get the nice low price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was a little worried after being booked at this hotel on Hotwire. We stayed July 5-9, and it was wonderful. We stayed with our 2 children. They each received a gift bag and we thought the pool area was great-lots of chairs and an area outside to play basketball (rooftop). Yes, there are a lot of amenities in the room that (if you choose) would cost out of this world, but we immediately put them out of our sight. We only ate in the bar (which they provided children's menu's happily), food was delicious. Would not recommend the restaurants, breakfast would have been 17.00 for a basic meal. Overall, would stay there again in the summer, maybe not winter, would want to be connected to the underground PATH.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a long weekend at the Westin Harbour Castle. We got a room in the south tower on the 31st floor. The room was decent sized, and included a couch/sitting area in addition to the standard furniture. The view was amazing, we were able to watch fire works over the bay from our room. The service at the Westin was OK, we were misdirected by a concierge when we were trying to find a restaurant. I was a little nervous about the location after reading some negative reviews here, but it was really only a 10 minute walk to the subway station and we didn't encounter any troubles. We found the location convenient, we left the car parked all weekend. The only real complaint I have is that the pool is way too small. We stopped by a few times to check out the pool, and every time it seemed to be teeming with people. We got a great deal on this hotel w/ Priceline ($70 US), I am not sure I would pay regular price to stay here. Overall though a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for a Convention”
Reviews.Author: MidwesternMom69_10
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised, after reading all the negative reviews. Service was very good; hotel restaurants were good, but expensive. Rooms were clean and cleaning staff were excellent. Concierge service was outstanding. Loved the "Heavenly beds"

Reviews.Title: “The Worst-Inn?”
Reviews.Author: mssqueaky
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at th Westin which I found to be inferior to any of the other Westin properties I have booked. My main complaint is that this is considered a luxury hotel, but the property and the room were inferior. Rough towels, so little closet space that I needed to remove the ironing board to hang my clothing, beat up furniture, stains on the wall. Restaurant had the worst breakfast I ever ate...how do you ruin scrambled eggs? It is located on the harbor, which is nice if you want to stay in the area. However, to walk to the central part of Toronto is at least 6 blocks, under a highway overpass, with a welcoming committee of homeless along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: lerikss
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little worried about staying there. My stay turned out to be very nice, but VERY expensive. Everything costs ten times more at the hotel then any where else in the city. Breakfast plates stared at $14 and parking was $30 a day. We decided to eat anywhere but the hotel and paid the $30 for parking. All the employees were very polite and made sure our stay was comfortable. The best part, was the beds. They really are very comfortable. I loved using every night we were there. I didn't miss my own bed at all. I booked this hotel for $110 a night through Priceline and very happy with the hotel, for what I paid. The door in our room said it cost $449 a night, I wouldn't pay that.

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot....”
Reviews.Author: Amymow
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Westin Harbour Castle and I don't have many complements for it. First you drive up to the entrance under a low hung ceiling of light bulbs (can anyone say tacky Vegas?). Inside you'll find an even tackier lobby of some marble, cheesy wedding hall reception chandeliers, and an ok bar. Our card keys stopped working twice during the stay, which is a pain from the 31st floor. We had a partial view of the lake and an ugly parking lot. The business center was just pathetic and they had problems everytime I went - it was a mess. The rooms do try to be tasteful, but there are obvious nicks and dings everywhere, which is typical of a conference center hotel. The beds were quite comfy, lots of pillows - so that was nice. Also the bathrooms were pretty large all things considered. Awful closet space, more stuff in the closet, less room for clothes. The whole place just screams conference center. The location is also less than ideal, far from everything - although thank God we didn't have a car w/us, considering the other reviews here. I took taxi's everywhere, which was fine when you consider how much the parking was. The pool area was kind of a mystery, only two chairs on the sundeck had cushions, and the rest of the chairs were filthy. The jets in the whirlpool didn't seem to be in working order either. The best thing about the hotel was the spa - which is a stand alone in the hotel. Extremely friendly knowledgable staff, who took their time and were very helpful in all matters. Otherwise, the hotel remains lackluster, especially for the price. There was just no attention to detail here. If you want so-so, stay here, otherwise I hear there are much better places around, and you can always taxi to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Hello_Kitty818
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed one night at the Westin on May 4th. The $249 Getaway pkg included buffet breakfast ($44) and $17 off parking. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Stayed on the 22nd floor. The rooms were clean, spacious and newly renovated. We had a partial view of the lake which was beautiful. The pool area was not so lovely, so we did not swim. Hotel is in a quiet area (not much entertainment around) however the CN tower was a $5 taxi ride away. The self-parking is 2 blocks away so valet parking is the best option however it costs $30 (but only $13 with the Getaway pkg). Buffet breakfast was delicious. The crowd was mostly business people (conventions etc.) but it was a nice atmosphere. I almost did not select this hotel after reading the bad reviews. But I'm glad I decided to see for myself. I recommend the Westin for a quiet getaway.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: rugbybabe77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Harbour June 04. When we arrived we were allocated a no smoking room, took the elevator up to find the room had not been cleaned and had definately been smoked in! reception gave us a new room which had better views, one window we could see downtown and the other out towards the harbour. location wise it is easy enough to walk to bars/restaurants/shops but maybe not great late at night as a bit desolate. you can though catch a tram just in front on the hotel. we loved the grocery store just across the way for breakfasts. didn't eat in the hotel. the room and beds were lovely and a good size. i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I will not go back”
Reviews.Author: Jife
Reviews.Content: My family and another family decided to stay at the Harbour Castle Westin hotel in Toronto for a March Break treat for the kids. I would say that this hotel is definitely average for the price. The one thing that really told us that this hotel was not a "service oriented" hotel was the fact that we ordered breakfast to our suite one morning. This was an expensive breakfast considering it was for 4 adults and 5 children. We ordered decaf coffee. They brought us regular. That was fine, we called down and asked them to bring up what we had ordered. We received a phone call back from the room service "person" very angrily telling us that WE HAD MADE A MISTAKE and that we had ordered regular coffee and not decaf. She was actually angry at us. I have to say that that turned us all off right there. What would a pot of coffee possibly cost that hotel, well it cost them two families never coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: Big rooms. Great beds (of course). It's a bit of a walk to anything. But loved the fitness club. Try the sports bar or the sushi place across the road. Or, though it looks like a dive, the gyro place nextdoor.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were clean and sufficient, the service of the Westin Harbour Castle was substandard. We are quite disappointed. Our first impression of the Hotel came while we entered the hotel through clouds of smoke. We cannot believe that people were allowed to smoke right at the doors! Not good for an asthmatic and a 7 month old baby to have to endure, not to mention the fact that we all smelled of smoke for the entire weekend we were there. We were also quite angry at check-out time. My husband went down to the lobby to obtain a cart to load our baggage. He was told by a bellhop that it was hotel policy for them to bring our baggage down. Although my husband wasn't thrilled with this, ( since when is this policy???) he came back up and waited, and waited and no one showed up to get our baggage! We waited 15 minutes, and only got service when we called to complain that no one had arrived. Terrible terrible service. We also found hotel staff to be uninformed on the area. They were of no help to us when we inquired about eating establishments. We had to ask several times for a crib to be brought to our room when it was made clear at time of booking that one would be necessary. We also asked for a bottle warmer but were told they didn't supply them. Surprisingly one showed up in our room when the crib was delivered. Again, the staff are quite uninformed. Needless to say, we did not enjoy our stay as well as we could have.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the fringe of downtown that is a 15 to 30 minute walk to the area where all the good restaurants and attractions are. It is separated from the downtown core by an ugly, 8-lane elevated expressway plus parking lots and condo construction sites. After dark it feels unsafe to walk underneath the expressway. During the fall/winter, in minus-20 degrees weather the walk is not pleasant. I echo others' comments that the hotel needs updating. Our room was not clean - there were stains on the table, as well as hairs and stains in the bathroom. At dinner the steak I got was the size of a postage stamp. At check-out, we received extremely rude and insulting treatment from an employee who identified himself as a "manager". My complaint letter to the hotel has gone unanswered. Good points: I did meet a very pleasant front desk employee on check-in. Washrooms near the ballrooms are clean and the number of stalls are adequate. If you decide to eat at the hotel instead of one of the many fabulous restaurants on King Street, the green mushroom soup is very good. For a more convenient location I'd recommend the Delta Chelsea, the Marriott and the Holiday Inn. If you're looking for something more affordable I'd recommend the Comfort Hotel on Charles Street - no facilities to speak of, but at least the rooms were renovated and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Westin Harbour for our honeymoon in September. Initially we were quite disappointed as the rooms looked nothing like they did on the web-our room could have been in any hotel anywhere but over our 4 day stay the disappointment faded. The beds are as comfortable as they promise to be, the room was clean and room service was great. The location is absolutely fantastic and central to everything. 2 minutes walk to the boardwalk at the lake and the ferry to the islands, which was a definite plus. Great restaurants, pubs and cafe's within walking distance. Staff are a little aloof but never rude. Don't make enquiries at the ticket desk for a show unless you're good at saying no to good sales people! Also, agreeing with another reviewer, the spa and beautician are a big let-down. I ended up paying almost $100 for a pedicure!! Overall though, if we could ever get back to Toronto, thats where we'd stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable but the SPA IS A JOKE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I visited Toronto the first week of October 2004. Westin was accomodable and the "heavenly beds" are true to their name! Shops and restaurants were a bit of a hike but we were in town to see a baseball game, so the dome was close. Unfortunately, we spent too much money at their so called "luxurious" spa and it was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This "luxury" hotel was absolutely horrendous. It all started with our first phone call to check on our reservations, which they did not have. I made a follow up call to verify check in time and the clerk was so rude I was sorry I called. When we got there we were given a completely different room than we had booked, with no apologies or explanation. When we got to the room it smelled terrible. I went into the bathroom to turn on the water to wash my hands and was greeted by a shower from the faucet. I went to take a shower and there was mildew all over the walls, and a pool of water a few inches high covering the whole floor when I got out. Apparently their shower curtains are there for show, and do not keep the water in the tub. It was a nightmare trying to clean everything up. We wanted to get some breakfast at the hotel, only to find out that there prices were so exhorbatant that even the wealthiest of people would scoff. Then, I was told when I left that I had no additional charges, only to come home to an astronomical bill that I am still trying to take care of. I would never stay there again and would not wish their rudeness and complete lack of attention to their guests on my worst enemy...

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is alright - it's a little old (early 1980's?) but most rooms look like they have a decent view. Lobby area etc is alright also, not too exciting but has everything most people would need (a few little stores, place to eat, etc). The downstairs restaurant (Mizzen?) serves breakfast, which is really not very good at all. The upstairs restaurant (at top of hotel, italian food?) is probably better, but only serves lunch and dinner. We didn't bother going, since there are plenty of other places which are good. The concierge was actually very helpful in choosing a few places. Rooms are fine, bathroom reasonably nice. We got the place on Canadian thanksgiving weekend for US$99/night. If you can get it for that rate, it's worth it. If you have to pay the rack rate ($400 CDN?) you could probably do better. The only real problem with the hotel is it's location. If you'll be driving it's good - right near the main freeway - but if you plan on sightseeing and walking, the location is not ideal as you'll have to walk a ways before you get anywhere worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable but better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CWS
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in need of serious updating. The decor is stuck in the 80's. Rooms are large but need a make-over. Bathrooms are small, smell and need to be totally gutted. Bar & restaurant acceptable but nothing special. Gym dirty, old & small, pool large but needs updating. Suggest you book a more modern, cheaper hotel as don't think Westin offers good value for money. Found all staff to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas in our room and unbelievable lack of customer service”
Reviews.Author: kemcdona1
Reviews.Content: Spent one night purchased thru priceline. Maybe the priceline rooms are the same as the rooms they give to guests who bring pets. We were repeatedly bitten by fleas and upon checkout even showed the bites to the front desk. The clerk offered to take $2.00 off from our bill and apologized. A security report was then filed and I was told that the remainder of our bill would be cleared. It was not. I wrote a letter to Westin. Of course, after 3 weeks, no response. Their customer service is very lacking and I definitely thought I'd hear from someone after taking the time to write a complaint but I assume if they don't care at the top of management, they don't care at the bottom either.

HotelInfo.Name: Westin Harbour Castle
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Harbour Square, Toronto, Ontario M5J 1A6, Canada
